review_content:
Tight white head left a creamy cover on a chill hazy light amber coloured body.
Tobacco, malt & grain aroma.
Medium bodied, smooth & sharp in the back with a cloying aft.
Grain, biscuit, tobacco & light fruit tastes with a malt finish.
Standard.
Crisp clean Pilsner. Some of the lager crisp funk but clean and flavorful. Not my favorite style but the beer is fine.

'맥주의 여왕'이라는 별명을 가진 독일 필스너맥주입니다. 개인적으론 왕관과 황금색 로고와 디자인을 보고있자니 땅크의 나라답게 독일의 티거 탱크가 연상되는데요.

실제로 티거탱크는 2차대전 당시 다른 전차들을 압도하는 악몽 그 자체였죠. 그런 웅장한 가슴으로 캔을 뜯습니다.

완전한 황금색의 오리지널 라거 맥주로 첫 입에는 탄산이 강하여 치킨이 미친듯 땡겼기에 없는데로 훈제삼겹을 준비했지만, 먹다보니 몰트의 고소함이 넉넉히 올라와서 도너츠와도 잘 어울리네요.

체코 필스너와는 조금 다른, 홉의 향과 맥아의 풍미가 균형을 이룬 독일 필스너의 표본 정도 되겠습니다. 아무튼 이렇다구요 뭔가 맛에 대한 얘기는 고작 한 줄 하고서 잡담을 더 하게되는 독일 맥주의 매력??

참고로 독일 내수용으론 필스너로 찍혀 나오고 수출용으론 프리미엄 비어로 나오는 것 같습니다.
Ljusgul med fint vitt skum. Doftar lite brödigt. Smaken fyllig, lite söt och besk. Eftersmaken tämligen lång, först lite söt sedan hygglig beska.
I've been drinking this beer for a long time, so I'm just taking this here to keep it written
Fresh normal pils like view/look. Foam sticky to the glass. More spicy wurzig and a bit iron/metal.. classic german pils with well implemented soft carbonation.
Lite Pilsner like refreshing. Some flavors and carbonation gives lite lager feel too

W zapachu ziołowe, lekko kwiatowo-słodowe, delikatna siarka.
W smaku mocno ziołowe, wyraźna goryczka, ta słodowośc trochę kukurydziana.
Klar lys gul med hvitt skum. Aroma malt korn humle. Smak Malt humle brød rødt eple. Saftig og fin pils, fin fylde og lett bitterhet. Boks kjøpt på Eide Handel
Bottle at Nick's.  Pours clear golden, nose is grass, toffee, hay, taste is sweet, buttery, hay
Decent pils. Some nice floral notes, subtle sweetness. Light bitter finish. Good but nothing special.

660ml bottle served fridge cold in a 600ml glass stein. Crystal clear, pale golden beer, with a white fluffy head. A slightly malty aroma, a malty slightly biscuity flavour, with a sharp hopped after taste. A very pleasant, refreshing beer, a bit more body than many generic lagers.
Clear gold with a white head and a malty nose. Well-carbonated with a medium mouthfeel and a malty-sweet finish.

Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień. Degustacja odbyła się jakiś czas temu.
Instagram/czgr_
Złociste, idealnie klarowne z małą białą pianą. Aromat estrowy, słodowy, może lekko chmielowy. W smaku wytrawne, pustawe z słodowo-chlebowymi nutami.
Tight white head left a creamy cover on a chill hazy light amber coloured body. Tobacco, malt & grain aroma.…
Crisp clean Pilsner. Some of the lager crisp funk but clean and flavorful. Not my favorite style but the beer is fine.
'맥주의 여왕'이라는 별명을 가진 독일 필스너맥주입니다. 개인적으론 왕관과 황금색 로고와 디자인을 보고있자니 땅크의 나라답게 독일의 티거 탱크가 연상되는데요.…
Ljusgul med fint vitt skum. Doftar lite brödigt. Smaken fyllig, lite söt och besk. Eftersmaken tämligen lång, först lite söt sedan hygglig beska.
I've been drinking this beer for a long time, so I'm just taking this here to keep it written
Fresh normal pils like view/look. Foam sticky to the glass. More spicy wurzig and a bit iron/metal.. classic german pils with well implemented soft carbonation.
Lite Pilsner like refreshing. Some flavors and carbonation gives lite lager feel too

W zapachu ziołowe, lekko kwiatowo-słodowe, delikatna siarka.
W smaku mocno ziołowe, wyraźna goryczka, ta słodowośc trochę kukurydziana.
Klar lys gul med hvitt skum. Aroma malt korn humle. Smak Malt humle brød rødt eple. Saftig og fin pils, fin fylde og lett bitterhet. Boks kjøpt på Eide Handel
Bottle at Nick's.  Pours clear golden, nose is grass, toffee, hay, taste is sweet, buttery, hay
Decent pils. Some nice floral notes, subtle sweetness. Light bitter finish. Good but nothing special.

660ml bottle served fridge cold in a 600ml glass stein. Crystal clear, pale golden beer, with a white fluffy head. A slightly malty aroma, a malty slightly biscuity flavour, with a sharp hopped after taste. A very pleasant, refreshing beer, a bit more body than many…
Clear gold with a white head and a malty nose. Well-carbonated with a medium mouthfeel and a malty-sweet finish.

Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień. Degustacja odbyła się jakiś czas temu.
Instagram/czgr_
Złociste, idealnie klarowne z małą białą pianą. Aromat estrowy, słodowy, może lekko chmielowy. W smaku wytrawne, pustawe z słodowo-chlebowymi nutami.

660ml bottle from local store. Pours light clear golden with low to medium foamy head, gone very fast. Not very strong aroma of malt and hay. Taste quite simple is sweet malt and cereal, some citrus with  hops bitterness in the finish, it's easy to drink and crisp but overall extremely mineral-watery and flat taste, with lots of carbonation. Not really great or interesting, but would say overall more decent than the cheap industrial lager average.
Grain and hay notes, with slight honey in the finish. Enjoyed it but for this price I'd rather drink soemthing else, more complex or a different style at least.
660ml bottle from Waitrose in Jersey. Pours amber with a white foamy head. Medium to strong carbonation. Aromas & tastes of flora, grain & sweet malt. Medium body. Medium bitter finish. Enjoyable

660ml (4.8%) at home on 23 Dec 2020, purchased on 22 Apr 2020 from Tesco, Whitletts Road, Ayr (bb 4 Mar 2021): sweet malty, grain aroma, golden, good bubbly pale cream head, some thick bubbly lacing, wheat, grain, pale malt flavour, grainy texture, moderate fizz.
Mini-Keg. Golden beer with a whitish head. Light malt aroma. Malt and light floral flavor with light grass. Medium bodied. Malt and light floral notes linger.
Pours a golden yellow.  Sparse head, moderate lacing.  Candy aroma (very light aroma).  Watered down palate.  Aqueous.
Light with a nice taste but not strong enough to pull through the strong german flavour I was expecting. Head was non existent but would have again if other options weren’t available.
Birra chiara, schiuma bianca. Profumi e sapori delle classiche Lager tedesche. Ottima durante i pasti.

Bottle. Aroma- just Pilsner malt notes and to be honest, that's all. Pale, clear, with a medium-low head. Taste- feels like Helles rather than Pils. Malty notes, but without that crisp feeling. Minimal bitterness. Low bodied, with a medium-low carbonation. Dull, mediocre lager.

Jasne, złote, klarowne z bujną zbitą pianą. Słód pilzneński, lekka mokra szmata, nuta banana czyli estry, ale także kwiaty i zioła z chmielu. W smaku słodowe, bardziej czyste niż w aromacie. Są kwiaty i zioła. Lekko ziemisty posmak, goryczka średnia. Po ogrzaniu gdzieś tam w tle momentami wyczuwalne są estry. Nie jest jakoś rewelacyjnie, ale chciałbym mieć krajowego pilsa koncerniaka na przynajmniej takim poziomie.
High carbonated, metallic aftertaste. Largely disappointing if you’ve tried a wide range of German lager pilsners previously like my self.

Aromat koncernowy, słód, mokre zboże, estry bananowe i mokra szmata.
Smak wytrawny, nuty ziołowe, metaliczne i ziemiste od chmielu. Za nimi delikatna zbożowość.
Goryczka, nagazowanie oraz pełnia na poziomie średnim.
Piwo smakuje podobnie jak polskie koncerniaki z lat 90., jakoś tak najbardziej kojarzy mi się z ówczesnym Lechem Premium (oczywiście z puszki, bez skunksa).
Aromat bardzo słaby słodowy z lekka chmielowa szmata. Ubogi prawie wcale  nie pachnie.  Lekkie, słodkie, niska goryczka. O centymetry od typical euro lagera.
Nieco ubogi niemiecki pils, trochę pusty wodnisty z niezbyt wyraźną goryczką na plus kwiatowe nuty, bez rewelacji...

Barwa złota, klarowne, piana biała, średnio obfita, średnio trwała. W aromacie słodowe, lekko zbożowe. W smaku słodowe, typowy słód pilzneński, muśnięcie chmielu. Goryczka do średniej, wysycenie i ciało w normie. Typowy pils.
Klarowne, piana po nalaniu obfita, utrzymuje się długo. Klasyczny niemiecki pils, ale w wersji nieco ubogiej. Nie dziej się wiele, w aromacie lekki dms, czuć słód pilzneński. Goryczka raczej niska.
Búza sőrkostolás után. Nem reális kóstolás utáni vélemény. Innom kell megtenni ilyet. :D
Nagyon tetszetős megjelenésű sör. A habja nagyon gyorsan eltünt de ez lehet a hőmérséklete miatt is.

Bottle from Asda. Light gold with small white head but disappointingly no retention. Aroma of grain, straw, light malts and sugar. Taste is the same with a sharp but short lived bitterness. Light body, moderate carbonation. 

Not as crisp and refreshing as Lidl's Perlenbacher but this does have more flavour and complexity  so I will say this edges it when comparing the two.
Halmgul klar vätska med tjockt vitt skum. Svaga aromer av bröd och gräs. Tunn, tunn smak. Kort eftersmak.
What taste, great drinkability, smooth palate,  light head,  overall, a great beer.

660ml bottle shared in the garden with Peter, 30th May 2020.  Had this straight from the freezer, it’s clear, aroma is straw, light booze and hay.  Taste is clean, fairly bitter, some pils character, not bad as a refresher
Not the best lager type beer on market but netherless a very refreshing drink. A light golden drink with a head that fizzled out rather quickly. Sharp citrus taste.
Nice pilsner beer. Very refreshing from those citrus notes with a little bitterness. Far better than most pilsners on the Irish market

Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Aroma of dry malt, herbal notes. Taste has bitter hop notes on the front of the tongue, hop oils coat the mouth, dry malt base. Palate has residual wheat notes on the nose. Good.

2 mai 2020 Bouteille achetée à La Vignery. Peut être comparée à la pils tchèque d'hier. Cette allemande est plus légère en gout, en malt, en houblons, même si on retrouve des similitudes. Facile à boire quand même!
1 aout 2021 Canette de 50 cl en supermarché à Oléron. Pas chère, correcte. Plus un helles qu'une pils à mon gout.

Piwo klarowne o słomkowej barwie. Średniej wielkości biała piana o krótkiej trwałości. W aromacie diacetyl, subtelnie chmielowo- ogólnie płasko i nudno. Trunek średniowysycony. W smaku podobne wrażenia jak w aromacie. Umiarkowanie udany, nieciekawy pilsner.

I have drank a lot of German beers (light and dark) over the years and this has always been my old reliable go to beer. It is very clean-unlike St. Pauli Girl and Becks. I have also had more expensive pilseners that were not worth the extra money.

Ok i have drink better "Pilsener" beers but still is an ok beer too. The problem here is im not big fan for wheat beers and this beer has many wheat inside. From the aroma and only you feel exist some real wheat to eat in the beer.
Despite that the taste is watery and bitter with short aftertaste bitter duration. The carboration is soft.
Overall an ok beer but nothing crazy.
Deep gold in colour. Bright & bubbly, with smooth malty tastes. Has a light bitter finish - well rounded.
Quite simply the best lager I've had. A classic on draught or bottled. Excellent in a frosty glass in summer. Refreshing, tasty, almost perfect German lager.

Butelka 0,5 l. Piwo słomkowe, całkowicie klarowne. Piana biała, średnio obfita, bardzo trwała, z piękną koronką. W aromacie nuty siarki, dms-u w postaci kiszonej kapusty, które czuć tylko z butelki, siana lub suszonej trawy, słodowe, kukurydziane słodu pilzneńskiego. W smaku bliskie wytrawności, kwaskowe, słód, kukurydza, siano, ziołowość, chleb, pozostaje na podniebieniu lekki ziołowy posmak. Pełnia niska, wysycenie wysokie, goryczka niska, ale zaznaczona ziołowa. Nieco wadliwy w aromacie, ale czysty w smaku i pijalny pils. Może być, choć piłem to piwo będące w lepszej formie.

Bardzo fajny, całkiem nawet goryczkowy pils. Pachnie słodowo i nic więcej, ale w smaku fajne, nisko wysycone, goryczkowe, bardzo pijalne. Zaskakująco solidny niemiecki pils, z charakterystyczną, ziemistą, konkretną goryczką.

Wizualnie klarowne, z dosc obfita piana drobno i sredniopecherzykowa. W aromacie nie za wiele sie dzieje jest w sumie tylko slod. W smaku lekka goryczka, w miare tresciwe jak na ten styl. Bez wiekszych wad calkiem poprawne.

On board of Eurowings flight to VIE
Classic German pils, not sure there's anything more to add. Bit watery, sweet malty, low bitterness. And that's it
Thought from memory that I liked this. Got it fit sessions and hmmm. Got the cardboard mustiness as soon as it went off super chilled. Ultra cold- yes. Anything else then not in bottle.
Very nice sweet , malty , bready German pilsner. Easy to drink enjoyable beer.
Keg at the Sportsman, Croxley Green in 2013. Clear mid golden. Aroma of lager malt and doughy bread. Fairly well balanced bitterness and quite crisp.

Dlaczego eksportowe pifko musi być w cenie piw rzemiślniczych? Tym bardziej takie. Początkowo był to dobrze zapowiadający się koncert o nazwie zwykły pilsner. Niemiecki kompozytor jednakowosz zafałszował ostatnie nuty dodając mocarny posmak spirytu na końcu partytury.

#  1645; 11/2019. On tap.
Floral and malty aroma. Straw, big and long lasting head. Spicy, slighlty malty, light body, very drinkable. Very good german pilsner. 0,5 l draught, restaurant, Berlin.
6-4-6-3-13=*3,2

Edit 7/2021. Can.
Floral to spicy aroma, candy, metalic. Clear gold body; white head. Floral, glucose syrup, metalic, malty. Long hars bitter finish. Bad beer. 0,5 l, can, gift.
Förutsägbart tyskt pilsnermässig arom med ljus malt och en aning humle. Frisk doft. Något mer komplex smak med vissa toner av honung och torkad frukt. Avsevärt intressantare smak än arom.

Słomkowe. Czysty kryształ. 
Obfita biała piana. Znakomicie oblepia. 
Aromat chmielowo słodowy. 
O ile w zapachu przeważał chmiel, tak w smaku jest na odwrót. 
Jest ziołowa goryczka. Nawet niezła. Ale też coś niefajnego. Stara szmata, czy coś.

Butelka 22.07.20
Aromat: słodowy, zbożowy, lekko chmielowy
Wygląd: jasnozłoty, piana średniopęcherzykowa, dość długo się utrzymuje
Smak: lekko słodowe
Dość pełne, całkiem fajny lager

Złociste, klarowne.
Piana biała, średnio wysoka.
Aromat słodowy.
W smaku lekko nachmielone.
Ani dobre ani złe.

Bought my bottle as Warsteiner Pilsener mild-hopfig.
This beer is clear golden with a thin head. Grassy, light fruity smell. Bitter taste with a malty edge as many Pilseners. High carbonation and a bitter aftertaste.
Uzupełnienie ocen piwnych bez opisu z uwagi na przeniesienie z papierowych zapisków.
If you’re looking for a Pilsner, this is 100% average and is good to go for any situation! Not too bitter, just above my preferred 20 IBU. White head, beautiful golden color!

Warsteiner is a good choice always. Good personality, great aroma and lovely taste.
It's a pilsner type beer , with a bitter main taste. A little bit fruity notes. Middle carbonated and weak foam.
I like it at all
Tap at cafe des anges in Paris. A very moorish macro pilsner to be honest. Good bitterness and quaffability.
Złociste, klarowne, z solidną pianą, zdobiącą szkło. Aromat słodowy z nutą mokrej sierści i skromnym powiewem cytryny. W smaku mało się dzieje - lekka słodowość, niska goryczka i tyle.

Tap @ Ristorante Milano, Berlin.
Pours clear pale golden color with a head. Grassy hoppy aroma, some grainy notes. Flavor is malty bitter, subtle grassy notes, some orange on the finish. Not very pleasant.
3413

Golden, clear, medium carbonation and two finger white head that disappears quickly. Fresh smell of intense malt with trances of citrus, yeast, bread and some spicies. The taste is more bitter and very refreshing, medium carbonation, intense malt, floral, citrus, yeast and bread. The finish is not too intense or durable, only some yeast and baked bread.
Good and decent Pilsner. Pours clear golden with a thick white head. It's very enjoyable and refreshening.

Pours a clear, bubbly, yellow color. Two finger white head. Great retention and good lacing.

Aroma is pilsener. Soft malt. Light bitter hops. Cracker, butter. 

Taste is cracker, light butter. Crisp. Light lemon.

Mouthfeel is light bodied. Crisp. Lightly dry. Lightly oily.

Overall it’s okay. Typical pils. I’d buy it again and would probably buy it again.
Earlier Rating: 9/6/2015 Total Score: 2.7
Pours a very clear, very pale straw color. About one finger head. Some lacing. Looks like your average lager.

Aroma is grassy hops. Light roasted malt. I’m searching for something more,but not really finding it.

Taste is like a pilsner. Yeah, I taste a lot of grassy hops. Some malts in there, but the sweetness isn’t there. It’s more bitter. It’s a little bready. Not so impressive,

Mouthfeel is bitter. It’s crisp, it’s clean. It’s dry. It’s average. It fits the style.

Overall, it’s okay. I would have it again, maybe. Not the best lager/pilsener, but far from the worst.
This a very good Pilsner in my opinion. Fresh and crispy taste, easy drinking and very enjoyable.

1.2 oz bottle. Pours a bright gold with a nice solid white head. Scents of bread and crackers. Good pils flavors with a light hops bite. Fresh and crisp with above average carbonation. Balanced and above average.

Pale yellow golden pour with a massive white frothy head. Wet dog aroma, softly malty, some yeast, hop, bread, crispy bread crust. Just under medium sweet and bitter, softly acidic. Halfway medium bodied with medium bubblies. Really like the bread crust aroma/taste of this one. Definitely a new favorite session lager/pilsner.
a Great tasting beer with a flavour that really suprised me, I wasn’t expecting there to be almost no bitterness
Аромат не сильный, но хороший, типовой. Карбонатизация оптимальная, вкус тоже неплох, но не более того. Обычный добротный пилснер.
Despite the hype, the beer is not much different from your standard light lager. Slightly more bitter.

Słomkowe, klarowne z dość obfitą, ale niezbyt trwałą pianą. W aromacie słodowe, żelaziste z lekkim DMSem. W smaku dośc pełne słodowe, lekko żelaziste ze średnią goryczką. Średnio-wysokie wysycenie. Ogólnie o klasę lepsze lepsze o polskich koncerniaków, ale też się nie ma czym zachwycać.
0.5 l bottle. Pours clear pale golden with small head. A: mild, generic T: medium carbonated with medium body, bitter,

Riecht typisch industriell muffig. Goldenes Bier mit einer mittelporigen Schaumkrone. Der Antrunk ist muffig, bitter. Sehr getreidig, muffhopfig. Ein absolutes Standardbier. Mehr nicht. Reicht zum Abschießen
Cerveza comercial con poco sabor pero correcta, sabor a cereal disipado y espuma fina

Bottle poured in tulip

Aroma: malty, honey-like sweetness in the aroma, also a hint of noble hop. The aroma profile is pleasing, but a bit heavy and sweeter than the other pils I have had.

Appearance: Golden body with white head, the head retention was sub-par 

Flavor: honey-like sweetness in the body, pleasing to drink. Medium to low bitterness, well-rounded profile. The malty flavor is very strong and prominent. 

Mouthfeel: medium level of carbonation, smooth finish

Overall: this is a good beer to drink, but as a pilsner, it just seems to be a bit sweet for me. I really like this beer, but I am not sure if this is what I should expect from a German pilsner.
Barwa słomkowa, przejrzysta. Bardzo słodkie, goryczka rachityczna i dość "żelazista", nieco kwiatowe. Aromat też nie powala. Chlalne, acz są lepsze pilsy z Reichu.
bottle at home bought from local supermarket. was very carbonated for me this was not a good example of a pilsner and more like a helles
Looks good but taste is disappointing. Sweet and a little weird, like they have mixed in some non-alcoholic beer.
Kolor bardzo jasny, piana obfita po czasie opada i zostawia lekką koronę. W smaku czuć kukurydzę
Finom germán pils, még egy kis szotyissag is befigyelt nagy meglepetésemre.
Gold with a frothy white head that fades. Grassy aroma full of pils malt and cereals. Taste is mildly bitter the whole way through. Medium to lightish body, refreshing. Drinkable but mediocre.
Clear, golden colored, strong white head. Malty with some grainy notes, moderate- sweet, medium-light bitterness, dryish finish. Medium-light bodied, soft carbonation, bit watery.
Im Flugzeug getrunken. Optisch einwandfrei, in der Nase Getreide, deutlich auch im Trunk, aromatischer als erwartet. Hinten weg halt recht langweilig, erst spät etwas bitter.
Bottle from Spar. Clear golden appearance. Aroma is corn and malt. Flavour is crisp and malt.

Aroma: Herb hop .. Light honey
Taste: Malt-Sweetish with a intoxicating aftertaste. Excellent body of beer, velvety taste. In the aftertaste bitterness hop .. Not bad!
11.2 oz bottle. Smells like a lager. Crystal clear, straw yellow in color. A little sweet, malty. Very inoffensive, but not impressive. Lingering sweet aftertaste. An ok pilsner.

Draft. Golden color, with creamy white head. Aroma is malty, with classic pils hops. Taste is quite similar, malty, with bitter finish. Some metallic notes. Well carbonated. Classic pils, nothing special but ok.

Zwyczajny, koncernowy lager, niewiele różniący się od tych, których pełno i na naszym rynku. Słodko-kukurydziany, lekko słodowy, wodnisty, estrowy. Na plus na pewno wygląd i to, że nie ma jakichś większych wad.
Dobrze wygląda choć piany mało i szybko się rozpuszcza. Lekkie bąbelki i wysoce wyczuwalny smak alkoholu. Średnio.
Una pils in stile tedesco, bevibile, niente male. Migliore di altre birre commerciali più blasonate. Si sente il luppolo, un retrogusto leggermente amaro, come ogni buona pilsner.
Zapach słaby, słodowy, estrowy. Smak wodnisty, lekko gorzkawy, metaliczny. Nic specjalnego.
Strong taste of grain which I really like personally. Tastes like peanut, almond. Earthy grass.

Cerveza ligera, de carbonatación baja y con una cabeza espumosa que dura por uno o dos minutos. Aroma a lúpulo y granos. En boca es acuosa, destacando el lúpulo por encima del resto. Final seco y corto.

Getrunken im Schlafwagen Wien-Berlin, wo der Schaffner dieses Bier neben den klassischen Stiegl im Angebot hatte.
Eines muss man dem Bier lassen: auch wenn es ein Industriebier ist, so hat es doch seinen eigenen Charakter. Es hat eine ordentliche Herbe ähnlich dem Zwettler Export. Auch wenn es nicht sonderlich hopfenbetont ist, so ist es doch interessant. Kann man trinken, aber es gibt auch bessere.

Mini-Casks and 660ml Bottle from B&M, Team Valley, Gateshead.

Pale golden coloured that pours with a massive rocky white head of foam (Mini-Cask version). It has a smooth malt, toffee and grassy flavour followed by a slight floral fruity creamy finish. Not bad.

Bottle poured a clear yellow with a small lasting creamy white head. Aromas of straw, graininess and light noble hops. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of straw, graininess and a hint of earthiness with a crisp dry finish.
Jasnozłociste piwo z ładną obfitą średnio pęcherzykową białą pianą. Aromat słodowy trochę chmielu, czuć estry. W smaku wodniste, słodowe z lekką goryczką chmielową, lekko wytrawny.
Bevuta diverse volte.  Tipica pils tedesca. Leggera e bevibile. Nulla di particolare.

Sampled at Brauahaus Schmidts, Clear gold with larger bubbled white head. Notes are cracker, stale hops, grain, toast, and a touch of citrus but hard to pick out. A touch metallic. Not a very good lager
0,5l can Nürnberg- golden clear with a white head- typical lager with a mainstream taste a little better that other filtered beers
Orange color, big foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.
Običan lager, ništa posebno, dobra karbonizacija, okus i miris umjereni... standard
Una muy buena cerveza sobre todo para acompañar con carnes rojas o choripán

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
Fat på Örebro ölhall. Ljust gul med vitt skum. Smak och doft av citrus och bröd.
0,5l can. Nicely carbonated sipping head. Lovely golden colour. Pleasant bitterness. Good beer. Just the pilsner you want. Take care. Love.
Smaakvol en stevig pilsener bier met een stevige hop smaak. -backlog de BierApp-
Aroma 3. Appearance 3. Taste 4. Palate 3. Overall 9. Cereals and some flower aroma. Malt, refreshing taste. A hint of hops aftertaste.
Just another German beer average at best.. 4.8 sold it for me... Had a bit of metallic aftertaste even from the bottle available in kegs from morrisons but that would be hard work..
Gulbrun farge medhvitt skum. Lukter malt. Smaker litt metalisk, pepper. Lite fylde.
A good pilsener beer, with light color, soft body, average carbonized, soft bitterness, (drunk a 33cl beer at "Lufthansa OPO-FRA flight" #755)(#65 DE)(#12 North Rhine-Westphalia).
Clear, pale yellow pour with a small white head. The aroma has corn and some cereal. It has a light body with thin texture and average carbonation. The taste is mildly sweet and slightly dry.
Pachnie lekko estrami i słodem, jednak niezbyt intensywnie. W smaku nijakie, dość wodniste, metaliczny posmak. Goryczki praktycznie nie czuć. Słabo.
Found from can on flight to Munich. Pours clear yellow. Very basic flavorings. A little less than middle of the road.

Frisch gezapft in Bar in Paris. Klare Farbe. Mittelgroße Schaumkrone. Angenehmes erfrischendes Aroma.Ausgewogene Hopfennote. Hat mir gefallen. Das Wassee ist wie auf der Vepackung beschrieben sehr weich und harmonisch.
Op 1 september bij Carien, house warming party in Delft. Lekker doordrink pils, gedronken uit de fles. Prima.
Jaune paille, mousse sympa, nez de céréale. En bouche, c'est du pain avec le côté herbeux des houblons nobles. Très rafraîchissant et agréable en bière de soif.

Typisch Duitse Pils, ziet er prima uit maar heeft ietsje meer bitterheid dan we in Nederland gewend zijn. Ook op een andere manier, het is droog bitter, niet met de frisheid en aroma’s van bijvoorbeeld IPA of tjechische pils.

Kortom: prima typisch Duits pilsje, maar springt er absoluut niet uit.
From backlog. 0,3 litre Bottle from Systembolaget Charlottenberg. Clear Golden with white head. Malts, hops and some bitterness.
500ml can. Clear golden with a frothy white head. Flavors are toasted cereals and banana bread with fruity, herbal and floral notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, soft texture.
Malty taste with low bitterness. Medium body with medium carbonation. Would prefer it dryer and more carbonated.

Helder blond gekleurd bier met een goede witte kop.
Smaakt wat zoetig, moutig en best koppig voor een pils.
Erg lekker bij het eten op een warme vakantiedag.

Clear yellow color with quickly disappearing white head.
Aroma: light malty
Taste: medium bitter

Prima pilsener, maar niet zo lekker als Bittburger. Warsteiner smaakt vrij ... Nederlands.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle in the sun and this one was way too sweet for me. We agreed that it really wasn't as good as the Krombacher and this is not one to revisit.

Lager alemana. Capa de espuma blanca densa. Un buen sabor equilibrado y refrescante donde prevalece la Malta ligeramente tostada. No amarga. Suave y tersa al paladar. Retrogusto un poquitín seco. Una lager muy agradable. Por precio/calidad una de las mejores opciones para comprar en supermercados italianos.
Very drinkable export pilsner with enough character to tide me over until I can re-supply with Jever.
Clear yellow. Minimal head. Aroma: malt, hay, honey. Taste follows. Crisp, high carbonation. Mild bitter finish. Decent.

Clear golden. Aroma is herbal hops some treber and malt. Dough and slight fruit. Taste is tart hoppy at first with dusty chalk later. Also malty sweetness. Sadly not very drinkable. A bit harsh. Malty finish. I expected much worse.
Disappointing taste. I would describe it to that of drinking the grease from a cooked joint.
W aromacie nic. Mocno słodowe w smaku, goryczka brak. Pijalnie całkiem spoko. W menu było napisane że to pils
Tipican pilsener...blijedo zlatna boja i slaba pjena...jako fin okus i veoma pitko,odlicno za nepce..

Can, 330 ml. Above average lager especially for the money it costs. To be honest, i'm really surprised on this one. Classic golden, head with big bubbles, not pretty foam, goes away quickly. Expressive aromas of malt and yeast, kind of bready, i guess i called GBR on blind. Even the not so much CO2 is quite British, but yeah, it's way too aromatic than an English beer. On the palate it's more German pilsner, rich and tasty, long aftertaste with extra taste of hops. It smells off-dry, but the finish is bitter. Great concept, well made beer, definitely a good stuff for the money... update: the bottled 330ml taste even better, but costs a bit more (1.32€), but this beer is just worth the money doesn't matter if it's canned or bottled. Update: tasted on draught, lemony malty, but it still tastes like a one with good inner content inside. A bit thin on the palate, aftertaste is short. Not bad anyway...
Bright yellow. Small, bubbly head. Aroma is dishwashing liquid. Taste is extremely sweet malt and lemon. Pretty gross.
Gylden, med fin hvid skum krone.. let humlet, medium bitter, citrus, hø.. ok, når den er iskold i 28 graders varme
Fles 33cl thuis als Warsteiner Premium Pilsener.  Maltig hoppig, zoet smaakje, ietsje bitter. (10-2010).

A color that matches a nice bright lager. The foam was creamy, hard and durable. German malt tickets hide next to the hops. Really very round and soft beer. The foam is also delicious. It is less hopy than the Czech pilsners. For me, it's real German ... pure, you can't tie it up.
***
Egy szép világos lagerhez illő szín.  A hab krémes kémény és tartos volt. Németes malátás jegyek bujnak a komló mellé. Tényleg nagyon kerek és lágy sör. A habja is finom. A cseh pilseniekhez képest kevésbé komlós.  Számomra igazi német... tiszta, nem lehet belekötni.

Bem maltada, com amargor e carbonatação médios.
Espuma pouco densa.
Simples e boa, mas nada demais tirando o malte.

Finom pilseni típúsú sör. Ami nagyon különleges benne és nagyon sok rajongót szerez szerintem vele, hogy nagyon selymes, lágy a kortyérzet. Az idáig kóstolt német pilsek mind inkább élesek, karcosabbak.
Descend vite si elle est fraiche et qu'il fait chaud. Elle est largement au dessus  des bières que l'on trouve en France.
Bottle. Pours clear straw yellow with little head. Aroma and flavour are grainy malts, grass, metallic. Not good.
Pour from bottle is a clear yellow with minimal head. Clean, crisp, dry, and light.  Mild bread and yeast stand out

Looks like enjoying this brew on a plane isn't the most unusual scenerio out there. 12 oz can, and poured on a flight to Frankfurt. First beer of the trip, so certainly no complaints. Besides, I expected my first on this trip to be of the "premium" variety. A bright and clean golden pour. Short oily head that sticks around. A more or less inoffensive Euro lager here, with all straw aromas and flavor. Plastic hints. A surprising amount of hop influence to this brew though. Keeps things interesting, I suppose.

Review: 0,5l, a nice can of Warsteiner Premium German Pilsener: ABV. 4.8% vol 

In a nice light brownish coloured can with the famous and striking Warsteiner logo of the crown with the slogan “Eine Königin unter den Bieren” (“A Queen amongst Beers”). 

On pour got a nice decent frothy white head of beer with a light golden colour, a nice looking beer. Not a bad looking beer. 

A very beery lagery smell, malty but light enough on the nose. 

Good initial soft taste. Very smooth, very easy to drink. Slight grainy taste.

Bit of an aftertaste that is apparent in the back end. Light enough though.

Very smooth, nice and clean, easy to drink.

Would be nice to have a kick or a stronger taste though as it is a little too mild for me.

2nd can.
Slight grassy taste. Creamy and malty. Frothy mouthful. Very smooth. 
No real kick, little alcohol to be tasted. Very watery too. 

After an initial flurry of excitement it all got a little bit boring and generic in the end. Ok beer, could be better.
Draft at Moriartys. Clear pale gold with some modest white foam. Mostly standard Pils. Lightly toasted bready malts. Modest hops leave hints of citrus and pine. Nothing offensive.

Pours pale gold that is kind of bubbly w/ a white head & a lot of lacing. The aroma is boring that is a little bready. The taste is mild cereal & otherwise clean. It has a decent & fairly soft mouthfeel. Overall it's completely forgettable & not recommended!
It's a mostly mineral tasting very middle of the road pilsener. It's light, sparkly and tastes a good deal like the carbonation. That said, it's definitely refreshing.
Gedronken van tap bij MovieWorld Germany. Het is een goudgeel bier met een witte schuimkraag. Het heeft een moutige geur. De smaak is moutig en maisachtig, ebt snel weg.

5-3-6-3-12


Can, 4,7 % abv, three months before bbd. Pours clear pale yellow, with a big creamy head. Aroma is grainy malts with cereals, as well as herbal hops. Medium to full body, with average carbonation. Flavour is malty notes with grains and caramels, as well as zesty, herbal hops with citrus and grassy notes. Bitter finish.
Better than most light lagers, has some noticeable hop aroma. Clean & light, decent version of the style. Hamburg

Very much the lager type beer I try to avoid these days. There was a time, 9-10 years ago where seeing one of these in the shelf might inspire me to buy it, as an alternative to all the domestic stuff, but these days its a burpfest of a grassy, slightly citrusy beer I just can't abide by.
Легкий,світлий лагер.Карбонізація невелика.Аромат солоду,водянисте.Піна невелика,біла.

Very nice Warsteiner. A little too much hops, but still had a decent taste and was a pleasure to drink. Thanks Warsteiner, I am appreciating your brews more and more.

update - 6/29/2018 -- what is with the odd aftertastes????  a good brew, but I find myself offering excuses, from time to time, for why it has a mineral taste, or other odd tastes.  Recently, there was a bitter aftertaste.  No, not hops, I understand that.  Yes, this beer has a little  TOO MUCH HOPS for my taste.  This was simply a bitter taste, as if someone had accidently wiped some stuff across the top of the bottle.  Not a good taste.  Then, the next day, I tried another and it tasted fine.  What is up???  Did the store spill some crap on a case and never cleaned it up???
Argh pilsener, so saturated to this type of beer, had to try it, wishing... (if I had a photograph of you).
Beer that all in all defends itself well between the commercial market, thin foam and that fades after a few seconds, a hint of wheat and citrus with perhaps excessive carbonation
330ml bottle @ Lufthansa flight from HEL to MUC. Smooth, slightly grassy and earthy lager with hints of hay and malts. Okay and clean.

Tap@Taphouse, Copenhagen (17/02/2018) - pours gold with a white head. Grassy and grainy with some white pale bready malts, some straw, hay, cereal, light watery body, papery cardboard notes, grassy grainy bitter close.
Piwo wypite jakiś czas temu. Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji, w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
Cerveja clara, pouca espuma. Leve, sabor um pouco amargo e marcante, lembra camarão.
herbs, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, soft carbonation, average carbonation,
Pale yellow, clear, effervescent pour.  Grain and grassy flavors with a bitter and undesirable aftertaste.
Clear light golden color with small white head. Grassy aroma with light bitter taste and bittersweet aftertaste.

Butelka 0,5 l. Wypita 09.01.2018. Barwa słomkowa, idealnie klarowna. Piana biała, ładna, długiej trwałości. W aromacie masa kukurydzy. Smak chrupek kukurydzianych, trochę  słodowości. Minimalna goryczka. Wodniste.
Ar: malt, slight hint of oxidation Ap: clear yellow, minimal head T: med sweetness, med bitterness P: lively carbonation

500ml can from the shop, drunk at home. Pours clear with a brief thin white frothy head, some lacing and bead. Pale straw in colour. Aroma of cereal, bread and hints of malt. Creamy at first in the mouth with slightly floral hops and biscuit flavours. Quite a bit of sweetness and a well-balanced bitter finish. Overall, another well-known pilsener that fails to make a lasting impression.
Jasnozłociste piwo z ładną obfitą białą pianą. Aromat słodowy trochę chmielu. W smaku podobnie podstawa słodowa z lekką goryczką chmielową, finisz lekko wytrawny. Poprawny pils
Meilenweit entfernt vom "einzig Wahren". Klassisches deutsches Massen-Bier. Getreidig malzige Noten mit einer minimalen süße, viel Wasser und einer unausgewogenen leichten Herbe. Nicht mein Fall...
Pours clear with a white, bubbly head. The smell is cereal and hay. Tastes sweeter than most pilsners with a toasted grain and typically grassy quality. Overall, an uninteresting pilsner.

Dal colore giallo limpido, versa un dito di schiuma che svanisce poco dopo. Aroma gradevole di malto e luppolo. Per essere una Pils industriale il sapore è più che discreto, non sarà la miglior birra al mondo ma si lascia bere con piacere. Unica pecca il retrogusto un po' metallico.

Nice overall beer. Still quite heavy but a lot of flavour. Bit of strange after taste but not unpleasant 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The average crisp and grassy profile of a lager, but nothing else. It's just wet grains, combined in a watery mouthfeel. Meh.
660ml bottle from Tesco, Reading. Gold colour with white head. Sweet cereal malt, grains, slight artificial citrus, crisp + refreshing.
Had in leeds during oktoberfest . Not half bad pilsner. malty taste with minimal hops and a clean crisp finish

Schmeckte mir überraschend gut für eine große Marke, Industrieprodukt hin oder her - ich fand’s gut. Frisch, angenehm herb und leicht süßlich.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Botella de 33 cl. Color amarillo oro, cristalina. Espuma blanca, poca o nula retención. Aroma casi imperceptible, notas florales muy tenues, pan, malta. Sabor plano, ligeramente amargo, notas a pan, cereal. No es desagradable, me esperaba más.

Bardzo dobry pilsner, jak dla mnie, może na ocenę mają wpływ niskie oczekiwania. Warzony przy zastosowaniu niemieckiego prawa czystości. Wygląd - piękny, barwa złocista, klarowna, niemała piana, jest lacing; duże wysycenie. Aromaty chmielowe, ziołowe, przyjemne. Dobra balans słodowo-goryczkowy, naprawdę dobrze ułożone.

A real disappointment. Pours dirty gold, very thin white head, medium carbonation. Aroma of herbs and bready dough. Taste of something like a burnt cracker or burnt bread, some wheat and yeast taste, very metallic honey type finish. Palate is incredibly thin which lets it down. Piss wasser.
Robe blonde très pale, fine mousse blanche, beaucoup de bulles.Nez faible de céréales, Bouche ultra fade légèrement sucrée et amère. Bonne carbo. C'est une mauvaise bière !
Fat örebro ölhall. Gyllengul klar vätska. Doft av bröd och örtig humle. Liknande i smak. Blöt kartong och söt maltkänsla

330ml bottle. Pours clear golden, white average head. Aroma of typical pilsner, grain, malts. Taste is same, typical macro pilsner, but I can feel some hoppy bitterness here. Light to medium bodied, over average carbo. It's not that good, as my rating, but I just finished ultra marathon and that was only beer in local bar, which was not local macro. After marathon goes down very well, but second bottle isn't that good anymore.
Pośród autobahnowych puszkowców jeden z lepszych przemysłowych pilsnerów, do wypicia na zimno bez grymasów.
Boca 0,5L - kupljena ku Konzumu....korektan njemački pilsner, lagan, pitak kakav i treba biti..

Pours a thick, sudsy white head which leaves some lacing. Color is golden with moderate streaming bubbles. Aroma of toasted malt and herbal hops. Mouthfeel is light and crisp. Flavors of cracker, toasted bread, with a noticeable, lingering hop bite. Overall a very solid pilsner.

Enjoyed: Poured from a can into footed pilsener glass. 
Appearance: Clear golden colour, with medium head. 
Aroma: Grains, malt, hay, hint of hops. 
Palate: Light to medium body, average carbonation.
Taste: Bread, corns, grains, hops; gently bitter with bitter aftertaste.
Overall impression: Drinkable, tasty and enjoyable.
Pours clear pale yellow with a thin head. Aroma of malts and hay. Taste of malts, a bit of corn. Watery. Light bitter finish. Pretty standard for a pilsener
Backlog, ocena wystawione na podstawie wspomnień. Dość przeciętny w swoim stylu.
aroma lupulado, bem como o seu sabor também lupulado. coloração amarelo ouro, pouco turva. corpo leve.
One of Germany's best selling and best-marketed Pils. Sure, not bad at all, but a PIls is a Pils, unfortunately none is really outstanding, including this.
Color amarillo anaranjado. Poca carbonatación, espuma de un dedo de grosor, poca retención. Olor a hierbas y sabor a malta. Final poco amargo. Muy básica, industrial digamos.

a beer to calm the thirst. It's a plain beer, easy, the kind of beer you can drink one liter. Is not a gastronomic beer but the kind of beer you want after a long walk in the Alps or when you are wishing to refresh hour throat with beer. Superior to most of commercial beers.
Bottle. Malty aroma, with hint of herbal notes. Taste dry, bit bitter. Malty, papery with some floral/herbal notes. Not bad after all.
Herbs, flowers, cereal in nose. Pours golden with white head. Taste is medium dry with cereal notes, herbs and some flowers. Medium bitter finish, lively carbonation. Overall decent.

Fles @ Pizzaria Tenne, IV 2019. Ja Warsteiner bier hadden we vroeguh wel eens in zo'n tap vaatje van 5 liter. Maar dat was een groot woord je prikte bovenin een gaatje en onderin liep via een tapje het bier uit het blik. Maar juist door die tijden is dit biertje in me herinnering naar grote hoogte gestegen. Heeft een helder gele kleur met genoeg koolzuur. Ruikt naar lager, proeft moutig en redelijk bitter wat je van dit soort type ook mag verwachten en drinkt gewoon fantastisch door. Absoluut niks mis mee en naar mijn mening echt wel een van de betere supermarkt pilsjes. Als je gewoon onbezorgd een avondje door wilt drinken zonder in een complex van moeilijke smaken wilt belanden die je daarna ook moet definiëren. Zal het in de toekomst vaker zeggen. Het raten met een spectrum van vijf facetten is fantastisch maar juist bij doordrink biertjes mis ik nog een zesde spectrum. Waardoor ze naar mijn mening toch iets onderbelicht worden van weer de zo veelste imperial stout waarvan je maar twee slokjes van kan drinken voordat je weer op je kop staat. Orgineel glas
Blikje gedronken tijdens vakantie. Goudgeel helder bier. Aroma en smaak is moutig. Bier is licht van smaak en heeft weinig nasmaak.

Bottle in Prime class lounge. Pale golden with a perfect head. Scent is pale malt and a bit unclean. Taste is off. Apple notes and pale cereal malt. I thought this was a world class weizen Brewer? Very disappointed. Metal. Finish is residing aluminum. In spite of correct temperature, very poor.
On tap in Germany. Golden color, malty, whit ok balance of hops, not a bad pilsner

Hazy yellow beer with a dry head. Aromas are sweetcorn, cereal, milk, cold porridge. Deficient. Sweeter than most nicer pilseners, this one bores me. Homeopathically thin, watery, disappears in a few seconds, pretty much no aftertaste, just that zingy metallic-wannabe-lemony end you get with bad lagers. Eugh. Boring and why? Can't really rate it much higher, I'm afraid, I find it even more boring than some of the better macrolagers.
Bottle. Clear golden colour, white foam. Light sweet malty, bit crispy and grassy. Not a bad pilsener but a bit boring.
Aroma: grains and grass. Taste, grass, herbal notes and grains as well as faint hay. Pretty nice bitterish finish. Nice beer.
In bottle, in Lufthansa plain to Frankfurt, not chilled enough, ok taste, no special aftertaste, mediocre, if I wouldn't know it's larger I'd say it's lite beer.
duft malt kant citrus lime 5smag blod og blid malt smag med lidt citrus og lime kant

(can 0,5l)

Aroma: Light hay hops, light malty.

Appearance: Clear yellow color. Medium white head.

Taste: Light bitter, light hops, light sweet malty.

Palate: Light-medium body. Light bitter finish.

Overall: Light german pils.

18/VIII/17 - 33cl bottle as "Warsteiner Premium Pilsener" from a Dutch supermarket @ Taste and Waste session 2 (home) - BB: 15/XII/17 (2017-1261) 


Clear pale blond beer, big solid creamy white head, unstable, falls down quickly, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: very malty, grains, cow fodder, sweet impression, fruity touch, a bit off. MF: soft carbon, medium to light body. Taste: sweet start, some almonds, grains, bit yeasty, herbal touch. Aftertaste: sweet still, metallic touch, more yeast, banana peel, bitter finish, pretty unpleasant. Nope.
Nula en nariz y muy escasa en boca. Excesivamente plana, incluso para una industrial. Bebestibilidad justita.
Clear straw colour, very thin white head. Faint aroma of light malt and herb. Light to medium body. Taste has bready malt, sweet grain, ok crisp finish.
the aroma is malty and herbal with shades of grain, straw and flowers... the taste is fresh and clear, malty, with notes of buckwheat, honey, hay and grain... dry aftertaste...

Bottle pours a clear pale straw golden with a large white head. Aroma of malt, yeast, and pungent grassy hops. Taste of sweet lightly bready malt, drying with yeast and hop bitterness. Drinkable, decent enough German Macro.

I found it not so tasty. But my Nyuszi found it really tasty. So we did not agreed on that.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Botella 33 cl del c Inglés Oviedo tomada en Oviedo junio 2000. Sin lote. Fcpref 02..08..2002. hasta 07..2001.(r2192). Cereales. Cuerpo ligero fácil de beber. Normal .

Light gold lively carbonation half a finger white foamy head

Restrained nose typical lager grassy herbal notes. When the beer warms it becomes more malty in character with a little caramel. 

Thin but refreshingly crisp mouthfeel but not at all sharp or biting. 

Initially it's underwhelming, with distinct lack of penetrating bitterness. Scorched grassy herbal note upfront with a faint hint of vanilla flowing in. When it's warmed a little there are fuller flavours coming through; herbal and caramel. Principally its unchallenging light and dry mermaids pee.

0.5 can @ Marek's Birthday 
 Clear, gold, small, white. Aroma of hops and pale malts. Taste is very standard too, absolutely nothing special. Light, slick, lively. Short finish. Lacks any distinguishing features.
Bottle in Germany. Color is clear and pale yellow. Pours a white medium head. Taste is somewhat watery. Taste much like a classic pilsner except for the somewhat hopy finish. Decent.

660 ml bottle @home,bb 29/05/2018.
Pale straw,clear. Aroma of malt and hay.
Taste is malt,bittery finish. Above avg. carbonation.
A little bit watery.
Warsteiner Gold. Aluminum bottle @Lufhansa flight. Yet another pils and pretty bland at that, very low bitterness, almost nonexistent. Nice aluminum bottle though
Pale golden color, medium white head. Aroma malt and hay. Taste malt and grass.
This must be identical to Warsteiner Premium Pilsener. A good pilsener with a fresh taste.

I bought this .5 liter bottle in Cologne, Germany with no prior experience with the brew. Served ice cold into a short beer glass it comes with an expected clear yellow body and a shortly-surviving white foam. A whiff gives grain and a touch of grass. I find the taste to be a bit different than other pilseners with bread, a hint of lemon and perhaps a very small hoppiness. My imagination? Nothing exceptional but still decent.

Nice golden beer. No head to speak of but a nice refreshing drink. Bottle drunk at home. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled and canned,  many times along the years,a few times on tap in Germany.

Average industrial pla lager, malt forward, more into the sweet side, lots of DMS, clean, crisp, refreshing and little more to say.

0.5l can from Aldi. Starts with medium head. Moderate aroma, sour bread, later some grassy spicy hints. Foam tastes bittersweet. The body is clear and golden. Taste is also bittersweet and also a little bit sour. Aftertaste is dominantly dry bitter, this is long lasting and nice. Moderate or a bit above carbonation. I have better memories of this beer when it was served on Lufthansa flights. This one is fairly boring, body is a bit thin, lacks maltiness and also spices. Drinkable, but nothing more.
Clear golden beer with small white head. Aroma is malty and yeasty like pilsener should be. Taste is low bitter with mild sweetness of malts. Light body. Refreshing beer.

I brew my own beer occasionally and yet I have to say that this is my all-time favorite beer. My oebr; rly problem is that I have a hard time finding it locally. Seems as if the stores don’t see it flying off the shelves, they don’t keep it on hand.
But make no mistake, this is a true German Pilsner, brewed to the highest German standards; which are far superior to our own. Love it, just tell me where to buy it.

Bottle, 660ml. Pours translucent yellow/gold with a huge frothy white head and loads of visible carb, large bubbles. Some patchy lacing. Aroma is light bready malt and damp carboard. Very light honey. Somewhat metallic bitterness but no hops other than that. Little bit of earth maybe? Could be worse. Taste is slightly sweet malt leading to a bitter middle and some lingering metallic bitterness in the long, wet finish. Body is light-medium, texture is watery and carbonation is surprisingly soft, but it’s smooth enough. Best I can describe this as is "damp".

330 ml bottle into lager glass, best before 6/15/2017. Pours fairly crystal clear pale golden/straw color with a 1 finger dense white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass. Aromas of cracker, lightly toasted biscuit, light honey, light pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Slight fruitiness in the nose, but pretty minimal. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance of pale malt and earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of cracker, lightly toasted biscuit, light honey, light pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of cracker, lightly toasted biscuit, pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Nice robustness and balance of pale malt and earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero astringent flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness, increasing through the glass. Very clean on lager flavors, with zero yeast notes present. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp, and fairly grainy/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is good. A little thin, but not watery feeling. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.8%. Overall this is a good German pilsener style. All around good robustness and balance of pale malt and earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink. A nicely enjoyable offering, and spot on style example.
clear pale yellow colour, strong aroma of malt, good bitterness, grainy taste, bitter aftertaste.

Bottle. Pale yellow in colour. Malty; grainy malts, slightly buttery taste. Hoppy; grassy hops. Sweet malty leading to mild hop bitterness. Refreshing. Dry mildly bitter hoppy finish. Easy drinking. (2009-06)

While the body is quite satisfying.

Poured from bottle into a pint glass
 Appearance – The beer pours a clear golden color with a nice billowy white head. The head has a good level of retention, slowly fading to leave tons of foamy lace.
 Smell – The aroma is of a crisp bready smell mixed with a little bit of a grainy smell as well as a lemon smell.
 Taste - The taste begins with a crisp and clean bready taste mixed with a little bit of lemon and herbal hop. As the taste advances some grassy hops join the profile and mix with some light grain tastes to leave a clean crisp flavor to linger on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel – The body of the brew is average to crisp with a carbonation level that is a bit higher. This was a great feel for creating a clean crisp and refreshing brew and suited the flavor profile well.
 Overall – I thought this was a rather nice clean drinking pils overall.

The beer has a simple pilsener appearance. The color of the beer is goon yellow. The beer is very clear with a rough foam on top. The bulk of the foam collapses quickly, but a little drape of foam remains. Almost no bubbles are rising towards the top. There are some hoppy and malty aroma’s. It is just a normal pilsener aroma. There is a tiny nuttiness though, which was also very strong in the Warsteiner Herb. In the taste this nuttiness is even stronger. There are also some nice fresh hops and some malts in the taste. Except for the nuttiness, the beer is quite simple and just like most pilseners. The beer has a nice tingling sensation in the mouth.
