Goût légèrement amer de houblon floral et herbeux (qui dure toute la gorgée) avec un goût de grains de malt pâle croustillants lors de l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute des notes de maïs sucré et un goût de houblon légèrement plus herbeux (foin) et asséchant vers la finale. Post-goût moyen et moyennement sec, légèrement amer de houblon herbeux et floral. [notes 2005]
Pours yellow with white head that doesn’t last. Light and dry, bitter, barley malt and hops. Average
Bottle. Aroma of light malt, straw and light hops. Clear yellow with white head, mostly diminishing. Tase is light sweet and light+ bitter. Light body, dry feel, avg. carb., bitter finish.

330 ml bottle poured at the creperie in Edmonton. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head that dies very quickly. Smells faintly of grass. Taste is slightly hoppy with a bit of a corn and grass. Just okay. But it was free so....

Canned, 500 ml. Pours clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grainy, grassy, malty, cardboard. Taste is hoppy, grainy, malty, and somewhat drier and more bitter than I expected from a pilsener, even a little metallic.

500 ml, can. Poured clear golden yellow, with a two finger white head that disappeared quickly. Aromas of cardboard, some malt, little citrus and floral essence. Taste pretty much continuation of the aromas. Not much going on here. Light bodied, with a short cardboardy finish. Overall a boring pilsner.

0,5lt bottle @ Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos, Greece
Clear golden-yellow color, white foam that’s not lasting very much. Aroma z bit sweet/honey, taste also bit sweet with bread, very little bitter, reminds me that aluminium taste (pasteurized?). Light carbonation

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ El Corte Ingles, Madrid, España.
A: Golden / Dorado.
T/S: Malt, sweet, slightly bitter / Malt, dulce, ligeramente amargo.
Classic German pilsner. It has that classic German ’bitter’ taste, while other Euro lagers/pilsners have less bitterness and more sweetness.
German pilsner beer. Light yellow. Particolar bitter taste. Fresh beer to drink every day.
Oft getrunken und für okay befunden. Ein recht charakterloses, aber frisches Pils ohne Missklänge.

0,33l bottle at home. BBV 01.06.2016. light yellow clear shiny color, medium big white head. smells of tobacco, cardboardish, a bit skunky, some light nuts, below average smell. medium body, medium carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of tobacco, light cardboard, a bit citric, some sweetness. finishes light dry and with some citric and tobacco notes. not too great.
Pours a very clear light gold with moderate head, with good lacing remaining. BB 15 July ’16. For me a pretty good pilsener. Can definitely feel it’s German. Above average - Prost!
Transparent light yellow color. Foam is not dense and disappear in less than a minute. Smells as a typical pilsner. Tastes a bit bitter for me.
Very fizzy to start, then settled down, Smooth with bittery kick, light pale colour, recommend with food as not too heavy
Flasche 0,33l: Goldgeld, klar, fester feinporiger Schaum; Milde, leicht süßliche Nase, etwas Honig/Sirup; Weicher, sehr milder Körper, leichte Hopfennoten, kaum Bitterkeit
Flaske. Farven er gyldengul og skumkronen er hvid. Aromaen er urteagtig humlet og smagen er den samme med en tør bitterhed.

Bottle 33cl. Clear yellow with a bright white head. Little carbonation. The aroma is typical pilsner, but with a heavy touch. The pilsner tastes spicy and fresh with a pleasant bitterness in the aftertaste.

Pours clear pale golden with a dissipating, frothy white head. The aroma contains citrus, bready malt and grain. It tastes light malty sweet and light grainy bitter; dry, grassy finish. Light body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation. Somewhat drying, there are better Pilseners. (Edited 20/5/18)
Bionda chiara, odore di cereali, leggero erbaceo. Sapore dolce di malto equilibrato dall’amaro finale. Non il mio genere preferito. Rinfrescante.
Bottle. Light gold with white head. Slightly skunked with earthy notes and peas. Crisp mouthfeel. Not great but I  found this beer satisfying in some strange way.

Barwa słomkowa, piana bez rewelacji, powoli opada. W aromacie chmiel i żelazo. Smak nie jest najgorszy, czuć chmiel i słód. Goryczka niska. Dość wodniste.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Another pilsener please! Not much to say about it now. Backlog from 2014/07/03.
Pours bright golden with conspicuous bubbles and large, white sticky head. Aroma is mild: porridge, cereal, bread, lemon zest. Taste is watery, fizzy and quite bitter. Nice refreshing simple pilsner.
11.2 oz. bottle. Pours clear/straw. Large white head. Aroma was sweet grass, barley and smokey peat. Taste was sweet.

Fuckin pilsner. You know. Not a fan of this style. ---Rated via BeerBuddy for iPhone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle on a Lufthansa flight. Gold with a lasting foam, lightly bitter, gassy, hints of sweetcorn.
Bright and very clear yellow shiny colour and the white tiny top. Medium carbonation and bitterness, lightly metallic and and grassy. Queen of the beers? Ha, ha!
Goldgelb, schwacher Schaum, dumpfer Geruch, gedchmack wässrig mit herbem Abgang
Vom Fass. Strohgelbe klare Farbe mit sehr festem Schaum. Herb metallischer Geruch. Geschmack herb und flach. Unschöner Abgang. Hier noch deutlich überbewertet!
has a slight hop hint in the aroma. felt a bit grainy on the palate. dry finish. average pils, nothing to really rave about.

Yellow to golden color. Clear. Medium carbonation. Smells like light bread, grains. A touch of hop aroma. Has a grainy taste. Quite dry with some decent hoppiness coming forward. Finishes slightly not-clean. Not a bad beer, but there is nothing interesting about it.
500ml can. Pours clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is malty and grainy and so is the taste. Medium butter finish. Average pilsener.

Puro malte alemã apresenta coloração dourada,creme baixo,boa carbonatação com formação de bolhas pequenas,o aroma perfumado,levemente maltado,lúpulo notado,no sabor boa presença de lúpulo dando um leve amargor delicioso,álcool em equilíbrio com demais componentes,retrogosto seco e levemente amargo,bom conjunto.
Pours very light golden. Little head. Very neutral nose. Malt profile medium light mouthfeel. A bit bitter

500ml bottle. Clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grainy, grassy, malty, cardboard. Taste is hoppy, grainy, malty, and somewhat drier and more bitter than I expected from a pilsener, even a little metallic. Not really that keen on this one to be honest, it’s not bad, just not for my tastes.

19th July 2013.
Nice head, very pale. Aroma is malty, average. Taste is malty, a little bit sour at the end. Low to medium, herbal bitterness.

Beautiful foamy lager with a delicious aroma of flower, hops and malt. The taste is light, but reflects lager character which type very, very clean and tasty. Certainly a lager is several classes better than usual Danish lagers (read Tuborg / Carlsberg). Lightly sparkling with perfect hop bitterness and a hint flower in the final. This lager is definitely recommended.
Biala wysoka piana kolor zloty . W smaku mocno wyczuwalny chmiel ale tez lekko cytrusowa nuta. Zimne smakuje nienajgorzej

This Pils looks great but it smells a bit skunky, tastes sorta metallic, and has a lot of carbonation. While simplicity is forgivable for the style not being crisp and clean isn’t. Hate to say it, but not very tasty and not all that interesting.

Bottiglia da 0,33. Schiuma contenuta e volatile. Colore chiaro e carbonatura adeguata. Gusto lineare senza accenti. Aroma leggermente aspro con finale appena agro. Pils dissetante; non di più. Consiglio 4/10.

Piana drobna, biała, obfita. 
Kolor złoty, klarowne. 
W aromacie nuty słodowe, chmielu niewiele. 
W smaku lepiej , wyczuwalna goryczka. 
Przyjemny czysty profil.

Backlog. 12 oz single bottle from Supermarket Liquors. Clear golden appearance with a lacy white head. A crisp and spicy pils with floral, earthy and herbal notes. Mild hop bitterness and a bit of toasted grain at the finish. A solid pils overall.

Bottle pour. Golden with a nice foamy white head. Aroma is cereal, hay, and grass. Light body. Slightly bitter and a little salty.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2 oz bottle- Pours clear golden with a white head that holds longer than expected. Aroma is clean, some adjunct grains, grassy, European. The taste is similar, Euro lager, grassy, hay, light malt, some grains, dry yet lightly sweet finish. Easy drinking, definitely boring, better than expected though, i was thinking this might be a drain pour.

Nombre: Warsteiner Premium Verum
Cervecería: Warsteiner Brauerei Haus Cramer KG
Tipo de Cerveza: Pilsener
Graduación: 4,8º
Volumen del envase: 330ml
Curiosidades: El eslogan que aparece en la botella: "Eine Königin unter den Bieren" significa, literalmente, "Una reina entre las cervezas". De ahí la corona que aparece en la etiqueta.
Comentarios: De color dorado pálido y un suave olor a lúpulo, no se trata de una cerveza excesivamente original, ni muy distinta a las rubias de los bares españoles, pero sí es especialmente fuerte y amarga, lo cual, en mi caso, es una ventaja.
Es una cerveza para tomar sin grandes expectativas, pero fácil de disfrutar y algo superior a la mayoría de las que se encuentran en los bares de por aquí.

Bottle. Bought as clearance for a pound. Nose is is sulpherous, cereal, grain, a little grassy. Taste is cereal, slightly herbal, grassy hops, light bitterness. One of those German beers where you can?t recall it from sip to sip.
Bottle at home very dry and metallic malts come through unusual lager looks golden with a small head.

Quelle horreur.
On sent au nez un houblon agressif et très déplaisant. L’odeur ne donne vraiment pas envie. Cela sent le chimique, le sur-aromatisé sans véritable arômes...
En bouche, on ne sent même pas le pilsner, juste une absence de corps qui permet à cet "extrait de houblon" d’offrir un goût plutôt affreux et terriblement artificiel.
Bbq & pils, niets mis mee. Lekker fris pilsje, niet bijzonder, maar wel lekker bij warm weer en een heet stuk vlees.

12 oz pour from chilled can into a plastic cup somewhere over the Atlantic on a Lufthansa flight. Totally clear, moderately carbonated, yellow, moderate white head, moderate lacing. Not too much on the nose. Light malts and a bit of a bitter scent. Body is light and crisp. Taste is lightly bready and bitter. Nothing fancy, but an alright straight-forward beer. I’d typically reach for something more flavorful, but it works with dinner on an eight-hour transatlantic flight.
Aroma:Watery, grain, corn, gras, hops.Appearance:Pale yellow/gold beer with a small white head.Taste/Palate:

On tap.
Surprised to find that this German pils from a fairly large, commercial brewery, is noticeably above average. Adding to the surprise factor, it has a very pale and light body. Excellent clarity.

Nicely balanced and clean yet relatively bold for style.

50 cl can. As always with pasteurised and filtered beers, it’s crystal cleer, 1-finger head, medium carbonation in the glass. Aroma of barley malt and wet cellar. Flavour is thin, hints of some spicy, peppery hops, and wet cardboard. But they all blend in surprisingly well, and make it a drinkable beer, though it’s average in every respect of the term.

Bottle.

A: Clear straw body that is absolutely flush with bubbles. Firm, foamy white head on top. 

N: Grain, corn, husk, some white grape, heavy minerality/artesian water. Some white peppercorn. Doughy bread. 

T: Sweet and bitter in proportion. 

M: Soda-like carbonation is nearly a flaw, light body, no alcohol. 

O: Mediocre pilsener. It’s plenty easy to drink, but it’s not interesting to do so. I’d rather have a PBR, in all honesty.

Dorata pallida, limpida, schiuma bianca di buona persistenza.
Aroma di malto d’orzo e leggero limone.
Al palato malto d’orzo con finale amaricante erbaceo accompagnato da caucciù.
Ben carbonata, corpo leggero.

Bottle sample at BEERS 2015, Tel Aviv. Clear and light yellowish with white head. Malty aroma with notes of hay and some flowers. Sweetish malty flavor, notes of hay and hint of nail polish, light bitterness in the finish. Lively carbonation, light to medium-bodied.
From the bottle, little to no Aroma, taste is hay or grassy hops quite bitter infact. Finish is grassy hops wich is long lasting... Average if cold undrinkable if not chilled...

Bottle at Lufthansa flight (:-)) Clear yellow color, medium head. Grainy malt and some eathy hops in the nose. Pale malt flavors with some hoppy bitterness, relatively crispy and dry. Light-bodied, smooth. Drinkable.

0,5 l bottle. Aroma: hoppy, light bitter, with a hint of malt. Appearence: Clear, golden beer, big, frothy, white, long-lived head. Taste: Medium bitter, light sweet. Palate: bitter, sweet, long finish. Overall: Solid, but not special Pilsener.
Yellow with a very small white head. Aroma is cereal, bread, biscuit, ligjt herbal and floral notes. Taste is cereal, bread, herbal bitterness. Light bitter aftertaste.
Golden pour with white fluffy head. Aroma of malts. Taste of something roasted, malty. Crisp with some dry hoppy finish. Not a bad pils.

Can. 
Pours greenish golden. 
Sweet brew with some vegetable notes and balanced bitterness.

Can.
Pale yellow, clear, minimal white head.
Aroma of aluminum, slight notes of honey and fish.
Taste, grains, honey and aluminum can

WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, klarowne. Piana średniej wysokości, drobna. 

AROMAT: Mało intensywny. Słodowe. W tle nuty trawiasto-ziołowe.

SMAK: Słodowe. Puste w smaku. Goryczka niska, krótka.
Ordinær på alle måter. Smaken og lukten preget av høy og brødeig. Frisk, men fort glemt

On draft, clear golden body with steady upward stream of carbonation that leads to a finger of white foam. Grassy, sweet corn and malt aromas. Taste is grain and skunky bitters. Light body, meh overall.
A classic - and bit boring- pale lager. Taste biscuit. Not so much more to say about it.
Grune Ritter von fass. Vitt skum tysk humle. Bra pilsner. För stort glas. Rätt underlägg.

Clear golden color. The smell is malty but with a tart touch. The taste is malty, a little tart and even some hints of bitterness are in there. The carbonation is strong but appropriate. Interesting mix, but it doesn’t meet my taste. Dryish aftertaste.
0,5 l bottle.Clear yellow colour.Minimal head. Cereals and hops flavor.Dry finish.

0,5 l bottle, best before 21/12/2015. Clear, pale golden yellow with a medium large, foamy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, grassy-spicy aroma of straw, bread and grassy hops. Sweetish, grassy-spicy taste of straw, bread and biscuits, followed by a short, slightly bitter finish. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, minimally watery, average carbonation. Solid, easy to drink, nice thirst quencher. Boring? Yes.
Pouca espuma, bem clara, gosto levemente cítrico com spicy porém bem rápido. Bom pra uma refeição
Bottle 33 cl. Overall decent. Adds a small spicy feature to the finish, mixes well with food.
Clear yellow coloured with a white head. Aroma of malts, corn and hops. Flavour of malts, corn and hops.
Draft. Clear golden color with good white head. Aroma: cereals, noble hop. Taste: clear, malty, pear, a little watery, some hop bitterness.
500ml bottle at home. Very pale yellow, what little head there was quickly fizzed away. Faint citrus and grass aroma. Watery, with very little actual taste. Won’t bother again
Dosta dobro njemacko pivo .. pio sam ga vise puta i uvijek sam bio zadovoljan ...

A slightly metallic aroma, taste is fairly standard. Quite crisp, it doesn’t have that almost sticky mouthfeel some beers of the sort do. It’s absolutely unremarkable but it’d do the job on a hot day.
Not a big fan of this beer......taste is bad but not the worst I’ve ever had. it’s a bit overwhelming and leaves a bad taste on the tongue. I don’t recommend it to anyone.

Muy pálida y transparente. Muy poca espuma y no dura nada. Aroma neutro. Entra acuosa, muy ligera. Con buen equilibrio entre el ligero dulzor, que lo tiene y el amargor. Lo mejor es el final, seco y con dominio del amargor del lúpulo, que deja un buen regusto. En conjunto no destaca por nada. Pero es agradable y bebible.
Tap. Pour is gold with a thin head, sweet aroma. Taste is light bitter, malty, sweet. Average
Bottle from Tesco; clear straw yellow pour with a frothy white head, aroma has crisp malt and citrus, taste consists of straw, crisp malts, fairly clean and refreshing with a hint of skunk.

Pours a very pale straw with a giant white head. Stringy lacing. Nose is malty, faint grassy hops, grain. Ultra-light body. Crisp. Slightly sour, grainy malt, noble hops, unripe green apple, and lingering sour mild skunk in the finish.

(330ml bottle, 11.6°, 4.8 ABV, Beijing. Rating Jul 3, 2015. 3.2)
(500ml bottle, 4.8%, Berlin, Feb 6, 2020. 3.2) 
Appearance: medium straw yellow, tight/sharp white head, a little creaminess to it. 3-->weak 3
Aroma: smells like german beer, hops, grass, wood/bark, slightly perfumey. 2) grainy, not sweet on the nose. 6-->weak 6
Flavor: distinctive hops flavor, with nice round graininess. Chocolate, toast. Some fruitiness (maybe raisin/prune?) If my eyes were closed, I might think it was a darker beer. 2) somewhat unique combination of malt and hops, leans towards grain, wort, whole grain toast, nutty, woody. 6-->strong 6
Palate: nice on the palate, medium body, a touch watery/oily with solid bitterness follow thru. Dry. 2) almost medium body so quite robust for a pils, strong grainy feeling, solid lager bitterness.  3-->strong 3 

Overall: a very good mass produced Pilsner. Not quite a Pilsner Urquell, but a solid beer. 2) i think quite chewy and flavorful for a Pils, but some may find it harsh or strange. But I like it. Definitely leans towards roasted grain/malt. 14-->14
Pours golden with white head. Light floral and pine aroma, taste is light bitter and malty. Refreshing, enjoyable.
Clear yellow with a bright white head. Wheat aroma with a hint of something floral. Well balanced flavor, and very refreshing. Good, and very drinkable. Maybe not great, but I enjoyed it.
Birra tedesca senza pretese. Aspetto tipico delle birre industriali, aroma inesistente. Molto beverina, poco alcolica, scorre liscia. Birra da pasto.
This is a good German Pilsener. It has a medium body with a delightful malt taste. It needs more hops. Compared to German beers available in the U.S. this is one of the best.
Good German style beer with great taste and aroma. Would recommend this beer to others.

Strong hops aroma, something not plesant, but can not name it. Poor head. Clear and sparkling a little. Pale color. Medium bitter, sustaining. Light sour. Dry. Very light body, thin texture, fizzy but medium carbonation, long, to long astringent bitter finish.
Bottle. Clear pale golden color with small white head. Aroma - Grain, stone, grass. Taste - Bread, malts, water.

This is a nice thirst quencher! It is un-offensive and lighter tasting with decent , dry flavor. I’ve had it in cans, bottles, and once on tap and they all taste pretty much the same. So I say it is a consistent brew. Nice beer!

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 5D). Bottle 33 cl - Batch 12A11. AROMA: slight sweet grainy malt aroma with very faint herbal hop notes. clean lager profile. APPEARANCE: light gold color and translucent. medium white head with average retention. TASTE: medium-low malt flavour and slight sweet. medium bitterness that lingers into a semi-dry finish. PALATE: medium-light body with medium-low carbonation. OVERALL: a commercial german pils without much intensity on the malt and hop fronts.
Typical German pilsener. Malty sweet aroma with hint of hops, crisp taste, low bitter finish.
Bottle. Crystal clear golden color, fluffy white head. Aroma of light grass. Taste is lightly sweet, crisp clean finish. Plain.
Pours golden with medium white head. Nose is grain and some hop. Few grainy and sweet aromas. Rather watery. Light body, low carbonation. Short bitter finish. Not interesting.

Olfactif à la limite de l’infection avec des accents de moufette. Petits houblons herbacés discrets. Une déception olfactive. Le visuel est jaune paille, très clair, avec une mousse blanche au maintient assez long et à la belle dentelle sur le verre. Des céréales à forte teneur en écorce de grain laisse une longue sensation désagréable en attaque. Une sensation de terre et de poussière qui est mal venue dans ce style. Un fond de noix rancies totalement désagréable. On est loin des bonnes Pilseners Allemandes.
A very decent beer, especially for those looking for something more towards lager. Good flavours, not watery, not too much fizz. Very enjoyable!
Nice malty glass. Fruity and grassy aromas with a taste of caramel and biscuit.
Tap@ De Tolly. Pours clear yellow with white head, stays. Aroma is malty, grassy, some yeastuness. Taste is malty, slight bitterness, some sweet notes. Watery thin body. Not for me
Can. Pours straw yellow with small white head. Aroma of corn, vegetables and pilsener malt. Light body, lgiht sweetness, low bitterness. Awful.
Słabe. W aromacie wyczuwalny DMS. Z wyglądu słomkowe z delikatną pianą. W smaku szału nie ma. Tyle w temacie...
330 ml bottle into glass. Sweet malt nose. Pale amber with large white head. A few bubbles. Watery, a little bitter but a full-on sweet finish. Cardboard and paper. Average.

Pours clear, almost brilliant, golden, with stable white head. Visualy medizm carbonation with moderate big up rissing bubbles.
Aroma is poor, prevailing malty, with crispy notes.
Similar is flavor, slightly sweet, crispy, corny, with almost no presence of hops. Body is full, carbonation is medium.
Aroma: bread, wheat, floral. Appearance: pale, clear, minimal head. Taste: light sweetness, medium bitterness. Palate: light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, bitter finish.

Słomkowe klarowne do bólu, ładna piana, drobna, odrobinę się osadza i znika dość szybko. W aromacie zero chmielu, głównie słód i odrobina DMSu, jakby kukurydza. W smaku wodniste, słaba goryczka. Nic specjalnego.
Very good German import Pilsner. Best to be enjoyed when on tap in the right glass.
Bottle pour. Aroma is roasted malt and grains. Taste is similar except the combination of the two just didn’t work for me. Would not drink again.
Keg 42 ossett. Golden thin head. Aroma is malty corn taste same some sweetness good hoppy bitters. Ok body nice carbonation. Ok stuff
Bottle. Clear, gold with a medium to small head. Aroma was kind of skunky, which surprised me out of a brown bottle. Taste was the usual German pilsner, with grains, straw, hay and a bitter finish.
Hameln, Grune Ritter von fass. Vitt skum tysk humle. Bra pilsner. För stort glas. Rätt underlägg.
33 cl. flaske lavet i metal med guld-look. 4,8 % . Meget dejlig og læskende pilsner, købt i Ka-de-we i Berlin sommeren 2014, da tysken blev verdensmester i fodbold

Pours clear yellow. Good lacing. Aroma of tropical fruit hay and corn. Taste of pear banana tropical fruit . Nice light malty cereal and buttered bread backbone and a slightly bitter fruit spice finish.

0.5l can from a local supermarket.

pours a clear pale golden with a fluffy white head and a nice lacing. light hoppy nose; grass, sulphuric hops, bread crust. flavour of herbs, bread with some fruity and grassy notes. low acidity, some bitterness, but little depth though, quite straightforward. pleasant dry finish.

0,33 l flaske fra en byttehandel med en nabo. Klar, sprudlende gyllen kropp med et tre fingerbredder høyt lyst skumdekke som legger igjen et spredt skumlag på glasset. Tre, høy, malt og papp-aktig humle i nesa. Den papp-aktige bitterheten fra humla er det mest fremtredende i munnen og den varer ganske lenge. Ikke så verst fylde og ganske tydelig kullsyre.

Pours a clear golden liquid with a very frothy white head. Aroma of roasty malt, hops and some spruce. Tastes watery with medium bitterness of hops and malt and a bitter finish. Smell and taste are both somewhat grainy and earthy, but still have a sweet freshness to it. Medium body, creamy texture, not too carbonated for a Pilsener. This is a pretty average German Pilsener with a nice flavour to it.
Solid enough pils that gets the job done when there aren’t many other choices. I’ve had better.
Pale yellow colour, white head. Aroma of hay, corn. Light sweet taste. Light body, thin texture, average carbonation.
First beer I’ve ever had. Many later and I still know that this beer bests any other. Germans make the best beer, period.

Draft and I have had warsteiner before a pale yellow color with a white head. Aroma of a typical German lager. But for me pretty bland all the way around not bad but definitely not very good and I am going to leave it at that

13.2.2014. 4.7%. Tuoksu lagerille tyypillinen mieto, hieman metallinen ja viljainen. Maku viljainen, lievän maltainen. Aika peruslagerihan tämä on, jos ehkä mallas maistuu hieman suomalaisveljiä enemmän. Saunakaljatavaraa ja sellaisena hyvä.
How: Can Appearance: Clear golden, medium to large white head. Aroma: Not much, some grass notes, citrus. Palate: Thin body, average carbonation. Watery.

Bottle: Clear golden yellow with a small white head and minimal lacing. The aroma is wet hay with a balanced taste. There is average carbonation for a pilsner with a clean texture and just a hint of a bitter finish.

Bottle (shared with friends).
Golden color. Bitter. No so much experience in pilseners to appreciate.

A me sembra una lager, sull'etichetta scrivono premium pilsner... Mmm di pilsner forse ha un po' di beverinità. Ma del resto proprio nulla niente erbaceo luppoloso e zero equilibrio. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85

9/3 2015 On the flight from Munich to Tel Aviv. 33 cl bottle. Pours clear yellow with substantial white head which gradually settles to thin lacing. Aroma is pretty neutral with tartlike and bitter notes. Medium carbonation. Taste is fairly bitter with only a little fruity sweetness for balance. Like most beers brewed under the Rheinheitsgebot it is not very adventureous but quite solid.

This is one of my favorite german pils, mostly because of its availability in my area. I love the crispness of this beer, the nice hop taste with a great bite. It is refreshing and drinkable. It is my go to beer for most situations.

500ml BB Oct 2015. Pale yellow, clear, sparkling, small foamy white head, a little lacing. Aroma is light cracker malt, laundered clothes, touch of glue. Body is medium, foamy, soft carbonation. Taste is soft water biscuit malts, watery, soft bitterness. Highly drinkable lager with none of the usual metallic or vegetal flavours to let it down.

Popular German Pilsener with very pale blonde, cristal clear colour under a thick, snow white head. Grainy nose, some malt sweetness, minerals, low hops presence; clean, crisp taste, light malt sweetness, dryish with some grassy hops in the finish but in a subdued way, rendering the ending a tad thin. Honest alright, but there are many better German Pilseners out there.
Classic German pilsener which does the job as a thirst quencher pretty well.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass
Aroma- caught a whiff of hops and maybe a floral backdrop
Appearance- A nice golden yellow color, clear with a lot of carbonation bubbles, nice white head
Taste- A nice robust bitter bite that was not overwhelming. A good flavor
Palate- Medium bodied with a good level of carbonation
Overall- not a bad beer, better than beck’s and St. Pauli Girl
Lengvas ir visai skanus piksneriukas. Mazai putoja ir labai sviesus, bei skaidrus. Kvapnus, neperkartus.

11.2 oz. bottle from Cost Plus. Amber in color with a small white head. Floral noble hop bitterness up front with a sweet finish of bread malt and a bit of lemon. Good amount of flavor. Not watery. Bitterness blends perfectly to offset the sweetness. Finish is crisp and refreshing. A very drinkable and satisfying pilsener.

Bottle. Clear yellow colour. Huhmge white head. Aroma of bread, grass and a tiny bit of citruss. Flavour of pale malt and grass. Smooth body. Medium carbo. Easy to drink but it´s not my thing at all.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle @ Jungle Jim’s / Eastgate OH --- Clear light golden amber color, white head that drops to a cover, strips of lace. Taste is simple malt that adds a solid shot of floral hops on the swallow, with both drifting through a lingering finish. Surprisingly satisfying, especially on a warm afternoon. Yes, it is a classic German Pilsener.

Kolejna propozycja z Niemiec. Piwo raczej od początku skazane na bycie którymś z kolei lub do popijania słonych orzeszków. Zawsze jednak jest tak, że daję szansę każdemu, nawet nie rokującemu, piwu szansę... Jasnozłoty kolor i niewielka biała piana. Delikatne aromaty słodowe i metaliczne, niestety. W smaku wodniste, metaliczne, słodowe i bardzo mało goryczkowe.

Uitgeschonken in Warsteiner fluitglas, lichte zeer heldere goudgele kleur met volle witte schuimkraag. Geur is licht granig van gerstemout. De smaak is zacht en zuiver, medium droog met mild bittere hop tonen. Wel vrij vlak van smaak en wat waterig, zoals bij de meeste pilsener bieren. De afdronk is aangenaam, enigszins droog met een zachte bittere hopsmaak. Een van mijn favoriete pilsener bieren, drinkt heel makkelijk weg. Zuiver pils, heel goed om de gehele avond te drinken. Niet mijn favoriete bierstijl, maar wel Duitse kwaliteit. Behoort tot de betere in deze bierstijl, vooral de zuiverheid en zachte smaak kunnen bekoren. Vrijwel in elke supermarkt hier verkrijgbaar.

A: Haystraw yellow with a small bubbly white head Fair retention and some lace. 
S: Hmmm. Nice but I can’t identify anything. Maybe a slight herbal hop note.
T: Light and tart with laid back malt background and a soft floral hop presence. Not bad.
M: Very light to watery with fizzy carbonation. Par for the course and nothing to complain about.
O: A very nice if underwhelming brew. No world beater but a case for the super bowl sounds about right!. Everyone should be able to get with this.

cereal, bread, citrus, vanilla, 
Very smooth, good head light body pilsner. An easy beer to drink very good & will compliment any dish. It will not overpower your palate. On tap at the Fort Springfield Mass
not as bitter as some might like....but smoooooooth! This is a very easy bite but almost bark like but flavourful

Fris aroma heel klein beetje fruitig weinig diepgang. Helder gouden kleuren erg licht zelfs, iets te. Standaard pils met een vrij lekkere bite en prettige ruime carbonatie. Aangename bitter zonder al te veel diepgang. Een van de betere pils.
Classic German pilsner with a very bitter upfront taste and a very bitter after taste. Golden yellow color and very thin composition. Beer is a pass in my book.
Pours a clear yellow color. Aroma and taste are grassy, pale malts, and is quite light bodied.

Clear golden body, large fluffy white head, soapy lacing. Light bodied, clean floral, spicy, and citric hops. Mellow grainy cereals. Simple, but pleasant. Light bodied with moderate to lively carbonation, semi-dry, mild bitterness.
Unterdurchschnittlich Pils. Klar und golden mit durschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Insgesamt zu wässrig, es mangelt an Aroma. Leicht bitter.

The aroma of wheat and pilsner malt. The taste is malty but most watery. Slightly metal also in taste. Okay bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long while. Still think the beer is good if it is really cold and if you are thirsty. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Bottle. Golden, clear, frothy, white foam, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, & astringent finish.

Bottle to shaker glass. Pours straw gold, quick one finger head, some lacing and retention. Aroma of grass and herbs. Taste is sweet at first, then has a medium light bitterness in the middle. Light bodied, medium carbonation, watery mouth feel. Finishes lightly bitter then dries. Notes of sweet bread, herbs, hay and salt. Typical German pils, easy to drink but no frills.
Part of my 2013 backlog. Colour is pale gold with high white head. Aroma has hops. The taste is medium sweet, with a bitter finish.
Cerveja clara responsável por me introduzir no mundo das premium. Sabor não foge ao que se encontra nas demais largers se diferenciando apenas por um maior amargor.

Bottle on the flight from Prague to Frankfurt. Served in to a plastic cup alongside a half sandwich. Cheers Lufthansa! Pours ghostly pale Yellow with a White head. Reasonable malt, reasonable bitterness. A thoroughly reasonable beer.

This beer pours a very clear yellow with a large white head that fades somewhat quickly. The aroma blends pale malts and lager yeast, and the taste is slightly sour, a touch umami, and a touch sweet with a clean yet barely-there aftertaste. The palate fuses a medium-light body, slick texture, and a soft carbonation.
Bottle. Sweet character. Wheat, toast, hops, citrus, sugar. Lemon and maybe some apple. It is almost cidery. Just ok.
Poured from 12pz bottle in El Calafante Paragonia. Clear yellow with bubbles and white head. Wheat and slight lemon aroma. Dank Pilsner taste. Light and smooth.

Bright golden colour with a foamy white head. Aroma of malts. The taste is bready malts which gives away to an assertive, grassy bitterness. A good, fairly typical, pilsner with quite a bitter flavour.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours clear gold. Bread and malts, a light bite to the taste which I really found pleasant, as it lingers, but isn’t too strong. A very nice pilsener.

0,33 bottle. Pours clean straw colour with high white head. Hops, litlle bit of apples, grass in aroma. Lively carbonation, light body. Taste is medium sweet and sone light bitterness, dry, with some metallic notes in the finish. Well-rounded, but I’d say that it’s even not enough bitter as for the pilsener. Well drinkable, but nothing too exciting.
bottle 355 mL. golden clear color, as a normal pilsner, somewhat average, although good bitter taste, for a pilsner. decent.
Blassgolden, weisse Schaumkrone. Riecht nach Gräsern, Erde, Stroh. Dezent bitter, leicht wässrig. Ist für den Stil und den Preis aber vollkommen OK.
Une pils allemande honnête, correcte. Bouteille offerte (provenance inconnue), bue le 09/08/2014.

0,33 l bottle. Redesigned label. Pale golden and very clear in the glass, nearly watery. Longlasting white head. Mash and grain on the nose. Starts grainy, later a little bit bitter. Polished. Typical industrial german Pilsener. Not really bad but also nothing real special.

Sampled from a 50 cl bottle. Bright golden colour with a foamy white head. Aroma of malts. The taste is bready malts which gives away to an assertive, grassy bitterness. A good, fairly typical, pilsner with quite a bitter flavour.

Typical pilsener colour with an aroma of fresh hay. Little flavour beyond the bitterness imparted by a reasonably generous dose of hops. Quite a pleasant palate and a reasonably long finish for a pilsener. A cut above most domestic UK lagers but my tastes lean towards something with a tad more oomph.

Flasche (50 cl) aus einem beliebigen Berliner Supermarkt. - Goldgelb, klar. - Strenger Geruch nach herbem Billighopfen. - Antrunk schlank mit grobschlächtigen Hopfennoten: Zitronenschale, Laub, Waschpulver. Durchschnittlich rezent, hart im Mund; keine Spur von Malzaromen. Im Abgang trocken mit schroffer Zitronenschale. Recht kurzer, mäßig bitterer, aromaleerer, schwach salziger Nachtrunk. - Billig gemachtes Supermarktbier, hochvergoren, ohne Malzkörper, derb gehopft und ohne jegliche feinere Aromen. - Zusätzlichen Punktabzug gibt’s für den neuen Schriftzug, der wohl von typographischen Analphabeten entworfen wurde: das frühere, korrekte lange s (Warſteiner) wurde durch ein Schluß-s ersetzt (Wars-teiner) und dafür ein albernes überlanges t eingefügt. Anscheinend kann man in Warstein nicht nur kein Bier brauen, sondern auch kein Deutsch mehr ...
Pies yellow and fairly flat, uninteresting pour. Aroma is pretty much just dough. Somewhat redeemed on the flavor, delicious herbal honey. Tasty, but much less hoppy than I would like in a pilsner.
Bottle. Clear golden with small white head. Light malts, slight dry with a touch of dough and light bitter herbal finish. Crisp pilsener with no off-taste and nice light bitterness. Decent enough.

Bottle at a random Oriental eatery in Tallinn. Clear golden colour, thin white head. Nose is hay, grass, herbs... Not really exiting, not quite off-putting. Taste is equally not noteworthy with grainy malts and almost medicinal hops most apparent. Carbonation lively, body mediumish. For a cheap macro lager this is above average though - wasn’t bad washing down some spicy food with it.

Grocery store / train station beer. Fine when you need a beer for sitting on the train... or for late at night after a long day traveling. Clear, golden appearance. Thin fizzy head. A little too bitter. Nothing special... not careful.

Bottle, courtesy of Luthansa. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Steady carbonation. Faint lacing on the tiny plastic cup. Aroma of grain, cereal and grass. Flavour of lemon, straw and a hint of corn. Thin body with a watery texture. Soft fizz. A bit sweet and low on hops.

Helder gouden kleur, dunne witte schuimkraag. 
Moutige neus met appeltoets.
Lichte bitterheid, conform Reinheitsgebot.

Gifted by my buddy Jim, who had just too much beer in his fridge. Pale clear yellow. Nose light and grassy. Blah. Taste is sweet corn and not much more. Doubt I’ll finish it. I’ve got good beer in the fridge.
Golden but with little head. Bitter, drinkable lager, ok but not exciting. Straw aroma. Meh.
Large can from local supermarket. First of all, drink extremely cold. Undrinkable when warm. Crisp malts and light metal on the nose and palate which is light and watery.

Clear golden color, thin white head. Light to medium body, average carbonation. Aroma is buttery, malty with caramel, apples and noble hops notes. Light to medium sweet taste, very little bitterness. Nice and pleasant cheap supermarket pilsener. Approved.
Una buona pilsener in puro stile tedesco. di colore giallo dorato, con un bel cappello di schiuma fine e persistente, di buona carbonazione, ben luppolata con un buon retrogusto leggermente amaro
Bottle on Lufthansa flight. Nice froth, yellow to darker amber in colour. Premiums are not my favourite but this was ok.
Can 0,33l. Clear pale yellow liquid with small head. Light body, medium to heavy carbonation. Corny, metal in taste, some bitterness.

Very solid Pilsener. Aroma is slight skunk. Some lacing. Slightly bitter edge with grass and lemon notes. Clean and crisp finish. I really like this lager..reminds me of watching the Bundesliga on TV.

DATE TASTED: October 25, 2014... GLASSWARE: Warsteiner pokal... OCCASION: PSU/OSU white out again... APPEARANCE: champagne-like effervescence; crystal clear and golden yellow; vast, foamy white three-finger head; lacing represents confidently throughout ... AROMA: bread/dough malts mix with a metallic sharpness; some funky yeasts as well--not really appealing... PALATE: reasonably smooth; a flat finish; aftertaste is plausible; drinkable but not very memorable....TASTE: a liquid English muffin whose malts end in a woody, almost lagerish base; some corny residual, though thank God that’s not a likely German adjunct... OVERALL: a pilsener that occupies the mouth for a few moments--crisp yet nondescript, Warsteiner is a year-rounder that probably needs a pairing (holiday party, dinner, snack?) to succeed...otherwise, a beer that’s a bit more fun to say or see than it is to sip or savor...
Straw color. White big head. Aroma mainly of malt. Sweetish malty taste of water. Bitterness low, light body, thin feel, average carbonation. If beer has DMS it’s hardly perceptible. Overall boring.
Appearance: a clear golden color with a thick head. Aroma: smells like some grains and some citrus notes. Tastes like lemon and grass. Watery.

Can. Straw-like colour with nice white head, but quickly disapearing and no lacing. Hoppy aroma with bready hints. It has a decent gerbal-like bitterness but maltiness as well. Maybe bit astringend. It’s well carbonated. Decent beer for meal.

Small can on a flight years ago, and then many other cases over the past years of living in Europe. Clean, a bit wattery and juicy pale lager. Some bitterness with the lagering sweetness. OK solid beer.
0,3l fles van de supermarkt. Licht geel met een witte kraag. Qua smaak en geur iets meer hop dan nl pils. Grasachtig met een fris bittertje.

Aroma: hay, bread; Appearance: clear urine, small foamy vanishing head; Taste: medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium sourness; Palate: abrupt finish, slick texture, light body, soft carbonation

Drinkable pilsener, not too impressive. Pretty well-rounded.

What’s wrong with this. Lager, get it on. Do people who rate beer not like beer? Its a good lager, good german, beery flavoured lager. C’mon. Big bottle from the supermarket. Reminds me of sipping my dad’s beer can when I was little and didn’t like beer. Now I love beer and this servicebale, drinkable, grassy, slightly hoppy lager does the job. A bit thin but refreshing taste and goes down a treat. Grassy, spruce, slightly skunky beer. Went well with my fish and chips. Bring it on. Good
Yellow color. The head went away pretty quick. Soft taste with a light bitter finish.

330ml bottle served in an ordinary glass.
A: Pours the traditional clear golden yellow color with a big fluffy and aired white head. Low retention and few lacings
S: Grains and hops, basically
T: Again, grains and hops backbone. Nice balanced bitterness. Metallic end
M: Light body. Refreshing. High carbonation
D: Good drinkability. A simple and refreshing beer, that’s all
[ BA Review @ 9/11/2010 ]
Golden crystal yellow color. Classic deep German Pilsener taste, Light malt taste. Mild sour finish.
Smells like disease and looks thin. If this is a queen of beers, it fits well with my feelings about the Norwegian monarchy -- it isn’t really very good, but it works.

Zapach: głównie słodowy, lekko chlebowy, orzechowy z lekkim DMSem
Wygląd: żółte, klarowne, niezła piana.
Smak: puste, wodniste, lekko kwaskowe, cytrusowe, goryczka o średniej intensywności, ale bardzo nieprzyjemna, skarpetowa i zalegająca, ściągającą policzki, zostawiająca kwaśny posmak po chwili.
08/15 wir krombacher, radeberger, könig pilsener und wat weiss ich watten da noch alles gibt
This was my first time having this beer. Not much of a taste though. I will be trying it again.

"A bready, crisply hopped, though still malt-dominated pilsner. OK, but has no one aspect that stands out at all. Thoroughly average, maybe juuust under for a thin prickly feel, but refreshing enough as a summer brew."
Clean golden color, medium white head. Aroma of malt and grassy hops. Taste has similar notes plus grain and light citrus. Thin body and lively carbonation. Very typical pilsner but quite ok.

Belo creme! Bonito mesmo. Espesso na medida, claro, consistente.
A cor, belíssima. Amarelo dourado bem translúcido.
O aroma se espalhou bravamente pelo ar. Refrescante, bem típico e agradável.
Vamos ao primeiro gole... O amargor é pungente e se destaca. A refrescância vem em seguida. Não é uma cerveja leve, embora também não possa ser classificada como densa. Tem alguma acidez associada a carbonatação, que atrapalha um pouco a drinkability. Mas muito pouco.
Se oferecida novamente, aceitaria sem problema. Não que eu seja muito de negar cervejas...

Blonde dorée limpide. Mousse blanche très peu persistante. Bonne carbonation.
Arôme subtil et balancé d’orge. Légèrement fruité, manque d’arômatique tout de même. 
En bouche typique pils, certes bien balancée mais manquant d’arômatique et d’houblonnage. Très légère amertume et sécheresse en fin de bouche.
Peu de caractère, mais au dessus de la moyenne parmi les macro-brasseries.

Aromat słodowy. jest chmiel, troszeczkę orzechowy, jest też żelazo. Piana wysoka, szybko opada ale nie do końca, dobrze zdobi szkło, kolor słomkowy, prawie woda. Gorycz średnio niska, czuć słód, orzeszki, alkohol. Piwo bardzo pijalne, goryczka nie zalega. Ogólnie bardzo dobre piwo do ugaszenia pragnienia.
Bottle. Pale straw, carbonated white head. Aroma is doughy malts. Flavour has some nice hops to balance. Not bad.

From a tall .5 liter can. With a big thanks to Alex for bringing this over. Pours out a crisp pale straw topped with a white head. Nose is sweet malts fresh cut grass and some dough. Taste is as the nose with a clean and refreshing taste.
Corrente. Agradável, leve, fresca deixa um travo ligeiramente amargo e seco no final.
Dourada pálida, espuma duradoura. Biscoito doce, cereal, erva, palha. Boa acidez, lever amargor, seca a boca no final. Final curto.

Drunk from 50 cl bottle bought in Koblenz, Germany. Classic fresh tasting pilsener.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

nose: i dont know why the smell of this makes me go to beer heaven even after ive tried many pilsners etc. there’s just something about it [when i get it fresh, otherwise it just skunks]. to me, it smells like a very specific new leather boot from mexico and ficus trees, or something like that.

palate: beautifully balanced. it’s all in the initial atack and then it trails off graciously with the nuanced hops hanging on for an extra little bit. it’s not necessarily distinctive in flavors but it gets it ’right’. nuff said!

0.3L bottle. Pours clear straw color with a frothy white head with decent lacing. Subtle sweet grain aromas on this: honey, cereal, and some hints of orange, Mild sweetness at beginning, quickly transitions to nutty malt followed by herby hops. Finishes with long, nuttiness and dry hop linger. Light body with a slick mouthfeel and average carbonation. For a macro-brewed german pils, this one is actually pretty decent. Really nice grain aromas, and ok flavor profile. This style isn’t my fav., but this one is certainly better than average.

Classic German Pilsner. Nothing more, nothing less.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear golden body with a large foamy white head. Aroma of light malts and grass, light bittersweet taste of pilsner malt, hops, with a dry bitter finish. A pretty standard german pilsner.

Draft at Lenape golf course. Clear golden color. Aroma and taste of grains,faint citrus fruit. Average carbonation. Pretty refreshing. Little watery. Not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Duitslands grootste pilsener in nl. Mooie aroma maar qua smaak weinig diepgang. Wel een redelijk aangename bittere afdronk

Premium Verum doesn’t say much about quality and style. Had to drink this at a local rock festival due to a lack of alternatives. I don’t know a German Pilsener with less aroma and less taste. For people who don’t like beer it might be a good option. If you want to know what a German Pilsener tastes like, choose any other German Pils.
330 ml can. Clear golden with white head. Smell is light malty. Taste is crisp malt with a dry bitter finish.
Can 50 cl. Pours light yellow with small smooth head. Grainy, grass, earthy, toasty. Weird tasting at the moment.
Een lekkere pils. Redelijk volle smaak, gouden kleur. Goede carbonatie. Zit iets boven het niveau van de gemiddelde pils.

Taken from notes. Pale yellow in color. Skunky taste w/ a bad bitter afternote.
would not buy this one again

Pours a typical clear yellow amber with a thin white head. Aroma is crisp and malty with fruity undertone. Malty flavor has subtle notes of pear and banana. Texture has average viscosity and not much fizz. Average, but pleasing and refreshing. Good for a party.
Bottle from sainsburys. Pale beer. Malty and a bit spicy. Taste is bitter and crisp. Prickly carbonation. Nice pilsner.
50cl blik. Goudgele kleur. Witte schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie : hoppig, licht bittertje. Koolzuur bij afdronk.
Cerveja clara de malte de baixa fermentação tipo lager german pilsen. Muito leve e agradavel.

Bottle. Yellow, clear with small but long lasting head.
Aroma: Malt with slight dms and coins.
Taste: Dry with bitter finish.
Flavor: Grain, corn, coins, herbs.
High carbonation, good refreshment after 10km jogging, but have some faults. I like the bitterness, but hate coins both in aroma and flavor. Dms in on acceptable level.

Good taste up front. Clean taste with light hops and crisp. Finish is anticlimactic with not much to savor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
draft at Waldfest 2014. simple not great German Pils. sweet malts, some grassiness, noble hops. ok

Can on the plane. Crystal clear pale golden with a huge white head, good lacing. Aroma proves that the Germans make shit beer too, grain, corn, grass, metal. Flavor is a bit sweet, light bitter, hard to deal with as it warms. Light body.

Pours golden with white head. Aroma is cereal, noble hops and citrus, Smooth palate. Aftertaste is sweet malt and a lingering hop finish. Overall: Nice. Smooth palate for commercial lager. Will probably improve if they start using real hops instead of hop extract.
Pleasant medium-full, well-balanced pilsner with a long malty and bitter finish. Crisp and clean.
A true German classic. Quite bitter for the style, with a grainy taste of bready malt and some hopping.
Bottle 0.33l from local market, Helsinki. Originally rated 30052012. Colour is clear pale with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain and malts.
Tap beer in Lübeck, Germany. Typical German Pilsner. Nothing special. Pale with medium head.

Hivenen hiivainen tuoksu? Vaaleanvaalea lagerin väri ja niukka vaahto, tuoksu lämmenneenä melko täyteläinen ja lupaava. Maku kuitenkin laimea, täyteläinen jotenkin samalla tavalla. Jälkimaku miellyttävä, jokseenkin myös mauton ja tavallinen.
Cab’t believe I haven’t rated this before. This is a very acceptable German Pilsner. Light and refreshing. Good hot-malt balance. Haven’t had it for a while I will again
Clean golden color, medium white head. Aroma of malt and grassy hops. Taste has similar notes plus grain and light citrus. Thin body and lively carbonation. Very typical pilsner but quite ok.
Couleur dorée, mousse qui disparait, Nez malté céréales. Gout malté, houblonné avec petite amertume. Fin rapide, mais pas trop mal.
Uma lager bem saborosa, sabor marcante, um preço razoável e envase um tanto quanto simples
Decent pilsner, not great but ok. Little bit skunky, think it was a bad bottle. Not very smooth. Probably won?t get again.
Bottle, gold pour, white head, hoppy aroma, taste is bitter, smooth, malty, decent pils
Bottle from Sainsburys team valley. Pours light golden colour. Decent flavour for a pilsner - slightly bitter, bready, malty. Good stuff
500ml can. Pours pale yellow with a fast disappearing thin white head. Not getting much aroma. Lasting bitter finish.
Decent German pilsner. Aroma is like the most big-brewery-mass-production-beers are having. Taste is surprisingly fresh and nice.

Upleasant aroma of adjuncts. Medium head, almost completely disappearing to ring. Light golden body. Noticeable floral hoppy bitterness in taste with appropriate sweetness and over-average carbonation.
Faint floral aroma. Pale straw color, clear, with a white head that disappears quickly with no lace. Nice bitterness, watery pilsner malt taste. Dry finish. Very drinkable but nothing special.
0,3l bottle served on a plane. Good german lager. There even is a little bit of bitterness. Clear, gold color.

A nice German pilsener, pours a clear golden color, topped with a generous and slowly disappearing white head. There is a pleasant mild malty aroma complemented by some grains. Nothing special, but nice. The taste starts slightly more on the sweet side and is followed by a nicely balanced body with some bitterness added. Finishes with a decent bittery feel, lasting for some time after. A very drinkable and tasty pilsener.
Pours a clear golden with white head. Cereal grains mostly on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes pretty clean.
0.5l bottle. Pours golden with medium white head. Aroma of hops and malt, taste is the same. Little bit sweet with bitter aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Ok beer.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

Halványsárga színű sör krémes, ám rövid életű habbal. Illatában jól elkülöníthető a komló és a maláta kettőse. Ízében is a komló érvényesül főképpen, azonban nem annyira intenzíven, inkább tompább éllel, mely komlóérzet idővel egyre inkább visszafogottabb lesz és malátásan édeskéssé válik a zamata. Az összbenyomás kedvező volt, ideális azokhoz a pillanatokhoz, melyeknél a sör azok kísérőjeként szolgál, és nem próbál meg minden figyelmet magára vonni. Frissítő gyanánt pedig szintén megfelelő.
Typical Lager with related properties. Fine thirst-quencher. It is always difficult to write an inspired story about this type of beers. Instead, I take another one.

Bottle at Lufthansa airplane
Aroma-grass, hops
Appearance-pale, clear, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-light body, thin feel, lively, bitter finish
Overall- refreshing
Ticked many many years ago. Surprised that it was still not rated. Perfect example of a simple German Pilsener. You can drink it nonstop.
It is a pilsner so it cannot be very exiting. For a pilsner it’s good. Not sweet, malty and a little hop bitterness.

Bottle. Clean golden color like in German pils, white medium head which quickly minimized to a small ring - very disappointing. Aroma is pilsener malt and hops and the beer has same flavour. he beer is medium bitter. A normal German pilsenser.
Bottle. Clean golden color, white head - did not last long. Aroma of malt with hints of hops. In taste similar. Bitter aftertaste. An average German pilnser.
Overall not bad. A good beer to drink if your having more than a few. Better than the other crap on the shelves around here.
Clear golden color, with white foam that quichky dissipates. Soft aroma of malts. Taste is strong with bitter hops and some malts. High carbonation.

The carbonation is really good. Agree with a previous reviewer and will call it biscuity but it works with the malty. Not real hoppy, slightly bitter. Really enjoyed it when staying in Germany during a heatwave. Sessionable as hell

DAA; Can 50 cl. Pours clear golden with a white, lasting and lacing head. Aroma is light malt, citrus, cardboard, light honey and grass.Taste is moderate sweet, light bitter, light spicy with a dry short finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
0,5l Flasche. Hellgelbes Pils mit heller Schaumkrone. Typisch deutsches Pils. Durchschnitt!
Heerlijk duits bier wat zich lekker laat wegdrinken. Vooral op het terras in de zon is dit een van mijn favorieten.

Bouteille de 330 ml achetée dans une SAQ. Dégustée le 11 septembre 1996. Bière blonde pâle limpide. Mousse assez, col moyen, peu compact et assez durable. Peu effervescente, bulles fines à moyennes. Faible bouquet de céréales et de houblon. Très douce et un peu amère. Léger goût d’amandes, un peu sucrée. Manque de caractère.

Clear light golden pour with an immense head. Good lacing and retention for a pilsner. The nose is a light biscuit sweetness over just a touch of hops. Light medium body with normal carbonation which effervesces a bit on the finish. The flavor profile is low key, yet nicely balanced. It begins with a slight biscuit that flows into a slight bitterness against a slightly sweet background. The finish is crisp with a pleasant light bitterness that lingers a bit.

Pours clear oizzy yellow low white head
Aromas of bready malts, honey, syrup, hints of corn
Taste has typical pilsner maltyness, frizzy carbonation

Diese Verkostung fand in einer Lufthansa statt. Der Schaum war exzellent auch in Plastikbecher. Ganz appettitlich. Einstieg sowie Körper sind aüsserst ähnlich - keine deutlicher (unterschiedliche) Übergang. Der Abgang ist wenig wertvoll aber die langtragende Süffigkeit macht das wett. Ein gutes zwischendurch Bier was exzellent im Pils Glas aussieht. Sicherlich unterschätzt weil es überregional bekannt ist.

12 oz bottle poured into a 6oz english tulip. Yeast is the primary aroma emanating from this one. The taste is mellow sweet with some very light, light souring. Not much bitterness, although what’s there does come through at the finish. It’s a light bodied, dry, thin beer with active carbonation. Review from notes on 07/06/10
33cl for $2 @ Huck’s in Spokane, WA

Poured from bottle to pint

A: pours a straw light color with little to no visible carbonation.

S: Great nose. Grain bed with a strong muscat grape scent over the top, sweet, nice and unique.

T: Sweet, white grapes with touch of acidity envelop the grain on this palate. The finish resonates for about ten seconds. 

M: Medium bodied, this beer has a velvety tone to it. Low carbonation allows you to attend to the flavor profiles more acutely. Well played.

D: Great beer. Unique, adequate for digestif substitute. Light, enjoyable, satisfying.

Serving type: bottle

Typical pilsener in the inoffensive North Rhine-Westphalian style: too little hop, too little malt, watery, hard to distinguish from so many of its kind from the area. Many American lagers find their roots in this style, without exception brewed with something like ’mountain-clear, fresh spring water’, and pretty much tasting like it, too. They do know about marketing, though. Can only be drunk well-chilled or the smell becomes offensive. Tasteless label, too, particularly the ’premium verum’ epithet with its overtones of Catholic mass, and the laughable ’queen among beers’ title it bestows on itself.
Drank a whole 64oz boot of this stuff so I formed a nice relationship with it. Vegetal fruity hoppy notes. Taste is similar and sweet. Effervescent.

Bottle. Straw beer with lots of carbonation bubbles and a massive head which refuses to budge. There’s a nice lemony cereal nose. In the mouth, that carbonation really comes into the fore swishing flavour in the mouth. That flavour is decent enough. It’s light and breezy, but lemon fresh, with a nice sweetness from the malt cereal. Finish is sweet and light, but lasting. Slight vanilla and peach. Really nice, and tastes a bit above the generic.

Pours a clear golden with a moderate amount of carbonation and a big, foamy, white head.  Very sweet aroma, with cereal and other grains.  A bit less sweetness detected on the tongue, but a nice hop bite comes through.  Definitely one of the better import choices.
Lys gyllen farve med hvitt skum som forsvinner. Lett søtlig og syrlig smak. Lett bitter avslutning. Supermarked.

Regular, blond beer, and a regular layer of foam. It has a somewhat hoppy aroma which is quite present. It tastes slightly bitter and "soft". It also has a slightly bitter aftertaste. Furthermore a regular lager.

Normaal, blond pils, met een strandaard schuimkraag. Het aroma is hoppig en aardig aanwezig. De smaak is licht bitter en zacht. Eveneens een licht bittere nasmaak. Verder een standaard pils.

I've always been under the impression that Warsteiner had quite the reputation as a superior beer, so i was disappointed to discover that this beer was only a little better than average. It features a faint but clean aroma, matched with a relatively faint hoppiness. To me this beer seemed to have a rather light mouthfeel that I wasn't expecting- it almost seemed too watery. Probably the lightest pilsner i've came across. Not bad, but I'd personally recommend Wernesgruner over this brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Faint but actually quite pleasant aroma.
Flavor is malty, some herby hops on the background.
Little bitter aftertaste but it stays long.
Straw-colored, high carbonation, slightly persistent foam. Not so much sharp in mouth, its moderate bitterness, though pilsener, makes it easy to drink.
Bottle. Color yellow with medium white head. Aroma malt, grass. Taste sweet, bitter, grass.
Had this multiple times over the years, still a good beer, nothing special but a decent beer.
This beer is not one of my favorites. I thought it would be lighter in flavor than it was.

33cl bottle on a Lufthansa flight to Munich. Pours golden with a white head. Grainy aroma with some grassy notes and hints of fruits. Moderate sweet a fairly decent bitterness. Weak in flavour, but fair enough.

(Bottle, 0.33 l, during flight to Munich, 20130513) The beer poured pale golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had metallicness and mildly grass. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grass, grain, metallicness, starch like sweetnes, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was mildly sweet and somewhat bitter. An easy to drink and similarly easy to forget beer.

330ml bottle picked up at the state store 

Appearance: Pours clear straw golden with a small white head, light lacing 

Aroma: Pils malts, straw and honey 

Taste: Pils malts, grainy, straw and mild bitterness 

Nice, mild and tasty
Crystal clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma of grass, hay, classic German malts. Light bitterness. Clean, drinkable palate. I like thus beer more than my score suggests.
A yeasty, almost strong pilsner with a pleasant aroma but too much bittering. Too much ’earthy’ flavor for a pilsner. This pilsner sets itself apart for many others with its unique hopping

I like this beer. A nice German lager that outpaces any mainstream American beer. Has a nice bitterness and citrusy nose.

Light Yellow, Some Head and Lacing. Probably first time out of a mug, therefore slightly surprised by light color. Also seemed a little thinner than I remember from previous time. Standard Pilsener with light bitter aftertaste.

Aroma: grass, lemon, hay; Appearance: bright golden, clear, sparkling, big strong long-lasting white foam (great lacing); Taste: medium bitterness, lightly sweet at the end little sour; Palate: light body, thin almost watery feel, rather soft carbonation, long bitter aftertaste; Overall: very good german pils
33cl bottle from supermarket in spain. Golden color with thin white head. Taste is light bitter. Carbonation is soft and medium. Aroma is light malt and water.

33cl bottle. Golden with small white head. Nose: bread malts aromas, pepper, citrus zest, hay. Sip: medium carbonation, low density. Sour bread start, develops strong herbal and peppery notes. Ends with decent bitter hop flavour. Overall the beer is refreshing and well bitter.

Can. "Keep the All Day IPA at home," he said. "I brought beer," he said. Fortunately I brought a six pack anyway and only had to suffer through one of these. The debate that this was "a step above domestic macros" raged on for the rest of the tailgate.
Light colour, average taste. Not terrible but I certainly won’t be my first choice.
Draught in Berlin; Extremely pale colour with a light body and slightly watery feel. Has a crisp taste though and is quite pleasant overall.
Not terrible. Aroma on the stale cardboardy side.  Has an okay citrus backing to its malt base.  Weak bodied and watery mouthfeel.

11.2 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured a clear gold with white head decent lacing. Aroma of malts, grain and hints of hops. Taste is pretty much the same sweet, malty with a slight bitterness to it. Drinkable and refreshing.
A good beer drinkers beer, I tend to grab Warsteiner anytime I’m heades to a party or a friends house to watch the game. Pass on the Coors or Bud next time a reach for the Warsteiner.

Rather sour aroma of... I don’t even know. Smells like something is past its prime. Very light, clear golden color, beer doesn’t get much lighter. Taste isn’t bad, though. Crisp and watery with a bit of banana. Not a beer I’d reach for often, but if you need something to chug...
33 cl bottle. Crisp lager. Really good beer. Good citrusy taste. Thumbs up from me.

660ml Bottle at home. Brilliantly Crystal clear yellow fine bubbles. Big frothy white head. Aroma is faint grassy hop some corn. Watery palete, dryish finish. Medium carbonation. Flavour is sweet pilsner malt faint nobel hop. Pretty average.
Bottle from supermarket. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with toast, citrus, grain. Dry bitter with citrus and toast. Ok brew.

Pours pale gold. Has a tall white head that disappears. Plenty of carbonation. Aroma has a nice fruity/ floral quality. The fruitiness is hard to pick up their the bitter hops. Crisp and clean finish. Pretty good.
pure golden colour with thin white foum. taste is medium bitter and aroma of hops. drinkable beer with strong aftertaste. as pilsener beer it1s prety damn good beer

Warsteiner@lufthansa. One finger foam. Golden clear. Faint malty notes. Dry short finish. Ordinary but drinkable.Warsteiner pils draft@Casa Nostra Hamburg. Light golden clear. One finger foam. Very light maltyness. Dry. Only to still your thirst on a very very warm summer Day in Germany 1.7

Light golden pour with a small white head that fades quickly. Some citrus aroma, but not much. Flavour is pretty weak. Slight tang, wet cardboard and a bit of toasted wheat. Better than most macros but still not amazing.

0,5 boks fra Helgø: rett frra kjøleskapet etter orkesterøvelse er dette en god forfriskning, dog uten særlig munnfylde og ettersmak. Diskret syrlig bitterhet, men neppe verdt de ekstra kronene. Højt hvitt skum i mitt Tuborg-glass.

Pours pale straw clear, low carbonation small white head
Aroma- grassy, yeasty bread smell
High lager-like carbonation; boring hop bite with some sweetness, dissolves to watery flavor. Aroma more rich than taste.
Bottled 660ml ; Devon ; UK ; Grassy hops aroma ; Yellow color with nice head ; Light sweet and medium bitter taste ; Nice German beer.

Poured into Hey pilsner  class. Pours a clear blonde color, head of about an inch with good lacing. Definitely a floral type of smell. Taste is on the bitter side with a strong presence of malt and hops.  Strong tasting at first but surprisingly good drinkability.

Glass bottle. That is nice aroma. Very bitter. Aftertaste stays long and strong. Great.
Light-colored with a very substantial head (others that reported a weak head are full of shit).  Very crisp and clean with a slight hoppy finish.

It pours a straw colored slightly eggshell white body that is transparent. The head disapeared within seconds. It leaves just a tad of white lacing here and there. The smell has some earthy aromatic hops tones, slight malts faintly in the background. The taste is very crisp with a mild tangy hop bite but barely noticed. There is some maltiness on the front but not much. The palate is smooth and good going down. It has a decent carbonation. Overall, this is a good German Pilsener and good for me.

Aroma is grainy with a touch of sulfur and some light corn notes. A hint of a herbal hop aroma. The aroma is fairly clean but there is some light fruitiness as well. 
Pours a super clear yellow-gold with a thin white head that quickly recedes to the edges. Decent lacing and medium legs. 
Flavor starts with slightly sweet malt notes - grainy with some corn to it. A low floral hop flavor is also present as well as a light sulfur note. Moderate bitterness in the finish. 
Crisp, medium light body with medium carbonation. Low hop astringency and no alcohol warmth. 
Overall this beer isn't impressive but it is clean and to style. I may be imagining it but there seems to be some light esters in the aroma.

SIDEBAR: Trying this Pils from an icy cold can; still uncomplicated; a nifty refreshing drink, this be.  I like it from can to footed glass. Try it very cold. From an 11.2 ounce (US) brown glass bottle, chilled but not cold, poured briskly into a 12.0 ounce footed pilsner glass, allowing for a thin layer of head to form atop the see-thru haze of light yellowed color. After a few gulps, some residual lace clings inside the glass.
In the mood for an easy, uncomplicated pilsner? 
Maybe a Warsteiner Premium Verum is for you.
Bottle. A light-bodied, watery pilsener. Notes of pepper, grass with a hint of buttered biscuits. A nice hop bite at the end. Not bad.
330ml bottle. Light yellow, white head. Light malty body with a brief bitter finish. Nothing special.

Can 50cl. Small white head, leaves a thin layer. Light yellow pilsener color. Very well carbonated. Aroma has citrus, corn, grain with a buttery hint. Flavour has grain, light hay.

500ml can. Pours nice yellow with a good small lasting head. Aroma is malty, hoppy like a normal pilsner. Not many to say about the flavor, somewhat bitter.

Bottle at the Brussels Beer Cafe, Petaling Jaya, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a crystal clear light amber with a broken white head and a little broken lace. The aroma is malty and the flavour is pretty much the same. It’s medium bitter and very much yesterday’s beer. It’s refreshing, but the beer world has moved on since this beer was first brewed.
Bottle. Clear golden color. Herbal aroma. Taste was medium hoppy with some malty tones. Light bitter aftertaste Not bad.
Cerveza rubia. De cuerpo ligero, refrescante si está fría. Sabor a malta, suave y amarga.

500 ml bottle from Munich, Germany. Golden color. White long lasting head. Nothing really remarkable for the aroma, just a little bit grassy with citrus. Light and easily drinkable. Average pils, with a flat taste. Overall not bad, but nothing stands out neither.
Clear golden color with small head. Aroma is malt. Flavor is malt, some hops. ok basic pils.
Bottle->shaker.  Pale yellow with white head.  Lager malt taste and aroma.  Average at best.
Drank this on a Lufthansa flight to Frankfurt. Not much of a Pilsener person but I prefer it to other beers in this style.

Very clear pale yellow color with barely one finger of thin head.  Smells a bit sweet with corn and malt scents.  Tastes also of corn and somewhat sweet with hops giving it a nice level of bitterness. Light and drinkable with good amount of carbonation.  Verum
is a pilsner style.  Brewed in accordance to the Bavarian purity laws of 1516 (Reinheitsgebot) which only allowed water, barley and hops to be used to prevent price competition with bakers for wheat and rye to ensure bread availability.

330 ml can @ home January 03,2013

light yellow,fizzy,frothy head,lacing.

One of the German mass market pilseners, it’s as expected with golden color, aroma and taste of malt and hops. Nothing special, but not bad either.

Bottle randomly found at family Christmas Eve dinner. Pours yellow with white head. Nose of grains and citrus. Tastes of lemon, grainy, cardboard, malt, caramel, and grass. Plenty bitter and some hops.

Bottle. Pours clear light golden with thick but quickly vanishing white head. Clear aroma of hop with a slightly metallic finish. Bitter, hoppy taste. Watery mouthfeel. Dryish finish with a note of cardboard. Drinkable but just average. Not quite a queen of beers, despite the claim on the label.

Pale gold colour; It has an apparent grassy smell. Good head and foam; full body. Taste is refreshing; Taste of grass / hay and slight lemon peel; Hop bitterness is medium to low with lingering after taste;  quite easy for the mouth and inoffensive. 



Comments: slightly above average German Pilsner which easily beat the useless Stella Artois with a pretty mean grassy / hay taste. Not outstanding but still worth another try.

Pale golden color. White, medium sized, long lasting head. Aroma is a little flat and weak in my opinion. Grass, hay.  Very easy to drink, light. Taste is a little hoppy; far from being awful but not very remarkable. Just fine.
Very bright golden colour, huge, although quickly disappearing head; sourish fragrance, greatly ballanced bitterness of hop and malty sweetnes Good pilsener

Bottle into a pilsner glass. Pour is a light yellow with a thick head that drops back fast. Aroma is a weak hop. Taste is a nice bitter with a hard edge. Palate is a hard strong malt with a bitter hop that lasts. Over all a good pilsner.

0.5l bottle. Nice hop aroma. Lovely golden color with fat hat, (casting time) but foam runs only seconds :( Taste is medium hoppy, relatively booring simple german pilsner, but finish is enjoyable medium or little less bitter and sour what i like. No special sensation taste. Drinkable beer.

Pale yellow color, transparent. White, medium sized head. Medium to high carbonation, light body, watery, dry. Aroma: Hoppy, grassy hops, hinch of sulphur, hay. Taste: A bit malty, pale malts, hoppy, medium strong bitterness, dry, medium long bitter finish.Good classic german pilsener with hoppy character. Dry sessional beer with good drinkability.

On tap @ Agave Grill Ottawa.  Pours clear blond with a foamy white head.  Aroma is a faint chalky grain.  Taste is grain, adjunct, and a little alcohol.  Smooth, moderate carbonation, faint short bitter finish.  Not a great beer.

The beer is clear and pale yellow hued with a half inch of white head. The aroma offers pils malt, floral hops, grain. A present sweetness throughout. Noble hops and grain with a lingering sweet malt presence. A touch of lemon. Light in body with adequate carbonation. Overall, decent and drinkable. An inexpensive beer suitable for session drinking.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-21-2012
Bottle. Pale gold colour, no head, Faint sweet malt. Taste is of grassy hops. It has rather dry finish. An OK beer.

#336
Ein hopfig-frisches Bier Pilsener Brauart aus dem Sauerland, welches erst recht vom Faß zu überzeugen weiß! Der schlanke Malzkörper sorgt für ideale Ausgewogen- und Bekömmlichkeit. In der Gesamtnote sehr süffig, da weder Hopfenkeule noch zu malzig. Dieses "Premium Verum" kann ich jeden Tag trinken, selbst aus der Dose ist es noch lecker. Zweifels ohne gutes Massenbier!
	
Test vom 4.10.2006, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 12,10,12,10,12,11 - 11,00
4.8% pale yellow with a thin head, sweet hops aroma, sweet malt with bitter hop taste and slightly nutty, not too bad for a pilsner

Yellow, white head. Nose is grainy malt, some sweetness, industrial hops. Taste is pretty much the same, but with some more pronounced sweetness and an industrial-feeling bitter hoppy finish. Drinkable, but boring.
Pours straw yellow with a thin foamy head. Aromas of cereal, some grassy hops. Light in the mouth. Nothing special, but decent enough.
A clean tasting beer.  Carbonation medium.  Flavours of hop, grass, and a little citrus zest. Finishes dry.

Pours golden with a nice head. Initial crisp aromas of hay. A malty taste with a slight bitterness that strengthens as an aftertaste. Head fades to "soap-bubbles" and disappears. Bubbles are present, but not at champagne frequency.
Overall, a nice quaffing beer,

Fresh aroma, corn, and hay. Maybe some sweetness that pokes around too.  Looks like any other pale lager/pils.  Malty thick taste for a lager.  Sweetness is pronounced where many other Euro-lagers exhibit bitter characteristics.  Carbonation is pretty high.  I would call this the only drawback.
It poured a golden color with a small white head. The aroma was grassy and grainy. The taste was light sweet malts and light bitter hops.

Good beer. Nice brewery tour. However, colors are outdated of the bottles.

No foam, clear golden colour. Bitter aroma, taste and palate. One of the worst german beers.
Postupně sem budu doplňopvat piva, co jsem vypil a zapsal si, chvilku to asi bude trvat a proto k těm dříve vypitým pivům nebudou žádně "dojmy" .
Pale yellow color with creamy white foam, fruit aroma and a little diacetyl. Drinkable and medium bodyed, not bad.

Very nice nose, strong hop, grassy and zesty aroma. Poured into glass and appearance clear but very pale with little head. Head disappeared when glass down to last quarter, but beer still lively. Crisp and lively on palate.
Initially bitter taste and dry on palate, then a clean sweeter finish. I am looking forward to opening my next bottle.

12 oz can into an over sized wine glass...only the best glassware!

A - Very clear straw yellow body. Pour yields a massive fluffy bone white head. Sticks around for a solid amount of time. Light lacing.

S - Sweet and grainy with notes of hay, banana, and light spice. Finish is fruity almost. Smell is actually fantastic. 

T - Similar to the nose. Initially it is sweet with some banana and cloves, then it finishes grainy with some noticeable hops. Kind of a bubblegum aftertaste. Mouth feel is lightly carbed and thin, was hoping for more crispness. Highly drinkable.

O - Surprisingly tasty. I could see working this in as a session beer. Its well priced, and the cans mean no skunked off flavors. Woot!
bij de eerste slok krijg je gelijk een droog mondgevoel. de smaak is als een pils, echter wel een wat betere body, maar dat droge mondgevoel was een afknapper.
Draft at Brass Tap Trinity.  Clear pale golden color with a very thin head.  Grassy hop aroma with sweet malt flavor.  Easy drinking but far from exciting.

12-oz bottle into a 0.2L Warsteiner glass. 
Pours clean pale yellow straw. Very pale. Glass gives 
a generous white head that disappears pretty quickly leaving almost no lace. Some made-for-order bubbles floating around. 
Smell of light malts and nothing much other than that. 
Tastes very clean light-coloured malt flavors with low bitterness and a touch of sweetness. 
Very smooth, low-medium body with dry finish. Drinkable.

Canned, 0.5l. Clear golden color with large frothy white head and lively carbonation. Aroma of hay, grass, light citrus and papery note. Taste of grainy malt followed dry and crispy with light bitter finish. Medium body, slick texture and average carbonation in palate. Classic German quality...

Pours a pale straw color with a large, white head.  Fresh, slightly lemony hoppyness.  Clean, refreshing.  Not great, but better than its rating suggests.  Methinks the hopheads have rated it, being let down by this being a pilsner instead of an over-the-top hop monster.

Bottle. Disaapointing head hovering not for long over a straw coloured beer. Nice aroma of grassy and lemony hops clearly dominating a rather shy maltiness. Dry taste with a quite strong bitter finish and a hoppy aftertaste. Way better than expected, can’t find any fault in this.

Location/Date:Draft on September 15th, 2012.

Summary: Not a big fan of the style, which this hits. Just okay.

On draft in Utrecht by the canal on a warm  sunny day. A pleasant enough beer in this setting. Light gold, malty nose, grassy finish.
Super clear pour with a huge head.  Pretty standard hay and grass aroma.  Taste is mild.  Some malt and caramel.  A little hops to balance it out.

Light bready aroma, pours a clear light yellow with a full white head and visible carbonation.  Mild malt flavor, with bread and a touch of sweetness, very little hop presence.  Light on the palate and easy drinking.  If I’m going for an actual German beer, I think I’d reach for a Reissdorf first.

From bottle. Served in a 25cl Pilsner Glass. Crystal clear.

Botella de 330ml. Vaso Pilsner. Saboreada en agt´12. Color dorado brillante y apariencia algo velada. Espuma blanca que crea una corona tupida, amplia y persistente. Olor levemente metálico, fragancias florales, maltas dulces y notas cítricas en nariz. Sabores terrosos, de grano y amargor limpio. Cuerpo ligero-medio y carbonatación chispeante. Textura aguada. 330ml bottle. Pilsner glass. Enjoyed on agt´12. Bright golden color. Chill haze. White froth creates a close, thick & lasting crown. Sweet malts in the middle rounded by lemon touch. Dry bitter finish. Easy drinkability.
Cerveza con un sabor no muy agradable para mi gusto. No me la volvería a pedir.

500 ml can. Pours sparkling light yellow colour with a large foamy and steady white head. Aroma of grassy hops, malt, maize and paper. Cloying taste of maize, sweet malt and grassy hops.
