I prefer other helles as well so I just wasn’t crazy about it in any case.

The Premium Verum pours as an amber beer with little head. The aroma is mostly of yeast. As I sip, I taste a good deal of grassy malt, along with a slight amount of caramel. The palate is pretty standard for a pilsner. Overall, it’s not a very complex beer; but it’s not bad either.

Mild aroma has mostly hay. Bit basement stuffyness. Clear straw yellow. Short head leaving some lacing. Taste has lots of malt which is quite one-sided and bit harsh in flavor. Bit hops in the dry finish. Medium body and dry. Soft texture. Standard carbonation. Ok mostly for thirst but not enough character to really enjoy.

0.33 l bottle.

Pale golden colour, clear liquid, long white head.

Aroma has notes of malt, hops, honey, fresh bread.

Bitter taste, medium body, average carbonation, bitter aftertaste.

33cL bottle.  I surprised myself with this rating.  I think the export Warsteiner I had before was worse than the local stuff.  Fine head, appearance and aroma, nothing exciting, but pleasant.  Taste was warm, appealing, and medium-bodies, not too hoppy or bitter, well-balanced.  Enjoyable, don’t be afraid to get one in Germany.  In the US, I don’t know.
Buen sabor amargo, como se esperaria, con cuerpo. La tomé directo de la botella y me gustó. Lástima que se acabara.
A little rotten taste, bitter palate. Whire foam, quickly disappearing. Light colour.

CAN:
Pours clear pale gold...tall foamy white head...a lot of soapy lace.
SCent is corn, grain, sour malt.
Taste is bready, bitter...macro-ish and vague.
Very mediocre.
Average aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, somewhat memorable. Rated in the past from the bottle.

Can served on lufthansa airlines, best before 1-30-13. 

Pours a very pale golden yellow color with a two finger pillowy white head that very slowly fades into a lasting ring. Glass is left coated with sheets of soapy lacing. 

Light crisp hop aroma with a subtle earthy, floral character countered by pale malt and faint bready yeast. Pretty bland really other than the faint hop character with a little bread and biscuit. 

Medium bodied with a spicy hop bite up front that lingers over the bready yeast and pale malt notes into a slightly dry finish. Nice grassy, earthy flavor with a decent amount of dry bitterness that doesn’t overpower the other flavors. Hints of straw and bready yeast followed by pale biscuity malt. Well balanced, enjoyable session(able) beer.
Golden color, white head. Slightly perfumic, herbal aroma. Light bodied, oily palate.
This is a golden lager with a short head and the German brewing laws mean there is tastes crisp and clean.

Appearance:  Pours a light golden yellow and crystal clear with a minimal head that dissipates quickly with no appreciable lacing.
Aroma:  The smell of unbaked bread and hay.
Taste: Crisp and clean with mild floral hop bitterness.
Texture: Grainy and light body with good champagne-like carbonation.
Drinkability: A decent session beer when your left with less desirable options.
Presentation: Poured from a 12oz bottle into a mug.
Great taste, great beer... I have tried the one brewered in Argentina and its really good

Bottle from Waitrose. This is a very pale golden lager with a rather thin head and quite pronounced sparkle. There’s just about enough character here to tell it’s a pilsener and not a generic lager, and I guess the German brewing laws keep minging adjuncts out of there so it at least tastes crisp and clean, but otherwise it’s a medium-sweet pils with quite a brief finish. Average.

50 cl, canned. 4.7 % alc/vol. version. Pours clear gold with a nice durable white head. Aroma: Fresh pale malt, grain, some grassy hops. Taste: Moderately sweet with a good pleasant mild bitterness. Palate: Light body, average carbonation. Decent pale lager, nothing special.

Aroma: cereal, Appearance: golden, clear, frothy, Taste: lightly bitter, Palate: light body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter. The aftertaste lingers. The white head bursts forth and then settles to a very thin ring with heavy lacing. It’s a Pilsner.  5 liter keg
Bottle. Pours clear pale yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malt and cereal. Taste is medium bitter. Body is watery with good carbonation. Finish is short.

Mine was just no good. The beer had just a mild hay and crackers smell. Clear straw with a fizzy white head. The taste is grass and crackers, with some off flavors in the back. Crisp with a dry finish and a light body.

330ml bottle pours a golden color with a small white head that leaves only a few specks of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is grassy and grainy.  Taste is light sweet malts and light bitter hops.  Possibly the worst German beer  that I have tried.
Crappy macro beer here.  Not much to say but it was free so yay.  Crackers, seltzer, and hay dominate with a very slight floral hop maybe.
Pours a very light yellow with white head. Aroma is yeasty with some very subtle malts. High carbonation in the taste that masks most of the flavor. There is a bit of doughiness but that is about it.
At table and vine tasting, clea crisp pretty watery beer. Def a fat guy outside beer
Beautiful bitter bomb! A really good German lager that works for everything except dessert.

Color giallo pallido con schiuma bianca medio-bassa. Aroma quasi insignificante con deboli sentori di luppolo e grano; gusto mediamente amaro e acquoso con una punta di acidulo, retrogusto amaro e mediamente luppolato. Flebile al palato, buona effervescenza: una pilsener molto leggera che non merita grande attenzione.
Bottle in Berlin.  Pours clear yellow/golden with a medium white head.  Aroma of malt and grain.  Flavour is a little sweet and light bitter.  Medium carbonation and light bodied.
Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariel’s place. Thanks Sahron, pours pale yellow with a small head, aroma of malt, dough, some fruity sweetness, flavor of herbs, malt, caramel, cookies, medium bodied

Aromas a cebada y tonos herbales.
Colir amarillo pdlido, traslucido, altamente carbonatada, de cuerpo ligero y corona de espuma pequeña pedo duradera.
En boca, picosa por su carbonatacion, ligero sabor a cebada y sumamente fresca.
Al paladar las sensaciones incrementan, y dejan paso a un amargor medio.
En general una cerveza algo comun, conun amargor superior a este estilo y muy refrescante.

Bottle. Moderate malt and hop notes of grain and dried grass, with paper and light fresh fruit in the background. Head is average size, frothy, white with fair lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is sparkling clear light yellow. Flavor starts moderately acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is light to medium, wateyr with a lively carbonation and a lightly dry finish. Nice balance in aroam from this Classic German Pilsener, with a refreshing and crisp finish.

I raved about this beer back in 2009 according to my Facebook timeline.  I was still in my BMC phase then, so I wondered if I would still find this beer good today.  2012 revisit: pours to a very light yellow.  Surprisingly big head.  Somewhat skunky smell out of the bottle, but some hops and malt as well that show more once it’s been sitting in a glass (almost popcorn-like smell, actually - not bad at all).  Nice, smooth flavor - grains - and solid hops kick at the end.  Quite refreshing.  Good aftertaste, too.  I can see why this wowed me in 2009.  Can hardly believe St. Pauli Girl and this one are in the same class - St. Pauli tastes like a pale lager whereas this one really separates itself as a quality German pils.  AUGUST RE-RATE: I keep returning to this beer - it just has a great clean smoothness with enough crisp hops to keep it interesting.  Great summer beer.  Bumping to 3.5.

Bottle; poured clear light golden colour with big soft foamy head which left good lacing. Fast to moderate carbonation. Musty and grassy aroma. Tastes slightly bitter and slightly crisp in the mouth. Palate light with slightly dry finish with lingering bitterness. Refreshing.
bottle   light straw colour  bright white head  . aroma is grainy  . taste is grainy  and some lemony citrus hints  . medium carbonation  . not  much body .  nothing outstanding
Pale yellow in color with a full white foamy head.   Light citrusy aroma with a somehwhat bitter taste a a stronger long bitter finish.  Average beer for a summer afternoon.
Bottle.Grainy malt aroma.  Clear yellow with a small white head.  Light grainy malt flavor with a subtle grassy bitter finish. Light carbonated body.
Fresh and tangy aroma of malt and grassy hops. The taste is rough, grainy and dry malt with a dry bitterness. No! This one I do not like!

Clear bright light yellow, creamy white head settles and lasts. Grassy grainy malt aroma. Taste is lightly sweet grainy malts balanced nicely with earthy bitter hops. Some faint citrus. High carbonation, light - medium bodied, moderately hopped. Finishes dry and bitter. Decent. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)

Swill-like appearance with not much head.  Some carbonation apparent in glass.  Smells like corn and hay.  Taste is refreshing, like a domestic but just a little more refined and crisp.  No "off" elements.  Refreshing palate with just the right amount of carbonation, great for summer.  Very good for what it is.
On tap. Yellow-golden body, with an average white head, thatstays until I finish my glass. Malty aroma, light bitter taste. Light to medium body, nice carbonation level, very pleasant. An ok pilsener

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariel’s place. Thanks zvikar. Pours clear place golden with some white head. Smells like canned corn liquid and tastes artificially sweet. Sticky, light body, soft carbonation.

Pours pale yellow clear body with white rocky head. Aromas are floral hops, malts, grains and hay. Palate is thin, watery with medium crispy carbonation and slightly soapy mouthfeel. Aftertaste sweet malty and medium short light hoppy dry finish. Basic pils, balance is ok.
Can. Pale golden colour. White head with a lacing. Sweet aroma of hops, malt, rice and vanilla. Tastes like a typical German pale lager but with a disturbing egg flavor.

Drank this (Aug 2006 plus many times before and since) in ’Cochem -on-the -Mosel’ at an outside table, people watching, a great hobby of mine! 

Sunny, warm and calm. A half litre handled glass is brought over to me, full of foaming beer, it looks good, no great smell, but it is a lager (sorry, pilsner). 

As others have said, it is fairly dry to the taste and has a touch of flavour compared to some German beers. I have drank it many times in the past, draught, bottled and canned, it is a fine example of a better German Pilsner in my opinion.

Only thing to drink besides harpoon IPA. But it did the trick to wash down the terrible Cali Cab they were trying to make me drink. It's a clean refreshing typical German pils. Nothing exciting but nothing offensive either. Safety net. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 38,000 ft above Germany on way back from Munich.  Clear, golden yellow, small head which didn’t last. Aroma is pleasant - bready and yeasty - but mild and typical of the style.  The taste has decent bitterness but well balanced with a sweet citric/apple hint.  Refreshing, perhaps lacking crispness.  Palate is typical pilsner fizz.

Sampled from an 11.2 oz brown bottle this beer poured a bright yellow-golden color with a large soapy white head that lingered and left slight lacing. The aroma was lemon, bread and a hint of skunk. The flavor was artificial grape, lemon, chalk and a hint of skunk. Medium finish. Light to medium body. Disappointing.
Very clear, very light yellow, nice foam head. High CO2, very much a German beer. Think it is somewhat overrated. Good bitter. (Rheden 201109)

Poured into a pint glass. Clear, golden color with a finger and a half of white head. Lots of bubbles visible. Head collapsed but left good lacing. I should have poured this into a Pilsener glass.

Smells like freshly milled barley with the slightest bit of citrus.

First a "nothing" taste... water, followed by a dry, bitter taste. That’s all there is to it.

Clean texture, not nearly as carbonated as it looks and a light body.

I used to think German Pilseners were uncomfortably bitter, but this one tastes pleaseant enough. Maybe after the assault my tongue took from imperial IPAs, this seems a lot more toned down. Either way, it’s a one trick pony in taste and smell, but it looks beautiful. The best way to drink this is in Germany on a cobblestone street side table in the proper glass. Spend an afternoon watching the world go by.
Bottle. Light clear yellow pour with a smaller white head. Nose and taste is light grain and honey. Not terrible, but not terribly good either.

330ml can into a footed pilsener glass.

Appearance is a clear medium yellow with a one finger kind of fizzy white head. Good retention, though.

Smell is quite malty with light bready grain along with some noble flowery hops thrown in.

The taste has a light breadiness at first quickly followed by some sweet caramel that is not really present in the nose. There is a quick hop bite in the middle lasting through the finish. Some flowery hop flavor is there but not a lot.

Overall, a decent pils but far from the best out there. It is pretty refreshing, though.

Originally rated May 2004. This pilsner pours a nice yellow body, with a small foamy head that goes down rapidly. There is a great volume of carbonation, but little sign of lacing. Pleasant notes of hops and malty aromas. Tastes a slight bitter at first, but has a reasonable smooth aftertaste. Warsteiner Premium Verum is a decent pilsner.

Extra pale yellow, almost clear, with a fluffy white head.  Nice medium malt with resin hops lightly in the nose.  Medium malt through the middle with a creeping hop bitterness at the back.  Nice balanced lager, not too light and not too heavy.

A: Pours a straw colored body that’s sparkling clear. Due to the aggressive pour, the head was an amazingly tall, fluffy 4-finger eggshell white color, with plenty of lacing, but only decent retention.

S: Earthy aromatic hops with just a hint of tang to it, and luckily, no skunk. I’m beginning to wonder if I suck at smelling beers...

T: Very crisp tasting, with only a mild tangy hop bite on the middle and back ends. Some malt sweetness can be found at the front as well. A little simplistic, but man is it refreshing. I can detect a bit of skunkiness on the flavor profile, though, which hurts the score some.

M: Smooth and slick going down. It’s not watery per se, but it drinks like water. Very good carbonation, without being overpowering.

O: Not a huge, huge fan of this, but it’ll work in a pinch, or if I want something to wash down German cuisine with. I probably wouldn’t buy it, simply because there’s way too much else to try.

Aromas of bubbly coriander and vanilla notes. Very light, almost green-tinted color with a medium foam. Taste is carbonated vanilla and coriander with an odd, almost metalic finish. Overall, this is your average beer with a bland vanilla and coriander flavor. I’d give this a C rating.
(can) clear light golden colour with tall white head; light aroma of honey, mild flavour with long light bitter flavour
A - pours super clear straw no head. S - strong floral notes, rose petals and honey. M - super light with a little tang  T  - sweet honey and floral notes. o - simple sweet honey floral lager. 4-
Yellow Gold color clear large frothy white head, dissipates quickly. Nose is light fruit and malt. Light crisp sweet taste, some funky scunk flavor, maybe from cheap adjunct.

500 ml can. Light (not dense) large head upon pouring. No scent to speak of. Really good lacing. Extremely sparkly body - clear pale yellow (Lovibond 2/3). Fairly fizzy concoction. Flavour is lightly sweet but very well balanced. Overall, a muted tasting beer which makes for easy drinking. Good texture on palate. Nothing terribly fancy or noteworthy, but a good beer.
Not the worse beer i ever tried but is way below average. the appearance is a straw yellow with a grassy and watery aroma. the taste is very bland, very mild bitterness.
Tastes of honey. Very little body but sweet honey aftertaste. Little to say about anything but the overwhelming honey. Not bad, but no beer taste. Very, very light color.

0,5 l. can. Poured in to a flute. Clear, golden colour with a fluffy white head, that faded to a thin ring. Light sweet aroma with hay, grain and a slight grass note. Light bitter taste. Medium body with a lively carbonation. Short, sweet finish. Easy drinkable German....

11.2oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a clear pale yellow with about a finger of white head. Aroma of light hops and malt. Taste is light bitter and mirrors aroma. Medium bodied with a thin texture. Lively carbonation and a decently long finish. Overall, not bad. Nothing really standout but drinkable anyways.

I could happily drink 3 or 4 of these without complaint. Light mouthfeel and a nice grassy flavour, some malt sweetness. Slight buttery note in there. Some bitterness from either saaz or hallertau hops or both. Whatever, its good german pilsner thats been made for 100’s of years and will certainly be made for 100’s more!

The lesser of several evils at a basketball game. The malt was unbalanced and synthetic, with no prevalent hop character to lighten the finish. The plastic cup didn’t help, but I didn’t get a sense that there was much to miss.

Enjoyed at a convention hall in Sinsheim, Germany while watching a performance from the musician Udo Lindenberg, which put me in a place where I may have been 1 of 2 Americans in a crowd of 1000 Germans (aside from the Canadian that we went with).  Appearance was nice, I guess, it was a pretty dark venue aside from the epic stage lighting.  Aroma didn’t smell like a men’s washroom, so I can’t complain.  Taste was exceptionally crisp, really nice beer to have at a large event like that.  I liked it.

Light golden color and has a white head that dissipates quickly. It has a light sweet/grassy aroma that is nothing remarkable, but works just fine for a pilsener. The taste is sweet and ends with a bitter finish.
Bottle. Clear yellow with average head. Plain aroma. Soft flavour with some hops.

On Tap at Bier Markt in Cleveland

a: served in a Warsteiner Pilsner glass. Clear straw yellow with a foamy 1/2" head with very little retention. Little to no lacing

s: clean smell, hint of hops and malt, slightly grassy

t: clean taste, nice malt profile blanaced well with hops. A slightly grassy after taste I could do with out
Decent pilsner but nothing special, basic taste with a medium carbonation, pours a golden yellow.
korngul i glasset, let lys skumkrone.. henad lidt citruslignende , lidt over i  metal smag.... nej.
Bottle @ home, bought on holiday. Clear yellow / golden color, average sized white head. Plain and simple pilsener smell and taste. Average carbo, low to med body.
Clear golden colour, avarage foamy white head. No real distinctive smell, very soft palate.
floral, hay, vanilla, cough drop, golden, cloudy, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, medium body, sticky, bitter, long finish,
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. I’ll update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.

500ml bottle. Large, rocky and lasting bubblebath-like head on a clear and lively pale yellow body. Lemon, grain, slightly herbal hop and slight corn on the nose. Grainy on the tongue, quite a dry bitter hop presence, corn, straw and cardboard. Finished quite bitter and lingered well. Medium carbonation, pretty dry, light to medium body. Crisp palate texture.
(500ml Bottle)excellent Pils. LOVELY flowery hop texture and bready, sweet , complex malts. A  long standing favourite. I love the woody bitter finish.
clear golden appearance with minimal white head.  very light floral aroma.  mildly carbonated with a faint citrus taste and a slightly metallic finish.  decent beer.

660 ml bottle served cool. Yellow with a frothy white head. Mildly grassy aroma, generally light sweet straw flavour. Pleasantly refreshing "holiday beer", boosted by a creamy mouth feel, but marred by excessive carbonation. Each swig led to a Barney Gumble style burp. I would imagine best experienced really cold with a group of close friends by a pool in the med.

Appearance is reasonable. Head dissipated immediately. 
Smell - is mildly hoppy, definitely German. 
Taste is kind of mundane. This was the lowest point for me. 
Serving type: 16.9 ounce / 0.5 Liter bottle



This beer was disappointing. It poured an extremely pale yellow with 1/8 inch head that quickly faded. The aroma had hints of resin and lemon. The flavor began with some bitterness and led to lemon and hoppy notes, followed by a bitter aftertaste. The mouthfeel is very thin, almost watery. Warsteiner Premium Verum, while a German pilsner, was more along the lines of an American adjunctive made Lager.




Overall not really impressed or really put off by this beer. It is a decent pilsner when it is very, very cold or mixed as a Radler (Sprite or Lemon-Lime soda added) or Cola-Bier (Coke-Cola/Pepsi/any type of colas added). I could have a few of these and not be too upset. Overall just kind of boring, but sometimes that is okay and it is the only German Beer they will serve on Lufthansa Airlines in flight...........not highly recommended!!!!!
Golden color with a small head. Almost no aroma. Thin warery pilsner with slightly metallic taste.
Una birra/bibita, dal gusto molto leggero. Perfetta da bere frsca davanti a un buon film. Le bollicine sono una rarità e l’aroma é tutto a base di luppolo, con poche sfumature.

Bottle, 300 ml

Almost no aroma at all, pale yellow color, foam doesn’t last long. Now, taste, I haven’t tasted a beer like that ever again and I’m not sure if that’s good or bad, its taste reminds me of the taste you have in your mouth after swallowing a mouthful of corn made chips! Mildly carbonated, thin on palate.

After some more sips, no, that taste is definitely not good, almost stinks..
Light yet distinguished taste. Great for summers on the patio or around the fireplace in the winter. Pale golden color.

Bottle as shown. Pours a clear gold with a medium frothy white head that leaves sticky lacing along the glass. The aroma is wheat and floral hop. Thin mouthfeel with wheat grass and skunky finish. Not much going on with this one.
Almost no aroma. Bitter fruity beer. Golden clear, a good white head. 33cl bottle
Doesnt taste very much at all, almost watery, with some notes of taste. It’s ok beer if you want something to just pour down...
Sparkling golden lager with a voluminous fluffy head poured by a chap who knew what he was doing. Good aromas of pilsener malt and yeast. A tasty, quaffable drop and I’m happy to go back for seconds.
33 cl bottle.  Pours light gold with a decent white head.  Mild aroma of malt and grain.  Taste is malt, grass, grain, and a bit of hops.  A touch of bitterness.  Nice pilsner.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. The rep made out as if this would be awesome and would fly off our shelves. The night it came in, I figured I’d try it to see if I could trust the rep in future...Well, it’s safe to say we no longer listen to him
clean yellow body small white head. smells of hay  nicely carbonated and taste of floral and grass notes.

very little to report in the aroma.  pours a pale straw colour.  quite a grainy flavour with a touch of bitterness in the finish.  
lacks a hop palate and is a bit too fizzy.

33cl bottle. It would be a good beer but isn’t. There is nice yeastly smell, fruity-hoppy taste, nutty-malty sweetness, a bit of bitter, and sharp alcohol in the aftertaste. There are fragments of a good beer, but they don’t make a whole. Foam, body, colour are OK. Price for this lowgrade beer is too high.

33cl bottle.  Sunday, December 25, 2011
Ok white head.  Clear golden pour.  Typical pilsner   ok.

33cl bottle. Golden with white head, moderate lasting. Aroma is malty, hoppy, with slightly citrus hints. Flavour is mainly bittery, with a final also bittery. Carbonation is medium. Body is light to medium.
Has a bit of a bitter taste that comes off a bit weird - almost more of a sting than anything pleasant.  Other than that, standard fare...It’s better than a lot of the Argentine lagers at least.

0.5L bottle at 1.15€. Pale light beer with a nice big white head, reducing but lasting. Used to have this from 5L kegs which rocked the parties. Hops & malts on the nose. First impact is a good amount of hoppiness, followed by crisp malts, then again lots grassy hops. Dry bitter finish. Light body and high carbonation. Good to have once in a while for a bitter break, not a favourite.

Clear straw with a very generous fluffy lasting head. Aroma of straw, and biscuity lager malts, some yeasty lager phenols. Taste was simple and lagerful; pale biscuit, straw, chewy German yeast, and some awkward macro beer phenols, kinda lame and bland.

Clear golden brew with a medium sized white head.
Easy aroma with bread, dough and herbs.
Dry and sharp finish escorted by citrusses, spices and nuts.
Balanced, pleasant one.
Pale yellow. Smells like a domestic adjunct lager.   Tastes of urinated hay.  Wow!  It makes me want to go out and cut grass.  Or possibly just crush my head inside of a vice.  Love it!

Haven’t rated this yet. Pretty pour from bottle into tall Peroni glass. Snow white head on gold beer; laces at each sip. Aroma is herbal hops, light though. Flavor is classic, balanced pils, with the crisp mouthfeel you expect. As pilsners go, I’d say this one is a bit sweet, light on the palate, and pretty sparse on hops. For those reasons, it drinks really easily. Not my favorite pils, but no complaints about Warsteiner.
Aroma of corn starch, bitter wheat and bread.  Pours pee yellow with a good sudsy head.  Tastes of iron, corn and bitter floral.  Very tasty but a little too metallic.

A slightly better then average pilsner. Very nice scent, and decent pour. Taste is alright, good for a pilsner.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
500 ml bottle in supervalue londonderry. very nice beer here will be returning again
Clear pale yellow color with medium white head. Malty aroma. Grainy flavor with a bitter finish. Another classic German pilsner example. Really nice refreshing pilsner beer.
Bottle.  Transparent light gold pour.  Aroma of pilsner malts and light hops.  Taste is clean, crisp, and slightly bitter.  Medium body and carbonation.

Bottiglia da 50 cl. Colore giallo oro limpido con schiuma media di grana fine abbastanza persistente. Al naso molto scarsi i profumi mentre al palato offre solo scarse note maltate chiudendo con un leggero amaro.

Can. Clear golden straw with a generous white head that fades. Sweet, slightly corn malt, mild hops, some grains but very mild. Average carbonation, too sweet for a pils, decent body, bit of malt and cloying sweetness at the end.
11.2oz bottle. Pours almost clear yellow with a white head that does not stick around. Look and smell of urine. What little taste it had carried an off metallic note. Not good.

Tasted from bottle into nucleated tulip glass. Poured a clear, light golden color with a full, fluffy white head, lasting but no lace. Very neutral aromas and flavor of a true German Pilsener: no adjuncts, some grass and grain, faint peppery and flowery hops, more in the bitterness and flavor than aroma. Balance is definitely more toward bitter than malty-sweet, but again, mostly neutral. Light body, spritzy mouthfeel with a lingering crisp, dry finish. Very clean and refreshing with no flaws. A mini-keg of this stuff is a great thing to bring to a party. So...time-out fellow beer raters, let’s be fair. Doesn’t 26 seem awfully low for this beer? Granted, Classic German Pilsener is not one of the more exciting or flavorable beer styles, but it is a delicate and exceedingly popular one and technically difficult to execute well. It only slightly resembles the mass-market American adjunct lagers we’re all so proud to have outgrown. The only "flaw" I can detect in Warsteiner is that it’s not Imperial Stout, which is silly. Right?

(bottle) pours a clear pale yellow colour with a frothy white head. aroma of light barnyard and pale malts, with a hint of earth and powdered sugar. flavour is very grainy, with lots of popcorn and a very astringent, unfittingly bitter finish. light-bodied with average carbonation.
From a 330 ml bottle. Golden with a medium head. almost nothing to smell in there. and its similar with the tase. just plain boring.

(Flasche in Glas) Die Farbe ist ein sehr sehr helles Gelb mit einem ganz kleinen grünlichen einstich.  Das Aroma selber ist auch selhr leicht und leicht süßlich. Geschmacklich hat es keinen Körper nur eine sanfte Bittere, die schnell abklingt aber trotzdem noch im Gaumen hängen bleibt. Im Ganzen sehr langweilig.
Pint Draft in Columbus.  Had nice white head that didn’t last too long and was a basic Pilsner beer. Not much sticking out in the taste department

Se encuentran pocos aromas, con algo floral. Cerveza de color dorado de sabor amargo y algo agrio con retrogusto muy amargo. El final es astringente y bien amargo.

Features: 
AROMA: floral, Yeast: dough, 
COLOR: pale, clear,  Head: white
TASTE:  very bitter,  medium sourness, 
PALATE:light body, average carbonation, Finish: astringent, bitter,

Warsteiner Premium Verum has a medium, white, soapy head and a clear, straw appearance, with a few streaming bubbles. The aroma is mostly of light, sweet barley malt and clean water, and the taste is a mixture of mild, bready malt, an enjoyable touch of hop bitterness, sweetness, and an unfortunate paper aspect. Mouthfeel is light and watery, and Warsteiner Premium Verum finishes crisp, clean, mostly refreshing, and fairly dry. Overall, this is a pretty good beer, and I certainly think it’s worth trying.

RJT

Poured from bottle into weizen glass. 

Appearance: Pours a pale yellow. Very clear. Good carbonation; continued the entire time I drank. Full head; some retention, but didn’t last very long. 4/5

Aroma: Sweet and citrusy. Very clean. A little disappointing. 4/10

Taste: Acidic with a slight sweetness. Moderate taste duration. 5/10

Palate: Light feel. Smooth. Slight dry feel. Very lively carbonation. Moderate alcohol feel. 3/5

Overall: An average pilsener. Nothing specail. Nice drinkability. 10/20
Meh... One of these, then I switched to Dewar’s for the rest of my Lufthansa flight.

After a very unexciting nose of grains and nothing more, I was pleased to find that this beer actually has some taste going on, with decent hops and malts which provide some bitterness. The palate is weak, but this is otherwise a decent thirst quencher (I wouldn’t say this beer’s overall score is a 14/20—more like an 11. I’m giving it the three extra points because, despite the very low marks for appearance and aroma, this beer doesn’t do as bad a job once it’s in your mouth).

500ml can.  Pours a pale yellow with a white head.  Aroma is watery straw, and malt, with a faint hit of hops.  Taste is sweet malt, mineral notes, with a metallic hop finish.  It is what it is.  Nothing to complain about, but nothing to rave about either.

50 cl can. Pale straw color, aiiry white head. Lots of sulphuric notes and pea soup when cold, thought it had gone bad (bb-date still far ahead). Luckily it got better after a few minutes in a glass. It has sweetish grassy, slightly herbal and perfumy hop notes, light grainy maltiness. The taste is quite the same: clean, light, grainy and medium bitter. Light body, medium carbonation, quite fresh. Slightly watery finish. It is clean and does have some taste, but not enough to remember and try again.

Lager colour. Slow, rocky white head.
Burnt aroma.
Slight hoppiness but a rather boring watery lager taste.
Palate carbonated more than it looks.
Overall boring.

Yellow, clear body and mind bubbly head. Clean aroma, not much to it really. Little bit of wheat and white sugar. Very watery taste, even more than others like Becks or Heineken. Less carbonation would at least make it more drinkable. Won’t get this unless nothing else is offered (which is why I had it in the first place really).

Bottle. Pilsener smell, color and taste. Some people were saying this is a good session beer - I disagree.  As a pilsener, something about it is cloying and would get old after a couple to me. Honestly this is piss water in my opinion - it tastes similar to a few other German brews I’ve had that are either ruined in the process of getting over here or just have a same, sorta off putting flavor to me.  Won’t grab this again. 4.8% alcohol.

This brew is a great session brew!  It pours up a light, golden colored body (almost like the color of a starfruit) and sports a frothy/bubbly head that dissipates rather quickly down to a fine film of a head.  The smell is not overbearing by any means; filled with subtle hints of hops and a light citrus-y smell.  The flavors are filled with the nice bite of hops touched up with some warm hints of citrus fruits and something grassy (lemon-grass perhaps?).  The body of the brew is awesome; no bitter aftertaste, very light, and a clean finish.

50 cl. bottle@home: completely clear, light golden with a fizzy white head, smells very skunky with some sweet corn, taste is lots of sweet adjuncts, corn syrup, grass, watery & skunky with bitter, hop-extract aftertaste, dull & run-of-the-mill at best, light & bubbly body

Aroma of hay, light herbal hops and honey. Appearance is gold with scant white head. Flavor has light, sweet malts with an overlay of herbal hops; the finish is slightly nutty and perhaps a tad bit skunked. Palate is bubbly and the body is quite thin. Went well with my lasagna, but didn’t stand alone very well.
Just an all out consistent beer that’s delicious and perfect for any occasion.
On draft at mont blanc restuarant in hells kitchen with Steph.  Sladek hops tang, crisp bohemian pilz taste.. But light and insubstantial

Helle Farbe mit anständiger Schaumkrone. Dezent getreidiger Geruch, leicht säuerlich. 
Auf der Zunge fein perlig mit typischer Pilsherbe und säuerlichem Einschlag. 
Abrupter Abgang, kaum Nachhall. 
Warsteiner ist nicht schlecht, nicht gut und irgendwie elegant glatt. Zugeschnitten auf ein breites Publikum.Test vom 4.2.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

50 cL can from the LCBO courtesy of Susan and Kennedy, served in a lager glass. Pours clear pale straw with a large white head. The head fades to a bare cover and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has notes of grass and soft noble hops, along with grain and pale malts. The flavour is fairly dry, with lots of grass and a hint of spice up front. It becomes slightly more bitter towards the finish, which is moderate in length and somewhat hoppy. On the palate, it is light in body with a dry texture and average carbonation. Overall, this is a fairly nondescript pale lager with moderate hops. Nothing special. 2011-09-07

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into clear cup.

Appearance: Pale yellow with stark white head that mostly dissipates.

Aroma: Very grassy with a spicy noble hop kick. Not too much aroma.

Taste: Same as the smell - very grassy, with a nice spicy and bitter hop finish. Very light apple and citrus, but this is a very simple Pilsner.

Palate: Moderately high carbonation, light body, dry finish.

Overall: Quite good for a mass produced German Pilsner, but the smaller German brewers and US craft brewers make better.

Juni = pilsnermånad. Dags för test. Ljust gyllengul, vitt skum som snabbt lägger sig. Stiltypisk doft av jordkällare, mineraler, vetebröd och blommig humle. Lätt munkänsla, liten beska, lätt sötma, tunn kropp, blommig, lite gräs, lite mineraler. Stor (för stor?) drickbarhet, liten smak och beska.

Pours a very pale yellow with a medium foamy white head...very clear, very lively looking.  Aroma has straw, grass, and a hint of lemon.  Flavor also has straw and some skunky, spicy hop notes.  Mouthfeel is very light and the finish is spicy and abrupt.
Pours a clear yellow body with a thin, rapidly dissipating white head. Sweet, somewhat dry. Slightly skunky.
Faint aroma, yellow colour with almost no head. Taste is almost creamy leading to a bitter finish. Not a expert on Pilsener but I wasn’t keen on this.
Bottle. Review from an old notebook. Very pale. A rather thin lager with a poorly developed malt base leading to a bitter finish. Harshly carbonated.
Some corn and malt in the aroma.  Sweet taste with a little bitter hops in the finish.  Good but not exciting.

Bottle (500ml):Lots of corn, some bread & a light bitter finish. Sweet smelling overall.

Light golden, almost straw like. Thin white bubbly head with ok retention. Crystal clear.


Nice sweet flavour with some corn & it is quite a hoppy with a light bitter finish.


Smooth with nice carbonation & a light to medium body. Finish is a crisp one.


It goes down well & makes for easy drinking, you could put away several of these without a problem.



1001 Beers Blog:
On tap. A nice premium pils. Not bitter. Clear and crisp. Refreshing. Goes down easy.
A simple but nicely balanced Pils. Aroma and flavor of pale malt and noble hops. A slight creaminess before a firm bitter finish. Refreshing and crisp, very straight forward.

I used to think that I was very adventurous whenever I bought a Warsteiner instead of one of the bland Norwegian macro lagers. It’s not as exciting as I remembered it to be… There’s nothing really wrong with the beer: the faint aroma has both some nice malty and hoppy components and the light sweet taste is followed by a light bitter finish, and there are no traces of any off-flavours. But not exciting by any means. 

[50 cl can, from ICA Hasle, Oslo]

Rerating 30.5.2012:

Drunk from can. Malty, fruity smell. Pale golden colour, white fine-foamy head. Fresh, slightly malty, slightly metallic. Mildly sweet.
Refreshing in the sun, better than most pilseners actually, but not much more. Hints of metal and fruit.
Very good German Pilsener which pours a nice yellow gold and is extremely refreshing. Nice round taste.
Muy buena cerveza, facil de encontrar y muy barata en Uruguay y Argnetina para la muy buena calidad que tiene.
On the plane to Dusseldorf.  Pours a golden yellow with a big fizzy white head.  Aroma is mostly malt with grassy tones.  Taste is heavy on the malted and a slight sting of hop.  Solid beer.

50cl bottle. Pours golden with a decent head, most of which hangs around. The nose has pale malt and a touch of citrus. The taste has pale malt, herbs and a touch of citrus. The palate is light to medium in structure and texture with a clean, zingy finish. Overall, a good pils.

On tap and can. Light golden color with small white head. Aroma of malt, grain. Taste, starts sweet malty, continues with fruity hints, ends bittersweet. refreshing but nothing special. Rating from 05/2009.

Pretty enjoyable balanced beer, nicely balanced with bitterness and sweetness.

better than average, but not the best ever, it should be more bitter, and it lacks a little bit of an aftertaste.

I would buy this in my local store if I wouldn’t be able to buy my Czech beer in Germany!
500ml can. Very representative of the style. Clear, slight sharp bitterness, light body.
ok beer but no real smell tasted ok but was to exspensive for wat it tasted like so wouldentr buy again
Picked up their 22.3 oz bottle for fun.  Haven’t had this for at least a decade.  Not bad actually.  A pleasant pilsener with a decent malt backbone.
Tap at Scaleria, Wolfgang am See, Austria. Pale watery yellow, practically no nose, taste is grassy and weak, nasty skunky finish. Bleugh.
Poured from a bottle. Aroma is almost nonexistent. Taste is slightly grainy while still being malty and a bit corny. Light and spritzy body. A bit unimpressive.
Average pilsner. Not bad but not great eitner. Simple taste, some bitterness and carbonation being the main characteristics.
Several bottles on my trip to Munich because it was cheap or free.  Clear gold pour, fizzy white head.  Light malts, light grassy hops, slightly skunky.  Not much going on, close to water.
Great beer. 660ml bottle for just over £1.80 but I’ve previously drunk it in Germany. Really enjoyed it, head all the way down, strong taste and aroma. Couldn’t drink too many of them however.

Poured from a can, light golden color with almost no head. Nice fruity hop with grains a malt aroma, slightly metallic and grassy. Flavor is balanced well, slightly bitter almost sour from the hops but a nice sweetness on the finish. Dry and crisp body, pretty good beer.

Pale golden colour. Very refreshing and thirst quenching. Aroma of fruity hops and malts. Fresh to drink with a hoppy flavour to it wich is fresh and bitter, bit like lime. Looks classic when poured into it’s original glass.

fine and lasting head, some laces, light yellow
fresh pilsner nose with a tone of rye - when poured there was a scent filling and sadly leaving the room.
Medium body, soft and with some length.
some sweetnes, hay. pleasant.
A very fine german beer - very quaffable.

Bottle. Pours a transparent light gold body with a white head with medium retention and no lacing.  Aromatically light earth, a hint of lemon, grains, and a hint of hay.  Lightly sweet with a grainy body and some bitter earth tones with a hint of apple.  Soft body, somewhat clean with a thin light grainy finish. Eh.
Bottle. Aroma of malt and hay. Clear yellow with soft white head. Plenty of malt in flavour with a touch of fuit.
A mass produced German tasting beer.  Light, crisp, clean, but for a German pilsner on the average side.  It is sweeter than I anticipated, with light taste of malts and citric bitterness. Enjoyable.

sparkly, lightly straw-coloured beer. Well-carbonated with a frothy head.
Dry yeasty smell. Subtly citric and cutting dry, icy. Malty.
Salty wholesomeness, fizzy, very refreshing but not much development. Aftertaste is a bit bitter with a mildly alcoholic feel. Nice for when its hot, but too many and the aftertaste will get too much.

Light golden, diminishing head and lace. Saazy aroma, subdued malts, grains. Nice body for pils, pale malts with a bit of artificial sweetness it seems, nice saaz that sharpen in finish, strangley metallic as it warms, better out of fridge. Decent.
Light and crisp, balanced maltiness with a hint of hops derived bitterness. Weak finish, but not a bad pils.

12oz bottle. Rating #1426 and the last beer style that I have to rate 73/73. Golden pour with a decent white head with streaky lacing. Grainy aroma, light sweetness, corn maybe. Very light flavor, a light bitterness, but smooth overall with no aftertaste, eh. (1673)

Bottle. Clear basic yellow gold with fizzy white head. Minimal bitterness in the aroma, but fairly clean and most veg notes left out.  Slight hint of grassy and herbal bitterness, but not really much of anything to report on for the flavor.  Bland, watery, and fizzy and a little bit of paper in the finish, which is the major detractor here (well, other than the overall blandness).

Draught at ølbaren - thanks Jacob. Clear yellow - white head. 
Bread. Hay. Light metallic. Ok hoppy. Light fruity notes. Ok, nice !!

ours a nice golden with a thicker white head. Aroma is sweet malts with a bit of hops. On the palate, it is light and refreshing. The flavor is sweetier than I expected. It finishes a little dry. Very easy drinking, but not a favorite
bright and crisp, this is a perfectly acceptable middle of the road pilsner.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow with a 1 cm white head. Aroma is malt, grassy hops, some spicy tones. Aroma of malt, bitter grassy hops. Thin to medium body, lively carbonation. Refreshing pilsner, not bad. 150411
It was told to me that this is the national beer of Germany. The smell is lightly roasted malts and some spicy hops. Taste starts soft, some sweetness which develops into a soft bitter aftertaste.

(bottle, 3/28/11). Clear light gold color. Medium white head. Light sweet malt and grain aroma. Flavor of the same with light citrus/grass hop. Avg duration. Light bitter finish. Thin texture. Moderate carbonation. Fair lacing.

Pours a pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is a lot of slightly sweet malt with some grain and dry hops. Taste is basically the same with a somewhat bitey bitter finish. I like the liberal use of hops compared to most macro pils. Quite pleasurable and my preference over most macros.
Light straw color; Light to medium body; Aroma of malt, & some hops; Flavor of malt, hops, and grain; Overall, a bit light - decent.
50 cl bottle, Sheffield, UK. Pale golden, frothy active head. Grain based aroma, sweet with cereal grains emerging. Sweet aftertaste.
500ml bottle.  Pours a very light lemon gold with a medium frothy head.  Aroma is grassy, lemon and a little corn.  Taste starts with some light lemon and finishes with grass and corn.

500 ml can.

Pours a light yellow colour with a medium-sized foamy head. Aroma of grainy malts, honey and some grass. Flavour of grainy malts, metals, grassy hops and hay with some honey notes. Light bodied with a grassy finish. Not bad and a canned version isn’t probably the best possible version of this.

Pours pale gold, large quickly fading head.
Nose is comprised of massive cereal notes, cardboard and honey.
Flavours mirror the aroma perfectly, quite plain, pretty dry, slightly metallic bitterness.
Carbonation could be higher.
330ml bottle. Pours a clear, golden color with a small white head. Aroma is sweet malts, not much else. Flavor is sweet malts, grassy notes, crisp, clean, highly drinkable pilsener.

A: The pour is a clear straw color with a finger of white head.

S: Sort of an aggressive nose for a pilsner.  Grassy hops are very prominent, and there’s a surprisingly spicy and peppery aroma to the beer.  Pale malts with a touch of bread and some lager yeast.

T: The flavor is very much the same as the aroma.  Grassy and spicy hop flavors with a pepper finish and quite a bit of yeast.  Pale and cracker type malts with a touch of bread and a dry, bitter finish.

M: Medium in body with a lively carbonation.

O: Could easily be that this wasn’t terribly fresh, but I wasn’t a big fan.  The spiciness of it was kind of harsh and became overwhelming at times.

Reviewed from notes. 

Pours a mild straw color with plenty of visible carbonation and a nice-forming white head without too much retention. The nose brings some Noble hops as well as a bit of grain. The taste is slightly earthy and floral, with a good deal of grass and grain. Feel is slightly bitter and somewhat dry, with fairly large amounts of carbonation. Drinks okay and is certainly preferable to Heineken and the like, although I think I prefer Pilsner Urquell.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-21-2010
Pretty average "Pilsener Style" beer. Quite easy on the hops compared to regional beers and short aftertaste. Easy drinking, but nothing bad.

smells ok... little like pool water?  looks pretty.  taste is pretty dry.  bitter finish.  not much in the way of sweetness, but i like that.  lively mouthfeel.  incredibly easy to drink.  the bitterness is almost to the point of metalic, but not quite.  i like this better than the henninger.  very similar to bitburger.  not sure i’d buy it again, but i’m not mad at it.
Tap. Classic. Lots of grass and earth, good body. Light piss colour. As good as you will get for a more mass produced pils.
Clear pale golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, light malty and hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. A decent pilsener. 071110

Can 330ml at 1337 Beer #5 Pours clear pale golden with off-white head. Aroma is of malt, grain and hay. Taste is light sweet, very light bitter. Light body, thin, soft to average carbonation. 26022011

500 ml can from LCBO.  Pours a clear bright yellow with modest-sized, white head that quickly recedes to thin cap.  Simple grainy malt and metallic aroma.  Taste ditto.  Rather limp body and mouthfeel is on the thin side.  Not terrible but quite forgettable.

Can 330ml @ 1337 Beer #5

[Courtesy of igniztion] Pours clear pale golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain and hay. Taste is light sweet. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
Pours clear yellow, white head.  Aroma has notes of hay, grass, bread.  Taste is pretty simple, could see myself drinking a lot of this, very nice hay, grass and a touch of bready biscuit.
This is a pilsener, there are many like it, but this one I drank. Like so many others... nothing special about it.
Can. Very pale and clear with a nice white head. Smells of fruits and malts. Taste is very fruity and dry. Some bitterness in finish. I really don’t like the extreme pale look

Roasty but soft taste, very nice aroma. Palate: quite hard and light. Little bit bitter taste, but it’s mostly only dryness. Maybe too hard/dry, but the aroma is "creamy roasty". Not very nice aftertaste. Too bad.

[4,7%, 0.5 l can, S-Market, Lahti, Finland]

Flaske 33 cl Gylden hælde med et stort formfast hvidt af middel til lang holdbarhed. Aroma og smag af lys malt og humle. En smule tørhed i gane og velafbalanceret bitter finish. - Tysk pilsner når det er bedst
Has enough of the good German Pils/Helles flavor to it to make the shortcomings not as bad (rather cheaply made).

Tasted on 2/8/11 from a 330mL bottle purchased at Cost Plus in the Beers of the World box. Pours clear light golden with an average white head that slowly recedes to thin but even lace. The nose is sweet corn and some caramel malt, and just a bit of light bitterness. The flavor is pretty much the same, starting with corny sweetness, no real mid-palate, and finishing with light bitterness. The body is light with average carbonation and a short bitter finish.

This one is a macro lager but it is tasty and subtle. It is refreshing with a subtle bit of hops and a clean malt bill. No diacetyl, just a n easy drinker here. Only 15 or so bucks for a case, you can’t go wrong.
Light, nutty.  Pretty solid for style.  Still poor beer, better than macro-piss but not worth shipping around the globe.  Little to say about it, it is hard to pick good things about a bad style.
Ett i mängden av helt okey öl från Tyskland. Inget speciellt alls, inte dåligt heller för den delen. Hade jag inte gjort anteckningar om smak o d hade jag inte kommit ihåg något om denna öl.

Bottle @ Old Chicago. Clear light straw yellow appearance with a small white head. Big lager nose that’s a grainy pale malty smell. Medium bodied with some bittering hops but mostly just a solid pale malty flavor. Maltyand slightly bitter aftertaste.  Mild Pils flavor which isn’t surpising given it’s German.

Pours light pale almost transparent body with decent white head. Quite strong macro brew nose with metallic and malty notes. Boring and thin with lots of carbonation.  A dusty mouth feeling and a medium hoppy ending. Did not like this at all. First one from me going in the drain..

500ml can. pale yellow, quickly disappearing head. Aroma is grain, metallic, hops. Taste is light, refreshing, but uninteresting. Refreshing beer that is going well with my chicken curry, but nothing fantastic.
Pours clear, golden with a nice white head. Aroma of bread, grassy hops and cereal. Brief taste of sweet apples, malt, hops with slight bitter finish. Light body, crisp, somewhat watery. A good pils.
Can. Pours pale straw coloured with good sized white rocky head. Very weak malty aroma. Taste is moderate sweet nutty malts, with an even more moderate hoppy end. Watery thin mouthfeel.
Regular german pilsener. Yeasty aroma and aroma too. Not bad, nothing to remember.

Beer pour nicely.Color crystal clear light wheat color.  Thick White Head.Smell good if you like yeast. Beer Taste Good, you can taste the yeast but you would have no problem drinking 6 or 7 of these. Did not leave much of an after taste. Would Get again, good to sit down in watch football with.
Sarà ma io sono rimasto molto deluso da questa classica pilsener tedesca, a parte rinfrescarsi d’estate...

330 ml bottle, poured into pils flute.  One of the most pale beers I’ve ever drunk.  Quite a large foamy head that stays for a while.  It’s clear.  Has a hoppy typical pils smell.  Taste is bitter sweet with a hoppy after taste.  Not the most smooth but you can drink quite a few of these.  Overall a typical pils with no suprises.
Nice crisp and clear. Tastes a hell of alot better than buttwiper. I think I better drink six or eight of these to better judge this lager.
Clear golden pour from bottle with virtually no head.  For that matter, virtually no taste.  A bit of lemon, a bit of grain and a lot of water.  Disappointing.

Nagyjából 4 éve kóstoltam utoljára, jobbra emlékeztem. Halvány, sápadt arany szín, és hamar leülepedő fehér hab. Illata édeskés, malátás, de még sajnos megvan benne az a kartonszag, ami a gyári lagerek kötelező tartozéka. Íze malátásan édes, kevés karamell és méz, de elég szegényes, lecsengése keserédes, tolakodóan szénsavas. Gyenge eresztés...
Bottle. A very light straw colour with a small white head. The aroma is grassy with hints of spice. The taste is pretty mellow with a crisp dry finish.
Aroma and appearance not so great.. Very pale. Nutty taste, not too bad. No head at all. Decent but not amazing in any way.
Had a pint on tap from Heroes in Fullerton. Light yellow color with a mild aroma. Very drinkable with a little sweetness. Doesn’t have the big bold flavor that I’m used to but nice pilsner taste.
outstanding brew.  There is not much of a head but that was not a problem. Absolutely no bitter aftertaste.   All in all - two thumbs up
Nothing too special, pretty easy to drink. Nice flavour, prob would drink again. Just not too much to this beer.

The last time I had this, it was via minikeg that I had to haul half a damn mile through a not so great Philly neighborhood back to my crappy hotel from the package store after US Airways stranded me in Philly and my luggage in Vermont. Suffice to say, this hit the spot big time. Anyway, this 11.2 ounce bottle comes from the Barracks Road Teeter in Charlottesville. best by 29 Jul 11. Pours a clear pale yellow color with a  medium sized fizzy head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of grainy malts with a grassy finish. The taste is grassy, spicy hops, grain and a sweet malty finish. Medium bodied. Not bad.
0,5l can. Golden colour. Strong aroma of grains with a hint of sweet malts. Grainy, grassy flavour with a little bit of alcohol and metal.
A pretty average German Pils. Nothing to write home about, but it is a decent beer. Good to sit around and enjoy, but I wouldn’t go out of my way for it.

0.5l Bottle.  Pours a pale yellow with zero head even after vigorous pour.  Arom is almost non-existent but slightly wheaty.  Taste is also leaves much to be desired: mostly commercial tasting sweet malt extract with a slight hop flavor and no carbonation.

Experienced from a 12oz bottle in a pint glass.  The beer pours an absolutely clear straw-colored yellow, with a faint short-lived white head.  The nose shows a pilsner malt grain character, but lacks the earthy continental hop tones found in great examples.  The palate shows a smooth, if one-dimensional pilsner malt sweetness, and is carbonated nicely.  However, the impression of the beer is underwhelming.  The finish is faintly malty and somewhat uric.  Overall, a disappointment.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle. 

Aroma: A hint of euro skunk, noble hops, grass, and a touch of grain.  A bit spicy too. 

Appearance: It pours a light gold color with a sizeable foamy white head.  Decent head retention and lacing. 

Taste: Typical european pilsner with a bit more spice to it.  A slightly sweet pale malt and a touch of fusels comes through as well. 

Palate: Light in body with average carbonation leading to a short, crisp finish. 

Overall: Certainly nothing oustanding, but a standard example.  Sessionable and simple.  It is what it is.
Typical Euro Pils of a pale straw colour, thin white head, cereal and hay malts and light hops, thin and short finish. Meh.

Very clear white gold color with a super white head that wasn’t too thick and didn’t stick around too long.  Few bubbles coming up from the bottom.  Minimal lacing.  Very clean grassy or grain aroma.  A minimal floral hop note that seems well balanced with the other aromas.  In the taste I’m experiencing some hop bite, a "wheaty", "grassy" malt and hints of corn.  I have trouble detecting all of the flavors of German brews.  I haven’t experienced enough of them to pick out all the subtleties.  Forgive my ignorance.  Medium to thin mouthfeel.  Rather refreshing and smooth.  Crisp and somewhat dry.  Flavor hangs on the palate for a split second.  This is an easily drinkable brew.  Would be nice for Spring and early Summer in my opinion.  I just need more exposure to German beers to truly appreciate them.  Other than that, I enjoyed it.

Pours straw color. Very light head, which goes away rapidly. Very little to the appearance, just your standard pilsener. Aroma is of grain and some herbal smell. Taste is bland with very little in it. Lots of grain, and not much in terms of flavor. Just a bit of hops in that flavor, but overall lots of grain. Not very impressed with this beer at all. For the style it is alright, but not that great of a beer overall.
Straw-gold pour. Very nice looking pilsener. Lemon and floral hops in the aroma, and a refreshingly hoppy but not too bold flavor. Nice, crisp, simple, and delicious.
Bottle: pours a golden yellow with medium white head with little lacing. German grain and hop aroma.  Average German pils taste.
An average pilsener,with a mediocre aroma.Nothing special,good malted and too carbonated I think for a pilsener.To be honest I thought it was a lager.Yet nothing bad.just awkward...
A classic German brew. I could probably learn to enjoy this. Get myself a nice big STEIN!

Appearance:  golden yellow, average head, average lacing.  Aroma:  sweet grains, light peppery hops and a little grass.  Taste:  sweet and crisp, light grains and slight hops.  Finish:  short, clean and crisp.  Notes:  Average pilsner.  A little more lagery sweet than some.
Regular lager, more taste that the common brands such as Heinkene and Carlsberg but still not good enough. The taste is more present, but it is not very pleasant, not bitter enough and tastes cheap.
On tap at Athena’s in Trier. Taste is breads, yeast, cereals. Aftertaste is average.

A-clear yellow, moderately carbonated with a nice sustainable head.

S-pils malt aroma with a sulfur smell

T-Dry, bitter and malty. crisp and light.

crisp, clean refreshing pils. Very enjoyable. Classic example of a German Pils. I would buy this again.
Yellow colour.Fine head.Taste and smell malt and hops some resin,corn and some sweetness.It is like an average common pilsner.But sth in this beer doesn t suit my taste.

golden. lightly bitter, cloudy, white foam, lively, 
entry level for a german pilsener.
Pours a pale straw yellow, nose is woody and earthy, taste is crisp, hint of fruit and sugar.

Location: I’ve had a few different bottle of this one over the years




Aroma: Fairly subtle nose of yeast, malts, flowers, caramel, and grass


Appearance: It pours a clear golden-yellow with a white head


Flavor: The taste is moderately sweet with a light, crisp hop finish


Palate: The body is fairly light with a bit of a dry finish to it


Overall Impression: 
This is an alright Pilsener.  It isn’t particularly exciting, in fact it is kind of bland, but it isn’t bad, and it is nicely drinkable.  An alright beer, but nothing particularly exciting.

Not as crisp as you might think for a German pils.  Friend once said it had a meat flavor, not sure I totally agree but it sometimes has a little different flavor, but I can’t say this is bad. Serving: Bottle and Tap

500ml can. Pours a very apple juice colour with cola bubbles that leave a little lace around the glass. Smells of wheat and apple juice and not much else. There’s something trying to make it up from underneath but doesn’t get there. Oh, fucking gross. Tastes like wet hay that’s been sitting around for a decade. Flat and thin on the palate. Just plain offensive. Ick.

Tap Some bar in Davos (the only bar I have ever been thrown out of. Thanks Mike). Straw yellow with billowy white head. Aroma not pleasant. Fairly harsh mouth feel, taste quite bitter with a lingering aftertaste.

Pours golden pale colour with a medium head white foam. Fresh aroma of grass and malt but very subtile. Medium sweet, some bitterness in the taste. Maybe it gets watery but it is very refreshing. Good.

Bottle: Pours a light golden color with a modest white head to it. The aroma is light graininess with a bit of sweetness. Taste is lightly sweet, malt and hops are muted but are certainly there as well. I don’t think its bad at all really. I also have yet to sample anything other than average/below average pilseners... however.

12oz. bottle poured into flute. Pours a light gold with white head and leaves thick lacing throughout. Very ugly pour. Skunky aroma with grass as well. Very bitter finish and aftertaste. Medium carbonation, but gulp this one down quickly because it becomes very watery very quickly. Loses its flavor after only a few minutes. Leaves a bitter and dry mouthfeel. Not a great beer. Below standard for a German pilsener, would prefer a Bitburger over this one anyday. 8/20
Bottle 33cl. A clear yellow beer with a poor head. What an ugly beer, very dry, very bitter, with paper aroma, metallic notes, there is nothing interesting out there.
Very light yellow, good head.  Brown bottle, but I seem to smell a slight bit of skunk.  Taste just doesn’t stand out from other pilseners.

Bottle, can and draft:
Clear yellow golden color.
Quick disappearing white head.
Typical pilsner smell, bit fresher smell.
Very refreshing and well balanced malt and hoppy pilsner.
Pretty bitter but very refreshing and tasteful pilsner.
Actually a decent beer for something so light, but nothing exciting. Decent taste and color while thin and closer to plain

On Tap- Warsteiner has a light golden color with a full head and nice carbonation. The aroma is grainy but pleasant. The taste has a bit of sweetness and is crisp The feel is creamy and refreshing. Warsteiner goes down easy and is a good session beer. Warsteiner is normally found in more upscale pubs and is priced to match.

4.8 ABV Faint little to no aroma, sampled in a Sam Adams glass, pure white head was gone instantly, beautiful clear golden yellow color, noticeable carbonation, easy drinking, with noticeable carbonation on the finish but there’s just not much to it to talk about.
Medium white head, gold clear body. Light bodied, aroma not much, vinegar, light hop, weak malt. Sweet and bitter. Too sweet for my liking. A real chore to finish this.
A decent and quaffable German pilsner/lager, available on sale at 13.00/12, another great choice at near American dreck-beer prices. Way more satisfying than, say PBR, for an everyday dinner beer.

Bottle. Pours a very pale yellow color with a big fizzy white head, that dissapears almost instantly. Aroma is of grains, slightly metallic, malts and a slight amount of fresh smelling grassy hops. Flavor is at first og grains, sweet malt, grassy hops, and has a clean jop bite. But after being out in the sun for about 5 min it is already slightly skunky in the taste. The body is light and crisp, and quite refreshing. Overall an ok refreshing Pilsener, that unfortunately turns skunky very quick!

Bottle. Aroma is straw, grass, and a bit too much fruit for the style. Clear gold with no head, active but sporadic carbonation. Again in the flavor there is too much fruit presence, finishing sweet with some pilsner malt character and little to no hop presence. Not a very good example of the style, and not exceptional otherwise.

Another pilsener... I’m not a fan of this style of beer, but have to try it from time to time. Bottle at home. Pours out lightly golden yellow, clear. Medium head that holds pretty good. Some cookies, some sourness, malts, tea taste. Bread/cookies and lightly sourness comes back at the taste, some spices inside also. It’s drinkable... And ofcourse I prefer other kinds of beer.
Served in the 500ml bottle and with a pint glass. Really enjoyed this beer. Beautiful clean taste to it and nice and great refreshment on a hot day.
Draft. Very pale yellow and bright. Nose is grainy corn. Taste is sharp, yeasty, tangy, and watery. Body is thin. Just above a domestic lager.
330ml bottle purchased at local Winn Dixie supermarket for $1.00ea in 12-pack. Good.

7th April. 1 Litre Steiner on tap at the Bavarian Beerhouse. Clear pale gold beer. Light crisp palate that turns soft. Clear sweet orange and citrus hops. Very light creamy malt. Decent and refreshing.

Big German noble hop nose, some sweet honey notes.  Brilliant gold, frothy medium head.  Mild sweet, spicy hop flavor, good balance.  Big carbonation, light to medium body, crisp finish.  Easy drinking decent beer, not super complex, but nice hop characteristics for style.
This is perhaps one of the most generic German light pilsner types I’ve ever encountered. Not much to say about this one, extremely bland and boring as it was.

bottle.  Pours light yellow gold with white bubbly head which lingers.  Smells of floral hops, corn, yeast, wheat.  Taste has classic hop bite character, medium bodied, slight water flavor, floral hops, clean finish.  This was better than I expected, not bad at all for a pilsner, nothing extraordinary though.

I wasn’t too impressed with this one. I could potentially have it if there’s nothing else around, but I’m just as likely to just go dry for the night. It’s frustrating because it does hold a resemblance with good pilsners, so you feel that every sip it falls just short. Better than most macros, however.

Color oro pallido, schiuma media e di breve persistenza,  aroma di malto e lievito.  Al palato è discreta, forse un pò troppo gassata, ma con buona bevibilità. Sà di malto, lievito, frumento, pane, pochissimo luppolo. Finale breve e poco intenso. Classica pils e niente più ma con buona bevibilità.
Pours a lite straw color, with thin white head. It is indeed a classic pilsner. Nothing too noteworthy here. Drinkable enough, with just a touch of hoppy bite. Move along.

lucent straw, no head, medium body, medium co2.



aroma: very pilsner, pilsner malt, noble hops.



taste:

T1= classic pilsner malt profile.

T2= metallic noble hop bitterness, with a hint of pineapple or something.

T3= dryish, some light malt sweetness.



more body and less carbonation than most pilsner, which i like.  But tastes cheaply made due to hop extracts and probable high-gravity brewing.

Smells of melanoidin and hops!  Pours dark yellow like the malt was boiled.  Tastes of melanoidin (honey/malt) and hops.  Just like a light lager should!  It is quite carbonated and somewhat watery, as per style.  What is quite incredible is with how many reviews you read on this site ,about this brew, and no one in the US seems to understand WHY you purchase this particular style.  The flavor of boiled malt (melanoidin) must be so alien to the general public that they do not appreciate PROPERLY prepared beer.
Pale golden beer with small white head. Aroma of grass, malts, bread. Taste bread, dough. Earthy aftertaste. Regular pilsner.
Clear pale yellow, creamy white head, foamy lacing.  Floral aroma common for this style.  Tastes of hay and grass.  Crisp with a medium finish.

Bottle. A clear pale yellow color body with a thick white head. Aroma is grainy and malty with some skunkyness. Taste shows the same qualities as the aroma plus a some notes of lemon, grassiness and pilsner saaz-type hops. Pretty sweet, moderately bitter hop finish. Medium body with fizzy carbonation. Good head retention. Good balance, crisp. very drinkable and a very good brew.
Decent all around pilsner pours a light golden straw. Nose and taste of corn, malts and floral grass. Rated 1/3/2000
Pours golden yellow, very clear with short white head.  Aroma of hay.  Smooth palate, med-light bodied, thin texture, medium sweetness a touch of grain, with a crisp finish dominated by bitterness.

I think I may be cursed.  I was looking forward to trying a German-style pils in a brown bottle because (if you’ve seen some of my other ratings) I know better than to drink anything out of green glass.  Also, it states clearly on the label that this beer is made with hops extract, which is supposed to get around the whole "skunk problem" that comes with using whole hops.  Having avoided both green glass AND whole hops, I thought with some satisfaction that I would finally taste an un-skunky Classic Bohemian Pilsener the way The Lord intended.  I was tricked again!  Although this was not the worst skunked beer I’ve ever tasted, I know I’ve had this style on at least a few occasions (a long time ago) and was impressed.  Not the case tonight.  Here goes:  Bottle pour.  Aroma:  mild polecat and noble hops.  Appearance:  Brilliant, clear light gold.  Almost glowing with a fizzy, tall head that dissipates rapidly.  Taste:  bread dough and grass with just the lightest touch of varmint urine.  Faint metallic taste also.  Mouthfeel:  fizzy and light, stinging on the way out.  Finish...well, you know the rest.  Can anyone steer me to an example of this style that doesn’t make me want to brush my teeth afterward?  Seriously, please contact me if you have any suggestions.  Thanks.
Light golden pour with fine white head. Scent is malt and bread. Taste is balanced sweet malt and biscuit. Nice.
bottle. Very pale almost watery colour with a thin white head. Slightly metallic aftertaste. Bog standard mass market beer
Pours a lacing, white head with a clear, straw-colored body.  Aromas and flavors of grain and grass.  Decent body with a clean finish.
bread, sweet,pale, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, oily feel, lively.
Pours pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is malt, grassy hop and DMS. Flavour is malt, medium bitter and some grassy hop.
Pours a nice golden yellow with a small white head that dissipates quickly. Crystal clear. Taste is of hay. Tingly on the tongue, but smooth taste.
Golden coloured with a fine white head that vanished 3 seconds after pouring. Hints of corn on the nose. Some soft bready malt. No real bitterness. Not bad, not good, just a bit meh.

Watery yellow color with thin white head. Some hoppyness in aroma (very cold one) with a hint of sweetness and malts. Dry bitter flavor with hints of herbs. Bitter in palate and also is the aftertaste which don’t last long.
Not horrible. Not great. Classic German Pilsener - kind of a sour flavor in the background. Nose is sour and malty. Flavor is dry and crisp, yet sour in the finish. Not horrible, like I said.
Bottle. Pours a clear, pale yellow beer with a white head. The aroma is DMS and malt. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is weak metallic and malt. Overall this beer is not a favorite.

Pours straw gold with white head.  Some lacing.  Aroma is pale lager malt and light hops.  Taste is more of hte same.  Good dry pilsener finish.  Light tailend bitterness.  Easy drink, but unexciting.

12oz bottle.  Pours transparent yellow with a thin head.  Has a nice herbal herbal hoppy aroma, with a bit sweetness and grain.  Taste is very dry and hoppy, with more herbal notes, coriander maybe?  Finish is smooth, with a bit of herbal bitterness.  Great session beer.

Bottle. Gold with a tall, thick head. Malt, cereal aroma with a bit of cardboard, grassy hops, and some fruit including citrus. Fruity flavor, medium rich malt, grassy hops. A bit of cardboard in the mouth too. Rather stiff and stale but ok.
Clear light yellow pour.  Little head.  Malty aroma with slight cerealness to it.  Sweet bready flavor with decent hop finish.  Decent pilsner.

Mild and flavorless, lingering bitter aftertaste on the roof of my mouth.  Drank from a bottle, but I can see it’s crystal clear.  Smells like unfermented wort.  Very light body, watery, and moderate carbonation.
Poured from a bottle.  Pretty good German Pilsener.  Enough bitter hops to make this one interesting.
Golden color, pretty clear. Somewhat of a bitter taste to it. Its pretty good, maybe I shouldn’t have had a few before, cause I can’t really define it too well. I’ll come back to this one too.

So.... this beer was a let down Golden colored brew, not much aroma to it. Drank from the bottle, so did not notice pour/head details. The taste was very generic, bitter hops and watery. Still much better than a Bud, Miller, or Coors.
This is a great beer for huge quantity drinking. It’s that type of beer you want for stein drinking. It a very German tasting beer.
Hoppy cereal aroma. Pale golden yellow. Hoppy flavour with bitter aftertaste. Harsh on palate.  Acceptable for this type of beer.

Very watery yellow/golden pour, medium soapy head, some lacing.
Watery aroma with some malts, grains and syrup.
Malty flavour, but quite bitter, plus something unplaceable, becomes stronger in the after taste.
Bottle. Clear straw yellow with small whispy head. Aroma of cereal and other light grains, lightly sweet and pleasant. Taste is sweeter grain with light bitter finish. Light bodied and refreshing.

500ml from Goody Goody.  Pours a clear pale body with a fluffy head that leaves quite a bit of lacing.  Aroma of corn, cardboard and skunk.  Flavors of medium biscuit sweetness and a bit of hops.  Medium mouthfeel with average carbonation.  Short, dry finish.  Drinkable once you get past the skunk in the aroma.

Pours a clear light yellow orange with about three fingers of stark white head.  Aroma is very grassy, hints of hay with some slight hop finish.  Smooth and crisp, with a little bit of sweet bitterness in the aftertaste.  Pretty good, nothing to write home about, but not a bad option for a warm summer afternoon

Can at home. Pours a clear pale golden color with a thin white head. Aroma is slightly grainy and malty but mostly watery. Quite decent slightly bitter grainy pilsener flavor. Slightly bitter short finish.

Warsteiner Brauereii--Premium Verum Pilsner--1997 Release--16.9 oz. Bottle--4.50% ABV.
	
Warsteiner Brauereii--Premium Verum Pilsner--1999 Release--16.9 oz. Bottle--4.50% ABV.  (3.75 / 5.0)  Pilsner--Very light clear straw color.  Nice light Saaz crisp aroma.  Body is a delicate with light crisp flavor and nice hop carryover.  Clean smooth finish with hint of hop spice.  Sampled 6/13/1999.

Warsteiner Brauereii--Premium Verum Pilsner--Longneck--2001 Release--16.9 oz. Bottle--4.50% ABV.  (4.0 / 5.0)  Pilsner--Clear light straw golden color.  Mild prominent Saaz hop front.  Continued spiciness pervades minimally sweet crisp clean body.  Bavarian Tang is light on tongue.  Mildly spicy crisp clean dry end.  Nice pils.  Sampled 5/1/2001.

Warsteiner Brauerei Haus Cramer--Original Brauerei Abfullung--Warsteiner Premium Verum--Eine Konigen Unter Den Bieren--2005 Release--12 oz. Bottle--5.00% ABV--20 IBU’s?  (4.0 / 5.0)  Pilsner--Foamy mild lace head.  Clear thin bright straw yellow color.  Rich Bavarian Saaz hop front.  Crisp butter cream mild sweet smooth caramel Pils body.  Crisp clean mild citrus balanced smooth hop end.  Bavarian.  Sampled 8/5/2005.

Warsteiner Brauerei Haus Cramer--Original Brauerei-Abfullung, D-59564 Warstein / Germany--Warsteiner Premium Verum--Eine Konigin Unter Den Bieren--2010 Release--22.3 oz. Bottle--4.80% ABV--30 IBU’s?  (3.9 / 5.0)  Pilsner--Lacy bright white head.  Fizzy clear thin bright light straw color.  Crisp aromatic delicate Noble Hallertau hop front.  Dry sweet delicate butter spice refreshing zesty Pils body.  Balanced crisp mild bitter hop spice end.  Nice Bavarian Pils.  Fresh with no stank.  Tangy, not lager smooth.  Sampled 1/23/2010.  $2.99 Each.

330ml bottle.  golden pour, white head.   Aroma of stale pale pils malts and skunk.  Flavor is a touch of straw hidden in a mouthful of buscuity malts and a touch of grassy hops.  Easy drinking, good.
Bottle thanks to thirdeye11.  Crisp gold with a frothy white head.  Nose is apples, corn and moist cardboard.  Decent on the palate, flavor is light hops, some corn and not much else.

( 12oz bottle) Pours clear yellow with nice frothy bubbles and actually good lacing. Nose of apple, corn, cereal grains. Taste of crisp lager hops, earth, some nice sweetness too. Finishes well carbonated, creamy, and nothing really offensive here. I also like the fact it has flavor all the way through.

12 oz bottle: poured tall sudsy white head with thin ring of lace.  Very clear and bright golden yellow color. Light biscuity malt with a hint of grassiness.  Clean and crisp taste with a moderate body and medium carbonation. Grassy malt flavor middle to end with a touch of sweetness up front but very dry in the back.  Sharp hop bitterness then fades to a herbal note in the finish.

330ml can

Simple malty aroma. Simple malty body, a touch of grain. hint of bitter hops in the taste, but they come through more in the finish. Very clean, but with some flavour. Relatively impressed - I was expecting this to be not good at all.

Who stole the mop water?  12 oz bottle to pint glass, I tried to give it a chance.  Pours golden and with strong pour delivers a two finger head.  That is it’s last saving grace.  It delivers a lemon smell, kinda like Pledge furniture polish.  Taste is non descript, other than acidic and sour, the finish is just plain bad, what I imagine what urine tastes like.  Marketing this as beer is damn near criminal.

A straw color beer with little head. The aroma smells terrible, utterly terrible & its beers like this that made me think beer was supposed to smell bad before I got into craft. And to think of it even some American macro is better than this. Bleh.

[bottle]
Typical German Pils aroma that is low on malt, with some hay, and a hint of noble hops. Clear straw under white foam. Typical German Pils flavour, low on malt, crips, quite bitter and with only detectable noble hops character. Light body, medium carbonation, slightly bitter finish.
Pale yellow, with a sweet malty aroma I can’t describe better than "beery." Fizzy head that dissipates quickly. A very pleasant pilsner.
Pale gold color.  Light aroma of malt and hay.  Slightly sweet taste with a bitter finish.  Very clean and light but with a pronounced malty flavor.  Very enjoyable.

Clear light gold, medium white head. Aroma of honey with a dry dustiness. Usually not a lager fan, but flavor-wise this hit on all cylinders for me, honey sweetness sparkling above a liquid bread malt body, balanced by hops bitterness and dust. Very lively palate, drinkable and refreshing.
Overall, a very decent beer that isn’t really that memorable. Goes down easy and has a crisp clean taste. Hint of hops, with a noticeable carbonation. Not something I’d buy again, but worth a try.
just another light lager, its up side is a cleaner finish though it is nothing special.
Golden beer with nice head. Mild aroma of malt and caramel and some hops on palate. Flavour is sweet with some bitterness in finish. Well balanced´.
On tap; very mild, stale/watery tasting pilsener. I have tried it now on tap and bottle and found it very average in both forms.

Bottle, 2005-10-23, Sweden
