AP: Golden body, with high steady head. AR:malts and hops, honey F: Fresh and sweet to start with then a bith dryness in the end!

From the 11.2 fl. oz. bottle marked 10 Jun 09-17:45. It pours a golden yellow with a half-inch fizzy head and slow upwardly mobile carbonation.  Not a lot of lacing. The aroma is well malted, lightly hopped, and bready. The mouthfeel is a average.  The taste has a nice, smooth maltiness to it with a weakly tart hoppy ending.  But the whole beer is darn smooth and fairly likeable.  I have always kind of liked this one so now I am finally rating it...and a bit better than others it appears.

Pours clear gold with a white head.  Nose is light malt, bread, crisp hops, and lager.  Flavor is exactly the same.  Clean, decent German lager, and very not bad for an InBev beer.  It has the makings of a decent occasional beer.  Light to barely medium body and a lingering lager/ bitter finish.
tap - The Rathskeller in Indianapolis.  Pretty simple pilsener beer - has a pretty decent bite and kinda skunky.  average beer

Pours a golden yellow with a medium head. It has a faint malty aroma, but otherwise the aroma is very lacking. It tastes of wet dog with a hint of fusel and sweetened malt, but otherwise is pretty rank.

500 ml can from LCBO, served almost cold in a Scotch Irish taster glass. 



App.:  Clear light golden with a nice white head.
  
Aroma:  Nice light biscuity malts and a touch of grassy, peppery hops, some light grains, a touch of grape-like fruitiness.
  
Palate:  Medium-ish body, moderate carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Fairly present white grape fruitiness, a touch of cardboard, a little wet hay and grass, a hint of hops; dry with very little bitterness. 



Drinkable.

330 ml. bottle. Pours a thin white head, over a clear pale yellow (SRM 2-3) body.....nose of biscuit, yeast, bit of hop spice.....taste is light malts to start, then medium hop bitterness....mouth feel is light carbonation medium to high. A little too light in all characteristics.

0.5L bottle, thanks mom and dad, medium stable frothy head, intense clear yellow colour, aroma of herbs vanila and a slight touch of malt. strong herbal hoppiness with a light biscuity sweetness, medium bodied. Long bitter aftertaste making it a good beer with food. Nothig fancy but quite solid and satisfying.

Bottle. Poured a pale yellow color with decent head retention. Tasted like the usual German pilsener, so in other words, nothing fancy. Uninteresting palate. Overall this is a below average beer that I won’t pay for again.

330ml bottle. A clear light golden beer with a small white head. Nose of grainy sweet malts and faint citrus. Flavours are similar with little hop presence to speak of. Light to medium bodied with a slick mouthfeel and lowish carbonation. An unremarkable pilsner.

Draft.  Pours a nice golden with a thicker white head.  Aroma is sweet malts with a bit of hops.  On the palate, it is light and refreshing.  The flavor is sweetier than I expected.  It finishes a little dry.  Very easy drinking, but not a favorite.

On-tap at the new Twisted Kilt. Fresh beer, brand new lines Pours light yellow, with carbonation bubbles and a modest white film that can be called its head. Sweatsock aroma. Very aggressive carbonation on this. Mild malty taste, maybe a tad of hops there. Some drinkabilty.
This was a good beer, but not an outstanding one. Highly drinkable and enjoyable, but not very memorable.
Poured a pale golden color with a white head. Aroma was very sweet, with malts and some hops. The flavor matched the aroma. Decent beer.

Very drinkable german beer. Light - med mouthfeel grassy flavor. Crisp flavor that’s slightly bitter and finishes well. Slightly malty and has a slightly skunky flavor. Feels alittle oily afterwords. Strangely it has almost no aroma. Like.. coors light has more aroma than this!
an ok/decent pils. more on the sweet than the bitter side. far better than the lagers made over here but not too exciting.

330 ml bottle. Pale yellow color with diminishing white head. Hay with grassy hops in the aroma. Nutty, malty flavor with
a touch of honey sweetness. Not so bad mass-pils, but i prefer the saaz hoppy czech pilsners.

11.2 oz. bottle picked up for $5 a 12-pack - Pours a clear light golden color with a 3/4 finger thick white head. Very light lacing.  Aroma is grain and herbal hops.  Flavor is the same.  Medium body.  No unpleasant aromas or off flavors.  A nice easy drinking Pils.  For $5 a 12-pack, I’ll be buying the shit out of this beer.
Bottle from the Sherlock’s in Lincoln Square.  Pale yellow pour, no aroma, taste is a little watery.

500ml can poured into a pint glass. Poured a clear yellow with a 1.5" head. Very little lacing. Aroma of grass, malts & hops. Tastes of sweet malts up front with a good bitter hop finish. Mouthfeel is pretty average for a Lager. This is one of my go to beers but there certainly are better Pilsners available.

500. Pours a crystal clear pale gold with a loose white foamy head. Skunky nose that also shows some peppery bitter hop with earthy undertones. Kind of a compromise there. Creamy medium body, could be a little crisper, probably. Toasty, nutty, some dry leaves on the mid-palate. Long finish of dark toast.
Gold-yellow color. Medium white head. Almost no aroma at all. Flavor of malts and hop with hints of fruits. Medium bitter finish. Easy drinkable.

From 500 ml can. Not much aroma. Appearance is very pale yellow. Well carbonated. Flavor is very light, slightly bitter. Little aftertaste. A drinker who prefers pilsener would rate this much higher, I suppose. Good to drink if you’re thirsty and nothing better is available.
Can. Yellow body with a medium white head. Light malty, light grainy aroma with some fruit and hops. Malty bit grainy flavour with some hops and fruit. Ends up fruity and light metallic.

11.2 oz bottle.  Pours a pale yellow color with a quickly dissipating medium white head.  It has a skunky and hoppy aroma.  It has a dry, roasted,cereal taste a bread taste and tastes slightly skunky. This is a pretty good very easy to drink beer but really nothing special.

Clear straw-gold lager with retreating effervescence. Smell is pleasing grassy hops, light grained malt. Tastes of sweet corn, light piney/spicy hops with a crisp mild bitter finish. Pleasing overall when served cold.
A very typical German lager. Fresh but with some sort of flavor, making it better than your average American lager. Nothing really wrong with this one but nothing special.
1 litre brouwn bottle in Buenos Aires. Pours a clear gold color with moderate bubbles and fading white  head. Light body, Dry grainy flavor. Slight sweetness. Slight hop bitterness. Drinkable.

Light clear golden colour with a decent white head leaving a small amount of lazings on the glass. Aroma is slightly chemical hoppy, light malty sweet with notes of bread and minerals. Flavours starts very sweet, a bit alcoholic and weak and ends somewhat dry with a chemical bitterness. Body is thin with fine carbonation.
Bottle. Pours gold with thin white head. Aroma is slight thin hops, taste is thin hops. Well distributed and marketed if nothing else.

Draft at the rusty nail in atlanta.  Clear light gold pour with miniscule ring of white head.  Nose of clean corn and a faint skunk that is massively pronounced in the flavor.  Lighly sweet and corny aftertaste.  How can a keg be so skunky???
12 oz bottle courtesy of Vadim.  Pours a clear yellow liquid gold with a medium white head.  Aroma of corn and grains,  Taste of corn malt, grains and yeast.
Only vaguely remember tying this... not bad, but not great - typical of the Wartsteiner releases.

Tall Can. Clear yellow pour, with a moderate white foam, very carbonated. Aroma is skunky hops. Taste is quite smooth, hops and barley malt, and the finish is very surprising, esp. for a canned beer. Quite impressed.

Clear yellow, a small loosely packed head fades to a sliver of foam, forced to the sides by an unnatural amount of carbonation screaming to the surface in apparent desperation. Desperation from what is yet to be determined. No lace appears after a couple vigorous swirls. Instead, I am met by lemon crème, wonderbread, and soft grains blanched from the sun, resembling the softness of mulled oats. A decent start. And the beer itself? A softer mouthfeel than I was expecting, though it still suffers from thinness and over-carbonation. I’m drinking a beer, not a soda pop, and yet quite a few breweries mistakenly believe that more carbonation is a positive contribution to beer. Initially dry and grassy, waxy bitter lemon skin starts to taint the top of my tongue. There is little finish to speak of, though some dinner rolls and white bread gives a bit of meat to her thin, carbonated body. Is that some stale bread long-forgotten sitting forlorn in the back? A few more quaffs, and I am more than done.




Not nearly as bad as I feared, but she was definitely not as good as I remembered her tasting. Has the recipe changed any in the years since I first tried the Warsteiner Premium Verum? Possibly, but not necessarily. What has changed though is my knowledge and understanding of real beer which in turn has broadened my appreciative palate as to what real beer tastes like. Skip the Warsteiner and grab a real German lager, instead.

Taste is reminiscent of a backyard party at someone else’s house where you weren’t smart enough to bring your own beer and had to drink what they had in a keg on the back porch. But then I think that of pilseners in general, so don’t take my word for it.

A: Poured an extremely clear, bright golden yellow color, with a large, foamy white head that dissipated quite quickly to a thin film.

S: Smells very lightly of herbal notes, and maybe a little corn in there as well?

T: Very crisp and very clean; finishes slightly bitter. Seems again like there’s some cooked corn or something in there.

M: Light-bodied and thin-textured, with average carbonation.

Overall, a very drinkable pilsner... not exactly overflowing with flavor, but one of those beers that is just right for quaffing a few out on a hot deck (which is exactly how I experienced it).

Clear very light yellow with a white fluffy head. Poured in a pilsner glass. Surprised by lacing compared to other pilsners. Not as sour as other pilsners, nor as skunky as say a Heineken. A hint of sweetness. Bitter aftertaste doesn’t last. More refreshing than other pilsners I’ve tried. To be fair, I’ve about given up on pilsners and would instead opt for a Summer Ale as refreshment.
50 cl draft. Clear light yellow body with big fluffy white head. Flavour is malt with a little hop.

Clear golden yellow with a bright white fluffy head and decent lacing. Smells reminded me of a field of wheat or stacks of hay. Slight hops bitterness included in the taste. Crisp, refreshing, but not spectacular.
Can. Small bubbles (light carbonized). I think it’s slightly more hoppier than other pilsners i know. Refreshing.

~Pours a light clear gold with big fluffy white head that leaves lacing.
~Sour hay scent, malts and light hop spiciness.
~Light malts and spicy hops in flavor.
~Medium to light feel, frothy, enjoyable spicy hop finish.
~Nice lager. I enjoy the hops.
unoriginal yellow pour with a white head. overall i thought this beer was relatively disgusting and very dissapointing. It almost tasted as bad as landshark.

Reminds me of the beers I tried to drink when I was new to beer. Smells only of light malt and hops (extract!?!), no surprises here. Looks like what’s on tap at any N.A. pub - pale lager that isn’t worht whatever the bar is charging. The taste is ’crisp’ and ’clear’, which is to say that The malt and hops balance well but are’nt too strong. Or flavourful. Better than local lagers, still not much of a beer.

Nothing to see/taste here

Finish is too dry; almost tasted soapy to me.

very pale; nice head; good aroma
Pour froman 11.2 oz bottle. Pale yellow beer with puffy white head that lasts. Flavor is light malt, respectable sour / bitter hops in the finish. Dry. Very good but not a good as some others.

Served at my church’s annual Germanfest. Tapped to plastic cups a straw hue with a creamy, lasting white head. Almost appeared nitro dispensed. The aroma was slightly floral, with a hint of noble hops. The flavor was light and thin with some slight malt sweetness and finished somewhat dry. It did go well with the homemade food offerings.

This pours a very clear, light gold colour along with a foamy white head; nice lacing, too.  Aroma was gently floral and the taste was obviously hopped.  Not a bad beer, clean and refreshing to drink.
Can at the airport.  Yellowish color, white head.  Grassy hop and malt/grain on the aroma and flavor.  Drinkable but very unexciting.

Very nice drinking beer.   Pours yellow, little white head.  Floral aroma (slight hops).  It goes down easy and you will drink a bunch.  Worth a try... not perfect but pretty good if you want something light.
yellow pour, fizzy white head, floral and a bit bitter in the aroma.  Taste mainly some toasted malt with a bit of  hop bitterness.  Really not as terrible as some say.
Aranysárga pilseni kemény habbal,komlós illattal.Íze kellemesen száraz,kissé "szalmás",könnyen iható.Utóíze kesernyés,hosszan tart.Egy sör a mindennapokra egy kiadós vacsora után.

Pint from Arlin’s in Cincinnati.  Picked it because it was the only draft they had that I hadn’t tried.  Agree with the rest- typical cheap German pilsner with nasty bitter flavor and heavy carbonation, both of which overwhelm the rest.
Another in a line of unimpressive want to be Budweisers I have had tonight.  Thank you very much.
Had a bit of funk--typical german pilsner.  Thats all I remember--that crazy german flavor man.
33cl bottle poured into a footed pilsner.  Sparkling golden with minimal white head.  Aroma is floral hops.  Flavor is bitter hops.  Heavy carbonation.  Medium bitter and metallic finish.
Pretty boring pilsner although a bit more refreshing when drank ice cold. Mild hop bite at the end that comes back moments after swallowed. Not a horrible beer.
Can 50 cl. Apperance; Yellow, clear with a small white head. The aroma and flavor is mostly sweet malt with a sence of hops. Light bitter ending... ok
Bottle.  Pours pale gold with big white head that reduces to a thin but persistent layer.  Tastes of corn, mild grassy hops, and grains.  Light and refreshing, but nothing special.
One of the cheapest beers I’ve had in weeks.  typical german pilsner.  nothing too exciting.

"Very pale gold body complete with a one inch rocky cap, descent enough looking brew. German style smelling hops and no skunk in the aroma, the malts are slightly bitter. The aroma is slightly milder than most other German lagers. Taste is bitter it almost has a coffee like flavor but not really, German hops and malts are fairly smooth and blend well together. I’m hitting some earthy notes in the flavor but there very weak, beer finishes with a bready sweetness that is acceptable. Beer is tasty and easy drinking very acceptable brew. "

Poured carefully into the tiny 200ml Warsteiner I finally got to use - what good is a 200ml glass?? Clear weak yellow gold with light effervecence, it still created a monster white rocky cap that suffered a quick death. Sweet dry grass, notable malts and fresh mild yeast makes up the aroma. A good ammount of flavour awaits: upfront malts and an early bitterness that reappears in the aftertaste. The malts, hops and yeast are blended together well as are the sharp grass and bitterness. The yeast became larger as it warmed. One of my favorite Euro Pils to slam back.
grassy aroma, a little corny.  slight chill haze.  Sweet grain with small bitterness.

Bottle 30cl.
This is together with Alfa pilsener my beer for any time.
Tastes great and definetly one of my favourite pilseners.
Pours a beautiful golden colour with a good size head and nice carbonation.
Smell is very hoppy and the taste is hoppy and nicely bittered.
Only dissappointing thing is that the aftertaste. which isn’t too pleasant, sticks around for too long.
A light yellow color. The aroma had hintsof hops. could have been a bit more. A bitter malty taste. Finishes of with hints of salt.
This is just another run of the mill light beer. For being a mainstream beer it’s not bad but eh this doesn’t quite do it for me.
Not a good impression at the start. Pale yellow colour and not good aroma. But the taste  is a lot better than that. This one gives this beer an advantage to other german pilseners.
Pours golden yellow with a thin white head. Slight hop aroma. Somewhat bitter taste that was more appealing than the average macro. I was not very impressed, but it was better than the alternative.

Nose is of grainy malt and a bready yeast. Mild hops in there, quite basic aromas. 
Quite effervescent. Looks great in it’s own glass, pale golden with a head that resembles a dollop of whipped cream. 
Smells much better than other mainstream pilsners.
Quite bitter flavours with grainy malt. Not much else, some lemon-like hops. An okay example.
Starts off with a lemony character which fades to a grainy taste and texture.  Good lacing.  Drinkable, and better than the mass produced lagers, but not great.
Straw color with white foam. Apple cider note to aroma. Easy-drinking lager flavor leads to saline, tinny finish.

500ml bottle. Pale gold colour. Rapidly vanishing white head. An easy drinking dryish pilsner with a little hop character. Better than many macro brands but nothing to get too excited about. Washed down a Chinese takeaway OK.

330ml bottle. Poured a golden amber with a medium white head of densly compacted foam. The head disappeared quickly with good lacing left on the glass. Aroma of hops with citrusy undertones. Crisp taste with a mild bitterness and silky mouthfeel
very light in color, holds a decent head. decent aroma, but a surprisingly well balanced flavor overall.
Bottle. Poured gold with a decently sized head. Tasted like plain bread and dust. Very watery and fizzy.
Terrific beer.  This is better than any of the domestics or the broadly distributed imports (Heineken, Grolsh).  This is the beer I keep stocked and serve to company.
Bottle - Poured a light golden colour.  Malt aroma, mild inoffensive malt flavour.  Slightly dry finish.

I buy cases of this quite frequently.  Decent beer.  Not overly flavorful or aromatic.  Pours with a very little head, and neither bitter nor sweet at all.  Pretty standard all around.  I prefer it to Heineken or Grolsch, so tend to buy it here more often.
Had this one right after the dunkel. Pours to a light tan head of medium size. Goes down smooth enough, but leaves a slight aftertaste. The Aroma is that of wheat or barely.

Bottle.  Pours a fairly transparent gold with little head and aromas of skunky hops and wheat.  Flavor isn’t very good in this bottle.  Skunky hops with a bit of cloves or something and some white sugar.
Odors of grain and cigarette ash. Pours a light yellow with a thin little head. Taste is similar to aroma leaning heavily towards ash. Not so good.
Not much I can think of to say about this, everyone seems to have hit the nail on the head so far. Just a barely passable, very Bud Light flavored beer.

Pours a very light yellow, only a very thin head which leaves a slight lace on the glass, some malt in the mouth, not too gassy which was a surprise and a slightly bready finish...still head and shoulders better than most UK brewed ’continental’ lagers
On tap pours golden color with off white head.  Has a grassy and grainy aroma.  Medium light mouthfeel.  Flavor is bread, grass, and some sweet malt.  Overall a descent brew.

On tap. Smells of grass and grain. Gold in color with a small white head. The taste is malty and sweet with a bitter finish. Clean crisp mouth feel that finishes slightly dry. This a good easy drinking beer.

12 oz bottle.  Poured a clear gold color with a two finger white head that lasted forever it seemed.  The aroma was bread, grass and malt.  The flavor was bread, grassy hops and a bit of butter.  This was a very good beer.

Bottle.  Pours pale gold with a very creamy dense head that lasts a few minutes.  Smells of malted grain and bread crust.  Tastes of buttery wheat bread and barley.  Some nice grassy hops in the finish.  Creamy smooth body.  Aftertaste is slightly buttery and smooth.  Very good stuff.

12 oz. bottle pours a melted-buttery yellow with fine white head that disappears almost immediately. Wheaty nose with hint of citrus. Thin body, highly carbonated. A Bud-Lite-ish front palate (what the hell IS that taste?), with a citrusy middle and light hoppy finish. Bland but good enough for what it is. Not too bad for a spring day watching the daffodils bloom.

Light pour. Has a bit of a stronger taste than typical light beers, but enough to be memorable. 3.0

RE-RATE 4/27/11 Tap at FW Saucer drank from a freaken BOOT! 

The beer pours a very clear, light yellow color with a foamy white head. And it’s in a boot.



Aroma is lots of pilsener grains and dry malts. Has the almost metallic touch that most Bavarian pilseners have to them. I believe the water there is harder than what I am accustomed to drinking and is rich in minerals which may explain my sedimentary sense. It also comes in a boot.



Holy crap. So I’ve been drinking this for awhile now while I’ve been blogging on my phone, and I just now reached the part where the toe will contain an air bubble. I KID YOU NOT, the moment the air bubble reached it, the beer bubbled like crazy and beer started shooting out the top of it! If I wouldn’t have realized it, I would have ended up with a face full of beer! Beerfest was absolutely right about that! I’m shocked. Ok now to employ the rotating method they discuss in the film.



The taste is lots of grain and light malts. Very bready as it warms. Some metallic tastes as well with a lightly bitter finish. Annnnnnnd it’s in a boot.
Bottle from well meaning relatives. Bog standard  German pils which tasted  pleasent enough washing down a take away curry.
Bottle, straw yellow pour. Some head to it but not a lot. Very crisp and clean. Weak in aroma and flavor, but it is drinkable.

500 mL Can. Pours a clear bright yellow with a small white head quickly subsiding to a foamy film but leaving good lace on the sides. The aroma is sweet malt, hay, grains, a light grassyness about it, and a faint hint of honey and floral and an innuendo of lemon rind. The flavor is sweet malt with a bitter finish that is well balanced with the malt. The hops come through in the aftertaste but not too overpowering. Smooth carbonation and a somewhat lingering hop aftertaste that I think fits the style. This is one German Pils I really like. A good beer for the money. Prosit!
Bottle... I had a decent review put together in my mind, but instead, I’ll simplify: German pilsener.
Yellow with a medium head. Malty aroma with a touch of caramel, a little hops and weak DMS. Malty flavour with a sweet touch. Well hopped.
Straw body and think white head. Nose of corn and straw, with light floral hop. Taste was very grassy and bitter. Slight metallic aftertaste. Ill be skipping it next time.

330ml bottle, six pack from LCBO. Pour golden with thick head.  Typically nice bready/citrus aroma.  Sweet taste with a nice balancing bitterness in the end.  An above average brew better than most Euro lagers available at the LCBO.

Bottle.  Pours a clear light gold with a three finger dense white head.  The nose is sweet malt and light hops.  Taste is pretty much the same.  Medium mouth feel.  Not earth shattering, but a refreshing sessionable brew.
Had this draft lager, light and refreshiing, not bad, good beer, nothing special though.

smells slightly corny and a bit like straw. colour is a clear gold with a moderate head that lasts. bitter and with a bit of hops, followed by a tiny little medicinal style bitter. keeping in mind the rating compared to the wide availability and price of this beer, this is most likely one of the beers i have consumed the largest quantity of in my life. good on a meal or on its own, a great standby.

Out of the bottle, no chance for a glass at the tiny deli on Isola Pescatori in Lake Maggiore, Italy.  Resembles a "nice" version of Keystone Light.  Not very bitter, low carbonation.  Not great but fine to wash down with a proscuitto and cheese panino.
500 ml bottle. Golden color, frothy white head. Slight malty aroma. Smooth malty flavor, very clean. Medium body, medium-high carbonation. Straightforward pils, but somewhat lacking in personality.
From 500ml can. Pale yellow color, foamy white head. Good carbonation. Bitter and hoppy. Fresh and smooth.

Pours light golden, with minimal white head that subsides.  Sparkling co2.  Tastes of hay, grass, honey, plastic, with a moderate skunk.  Light and fluffy with good noble hops bitterness in the finish.

Pours really light yellow with a 2 finger foamy white head. Aroma is grassy hops, straw, sweet white bread, month old hay with a fresh rain, and maybe a hint of citrus. Flavor is slightly grassy, grainy, sweet straw, and bread. A little spicy hops as well. Finish is strangely woody in an off putting way. Strange and not really good, maybe a good session to accompany rich spicy foods...come to think of it this would go great with a rich cheese covered chili, other than that....
Spicy hops, slight skunk. Subtle bready sweet maltiness balances well. Not a bad pils, but not topnotch.
Ingen kommentar för tillfället. Ingen kommentar för tillfället. Ingen kommentar för tillfället.
Smells like chlorine. Tastes like crappy beer. Maybe a bit of crisp hoppiness. Otherwise, horrible. I didnt even finish my pint.
Not that bad, goes down nicely with food. a sweet bready taste, few hops in there also, but downable.

Sparkling golden, small but lasting pale head. Mild hayish aroma, little paper, overall very neutral. Dry, mineral and hayish flavor, little cardboard. Light to medium bodied, strong foaming carbonation. Slightly cleaner than your basic bulk, just very neutral and dull. Cant say I enjoyed it..
Mini-keg.  Light golden with white fluffy head.  Low malt flavor with just a hint of spicy hops at the finish.  Not the worst but far from best.
Aroma is moderate hoppy and light yeasty. Huge, frothy, white head. Good lacing. Mostly lasting longevity. Clear yellow body. Moderate bitter flavor. Medium palate.
Fluffy white head and golden yellow and some small lace.  Smells quite hoppy with citrus notes. Light body, smooth hop flavor with sour bread tones, and a dry finish.
Cerveja pilsener alemã, de sabor encorpado. Amargor no ínicio, mas com residual ligeiramente adocicado. Espuma clara e fina. Aroma suave.

Pours a pale golden colour, with a  firm white head. A grassy aroma, quite sweet and  malty with a hint of hops. Has a quite strong grassy hop flavour. The malt flavours overpower the hops, with some bitterness coming through near the end. Quite a musty flavour overall. An easy to drink session beer with some flavour to it, but nothing outstanding from the crowd.

Draft at my local watering hole with dinner.  i ended up having two and enjoying them entirely even though the ketchup exploded upon opening.  Medium minus body is slick, crisp and refreshing to the palate.  An ample peppering of hops at finish allows the tounge to prepare for the first bite of dinner. Enjoyable

On tap at a local german restaurant - maybe I’m missing something, but I thought this was quite good, and it went very well with my food - light, crisp, and clean - moderate body, with some light sweet malts up front - floral character builds and makes way for a nice spicy kick of noble hops, drying the beer out for a grassy finish - quite hoppy for a german lager, but I liked it.

essa Pale Lager alemã foi uma das primeiras cervejas importadas a que tive acesso. A combinação de bela garrafa, do copo adequado (seu belo e trabalhado flute), do balde para mante-la gelada e do ambiente de status em que a consumi criaram em mim uma imagem sólida de respeito. Com o tempo, novos exemplares do estilo foram sendo provados, e o que era unanimidade passou a ser considerado uma cerveja que dá conta do recado dentro do que se propõe, nada além disso.


Exemplo dessa regularidade é sua pouco apelativa aparência para o estilo, que engloba um visual inicial pequeno em uma espuma alva e reduzida longevidade. Há moderada formação de colarinho em seu corpo amarelo pálido, transparente e de densidade rala. O aroma cai no lugar comum: lúpulo moderado e pão claro. Em termos de sabor, é levemente ácida e amarga no início, com toques salgados; apresenta moderado amargor e mantém a presença de sal em seu final de média duração. Seu corpo é leve, com textura aguada, forte carbonatação e final metálico - o típico paladar do gênero. O forte amargor de lúpulo aliado a sensação salgada prejudica sua refrescância - média drinkability.
Not too bad, but not too great either, metallic tinge in the flavor. An average pilsener. A very over rated beer.
29.11.2008. 0,33l Bottle. The colour is yellow. The aroma is a little sweet with a mellow smooth taste, nice.

33cl bottle. It poured a pale yellow colour with a medium big white foamy head that settled down fast in the glass. The aroma smells of wheats. It has a dry flavour that tastes of malts and nuts. It has a short aftertaste.
Cask at  The Two Tubs, Bury.  Typical Pilsner colour - gold with medium head.  Slightly hoppy aroma.  Malty taste and a crisp finish.  Nothing to get too excited about but a decent beer nevertheless.
Draught, in pint glass. Quite bland and inoffensive, nothing to distinguish it from other pilseners. I’ve had it a few times in the past but i doubt i’ll be ordering it ever again.

I have to believe this is the one I tried.  Golden pour with light carbonation and a medium head.  Crisp aroma with wheat and straw like grain.  This tastes like a 5 to me.  Lots of strange mingling of flavors.  What seems to me to be a wheat like flavor coupled with earthy hops, and semi-sweet malty grain that gives this a “young”-just out of the fermentor taste.  Carbonated wet mouth feel with a semi-dry finish.  I’ll pass on this thanks.
50 cl bottle, clear and pale yellow colour, small white head, malt aroma with hops notes, grassy hops bitter flavor, dry and hoppy finish
Clear pale yellow brew, aroma is fresh lemons. Large white head. Dry and bitter nuttyness, heavyness and malt aftertaste
bottle. Clear golden yellow, hopy nose. Shy malty accent, but nothing behind - no malty background for the hops to lean on. This gives it a feeling of emptyness. Thin flavour. inoffensive. So boring.
This is possibly one of the best lagers I have tried, looks great and keeps it’s head which is rare these days
(Bottle).   Damp hay aroma.  Pale golden body, white head.  Flavor is semi-sweet hay, also some breadiness.   Tasty, but could use some additional bitterness.
Pours a mostly yellow body with a decent white head.  Aroma is definitely malt and not much else.  Aroma is sweet and hay-like.  Finishes nice and mostly dry.  Nicely carbonated
Bottle. Solid yellow in color, but poured a nice, white, puffy head. Medium bodied and crisp in tatse. Pretty good. I’d drink it again.
Clear gold with a quick dissolving head clean taste...soft spot for the brand after German trips
Clear golden colour with white head.Aroma is sweet malty and hoppy,flavor of hay and corn,sweet mild finish but light watery.
Tres bonne pilsener plutot légere.  Rien de surprenant, belle blonde classique.
Appetising bread aroma. Lingering white head, clear yellow. Crisp and refreshing. Hop spiciness and pilsener malt flavours. Slightly oily mouthfeel and lingering grassy flavour.

Pours a pale golden with a decent fluffy white head that, sadly, doesn’t last.  Aroma is sweet pale malt.  Taste is crisp and cleansweet malt and light hop bitterness.  A real thirstquencher, but not exceptional.  German Budweiser.
Light pilsner close to a Bitburger but not quite as bitter :(  Still a very refreshing beer that puts American light beers to shame.
This doesn’t do much for me. Slightly herby hop taste, but very little else. Watery, and overly carbonated. Meh.
From a bottle poured a clear golden color with a good amount of head.  Not mouch flavor and a quick finish.
bottle. pours a golden colour with a ok head. avarage pilsner aroma. taste is nice with a good aftertaste. nothing special but in overall a very good pilsner.
Bottle. Decent head on pouring, and attractive enough cloudy yellow appearance. Mild malt and hops on the nose, and quite clean and crisp on the palate.

Ok I admit it, i have a soft spot for War Starter on draught!  especially when served in the correct glass.  Drank at """"The Grape Vine"""" in Poulton Le Fylde.

This is a pale golden colour with persistent head and bubbles.  nose is floral with a hint of citrus.  flavour is reassuringly sharp with a nice hoppy presence and of course the trademark Corn flavour of this style of brew.  Cold and refreshing as a good lager should be.  In short, wonderful!
Pours gold into a shaker.  Head immediately dissipates to nothing. No aromas. Crisp and sour/sweet honey upfront with a quick hop finish.
Golden yellow color, aroma is wheaty grassy, tastes a little bit sweet and mildly bitter

Decent pilsener.  From my hotel in Orlando.  Appearance is unremarkable, straw yellow with white head.  The aroma is of malts, and erthy, grassy hops.  The flavor is malty sweet, some hops make themselves known, and the carbonation is lively.  The finish has a nice hop signature, and the beer finishes clean.  Good for the style.

Bottle.  Pours a golden yellow with a thin white head that slowly fades away.  Taste is of malt, hop honey, kind of sweet and bitter in the finish.  Has a good mouthfeel to it.  Aroma matches the taste.  I like this beer, it is satisfying, easy to drink and moderately priced for an import.

Pours a pale golden color with a huge white foamy head. Aroma is wheaty grassy. Taste is slightly bitter a little watery. A hint of hops.
Not much here.

Canned. A clear pale yellow beer with a very small (almost nothing) and disappearing white head. Not a great appearence. The aroma has light cerals, some malt and a decent grassy hoppiness. The flavour is quite weak and with a metallic note. Quite mild with the hops for a Pilsner. Light to medium body, lively carbonation, dry not much long finish with almost medium bitterness. A bit watery, but overall not awful.
Bottle. Yellow with a nice white head. Aroma and taste are both pretty sweet. Just an average pils.

Bottle. Straw yellow with short-lasting white head. Aroma is very sour and bitter. Mouthfeel is actually sweet for a pilsner, at least to begin with, but then the very, very unpleasant taste of pilsner comes through and leaves your taste buds appalled. Flavor is repulsive.

Bottle. Pours almost a neon yellow with good carbonation and a bright, white head that diminishes almost completely. Lacing is there but not prevalent. Initial taste is a bitter Pilsner but somewhat watery compared to Czech versions. Aftertaste is metallic and unpleasant. Overall fairly expensive and not really that special. Would probably not buy again or order at a restaurant/bar.

From a can, smells like a German beer normally does, kind of wheaty. I did appreciate the head, and the light gold colour. Tasted very wheaty, but it doesn’t contain any, had a hop flavour aswell. I don’t really dig it, but I’ll give it 50%.

From a can. Light yellow color, decent head. Light malty aroma. Taste is the same, after taste has a little bitterness to it. Overall a light refreshing beer that help me through a rainy camping trip!
Pours a lighter shade of yellow with a medium, foamy head. Tastes a bit sweet and mildly bitter. Very drinkable though rather lacking in overall flavor.

Bottle 50cl @ home.
Clear light to medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lancing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty and hoppy. Flavor is light to moderate sweet and light moderate bitter with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. (030608)
strong nice hoppy aroma, clear yellow, whilte head. great for a macro but bitterness flavor and balace is a little weird.
A good clean pilsener. Soft malty sweetness, nice dry bitterish finish. An all-nighter, especially from the bottle.
Easily one of my favourite German Pilseners. Well balanced and goes down smooth. I drink these a lot nowadays.

On tap at T’Nev’s in Naperville.
Very clear golden light with a white, foamy head. Pretty cheap looking, actually. Not too aromatic, but hints of lemon, mild grains, and century old pennies. Very light and crisp without a whole lot of aftertaste or hoppiness. Slightly fruity and grassy flavor with a very light sweetness and german tasting malt. Overall a decent beer to have on tap at a bar without too many selections.

Soul Cafe, Budapest. This was pretty bloody horrible. Revolting metallic chemical tinge. Nasty aftertaste. Rank !!
The German Fozters !
bottle, clear gold color, bright white head, fruity nose, flavors of apple juice and lemon, crisp finish
This is a good beer for the price.  It is like enough that you could drink a bunch but to me it does not taste watered down.

Pale golden color with a decent head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is citrusy with skunky under tones, taste was the same, but skunk taste may been because of the scent.  Light carbonation with a crisp finish.  I have had better Warsteiner than this, but this is what I was served tonight.

Overall, a good pils. Had on tap in Kimberley, BC. Pours bright golden yellow in colour with a frothy white head. Aroma is a plain grainy scent with mild malts. The flavour is somewhat hoppy and has tasty malts. Overall, a average pilsner.

No 400

Rated: 07.05.2008

Bottle, 500 ml

Appearance: Pours yellow, clear (almos perfectly) in its body, shiny and lively typical Pilsener colour, carbonation of body is weak to medium, head is initially quite big, than decreasing to medium. There is quite nice lacing, head is foamy to frothy, snowy white in colour.

Aroma: Bitter, grainy, dusty, cardboard, paper, hoppy, malty character is rather hidden, citrusy and most of all chalky, clean and again like in the previous typical of Pilsener style.

Flavour: Nice bitterness with hoppy - aromatic nose and mildly grainy touch. Reduced sweetness as compared to ’Krombacher’, in the aftertaste grains and flour with chalkyness is felt. Finish duration is medium.

Palate: Body is light, texture is wattery with slight bitterness and saltyness flavour. Carbonation on palate is medium, finish feel is grainy, floury, chalky typical for Pilsener.
On tap, No.27 Inverness.  Much better on tap than bottled.  Not a bad German pilsener, but there are far better out there.  Golden colour, malty taste, grassy.

Bottle. Golden yellow color with a big, but quickly shrinking white head. Light aroma of biscuity/bready malt, grass and cardboard. Clean and crisp taste with hints of malt, grass, white bread, light sweetness, and hop bitterness.

Pale gold color with 2 fingers of white head. The foam is a little fizzy and leaves just a few wisps of wet lacing. Nose is malty and grainy with some Hallertau influence. Flavor is simple but effective. Clean and grainy with some pale malt. Hops lend a grassy crispness but very little bitterness. Infinitely drinkable, smooth and refreshing.

Darft Tall mug from Rookie’s (Homewood, IL). Pours a pale yellowish hue that is not cloudy, and despite its macro look, is inviting. Decent white head that dissipates down to a much smaller version of the original. Aromas are decent for the style, light noble hop characters and larger and more prominent pilsner malt qualities, subtle and non adjuncty. Nice on the palate, as the initial is largely pilsner malt sweetness mixed with a touch of bitterness. I’m pretty happy with this beer.

33 cl can. Pours a pale yellow colour with a white head. The aroma has some grassy hops in it together white some white bread. The flavour has some malty sweetness and some notes of white bread and caramel. Some bitterness in the finish.

Nice cloudy golden color almost witbier cloudiness with a couple fingers of white head with nice retention.  Weak aromas and what is there is typical pils with a bit of skunk.  More substantial on the palate but still too typical except for a nice hop bite.  Good.
This is what Bud wants to be.  Lightbodied.  Medium bitterness.  Crisp and clean, beautiful color blonde gold straw.   I could drink 6 of these before I realized it was an hour past.
I tried this on July 4th and really enjoyed it.  It was refreshing and has a slghtly sweet flavor.
clear yellow pour, somewhat yeasty/malty smell but rather muted. taste is clean with a little bitter.
Clear light blond coloured beer with small white head and some nice carbonation. Smells like cartboards. Full warmy palate. Ending is hoppy and a bit bitter.

What I was most impressed with in this beer was the appearance and palate. It looked good to drink and felt good to drink. The only thing is it was vicously bland with a light bread/grape aroma, and moderately sweet flavor.
From can. Aroma of honey. Very pale clear lager. Very thin flavour of malt.

Appearance is a light yellow, with lots of carbonation and a thin pure white head. Aroma is yeasty, grassy and floral. Flavour is not nearly as crisp as a pils should be and is so grainy it’s like drinking pureed Cheerio’s. Very light and watry going down. Take a pass on this one.
I had two of them when I flew through Germany, it’s a very smooth pilsner with a hoppy taste.
i like warsteiner, good clean pilsner with slight malt kick, hell of a lot better than their flavored shit
A solid pilsener.  Gold to orange color with more hops and body than other large pilseners.
Golden blond coloured beer with some light carbonation and a rather small white head. LIght grassy sweet hoppy aroma. Medium palate. FInish is light bitter, somewhat hoppy. Not bad.

On tap at Nevins.  Very light aroma, i didn’t get much, mostly bitter, some copper hop bitter.  Fairly watery looking, golden yellow color, carbonation, ok head from the pour, but dissapates to nothing, no lacing.  Alot of light bitter copper grass, some sweetness, lingers ok, not complex, but very crisp and smooth.  Ok, didn’t mind drinking it at all, but nothing special.

clear pale yellow color with a soft soapy white head. the aroma is dry graininess, earth, lemon, grass and mild skunk. the palate is quite dry with just a scant amount of sweetness from the grain. there’s some yeast, pale malt, grass and honey notes in the flavor with a dry spicy finish. medium body, smooth mouth feel and a parching quality. a bit bland but really refreshing in the arizona heat.

Bottle, 33cl - Pale yellow color with a big frothy white head. Aroma is rather malty with a grassy hop aroma. Flavor is dry but pretty average. Surprised to see that such a large German company uses hop extracts though...

This was a decent beer; nothing special, though.  Could not discern a strong aroma.  Bottle poured golden into a glass and left a tiny head that dissipated within a minute.  More of an overall bitter taste than I expected, but still a decent, light-bodied, drinkable beer.

This is not bad for you average golden beer. The first time I had it was on tap in Switzerland and I found it very pleasant. Since I have started drinking darker beers but I still find this to be tasty. It is pleasant in aroma and has a slight hop flavor without being to bitter.
A clear yellow colored beer, with a white head. The aroma of hay and malt. The taste is smooth, malty, sweet, with little bitterness. A good drinkable lager on a sunny day.
Bought a case of cans for a good price. It’s very light and dry, with a good carbonated bite. Not great, but drinkable and the cans are nice for outdoor events.

12oz.  Pours pale yellow.  I remember having a strong distaste for this while living in Germany and this memory was strongly supported having recently tried it again.  Loads of sweet corn throughout the body, slight notion of honey but nothing to get excited about.

poured into a footed pilsner glass, golden orange in color with very little white head the aroma has a strong corn scent and maybe a little malt. The flavor is slightly corny with a bitter finish, this isn’t that bad overall.

0.5l can. Smells very pilsner-y. Slightly fruity but very hoppy. Pours a transparent, carbonated yellow with a tiny head. Strong flavour, quite bitter with a smooth palate. It’s okay, but i’m not a pils fan.

Bottle from Trader Joe’s in San Jose, CA. Pours a yellow color with no head. A ton of carbonation present. Had flavors of wheat and corn. Once it got even a little warm it tasted terrible. Drink it as fast as you can and maybe it would taste good.
Because life is too short to drink cheap beer?  Well I wouldnt exactly say that this is the beer to drink if life is short. Sure kicks Heineken’s ass though!!!

Bouteille de 330 ml. La bière se présente avec une couleur paille-dorée et une mousse blanche modeste qui se transforme assez rapidement en simple collet. Au nez on découvre des arômes de houblon floral et de grain. En bouche le corps est mince et la bière nous révèles des flaveurs de céréales et de houblon floral plus présent que la plupart des pilsener Alemmande que j’ai goûté. Dans la moyenne.
not impressed, ive drank it hoping for a "top of the line" German beer... and it was not...
I have this in cans for the pool and was not really impressed.  Overall a smooth beer lighter beer which makes drinking in the summer easier.
bottle at henk’s.   not bad with sausages, sourkraut and cabbage.  Decent german pilsner.
Taste is somewhat industrial and stale. Hops are clearly up front t just not as lively as I’d hope for. This is about as good as St pauli girl or maybe worse. I’d rather have Beck’s.

Pale yellow stuff, all very clear. Low on taste, thin on aroma and short on the palate. Tis a very average beer that has the hint of potentual, but only a hint. It makes for an easy drink as long as you have an alternative distraction, like watching some paint dry.
Thought this beer was really smooth, with a nice sharp hoppy taste. It didn’t blow me away, but I wasn’t underwhelmed either.

Come... potrei... descrivere... una birra... che non ha... alcun... sapore? Non potrei; io credo di non avere mai prima d’ora assaggiato una birra così insipida nel vero senso della parola. Insipida nel senso che non sa di niente, e dico NIENTE; ma proprio nulla di nulla. Non sa di buono e non sa di cattivo (per questo sarebbe stato ingiusto darle meno di 1). E’ la birra peggiore, la birra indifferente, che non sa proprio di nulla; sembra acqua. Niente niente niente, non sa di niente; è misterioso come faccia a non avere neanche un po’ di sapore. Nulla.
Bottle.  Pours a clear golden color.  Typical european pilsner aroma, and taste.  Not terrible, but nothing special.
Nothing really to separate it from your average drink-it-every-weekend cheapest-beer-in-the-store lager. It’s not bad but I wouldn’t praise it too much either.
500ml bottle-pours a dissipating white head and yellow/pale yellow color.  Aroma is spicy hops.  Taste is spicy hops.

Pours a pale golden color with big, white head and decent lace retention.  Appetizing hop aroma with hints of damp hay.  Medium bodied with good carbonation.  Sweet malt taste gives way to well-balanced hop bitterness.  A good session beer.  Try with hearty beef dishes.

light goldne colour, medium body, tiny head that appears right away and disappears before you know it. the little lace reminds me of foam on a beach when the tide comes in. It moves in smoothly up the glass, and then soon seeps back into the sea of beer.
esta la probe en todos lados cuando voy a tomar con amigos y todos los dias despues de lo que sea nos echabamos las birrias y pasamos un buen rato que vale la pena super

(330 ml bottle (best before 7/30/08)) Pours clear light yellow with three fingers of white head. Aroma of light honey, some hay, hint of pine. Mouthfeel medium-full, fairly smooth except lightly prickly. Flavor is honeyish malt, light hint of smokiness, slight bitterness overlays and provides a little pinch in finish. Pretty darn drinkable and good.
Draught at Heinrich Böll. Clear golden beer with white head. Mainly malty aroma with a little hopps. Malt and hopps in the taste. A quite boring pilsener.

A little hoppy on the nose, nice balanced flavor between malts and hops with a little yeasty flavor. Oily with medium bubbles, nice golden color. Head could be a little more dense and lacks body on mouth.
An average german pils.

On tap at Jan’s Wine and Boos (North Tampa, FL). Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Smells of sourdough, honey, grain. Flavor: Slightly watery with hints of grass, hops, honey. Slight tastes of honey on finish as well. Could a good thirst quencher on a warm summer day, but . . . .
Bottle. Pours a golden hue with a white head. Very subdue grassy, pils aroma. The flavor is basic pils, slightly skunky.  Light body, crisp, dry. (Rating from 14 Mar 08 on Lufthansa flight 430)
330 ml bottle. light golden coloured. not to impressive head. taste is to bitter and sour. not as good as I hoped.

550ml Bottle - Gravity Beer Market - Olympia, WA 

Aroma – Nice use of malts with a very flat hops nose.  Very bitter in the aroma. 

Appearance – Golden in color, Nice head and clear. 

Flavor – Had a decent flavor, crisp could be drank but the flavor was very flat and dull. 
 
Palate – Decent Mouthfeel, OK texture with a dry finish. 

Overall – Hard to get beers from one Content to the next so this beer had a long travel.  Held pretty good but not my favorite beer.
A very smooth, mild, easy to drink and enjoyable German beer, or verum.  It is a classic German pilsner.
this a good lager. good flavor, easy to drink. great looking bottle. will drink again.

4/2/08: Bottle.
 Light yellow body with a pillowy, pure white head.  Straw nose.  Light lager flavor with a lemon finish.

Pours blond with a tall foamy white head. Aroma is crisp and a bit grassy and mixed with some European hops. Taste is carbonated and grassy. Some malt but generally pretty crisp and refreshing. A decent summer type beer or for whenever it’s hot. Finish is a bit sharp and the palate is carbonated. Not horrible, but more of an everyday refresher, especially when working on the lawn.
Golden yellow color. The smell was kind of skunky. The taste wasn’t bad, but nothing spectacular either.

Love the olive green bottle. Thats were the love ends and followed by disappointment. This is not a bad beer by any means however it does not excel in any form either. Knowing that it was brewed under at least some form of the Reinheitsgebot eases the mind. However they did not do much with their great ingredients. Pilsner Urquell manages to pack a ton of unique flavor into their brand. This is simply a cold yellow alcoholic drink. Flavor wise it is not with the import over even a Bud Lite. If I were in Warstein, Germany I would have no problem drinking it all day long and would enjoy it. Seeing someone drink this outside of Warstein would cross me as pretentious.

bitter, good aroma the color is intense like a sun flower, the presentation is great but the flavor normal, i like the bottle and the brown cristal color. in tonge is good, sweet, bitter and the malt is in each drink. i enjoy it listen the radio Gaga of Freddy Mercury and firends ; ]

12 oz bottle, pours gold-ish. Small, quickly dissipating head. Grassy, lemony, skunky taste (pretty much same as smell). Better than American Macro’s, but I can’t remember how expensive it is. If t is +$8 a six-pack, it probably isn’t worth it.

Bottle. Off white Goldish in color with a small head that quickly dissipates. Lacing is minimal. Lots of carbonation. Nose is malty and sweet with a hit of hops in the background. taste is light an bready/malty, a bit sweet. very clean. okay but not good.
Golden straw color.  Fizzy head that quickly dissipates.  Typical lager/pilsener carbonation.  Almost no aroma.  Grain/malt taste that’s clean, fresh and simple.

yellowish, goldish look. not didnt really like the aroma or the appearance of the beer but
the taste was pretty skunky with a little taste of caramel, Ok beer

bottle on airplane in plastic cup!!! Straw yellow clear pour with good rocky white head. Lots of bubbles rising from the cup. Firm lacing. Nose is grass and grain with definite skunkiness. taste is much the same, grassy, skunky, some minor spice and maybe lemon. I remember this being better. It seems even a german airline doesnt take care of it’s beer properly. Go figure.

Pours a clear straw color.  Fluffy white head.  Aroma was a bit skunky, with some graininess to it.  Flavor wasn’t offensive but not great either.  Not a huge pilsner fan, but there is nothing special here to get excited about.

Pours a clear straw/gold with a nice head of white bubbles that quickly dissipate. Doesn’t have much aroma but what’s there is pleasant. Clean, crisp, and easily drinkable. Nothing amazing but great for back yard drinking on a hot day.

Golden pour with light white head served in a long warsteiner flute .... aroma of straw and bready malts ... taste of bready malts kinda sweet and a light hoppy bite ...... a bit watery .... smooth drinking and slightly bitter going down but overall a good safe beer .... came with a free das boot too which was kinda cool
In the bottle, this beer is garbage.  On draft, however, it’s excellent.  Can’t understand the dramatic difference.

11.2 ounce bottle- poured a very clear light yellow, looked weak.  Moderate, but long-lasting bright white head.  Virtually no aroma.  Anemic, alcohol flavor with a mildly bitter after taste.  Felt like an empty mouth.  Save a little on this brew and buy any American "Lite" beer at the local Kroger.  Disappointing.

Ok beer. Bottle, 1L. Faint aroma of hop, some fruitness, a little acid. Golden body, white head, that lasts nicely. Higher carbonation than I’d like to see, body with some more density than I was expecting, but nothing much. The taste is very soft, hoppy, some maltness, with bitter and lightly fruity aftertaste. Nice barbecue pilsner! / Cerveja ok. Aroma leve de lúpulo, um pouco de frutas, um pouco ácido. Corpo dourado, espuma branca, que dura bem. Carbonação mais alta do que eu gostaria de ver, corpo com mais densidade do que eu esperava, mas nada demais. O gosto é bem suave, de lúpulo, um pouco de malte, com retrogosto amargo e um pouco frutoso. Pilsner legal pra churrasco!
Light yellow golden sort of color with an ok head.  Slightly skunky in the smell maybe a slight grains and malts.  Taste is very light with slight malts and hops.
Clear golden with medium white head. Grassy aroma with malty notes. Sweet flavor with caramel notes and a discrete bitter finish.

A - Grassy, floral and wheat
A - Golden with lasting white head
T - Sweet with slight dry finish
P - Thin to medium and soft
O - Good classic German

Its was ok.  Taste allright, but a litlle bitter.  The aftertase is not too pleasant.  Has a slight fruity taste to it.  It better then Budwiser but not quite Bass Ale. I won’t have any trouble finishing my six pack but I probably won’t buy it too often.

July 2007 - Pour was pale yellow, crystal clear with a finger sized head which dissipated quickly, no lacing.  Aroma was grassy and hoppy, which gave me high hopes.  Sweet pilsner malts, grass and a hop bite, but a flavor underneath that reminded me of the way sweet things taste after brushing your teeth.  Hard to finish.
An OK pilsener that doesn’t seem to go in any particular direction.  Fairly hoppy, somewhat vegetal, lacks crispness. The head is decent but doesn’t quite hold as much as I’d like to see. Just ok.
Alittle watery for a pilsener, there are much better. There are of course much worse. Slightly bitter aftertaste. It was cheap in my local offy and I’m skint, and tasted likt really. Average.
Bottle - Pours light golden with a moderate white head. Aroma is a little skunky with slight hop aroma. Taste is a little hoppy but tastes watered down.

This is a nice German-style pilsner (which is by definition good in my book) but not as good as others.  Ut s gold with a decent white head that dense but steadily shrinks to a thin lasting top and leaves no real lace.  The aroma is a strong lager smell with strong grain quality, a little mustiness, pine, herbs and hint of sulphur - nice.  The taste is grain and a grassy-herbal-flowery sulphur hop quality making it light but tasty, with a nice grain-0bitter hop finish.  It’s very tasty.

Bottle poured into flute- poured transparent light golden yellow, very thin white head formed but bubbled away from high-medium carbonation after a minute, aroma of very faint hops and grain.  Hits the mouth with a thin body, wheat and hops are very underpowering even for the style, finish is a little bitter but refreshingly dry.  Bit of a letdown for me.

Bottle. Aroma contains notes of wheat, faint notes of banana, and grassy/floral hops. Flavor is very wheaty with the faint banana roaming as well. Hops aren’t terribly notable in the flavor except to announce their presence, in mild manner of course, but a presence which, combined with the notes of banana and wheat, and the overall drinkability of the beer, makes me wonder why, why, why can’t American macros taste like this? why?

Bottle.  Poured light yellow with a thick white head, lots of carbonation.  No real odor, just smelled like a Bud or Heineken.  Taste was alright though, some zesty lemony/spicy hops while cold.  As it warmed, I got a slight light fruity taste (pear, banana).  Also some wheat.  I was impressed by this beer for being more complex than I had anticipated.  A good beer to chill with.

bottle. light malty aroma and that’s about it. nice gold color. ok carbonation. no head to speak of at all. very watery. bubbly. kind of odd that it smells malty but I don’t taste malt at all. kind of reminds me of budweiser. this has a skunky palate that leaves me with the "bitter beer face". Description says...A CLASSIC GERMAN PILSENER. I have to question why that is.  feel kind of ripped off with what I payed for this bottle.

Bottle...  Poured pale golden with a white head.  This stuff is really
putrid.  I was very disappointed with this one as it tastes like Bud or something.  Tough to finish a whole
pint of this fermented seltzer.

Hmm, pours with no head and extremely pale.  Smells skunky - I’d say it was a bad bottle, but I get the same smell (everytime) I drink Heineken - so I think it’s purposeful.    Anyway, tastes sweet, a lot like Budweiser (yes, the American one) despite the clear claim that no adjuncts were used.  Sort of the German Corona??  While drinkable, not worth the price.  A (seldom for me) disappointment.

Bottle-namesake glass.  Pours clear golden with a small fine head and lively carbonation; nice lace.  Aromas of grassy hops and grain.  Tastes hoppy and grainy with traces of sweet malt.  Bitter, dry end.  Pretty good.

I love this. 
For those who dislike the aftertaste of a normal beer, this should be just it.
Botella. Comprada en supermercado. Lo mejor que tiene es el aroma. No es una  mala cerveza, pero nada extrordinario. amarga y poco mas. Poca retenciòn de espuma

Draft at Mcraney’s pub. Clear, golden color with very little head. Light aroma of hay and grass with a similar but slightly fruity flavor.   Thin, watery palate which helps it go down rather easily. Maybe too easily.

I had this beer poured out from the bottle in Berlin.  It had a grainy, earthy hops aroma; no strong malt aromas.  A clear gold color with a foamy white head.  The taste was mostly bitter with a sour effect, but not sweetness.  It had good carbonation and a medium body.  Another decent, but unexceptional pilsner.

12 oz bottle pale yellow pour , no lace no head . very faint malt aroma .metallic bitter and a bit lemony .very light ,crisp and a little skunky . so thin ,and a faint bitter finsh . reminds me of Heineken  but a little better.

Pours from the 12 oz. bottle a macro-like pale golden with a foamy 1 1/2 finger head.  Very active carbonation.  Head settles to a light collar.  Aroma is a mix of sweet malt & bitter hops.  Taste is a metallic bitter mix of Saaz hops and a kind of lemony, grassy dryness that lingers on the swallow, with a hint of the malt showing.  Mouthfeel is light and fizzy.  All-in-all, a drinkable, but not great pilsner.  Would make a nice crossover beer for a macro drinking buddy who’s ready to branch out.

Poured pale amber with a decent amount of head and good lacings. Taste is smooth malts and a good amount of bitter euro hops. Very refreshing and almost bold pilsner. Dry bitter finish. Very nice beer, would be a good session brew.

500 ml Can.  I couldn’t get much out of the aroma on this one, it was extremely faint.  I found it lacking in flavour, except for an extremely, EXTREMELY bitter aftertaste.  I like bitter, but not this much. I won’t be buying this one again.

Bottles and on tap.  Clear golden pour with a foam white head, some lacing.  Light aroma, taste of grains and hops, smooth and drinkable, maybe a little weak for some.  For a popular mass produced German Pilsener nicely put together and I like it very much- great drinker!
Bottle. pale gold body and white head. aroma of grass and bread. flavor like de same with bitter. A good pilsener.

A deep golden pour with white head. Not much on the nose, just a hint of corn and not much else. Very clean light malt flavor with a hint of bitter on the finish. Mouthfeel is medium carbonation is good as well. Solid offering. Clean crisp and refreshing. I drank it at 50* at about 40 it would be really easy to drink.

Bottle. Pours golden into flute glass with dense rocky white head. Nose is Grassy, mildly soapy hops and breadiness, also some raw not so pleasant grain aromas. Flavor is soft bread, fresh grains, with fresh herbal hop flavors and lightly oily hoppy bitterness in the finish. A solid pilsner built for drinking in quantity.
Bottle. Extremely smooth and has a nice sweetness to it. One of the best German beers ive had.

Pours a nice light gold with a foamy white head.  Very light aroma of mostly wheat and a little malt.  Very light tasting, sort of reminds me of a miller lite, but without the weird skunky flavor.  Crisp.  Not bad, but nothing special.

Great beer!  Appearance: a soft golden color with a white head that lingers awhile;  Flavor: light and crisp with a wonderful touch of bitterness;  Palate: flavor moves from the front to the back of the of the tounge with a light hop bitter at the end.  Overall this is a keeper.
THE BEST GERMAN PILSNER I EVER DRUNK. BEAUTIFUL IN THE TULPEN GLASS, FOAM SOFT AND PERSISTENT; NOT INVADING SCENT AND PERFECT BITTERNESS; FRESHNESS AND DRINKABILITY ARE HIS BETTER NOTES

one of the best beers i’ve ever tasted, allthough it has to be cold when you drink it. its one of those beers, where you dont get that, "i’ve had too mutch beer" feeling, because of a week aftertaste. in my oppinion. the best beer avaiable at the moment!

12 oz bottle poured into a pilsner glass. It was clear pale yellow with a nice three fingers worth of white fluffy head that didn’t last to long 

Nice light aromatics of wheat and bread fill your head 

Light and crisp whit a nice tingle from the carbonation on the tongue

Extremely mild flavors of malt and light hop bitter end 

A nice light beer to start of the day I’d drink it again but wouldn’t go out of my way looking for it

50 cl can, Norwegian 4,7% abv. Ligth golden/yellow color. Disappering white head. Moderate aroma of malt. In flavor there is some sweetness, strawy malt. Very moderate bitterness. Thin and very boring.
(German) Light crisp Beer, with small Head, Pale Yellow color, easy to drink but Average at best.

noticed lots of big chunks floating around in the bottle before i opened it. pours a light gold with a bit of cloudiness to it. faint smell of malts coming from the head. taste it slightly sweet malts. finishes bitter. has a nice bubbly mouthfeel. not worthy of the "premium" moniker.

Gold pour, light malty aroma, with a bit floral and cereal tones.  A lightly nippy pilsener, not sweet but still in balance, with some mitteleuropean hops.  Fairly fizzy mouthfeel.  "German brewing perfection" crows the label.  Not sure I agree, but it is good, and better than average for a Euro macro.
Typical lager.  Crisp and refreshing, but watery and pretty much flavorless.  Nothing to boast about.
Pale yellow, massive head. Faint aroma and very clear fresh flavor, not very malty. Lacking any real finish, which was both a surprise and a disappointment. Smooth and easy to drink.

Light beer, great carbonation crisp taste kinda weak though decent beer.  Kinda taste a little bit like corn.  Tommorow I will drink this out of 1/2 gallon mini keg.  I will be back for more rating.Rerate:  The beer from the mini keg taste much better, decent frothy head with a good lacing, taste crisp and drinkable, def. session beer.

Clear pale yellow, pure white head. Faint pils (eathen, undergorund, dirt roma). Weak flavor, unfortunaltely it almost resembles corn. It’s a little sweet like corn pops, but then fades. A mediocre pils at best.

Bottle. Pours clear straw with a short white head. Aroma has a bit of noble hops and some fermented barley malt. Taste is pretty non-descript pretty much like a standard pale lager. Nothing to get excited about here. Mouthfeel is watery with pretty hight carbonation. No thanks.
Bottle. Clear yellow, white head. Aroma is hoppy and malty. Flavor is the same and watery. Bland.

04/01 0.5 l can from Spar in Semriach. Poured pale yellow body with bigger fluffy head that went down pretty fast. Pleasant flowery sweetish malt aroma. Flavor also sweetish, very simple but not bad, not interesting either. Finally goes to bittersweet at the finish, which is much better than flavor itself. Quite nice, although could be better, specially as this is a pilsener, it’s too sweet.

Poured a crystal clear golden color with a fizzy, one-finger tall white head.  No lacing.  Small bubbles slowly rise from the bottom.  The nose is malt with very light spice.  The flavor is as bland (but not in a bad way) as I can remember a beer being.  Watery mouthfeel.  Fairly refreshing, but not as nice as say a Spaten Pils.

I had this pretty frequently when I was in Germany and can find it in a lot of places here as well. A good solid example of a German Pilsner but nothing particularly special. Out of a bottle it’s a little too bitter but much better on tap.
This is a very light German brew.  One of the few German beers that I can easily find in most stores.  Far better than its American counterpart, special but not amazing.
Golden, with the typical lager aroma and flavor. Refreshing but nothing special.
gold blond sparkling body with a average white head a hoppy aroma a hoppy nice taste and a sweet finich
pours pale golden color,grainy nose,light grain taste,crisp,light beer ok for what it is.
Light but good. I poured it about 20 minutes ago and its still bubbling. Nice and crisp, great beer and very clean. Could drink it with dank meals!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
A great beer, but leaves something to be desired in the taste department. It’s a little light for my taste, but it is a good beer none-the-less

Good choice for an affordable, everyday, bottled German Premium Pils especially in the U.S.  Same league as Bitburger, Radeberger, Grolsch -- no raving but also no disappointment.  Straightforward, top notch ingredients and solid crafting, just on an industrial scale.  Still in a totally different galaxy when compared with Budweiser & pals.

This beer surprised me. I lived in Germany for a few months, and during that time period drank A LOT of german pilseners. I also came to know Warsteiner as sort of a miller or bud on the German beer scene - to my surprise  however, when I picked up a six pack here in the states it turned out to be a pretty tasty brew. Color is pale with a thin white head. Aroma is hops, grass, herbs and a hint of fresh fruit, maybe apple. The taste is about the same, with a nice dry finish. The beer is a little thin, but I’m sure that if I were drinking it in the summer I would probably appreciate that quality. Pretty good overall.
Pale golden in color.   Head dissipated quickly with virtually no lacing.  Nice herbal hoppy aroma.  Bubbly and dry on the palate.  A nice pilsener overall.
Pours clear light gold. Clean aroma of apples, hop, grass, and alcohol. Flavour is pruney malts and hop. Light. Watery, reminds me a little of club soda.
From a sampler box of different beers. Clear golden color with small head. Mild malt aroma and slight bitter hop at the end of the flavor.

Half liter bottle sampled one day before the end of the best before date.

Had a nice appearance with a golden color and had a white head that dissipated slowly with slight lacing. Smell was slightly skunky but still had a slight floral hoppiness to it. Has a nice clean flavor to it, again with only subtle maltiness and hoppiness as expected. Mouthfeel was decent with a good amount of carbonation and light body. Drinkability is insane on this, it goes down incredibly smooth, if only the rest of it was on this level. Definitely worth a try, and it’s one that when fresh, I will be coming back to.

Another beer that has probably been rated to death, but I had a pint or two last night and figured I’d submit a brief review. It was served cold from the tap at a local German watering hole. Slightly hoppy smell, but quite weak when compared to other like-brews. Weak flavor, not too crisp, watery.

500ml can 

4.8% ABV 

I tried this beer on November 3, 2007 after purchasing from my local LCBO outlet.  The beer poured beautiful translucent gold colour with very little head that dissipated quickly.  The aroma was weak with hops and grains.  The mouthfeel was thin and crisp with mild carbonation.  The flavour was a combination of malt, and hops and grass.
Bottle. I enjoyed the crisp and slightly bitter taste, but it faded into a unpleasant, lingering oiliness on the palate that prevents a recommendation.
Wouldn’t buy again. Tastes like overcarbonated, slightly watered down Heineken. It could be worse, but it could be much much much better.
Colour gold head good,carb perfect,nice freshalmond like smell,earthy one that appeals to me.Tastes lovely hoppy and good bitter and dry finish,very refreshing drink.

From 500 ml bottle from Bevmo. Pours a pale brass color with a small off-white head. The aroma is medium in strength with a laggerish funky quality. Unlike the aroma there is nothing strong about the flavor, this is a weak beer. There is sort of a understated grassy taste with bland hops and a taste of biscuit around the edges. The mouthfeel is thin and watery with adequate carbonation. The finish is short with a sweet metallic aftertaste. Overall: Not recommended
Poured from a bottle a clear golden. Not much of an aroma. Crisp flavor with a malty, grassy type taste. Nothing great, but you could do a lot worse.
Bäh, what a terrible beer. One of the worst pilseners I’ve ever drunk. Never again!
Not bad, just has an average taste compared to better beers. Reminds me of a better Macro brew beer.
Bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear golden with a medium but fading white head. Smell mostly malty with hints of yeast. Taste is mainly malty too, with some hops, but not that much. OK pilsener, nothing more
12 oz. bottle.  Pours a pale, clear, light gold.  Not much on the nose, a bit of wet hay.  Small, white head.  Mouthfeel is malt, grass, with a hint of hops.  Decent crisp finish.  Ok beer.

Bottled.
Pale golden. Brief, white head.
Grassy and malty aroma and flavour.
Slightly metalluic with a somewhat hoppy bitterness..
Had this beer on 9/27/1999.  Color is very light, looks like piss.  Taste is ok, better than most Pilseners but still not good.

Pale yellow colour with light white lacing around the edges of the glass. Malt grassy aroma with a little bit of hops. Flavour is crisp. You have the malt and grass going on but more hop bitters are apparent. Body is medium with medium carbonation. Dry on the back of my tongue.

pours a crisp clear yellow with a one finger bubbly white head. aroma is strong pilsner malt, corn, and hay with a touch of hops. has a light body, good carbonation, and just a touch of lacing. flavor is the same as aroma but just a touch stronger. a good german pils.
Golden straw color with very little head.  Very grainy and grassy.  Some veggy and hay also.  Not too bad.
Nice golden yellow color with a light head. Nice crisp taste with a little hop bite. This would be a nice everyday summer beer. Good nice and cold after mowing the lawn.

Came with a really beautiful pilsener glass from the LCBO.  Nice sweet scent.  A bit of citrus and hops.  Pale pour, thin head.  A bit weak in the initial taste but a strong hoppy aftertaste.  Not a bad beer, but not enough of anything to be great.

Poured from a bottle, there is nearly no aroma to this beer.  All I get is sweetness.  The color and look of the beer is right on, very appealing.  Taste wise, its okay.  Certainly not offensive, but not overly hoppy either.  It’s like a better version of a silver bullet.  Nothing wrong here...but nothing exciting either.

Bottle in Berlin.

Pours gold with a modest white head. Mellow, slightly sweet, slightly fruity pils, laiud back on the hops.Not a standout but enjoyable enough.
I don’t know if it’s because i’m loving everything German at the moment (after honeymooning at the Oktoberfest) but this isn’t to bad. Light creamy buttery flavour, fairly crisp, not bad.
This is one of my least favorite beers from germany. Maybe its due to the skunkiness bottles

Light yeast aroma without much else in that department.  Light golden radiance.  Crisp and refreshing with noble hop overtones.  Light feel on the palate with a refreshing moisture aftertase.  Overall average, a crisp, bitter refreshment.

25 cL bottle on a Lufthansa flight to Bologna. Pours pale to golden clear yellow with lasting white head. Hay and grassy cardboard aroma, somewhat dusty. Soft carbonated mouthfeel. Flavour has a mild malt sweetness but is dominated by a grassy bitterhops flavour, not too sharp though. Ends mild and dry.

500ml can. 

Pours a shining yellow gold. fair head. Quickly escaping. Smells of corn and pils hops with a little sweetness. Sticky cloying and creamy mouthfeel. Taste is sweet and corny. Not great at all. I generally like pilseners but this one is pushing it for me.

On tap at Redlefsen’s in Bristol RI. Yellow clear light too easy to drink beer. I’m guessing this is Germany’s Bud since i saw an ad on the menu that says its their #1 selling beer over there. Well its much better than any thing Bud makes put its just on ok pils.
Crisp aroma. Flavor is clean and hoppy with lingering bitter aftertaste. A good solid pils.

Sitting on a 10 hour plane flight and this is being served, well I guess I will pass the time a bit by writing a review.  Pours with a medium head that fades into a decent lacing. Color is crystal clear pee-yellow with a few bubbles shooting up the beer. Aroma is all-that nasty pilsner-corn, really spot on for European macro and even goes into South American crap lager territory. Taste is a saving grace, by that I mean it’s just very bland. If you look hard enough you could find some sweet apple followed by pear and ends with corn. Low bitterness with average carbonation, light and very watery.  33cl bottled on 29/05/07, small clear Luftansa plastic cup.
This was a very poor beer. The aroma was unnoticeable and the color looks like piss with a soft head. Though the flavor is suprisingly rich but doesn’t match the look at all.

Looks like somebody drank a lot of water and peed in the glass.  Very pale in colour, even for a pale lager.  Taste isn’t bad though.  I like it but I probably won’t get it again.  I drank this out of a shaker.
A basic German pilsner. Very crisp with a quick bite, but no lingering taste. A light amber color with white head as expected. Nothing new here, not very exciting, but an all around decent beer.

A distinct pilsner taste, but without the finish of its sister beers. This brand looked extremely promising, but the delivery was a little lacking. Personally, I think if you’re going for a pilsner, skip this and head toward a true one. Definitely worthwhile for washing down a hearty meal, but not necessarily a standalone product.

Could someone explain to me why this is a "classic german pilsener" and everything from the states is a " pale lager".  The aroma, appearance, and taste all scream pale lager to me.  Im not saying its bad cause its not, but i dont see the difference in the styles.
A pale yellow lager tasting pils. Usual bud scent, some minerals and stale malt. Certainly not a good beer but helped to wash my burger down adequately.

500ml can. Light gold in color with a quick foam head. Not much for an aroma. Easy to drink with good aftertaste. Beer that abides by the Barvarian purity law all have a simular natural earthy taste. Over all impression of this beer is pretty satisfiying.
330 ml bottle.  Pours a pale yellow with a quickly diminishing white head.  Sweet nose with malty notes.  Light semi-sweet body.  Initial sweetness tapers off into a semi-dry lingering finish.

Bottle - generic.  I could have rated it without  opening the bottle.  Mostly malt in the aroma, maybe a touch of spicy hops ... maybe.  Very pale yellow with a white head.  Kind of soapy.  Flavor matches the aroma exactly.  Very thin.  Not worth the effort.

Draft in the Philly airport - Poured a golden amber in color with a small head and relatively low carbonation overall.  Aroma is malty with a hint of fruity/estery hops.  Flavor is slightly sweet and malty with a small amount of hop flavoring.  Flavor is pretty weak.  Finish is mildly bitter.  Unremarkable at best...

Golden colour with white head. The aroma is a bit grainy with hints of hops. The flavor is somewhat sweet with a bit of fruit to it. The aftertaste is crisp and clean. A very nice example of a German pils.
Tried this because I love the dunkel, but this fell short. Gold color, no real head.  Smooth in the mouth, weak on flavor. Would choose this over most others of this style
*updated* Had this again a day or so ago. Much better than I had remembered it. Might make this my standard everyday type beer. Love the flavor - just a bit different.

i was nervous about the aroma, couldn’t tell if it was going to be very acidic or sweet, it was definatly a sweet beer, and the head was shortlived, but the taste made up for most everything. although there wasn’t much flavor, it was a balanced sweet beer, the finish was creamy almost oily. i enjoyed it, it was almost to easy to drink.

can:  Again, just not my thing.  All these German pils at the LCBO just blend into one sour, thin taste.  Gimme a fresh Steamwhistle Pilsner any day. The bitterness in this beer is not unpleasant, would be nice super cold on a hot day.

rerate: said i wouldnt but it again, but ended up picking up a case in germany.   not much to look at with a champagne like body and small quickly dying head.   Aoma is dry with some floral hop notes.   thin clean body with lively carbonation.   Tastes better this time with a definite hop presence and bitter finish.   not as malty and sweet as i remember, but its for the better.   i’m going to have to up the rating a bit
