Golden color, slight bitter finish. Good all around German Pilsener. will continue to drink this one on occasions.

Bottle served on a Lufthansa airplane. Clear golden, Medium white head. Malty aroma with a bit of hops. Sweetish flavor of malts and a bitter, slightly metallic, finish. Medium-bodied. Quite unpleasant.

Name: Lager

Date: 03/29/1996

Mode: Draft

Source: Taco Mac, Sandy Springs



clean yellow, whispy head with nice lace, lots of carbination, little or no aroma, light body  followed by a good kick of flural hop flavor, dry and slightly bitter finish

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Name: Lager

Date: 10/28/2002

Source: Summits - Sandy Springs

Score: ii to ii+

Words: Draft



Clear yellow, lots of tiny bubbles, robust fine bright white head, nice lace, light slightly sweet crisp hop aroma, sharp hop flavor, nice bitter finish, an excellent pilsner 



Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 13/20

Rating: 3.1/5.0
Score: **+/4

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.
A good classic pilsner.  light and clear, but not weak in taste (not watered down like most north american pislners).  Had the 500ml can...

Pours a clear golden color with a medium white head. A nice aroma of grassy and grainy notes. The flavor was full of very clean and easygoing hops, some malt, and lots of grass and light Saaz hops in the finish. Very. very quaffable. Nice and simple, but good.

Bottle. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of pale malts with a weak amount of spicy hops. Light bodied with a somewhat thin texture, but not as bad as the american macro versions. Compared to the Bitburger I just had, this has less bitterness and sweetness and a touch more dryness on the finish.
nice crisp and clean. hints of yeast and slight hop flavor. good pils for the 98 degree day here
A pleasant bready sweetness with a crisp dry finish. Pretty basic, but nice and refreshing in the 110 degree heat.

355 ml bottle. Golden color, quickly fading head. Pleasant aroma. Sits well on the palate with a very pleasant taste. Nothing spectacular but not a bad choice. I liked it because it didnt taste watered down like some other pilseners.
i bought a mini keg of this at the local beer depot for 18 dollars very good beer ice cold went down smooth

The weak/clean pilsener aroma is mild. The uber clear beer tastes as it looks...clean and clear. (Or you could say it looks like urine.) Mild-to-no body. It was 100 degrees today, that is when this beer shines.
Slight hoppy aroma. Golden colour, medium head. Some herbal notes, generally hoppy flavour with nice bitter end. Ok pilsener.

Picked up a case of cans for our company picnic. Pours a clear, light golden pale yellow brew with a fast dissolving white head that leaves behind a thin white ring and no lacing. Aroma of light bread dough, some grassy hops and a touch of Ivory soap. Taste is light bodied, lots of carbonation with a good balance of light malt and grassy hops. Finish is clean cut, crisp and very watery. Just a slight metalic finish but good enough for a 90 degree summer picnic.
500 ml can. poured light yellow with a small whit head. faint crisp pils aromas. standard pils flavours. a good example of the style. very easy to drink but not watery or boring.

Bottle pours our golden and very clear with a fluffy white head. Aroma is malty, very classic pilsener. Taste is a little sweet with a touch of bitterness. This is not my favorite german pils, but it is a good hot day beer.

12 oz bottle. Poured a clear golden/yellow with lots of visible carbonation and a fizzy white head. Bready aroma with lots of malt. Flavor is crisp and refreshing. A nice pilsner and much better then some of the other German pilsners out there.
Another run of the mill beer.  I mean, its not bad, but its certainly nothing to right home about
Pours a light golden colour with standard pilsner carbonation. Aroma is sweet malts and earthy. Pretty boring flavor. Not a bad beer but nothing special.

German Budweiser, yet with more color, aroma, and flavor. Strong pilsner qualities, deep straw-golden color, normal carbonation, unimpressive lacing. The aroma was pils malts, grass, dirt. The flavor was strong pils malts, earthy, dirt, grass hops presence. Nothing special, yet of course with more flavor than Budweiser, mouthfeel carbonated, medium bodied. Snore.
Light, sweet malt, hoppy finish. Smooth but not thin, some malt and a little stickiness. I’ve had better pilsners but still drinkable.
Bottle... This is one of my favorite beers. Much better when you actually drink it in Germany.

THOUGHTS: I’m not much of a pilsener fan, but this is one of the best I’ve had so far. Goes down eaier than most because of less metallic aftertast. Flavor was a little earthy but not in a bad way.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a sparkling, light golden, yellow with beautiful carbonation and an average, white head. the aroma was moderated flower and grass hops and light dough and earth yeasts. The initial flavor was lightly sweet and acidi, while the finish was moderately sweet and lightly acidic and bitter, and sour with an average duration. The light body had fizzy carbonation and a lightly astringent, tad bit metallic finish.
Pours a clear deep golden.Very sweet malt, corn, and biscuits, as well as some honey.  Lotsa grain, lotsa honey, but pretty damn good for 18.99/24pk cans.
From the bottle. Quite drinkable, plenty of malt and bitterness drawing through. Something I definitely do not mind drinking if it’s there.
Bottle.  Light gold and clear, with a thick head.  Very malty aroma.  Smooth and silky body with a light malt flavor.

Aroma of light cooked (or bready?) malt accompanied by some hop. Brassy gold color with a white head that went flat fast. Medium bodied. A bit strongly carbonated. Starts with a fruity sweetness that suggests grape. Not enough bitter to balance. An ok drink, but it’s a bit malty. Needs bitter. The malt keeps the finish from being crisp.
A disappointment. A bit sweeter than the bmc types and thats it. Avoid the price and buy MGD if that’s what you’re looking for.
Pale yellow colour. Just the average pilsner, except this one is a bith smoother. Drinkable.

On tap at Castro’s in the beaches. 
Bready, malty, and sweet corn nose, Flavour is grainy, and has notes of sweet malt. meh, avergae, nothing special .
Golden body with a large fluffy white head.  Aroma is light malty, honey, earthy.  Taste is sweet malt, with wet grains and hops.  Decent Pils, nothing special though.

looks like a pilsner.  tastes like a pilsner.
not much to say here.
just an okay beer
Poor aftertaste (almost grape like), decent color and aroma.  Unimpressive for a German beer.
Pale straw colour. Dry, bitter hop flavour. Clean and fresh with a real beer flavour.
Mini Keg. Nice copper hop notes with light malts. A very average german pilsner, I guess that explains its popularity. Mini Keg tastes better than the bottle but nothing fantastic.
strawy, grassy, like most pilsners...kind of a german bud but a bit better...because it’s not bud.

[315-20070514] 250mL. Light plastic skunk aroma with some floral notes. Clear, pale yellow body with tiny bubbles along the sides and a medium-lasting bubbly white head. Same plastic yeast flavour with a bit of grainy earth. Light body. Not pleasing but... nicely bubbly.

On tap, clear yellow, frothy lasting white head, light malty smell, lightly hopped and crisp, lively carbonation, dry and a little bitter, great on a hot day, would have preferred out of the giant boot that decorated the bar.

Bottel.50cl. German Pilsner and what a nice one it is. It has no head and that is too bad.
Good taste hop´s malt in a nice balance.
Cerveja refrescante, mas leve demais. Falta sabor e aroma. Falta mais malte e lúpulo.
Pours clear pale golden. Aroma has more hops than malts. Slightly bitter. Light and a bit dry mouthfeel.

Canned 50cl. It pours a nice, very pale yellow beer with a big white head. Dominating grassy hop aromas with some sweet light malt coming through. The taste is rather sweet, lots of grassy characteristics, some very faint biscuitty elements. Some hay. There is a slight bubblegummy touch to this beer. The finish is dry, hoppy and lingering. An average pilsener, rather bland but consistent. Quite mediocre.
Not as good as the dunkel, but better than other pale lagers. Nothing stands out, mainly a malty beer. No hop flavor. Bland flavor and a sweet finish.

Beer 49-50 Summer 2006 trip in Europe.  Drank on 7/9/06 on a train from Stuttgart to Munich.  Draft on a train moving at 109 km/h.  The beer was well eh, but draft on train is pretty damn cool.  From my notes I though it was smooth and nice, and I was getting drunker by midday.

Current house beer..12 oz bottle.  Great for the summer . good carbonation, a really clean pilsener.  In total accoed with JAF737300:  all American pilseners should be this good.   Can drink this beer all day.
This is what the american pilsners should be like!  It has a nice aromas of hops.  The palate is frsh and has nice light notes of malt and hops.  This drinks very well!

A Sim rate (Draught at Lucia’s 70th shindig): Smells of hops and malt and is surprisingly not too offensive. Appearance is watery and fizzy with no head at all. Flavour is malty but bland, slightly citric with an almost unpleasant finish.

Beer No.1 on my Berlin trip, from the Buffet car on the train from Paris. This will explain my brief notes: Very carbonated. Malty. Sweet short finish. I wasn’t impressed. A woman in the same compartment as me said ’Ah, in German this is a very cheap beer’. I trusted that better awaited me.
12oz bottle.  Pours golden, clear.  Head lost quickly.  Crisp hoppy aroma.  Lively carbonation.  Good malt.  Sweet bread finish.  Overall good German.

Bottle.  Pale yellow pour with light head.  Not the best German pilsner I have tasted, but still pretty good.  I’m actually impressed that its not at all skunky and in an amber bottle.  Mouth feel was good and beer is definitely high on the drinkability scale.

500ml can. Not a whole lot to say about this one. Middle-of-the-road german pilsner, that’s still enjoyable but nothing remarkable. Worth a try if you’re into pilsners, it’s not skunky don’t worry (well, I didn’t find it to be skunky or unpleasant). EDIT: I was too harsh on this initially. It does have a bit of a weird plastic type flavour to it, but for some reason that seems to work? Nice malt profile actually with some nice Noble hop character. A go-to beer for me, as well as a solid party beer.

Bottle.  Pale yellow with a small head.  Smells like a worse pilsener than it actually is.  Taste has a little more hop than your average mass produced pilsner.  Not bad for a warm day, not that exciting either.

My instincts tell me this is just another common pilsener, but my eyes, feasting on that ornately Prussian label like an officer’s medal, can’t help but say “Now this is a real beer, a sophisticated beer, a gentleman’s beer!”  Well, I’m nearsighted.  My eyes can’t be trusted, and the Warsteiner Premium Verum did end up being just another pedestrian drink.  But I can see myself ordering it at a bar or restaurant, especially if the establishment’s touted “Global Selection” means all the world’s worst macros.  It’s a pale, sickly yellow beer, like an overworked orphan at the chemical factory.  A single pillar of carbonation rises from bottom to top in the direct radial center of the glass, feeding a mottled, sea foam head as it clings tightly to the glass sides and edges in a desperate bid to escape the receding beer line.  The smell is sticky and viscous, accumulating in the nose like geologic layers, oozing with honey, corn syrup, white grape juice and freshly cut green apple.  The taste is a blander version of the aroma with the added benefit of rough, wheat grain to balance out the sweeter bits.  The body is medium, moderate, in the middle and totally unexceptional.  Served cold the Warsteiner Premium Verum is a dessert and refreshment at the same time, but too much thought, consideration and time spent drinking it can spoil the effect.  It’s a mass produced pilsener after all, but one that slips the villainous connotations of nuts and skunk.  If I were trekking around Germany with a heavy camera around my neck and a backpack filled with guide books and souvenirs, this beer would look darn appealing, especially if it could be had at a friendly beer garden.
clear piss color reminiscent of natty, but strong german pilsener taste and flavor - good beer to get crunk at a bar

Pours a light clear yellow/straw. Aroma is strong with lager yeast followed by some spicy hop fragrance and a touch of sugary malts. The flavor starts very light - some sweet malt and some balancing, noble hop bitterness. The middle of the tongue finds the flavor mostly watery. The beer finishes crisp and light in body with an after-taste of sweet malts and a touch of hop bitterness. The carbonation provides a touch of acidic sting to the back of the tongue. Otherwise, the mouthfeel is rather light. Overall, nothing special.

Pale yellow with a white head. Aroma typical of Americna pale ales. A thin corney flavor with some lacing.
Thick finish.
lemon yellow color with a little creamy white head light thin and lively in the mouth aroma and taste of pepper apples and lemons subtle floral hops and grain

Fucking Great!!
With a very classic german aroma and palate,good colour, tasty for a pilsner like all the germans. Here in MEXICO 
a single 12 OZ bottle cost about 1.5 dollars and still very popular for a foreign bier. Export more styles,please dear Germany!!
For a mass produced beer this is pretty good,, nice hop taste with smooth finish, nice hop aroma and decent appearance.
On tap at the oasis in rockford.  very light color with a thin head. Big hop finish. Not for me.
Bottle:  Pours a clear yellow, small white head, very little lacing.  Nose is sweet with malty  tones and bread, taste is mostly the same.  Some light bitters in the tail.

Bottle-Poured a nice golden yellow, big creamy white head. Smell was nice. Sweet grass! Taste was pretty nice. Light, sweet malts, and grass, followed by a little bit of skunky after taste. Pretty decent beer for a hot spring day.
Bottle. Clear yellow colour with a white head. Aroma of citrus & faint notes of rubber. Grainy, yeasty flavour. Medium bitterness.
Pale yellow of color with a white head. A boring aroma of flat corn and some weak bitter aroma. A thin flavor with some notes of corn and hops.

Rated 9/14/06:  Yeah this is decent but extremely common. Grassy/grainy aroma, light yellow with a sizeable white head and moderate lacing. Sort of sticky and funky on the finish. Flavor is sweet and grainy with that typical euro lager flavor. Cheap import, standard fare.

In Can.
Brewed and Canned in Argentina.
Has a golden clear color, with a lasting head, very white. The aroma is well hoppy. In the palate the bitter one is balanced well, just. Light and carbonic body. I would say that it is a good standard European beer.
Aroma of grass and weak hops, thin golden colour, no head, cardboard taste, thirst quenching, but thats about it.

Bottle, 33 cl. Clear straw yellow, medium fluffy white head. Clean, bready malt aroma, with herbal hops. Light to medium bodied, decent mouthfeel. Dry with a long and pleasant bitterness. An average german pils, and very refreshing.

Argentinian version. Bottled at Zarate, Argetnina. Nice colour for an industrial beer. At least it has aroma! In the mouth hops,  corn syrup and sweet in the aftertaste. One of the best industrial pilsener.
Yellow with some bubbles.  Some bittering hops on top of a little maltiness.  Beats the hell out of American pale lagers that call themselves a pilsner, but still not my favorite style.
Typical German Pils and pretty good.  A fizzy yellow lager appearance and sweet taste with a fair bit of hoppiness evident.  Ziemlich gut!
Sweet corn and honey aroma. Pale golden in color with a thick fluffy head. Tastes of corn and barley with honey on the edges, only light hop finish.

bright yellow, thin foam with a weak aroma. flavor has light hops, corn like. very light in texture with not much after taste which can lead to puttting down a bunch without feeling full. my college party life would taste alot better with german beer instead og bud light kegs...

This one can really hit the spot on a hot summer day. Better than your regular BMC crap, but still nothing really extraordinary. A cornflake nose with a light grassy hop character. Bright pee-yellow like color with a thin fluffy white head. Flavor is light cornflake and very light grassy hops. Finishes clean with little to no aftertaste. Easy drinking, hardly complex. Great German lawnmower beer.
Very pale yellow in colour, sour hop nose, with a light fresh laggery hop flavour.
Straw and an OK head. The aroma is weak with notes of malt and hops, and the flavour is sweetish with notes of malt and hops and a refreshing bitterness. It’s boring. 1702
Clear, pale golden color with a decent head.  Aroma is slightly grainy with a bit of pils malt and light hops.  Taste is cheap and adjuncty (is that a word?)  Not something I would seek out.
Bottle. So this is wheaty and fruity in both taste and smell, but with the bitter apple skin aftertaste and better malt than most pils I’ve had. Nice and refreshing.
Bottle.Pale clear yellow.Corn and hay aroma.Light bodied.Mild hops bitterness.Slight sweetness.Easy to drink.OK.

Pours clear, pale golden with a small creamy head that lasts. Aroma is Northern European lager yeast and corn cereal. Taste is same, with some sweetness that makes it slightly more palatable than some of this style. Palate is thin, watery, and qualifies this beer for lawnmowing time only.
I Drink a lot of this beer in Germany, mainly at train trip. Its look like some other pilsen beer but a little more better. I really like this one.
Bottle.  Pale color pour, aroma and taste are classic German Pilsener.  Nothing outstanding about this beer, though it is very drinkable.
It is alrigh, nothing impressive. Not much head, but it is refreshing with a hint of fruitiness.

Rated 2006-04-15. Light golden, small white head which vanishes quickly, almost no lace. Mild, fruity and corn-malty aroma. Light bodied. Bit sweet and fruity, corn-malty flavor. Boring corn-malty bulk lager.
if i had to compare it with something, i’d call it a kicked up version of budweiser, but not really that much better. bottle pours light golden color with little head, decent taste but not great.
A below average Classic German Pilsener. Aroma of corn. Taste of adjuncts of corn, grain and nastiness. Light gold pour with no head. Blah

Bouteille. Couleur or clair, mousse mince qui reste et colle au verre. Arôme bien frais et houblonné et légèrement malté. Goût malté, floral, un peu de sucre. Finale gouteuse avec amertume assez faible. Corps un peu faible et effervescence moyenne. Aurait préféré plus d’aromes de houblon. Pils correct.
Bottle.  Clear yellow colour with small white mostly diminishing head.  malty aroma with hints of grain and straw. watery palate

Bottle; poured a clear gold with carbonation bubbles and some small specks of something.  Aroma actually wasnt bad; some hops to complement normal expected aroma.  Had a good body and palate; with some noticable hops.  A decent beer, but not something I would actively try again.

12 oz brown bottle. Pop the lid and get a whiff of cabbage family cooked vegetables. After it ends up in the glass it is much more attractive, has a plastic or chemical sterile aroma.  The look of this beer is rather different than others.  At first I thought that it was full of fine bubbles that was not rising to the top but upon closer inspection I see these are some kind of particles in there floating around. This is interesting and hypnotizing, I hope I just don’t have a bad bottle. I looked in the bottom of the bottle, like a wheat beer, and there is no sludge on the bottom, go figure. Other than that the beer is pale yellow with a ring around the inside of the glass for a head. Very smooth initial flavors. It has the same kind of flavor that the aroma insists. It’s not plastic or chemical in a bad way, it seems very refined and controlled. There is a slight hop or malt bitterness that builds on the back of the throat. Enjoyable with just the right amount of bitter personality. The carbonation provides just the right amount of tingle on the back of your tongue. The bitterness that builds as you drink keeps trying to insult the back of my throat but really never quite gets there. Overall a well mannered refined and cultivated German beer taste. I’m sorry I waited so long to taste this.

beer festival. run of the mill generic. kind of nothing. tastes a bit like dirt. maybe this was meant for people after they got drunk who didn’t REALLY want to have beer anymore or couldn’t tell the difference?
germany can come up with and expect more than this, can’t they!? cornponey with decent body and a nice backwash. i don’t have more time. budweiser of germany.
Made in Argentina. Good head and golden colour. good body for an industrial beer. Not a wonderful beer but a good choice in this range.

This Pil poured a clear yellow with a bright white head. To the nose...typical for this type, corn & malt. First sip is watery and full of corn. Nothing special. Not bad but boring. Palate is the same.

Bottle Clear gold pour with lots of carbonation bubbles on the glass. Thin white head that lasts, but no lacing. Light typical pils aroma, bit of hops and some wheat. Light flavor, a bit sour in the beginning.  Not bad for a pils, but I’ve had better.
Bottle. Lekker looking beer, pale gold with a thick lasting white head.  Not much aroma.  Smooth malty flavour with a bit of a bite.  Short finish, hoppy, then bland, then almost peppery.

Cerveja pilsen fabricada na Argentina, fórmula alemã. Refrescante e um pouco encorpada, parecida com as premiuns brasileiras. Cheiro gostoso de lúpulo, espuma branca de pouca presença, coloração dourada. Amargor seco presente mas não muito forte, retrogosto também amargo (lúpulo). No barril vindo da Alemanha: traços de mel no retrogosto - muito boa, não deixando de ser amarga um só segundo.

Bottle. Golden color. Grainy, malty aroma. Very little head. Very crisp, dry beer. A bite at first that smooths out. Almost has a wheaty taste. Fairly bitter. Not that good at first, but it has a unique taste that grew on me. It didn’t hurt that they were complimentary on the airline.
Last bottle at the bar, dated 7/06. Mild malt and hop flavor, somewhat roasty and nutty with a bitter finish. Okay overall

Love this. It’s true life is too short to drink cheap beer. Love walking around the old american concentration camp during a german festival. Cute girls walking around and dudes in lederhosens. I hang out under the oak trees drinking straight from the pitcher. Oh best time of the year.
Poors a nice golden coulor, nice head, very grainy, very little hops, with a mild bitter finish.
Can 0,5l. 4,7%. Pale golden coloured. Looks like dirty water. A large white fluffy head when poured from a distance. Flavor of grain and bread. Some bitterness in the finish.

[rerate]  Pours yellow with a medium sudsy head.  Grassy aroma.  Sweet malt and some very grassy hop bite.  Light fizzy carbonation, watery body.  Gave it a 1.8 a year ago....tastes better now... but I do remember it being tastless/lifeless the first time I rated it.

[Canned. Gift from Gnoff]
Pale golden colour. Grainy, bit bold flavour profile with low bitterness. Fatty malts. Pretty useless.

(Canned, thanks Gnoff) Pours pale golden. Light skunk-ish aroma with hoppy tones of herbs mostly but also some grass and maybe some flowers. Malty and grainy with notes of bread and hay. Medium sweet with notes of marzipan. Medium sweet flavour with some hoppy tones. Light bitter and sourish. Malty, light bitter and some tiny off flavours in the finish. Decent, nothing more.

What do expect from a german pils. It’s smooth, that’s about it. Even compared to other pilsners, this beer has very subdued, grassy/sweet flavours with almost no hops. Eh. I prefer a Prima Pils or Pilsner Urquel. I just hate grainy beers. Good alternative for women who usually drink BL.

Pours a light almost translucent gold with a faint head. Aroma is very grainy. Flavor is grains, sweet malts and a touch of citrus. A pretty bland but refreshing pilsner. A decent summer beer I would guess.
Bottle. yellow with a thin white head. Malt and hops in the somewhat weak aroma. A little malt and slightly more hops in the flavor. Rather watery on the palate. Short, primarily bitter finish.

Light ever so slightly skunked aroma. Pretty clear bubbly gold color. Hoppy, alittle skunked (at such small amount skunk might be a good thing to some) very light taste. Very little aftertaste (except for the hops). Can’t detect much flavor at all. Best drank cold. Watery highly carbonated feel.  It was alright. Good for a cheap beer. Rather have killians though if I wanted to go this cheap.
Draught, a clear gold with a large foamy white head. A malty aroma with a hoppy grassiness. Quite smooth with a crisp finish. Malty with some citrus hop.
Fairly and a bit acidic. Light in color and slightly watery with a thin head. Probably worth a try for a beginner looking to see what they might be interested in.
Quite good for a cheaper beer. Good and malty with detectable hops. Very light in color.

Really quite a bland beer. Doesn’t taste or smell like anything special though it has a deeper palate than most North American beers. I would not recommend buying a 6-pack of this like I did. really just an average beer.

Claims to be the best beer from Germany, however I have never seen it in Germany proclaiming the same thing. I have never seen it even on draught. A nice smell of hops, but the appearance is very light yellow, like bud light. Goes down smooth and has an alright flavor. Worth a dry. A dinner beer, not a sipping beer.
No aroma and watery, lite golden with a head that quickly disappeared.  Fairly bland mix of hops and malts.  Mild bitter finish.

An agreeable pilsener.  Has some nice hops, herbal flavors.  A little nutty, clean, with a touch of toffee.  Had on tap at a steakhouse where nothing good was available.  Haven’t had since, but good in a pinch.
Poured from a bottle, grassy and mild lemon aromas. Milds hoppy flavor, not too much to this beer. Decent at best.

Bottle--Watery yellowed color with a white head that lasted a short time.  So far, pretty typical.  Aroma is a little weka but can detect some hops.  Taste confirms aroma and appearance.  A little watery with some hops.  For the style it’s not too bad and I’d drink it if it were offered to me but I’m not going out of my way to get one.

Watery, dense but little consistent cream, metallic taste and none aftertaste noteworthy.........................................PORTUGUÊS: Aguada, creme denso mas pouco consistente, gosto metálico e nenhum retrogosto digno de nota.
this one is great in a bottle and even better from a mini keg! I was suprised how much i like this although it takes some getting used to tastewise.
Can. Yellow colour with a big bubbly short lasting white head. Aroma of some malt and hops. Flavour of some malt, hops, bit bitter. Crisp beer.

Bottle. White high creamy and lasting head. Clear golden body. Mild malt aroma with lemon notes. Sweet flavor of corn sirup with  hay and grassy notes. Thin mouthfeel with sugary aftertaste without much bitterness.

On tap at The Tap House. Pours light amber with a thin but lacy white head. Nuts, caramel and noble hop nose. Medium-light body and carbonation. Biscuit-y caramel taste. Crisp finish that treads surprisingly close to macro lagers.

Bottle. Nice color and decent aroma but very weak taste.  Not much to go on as far as flavor, almost bitter even.
Will probably use the rest for cooking

We can call this "baby" Pepe Le Pew.  I immediately think of Heineken, but not nearly as strong, when I pour this German Pilsner.  It pours nicely beginning with a thick white head which diminishes at a moderate pace.  It starts out on the ok (slightly drinkable) side and, like the head, diminishes with each swig.  The skunk aroma is not a turn off for me but just does not seem to be done right.  Very light bodied with a touch of sweet maltiness.  As I continue to drink "baby" Pepe Le Pew, he begins to grow up a little and get stronger, especially in the finish.  This would be the Bud Light of German beers.  Toodles.

Bottle. Head was spare to small with a white slightly frothy sparkle. Spare lacing. Clear slightly sparkling body. Color was pale yellow. Aroma was light hay, straw, grass with some notes of sweetness. Light bodied with a thin texture and an average carbonation. Light sweet flavor with light notes of bitterness. Short finish.

Bottle.  A very average Pilsener--and one of the better easy-to-find beers in Argentina, where I drank it.  Warsteiner is heavily marketed to the "Cone Countries" of South America (possibly because of the German heritage of some of the people there).

12 oz bottle via LS. Pours clear yellow/gold with a small head that dissipates in the blink of an eye. Nice fruity yeasty aroma with some wheat notes although i do not believe this is a wheat beer. Taste is very malt driven driven, with excessive carbonation that makes it hard to discern any flavors. Grainy aftertaste. Wish they would NOT make a beer that is so prickly i feel like i am drinking a very carbonated soda..what’s the point? Am i suppsoed to let it sit in the glass for 2 hours and then drink it just so i can taste something under the fizz?!

Yeah.....I don’t care if it comes from Germany or not, I know macro swill when I taste it. Corn flavor and very thin. Tastes almost like a cream ale. To be fair, I don’t get into Pilsner much. Kind of like Kolsch, I just don’t have the nuanced taste buds to pick anything up other then whole bunch of something boring. That being said, it is cold beer and I do have the day off of work....
Bottle. I liked this German Pilsener. Decent color and aroma. Not the best to come out of Warsteiner, but a good beer.

Prior to the American microbrew revolution, I would have given this beer a higher score.  The grading curve has shifted quite a bit.  However, I still like a good German mainstream brew, and this is one of them.  Tasty, steady and definitely a product of the good ol’ Reinheitsgebot.  Recommended.

Corn, vegetables and grass in the aroma.  Thick, quickly dissipating bubbly head of one finger on a light golden body.  Flavor is astringent with metallic notes.  Watery and boring mouthfeel.  Canned, discount import without any virtues other than being an import.

They sell these in my area in 5 liter mini kegs, so we decided to pick one up. It was my first German Pilsener, and I enjoyed it very much. Not much head but the head that is there lingers for quite a while. Grassy aroma and an interesting taste. As others have said, almost biscuit.

Overall, it’s not a bad buy, especially since it comes in a mini keg.

Tried this and liked this, I agree this is a standard German pils but I liked it alot. Crisp and clean with a decent hop profile. Smells fairly decent without skunk too. Nothing outstanding but a good little session beer. I would have this beer again.
Bottled. Clear pale yellow with a white medium head. Aroma is grassy hop. The body is light and the flavor is mild. Well hopped.
Huge fluffy white head.  Clear golden-yellow color.  Hoppy aroma, minimal malt presence.  Standard Pilsener-ish flavors...but a bit light overall.  Not horrendous, but not special by any means.

Okay.. standard German pils.. but still excellent despite its bland and uncomplex flavor.  This brew is meant for quaffing in quantity, and it excels at that.  Cheap beer, but excellent beer.  Take it for what it is.

I know I know  but I like pils styles of beer/bier it was desighned to drink and not for a fancy taste test arena. Sour corn aroma, beautiful gold color, short lived white head. wet lightly hopped flavor short lived grass after taste.

I can see I’m in the minority on this, but I thought this beer was a pretty decent European-style lager.

Poured a fairly handsome golden color with abundant white head with limited staying power.

Aroma smelled a bit like corn, but I believe this beer is in accordance with Reinheitsgabot (sic?), so I don’t think that’s what I was getting.

Flavor was slght malt flavor, but still tasted like a German-style pilsner and was fairly crisp, refreshing, and drinkable.
Bottled. Poured yellow typicalwhite head. Hint of a sour aroma. Corn flavorith a  slight malt taste..Thin body very watery. I did not enjoy this too much.
Completely terrible. One of the worst beers ever experienced. Flat and watery taste with no head or carbonation. Poorly executed.
Bottle/draft.  Another average offering in the long line of mass-produced pilseners.  Mainstream German bier that delivers nothing special.
Pretty average german beer. Quite easy on the hops compared to regional beers and short aftertaste. Easy drinking, but nothing bad.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of hops and malt with a short bitter finish.
Bottle. Good appearance of pale blonde with a good size head. Decent flavor of spices. Smooth but not really flavorfull. Too much of a watery feel and aftertaste.
Nice clean golden colour, good aroma, mild flavor of hops, a nice tasing Pilsner
My favorite commercial pilsener. A great golden beer with a great thick head. Just the right bitterness and a aroma of baked bread.

I love this beer.  The Dunkel offering is far better, of course, but this regular Warsteiner is a great beer to sip as well.  It is, in my opinion, the best of the major German regular beers.  Soft and easy on the palate with hints of maize and subtle wheat.  Enjoy many!
Pale yellow, small white head. Aroma is maizy and ricy, with hints of hops. Flavor is a syrup laced with malt. Kinda thick on the swallow. Not very good. The Bud of Germany.

A hint of apple, white wine and corn aroma.  A sweet smelling beer.  Virtually no head, but a sparkling body that is a bright pale-yellow.  An initially moderate bitter and light sweet flavour with a light bitter short finish.  A light and dry beer whose flavour may be enhanced by a meal (chicken, fish).  A crisp German Pilsner

Pours a bright pale yellow w/ a short lived, spritzy froth. Aroma of skunky German malted gains. Medium nectar w/ ample residual effers. A fruity brew w/ a slightly bittered finish. Flavors of malted grains are forward. Very simple and uninteresting.
Aroma of yeast and corn...Nice golden colour, very smooth and virtually no head

I fell in love with this beer right from the first sip.  Clear golden colour with a nice head.  Mildly bitter and very smooth, but without tasting watered down in any way.  A very easy drinking beer, my favourite lager.
Great slogan.  Average beer.  Clear yellow color with no head.  Aroma of hops and yeast.  Taste is smooth for a pilsner with yeast and hops dominating.
Deep straw in color with a small white head. Aroma and flavor is very clean and crisp, grainy malt and faint hops. Finishes thin and dry.

Cold 12oz bottle:  Pours a clear golden yellow color with a very thin layer of alabaster bubbles, mostly around the edges, that leaves some lacing.  Aroma is of fresh baked biscuits! Yum!  Taste is light malts and liquid biscuit. Light bodied, crisp and well carbonated. Ending is malty with a hint of earthy hops. Light biscuit aftertaste.

Pours a transparent bright golden with a thin, fizzy, wispy-lacing white head.  Standard lager aroma of roasted corn and Saaz hops.  Body starts in much the same way with some mild sweetness before a stinging carbonation and drier bitterness set in.  Not very fresh or balanced enough to be true to the style or worth sampling again.

Gold color, with a thin head. Minimal lace. Clean aroma, and the flavor follows along. Sweet malt up front, but a then very pleasant bitterness takes over. Moderately quick finish. Nicely carbonated, and very refreshing. Go ahead, have a couple!

12 oz bottle. Clear pale gold color with thin white head. It has that pale grainy maltiness to the aroma. I can also pick up on the smell of floral spice hops. Tastes just as it smells with grainy Munich style malts plus floral spicy hops. Refreshing brew although a bit lacking in depth. It also comes off a bit watery. There is a nice hop bite that lingers in the aftertaste.
This is a pretty good lager. it has the bitters so thats a big plus, its got OK foamers. its quite clean and i guess its above average by euro lager standards but not by that much.

Can. Pale yellow/golden. Snowy white, fluffy head. Good laces. Very weak aroma, hints og malt and hops. Clean taste, but also weak and bland malt and grain flavors. Surprisingly low hopbitterness for the type. High carbonation level, short dry finish. Drinkable, but light all over.
Draught. Pours a clear yellow colour with a longlasting white head. Malty grassy aroma with some griny hints. Sweet malty grassy flavor. Dry malty bitter finish.

12oz bottle.  may have to re-rate.  Good beer, havent had it in awhile so Im going on whim here.  I remember it having a decnt body, and it was much better tasting than anything i was drinking at the time.  We’ll see.

Re-rated: had a 12er of this, what a mistake, a friend talked me into it. So skunky and grassy. I would never have it again, bvery unenjoyable.

Bottle. Mid-gold with a thin white head. The beer itself is very lively, quite carbonated, bubbles away for some time. Nose is wheaty, hay and grass. Taste is sweet, malty, but also refreshing and easy drinking. Palate is sweet, but unobtrusive. Quite a refreshing drink.
Very nice taste.  Goes down smooth.  Nice sweet flavor.  Could drink this all the time.  I think this would be great to fill in for or replace any standard session.  Thank you Germany.

1 pt .9 floz bottle from Hy-Vee Liquors poured into flute - Pours gold with a one finger white head; Skunk and a little hops to the nose; Rice, corn, VERY light hops and a little grassy note on the initial taste; Malty, sweet backtaste; No real visible carbonation; It’s ok...better than some that I’ve had...not too many though.
Bottle. Light yellow in color with a decent head. Not as flavorful as Urquell but, still pretty good. Way, way better than any American lager. I like this beer and drink it from time to time.
The flavor is muted, not alot going on here, but this is a smooth, drinkable beer.

This is a kind of been there done that kind of a beer. It really adds nothing to the style and is just there. Sure, it is a nice and smooth pilsnener with a refreshing taste. Frankly, I would rather try something new, even if it is worse than this beer. If you haven’t tried it, drink it... you might like it more than I did.
Light malty with mild hop undertones. Good everyday europils. A reliable and refreshing mass produced lager.
mild sweetness, pale,to me like tastes what budweiser advertises itself to be,minor grassy appeal, and just a little skunky but not enough to complain. A decent super distro lager.

Bottle. Pours with a pale straw color and a medium head. Typical German pilsner, with aromas of grains, bread and a certain bitterness.
Flavors of hops, and grains, with the required mustiness kickin in at the end.
like has been said a reg lager, ohh actually for anyone out there reading its a Pilsner. dont want anything to be wrong. some hops, easy drinking, some grassyness. nice summer lager

Pours a very pale yellow golden with thin white head. Decent aroma of crisp malt and grassyness (German lager). Light and crisp beer, ideal for a session beer. Crisp, grassy with a light hop touch and a clean light slightly sweet corn malt background. One of the better mass produced lagers.
Richmond Oktoberfest 2006.  Yellow body, thick white head.  Couldn’t catach an aroma, but the flavour is surprisingly rich for one used to American pissers.  Sweet, grainy and a little hoppy.
Clear golden yellow body with a medium white head. Sweet honey aroma. Some light grain and some light grassy hops.
Pours yellow with a generous white head.  Smells lemony with some minor misc. hoppy elements.  Tastes light and malty with some hoppy notes.  Sessionable but boring.

5l Keg: Beady clear gold with a tight white head. Cordial-like grainy and floral notes in the nose. This continues in the mouth with touches of corn added to the grain, and some faint bitterness added to the floral hop notes. OK.
there is nothing great about this beer. has a good aroma and color but i think it would be good in germany.
Bottle.  Pours light gold with a white head.  Grassy, slightly hoppy, and slightly malty aroma.  Flavor is similar.  Refreshing and wholly decent, but doesn’t stand out from the crowd by any stretch.
On tap at the Virginia Beach Brewfest. Light gold with a decent white head. Mildly grassy, slightly grainy nose, sweetly malty. Flavor is more of the same. Decent but unspectacular.

Light golden color.  Thick white head, dissipated quickly.  Mild grassy, skunky aroma.  Strong hoppy flavor--lots of metal and charcoal.  Bitter/sour aftertaste.  I didn’t like this one...just not my style.
Bottle in Berlin. An extrememly ordinary pilsener. Not sure that I finished the bottle... one of those beers that makes you wonder if it’s worth adding to the beer gut for so little reward.

12 oz. bottle.  Pale color.  This is beer has a lot of hoppy flavor, though not enough to make a statement.  I would say it’s one of the better pilsners you can buy in the states for a dollar a bottle.
Very light yellow, but good hop smell and taste. One of the lower priced German pilsners---but very decent.
Have tried from tap and it is simply one VERY nice refreshing beer.  It is not the most special. Light, with nice head, dry.

Pours a very pale yellow with a small, lumpy head. A little sweet with some hops and a bitter finish. Not great, but fine in a pinch. Didn’t think I’d ever see "Naturally Brewed According to the German Purity Law" and "hop extract" on the same bottle; I suppose I misunderstood the rule...

(bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a big and slowly lacing blonde foam. Slightly sweet and slightly sour grainy and herbal hoppy nose with faint traces of grassiness. Light-bitter flavour, soft malty, slightly grainy taste, light to medium bodied, crispy MF; quite dry and mild malty, light-bitter finish with shy hints of grassy hops. Boring.
it is a Scientology beer but it tastes well like hop, it is no beer to drink only one bottle and enjoy the taste of beer but it is to drink a lot of it

Bottle, picked up at the Dodgy Deli’, Cowley Rd, Oxford, 15-09-06. This was quite a bit different after a few darker heavier numbers, and whilst not a stunner it went down well with my curry.  Pours light yellow with a good clarity not a lot on the nose maybe some floral notes, but a crisp refreshing taste, some hops present in the taste dept’ absolutely fine relaible pilsner.

This is quite a good pizza beer. Lightly floral in the nose, a good crisp alcohol mouthfeel, perfect for washing down gobs of molten cheese and peperoni. The finish is rather mild for a pilsner, which makes this brew good for hot days. Downsides? Not very complex or exciting. A good daily drinker.

Bottle: Nicely hopped aroma, it’s got a wonderful nose.  Apearence it pours a straw yellow with a medium head that dissipates quickly into a soupy film with very nice lacing.  Taste is nicely hoppy and bitter, with a little metalic twinge to it.  Palate is slightly bitter, carbonated, fizzy, and rather short.  Overall, a nice German Pils refreshing and smooth going down.
25cl bottle, served on a Lufthansa flight from Frankfurt to Nurenberg.Pleasant floral aroma, bright straw colour with short lived white head. Refreshing hoppy flavour.

Cant believe I havent reviewed this one before. Used to drink it often years and years ago.
Served from a 500ml bottle.
In appearance its just your typical run of the mill pilsner, pale golden with a thickish pure white head.
Aroma is mainlly of grassy hops but its compartivlly weak.
Nice enough taste, this has good malt but the grassy/spicy hop is more dominant. 
I really liked the mouthfeel on this one, quite smooth and no problem at all to gag one down.
An average beer, good in hot weather.
500ml bottle. Pours clear yellow with minimal head. Decent, refreshing beer with grassy/hoppy tastes dominating. Not too disimilar to a Bit.
Buddy of mine uses this as his octoberfest barell.  First time I tried it fell in love...Fine Beer!

Fairly crap. Pours golden with a large head that quickly leaves, Aroma is grainy. Goes down ok, but leaves with a skunky aftertaste. I didnt finish. This is one of the beer beers commonly available in Panama. What a shame.

Very light gold color, disappearing fizzy head.  Aroma of fresh straw, grain, earth and hops.  Familiar imported German pilsner flavor, light body with a mild hoppy finish.  Good but basically run of the mill, nothing to write home about.  I think I once had this on a Lufthansa flight.

(draft @ The Old Toad - Rochester, NY) Clear yellow color with a fizzy white head. Aroma is slightly dry and bitter with some hints of hops. The flavor is very bitter and hoppy at the front but the bitterness disappears quickly and leaves a very nice clean finish. A bit watery, but a good pilsner.
Bottle: Pours like every pilsner I’ve ever seen. Taste is kinda sweet and ver carbinated.  Smells of grass.  Not much else.  I am not big on pilseners though
Yellow coloured liquid. Mainly no head. Not much aroma. Flavor is mild but has no special notes.
(bottle from irishboy)yellow body witha nice white head.aroma was of wheat,hay,and caramel malts.flavor was much of the same.

500 mL can.  Yellow with sticky white head.  Nice grassy aroma.  Don’t get the bitterness - just mild malty sweetness.  Looks carbonated, but tastes a bit skunky/flat.  Drinkable, but kinda disappointing.

Pours pale, clear yellow with small white head that quickly vanishes.  Nose is rather faint sweet corn, minimal floral hops.  My initial flavor impression is malty sweetness, with only mild bitterness towards the end.  Oily mouthfeel, minimal carbonation.  OK I guess.
A fantastic lager from the heart of Germany. What a brew... it’s unobtrusive, wheaty, clean, refreshing, absolutely no trace of anything unpleasent. Yum.

Aroma: musty, hops, countryside, wheat.

Appearance: light yellow, some white head.

Flavor: bitter, slightly sweet, well balanced, slightly papery.

Palate: boring, thin, slimy, fizzy.
Can. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruity malt and apple. Flavour is fruity malt and apple.
Draft at First Floor, a pub on Portabello Road in London. A solid beer in a huge glass. Very refreshing taste. Tasty with little afterbite.

Poured a pale golden colour with a pure white head that settled into a thin lacing and just the right amount of carbonation. Aroma is subtle with grainys and hops. Taste is just what the aroma promises with a great balance of bitterness to it. I found it to be rather refreshing after a hot day at work.
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Nice hopy aroma. Slight bitter flavor, short finish. OK watery low carbonated palate. Deasent Cl. Ger. Pils.
Bottle. Light golden appearance, clear, a minimal head, medium body, fairly lively.  Average German Pilsener.
yellow with white head. Light taste of spicy hops and pilsner malts. watery typical lager texture. Ok pleasant short finish. slight bitterness.

when i first tried this i thought it was flat, its a very soft carbonation to say the least. Its easy to drink which can be good if u want something softer but with flavour. Has a short bittery aftertaste.
Maybe I should have chilled this beer more.  Appearance is pretty poor, general light gold with no head.  Tastes to grainy for my liking.
On tap. A nice pils/lager. Good quality hops and a little more malt than some pilsener types. Crisp yet smooth, very pleasant finish.
Carmelly, rich at start. Not a lot of carbonation. Smooth with an earthy finish.

From the tap, served in a Warsteiner pilsener glass.

Poured a clear pale golden with a foamy white head that settled into a thin lacing, leaving ring lacing.

Aromas of sweet crackerish pilsener malts and hayish and spicy hoppiness.

Crisp and dry, with good carbonation, smooth light bodied mouthfeel.

Dry grainy and cracker maltiness balanced by a hayish and spicy hoppiness, a little herbalness and a dry hoppy and malty finish, good pilsener drinkability.

A pilsener to have on a hot summer, I’m going to pick up a mini-keg of this soon.

Can. Yellov colour, white foam.Aroma Sweet aromatic maltyness and citric, bitternes in the end.
Thin body, with a balanced bitternes and sweet maltyness. Short bitter finish.
For me, really one of the best German pils out there. Hadn’t realized til just now that I hadn’t rated it.  Easy to drink, no downsides.

Hey, it’s an average north-german style pils! The thin, shrill note of hops above the very tame mildly-sweet malt body... just enough clear identity to be ’ein richtiges Bier’, but maybe a little mild mannered as to avoid to glare of any frowning, über-conservative faces. It is just what it tries to be, the very wallpaper of measured German life.

In Leipiz, Germany.  Draft. Came clear and light yellow.  Some hops and decent nose.  Decent mouthfeel.  A really basic pils that is so common in Germany.  Always good, but rarely great. But always enjoyable. Why can’t they makes pilsner like this in the US?
Clear straw body with white head. The aroma is herbal and slightly skunked. The flavor is lemon, bready and herbal. The mouthfeel is light.
This had a good head.Aroma was malty with a deep malty aroma.tated like a musty malty beer.I really didn’t like it.Won’t buy again.
Dull gold hue – no head – sweet corn, bread, cinnamon nose- bitter, malt, skunk, cat urine taste- light body- cat pee, bitter skunk aftertaste

Bottle in Stuttgart.  A delicate pils that is quite refreshing.  Less bitter than most German pils and much less sweet than hefe, it leaves you feeling clean.  It doesn’t have a lot of colour in its taste, and could easily be considered boring, but has been very enjoyable at the right times.

’King of Pilseners’, no less. Maybe an outside claimant to the throne. Crystal pale pils with a buttery sweetness, elegantly tempered by a crisp finishing dryness. Not remotely representative of the (typically much more bitter) style of most German Pilseners, but bready, delicate, appetising and...delicious?Draught sample(s) at a sausage stall in Lubeck.
Poured a clear yellow color with a small white head.  Aroma of dough and grain.  Malty flavor with some doughy notes.  Crisp lightly bitter finish.
On tap. Light golden in colour with a small white head. Weak and thin. Notes of malt and hops. Too sterile.
Keg at Roma, Oxford. Pale gold with big white head. Light, dry, wheaty beer with heavy maltiness. If there is hop, it was too subtle for me. Crispness seems to be the key, it was ok but not special.

Bottle (from Bitter Virtue, BB Apr 07). Pale watery appearance. Light spicy straw hop aroma with perhaps a little almost fruity English edge to it. Smooth malt body.Quite drinkable but other than the delicate hops at the start not much of interest.

330ml bottle bought at a supermarked in Crete. Pale yellow. Disappearing white foam. Very light malty aroma. Vague taste of malt extract. Dry finish. Not exactly  "Eine Königin unter den Bieren" (28.05.2006).
Can brought to Sweden from Germany by a friend of mine. Clear light yellow color, small white head. Malty scent, malty sour taste. Medium bitterness. Medium body. Spicy aftertaste.
Bottle. Pours pale golden with a decent sized white head. Aroma of grain,  hops, and slight citrus. Flavor is grainy, slightly bitter, and malty. Not a bad brew at all.
Yellow. I thought German beers would a little bit more to them. Granted I had it in the U.S. but it seemed like a boring light beer.

Pale yellow gold, generous head with medium retention. Sharp grainy aroma, faintly hoppy. Light in the mouth, mostly grainy pale malt with a subtle hop bitterness in the finish. Not nearly the amount of bitterness I expected, given some of the other classic german pilseners I’ve tried.

330ml bottle. Truly golden, average sized, white head. Smells like a king of hops. This aroma is later returned in the aftertaste. What happens in between is hard to put in words, but it’s certainly not good. The palate promises good but the taste is just... damp. Lapin Kulta if you know what I mean...
Clear gold with a small white head. Malty aroma with some citrus notes. Malty flavor with some pleasant hoppy bitterness in the finish.
Inoffensive German Pilsner, it has a pleasant dry finish but it’s a bit one dimensional as far as the taste goes. Nothing really memorable about Warsteiner one way or another but it is easy to quaff.

Very pale yellow, extremely clear with beautiful bubbles. Good foamy clear white head. Aroma is mostly malty with citric undertones. The taste is more complicated. Quite dry and harsh with limtited sweetness. A little bitterness that stays for a while.
(0.33L Bottle) Pours golden with small white head. Malty and hoppy with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Tastes very similar to others in the category.
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Golden color (slightly pale). Aroma is malt and hops. Taste is malt and hops as well.

Bottled.  It had a malty and grainy taste. Although it had a slight, bitter aftertaste, but it was not offensive enough for me to throw it to the bins. Warsteiner is way better than Beck’s in my opinion.

While it wasn’t terrible or anything, it had an unplesant striking quality to it going down that didn’t impress me.  Maybe it was because I had one shortly after drinking an Erdinger (which is just SO good), but something just seemed a bit off.
Well, it poured yellow and had a small head. Beer started out pretty good, but I think it was a bit skunked. Something didn’t seem right. I might have to try again later.
I often forget how good this beer is untiI make the mistake of buying lesser beers.  It has a smooth taste and a clean finish, yet it’s not too heavy to enjoy on a hot day.

Pours pale yellow with a good sized head that leaves fairly quickly.  Aroma is sweet grain with light mustiness.  Very thin body, light carbonation.  Mellow malts on the first taste and the finish is sour hoppy.  While this is not my favorite style, this is kind of boring even for a pilsener.  Easy to drink and was very unobtrusive with the soup I had it with.

bottle - Pours yellow with a thin, fading head.  Light malt aroma.  The flavor is fairly typical for the big brewery, pale European beers.  They have gotten the hops balanced nicely and the lively mouthfeel is not unpleasant.  The finish is crisp.  It’s not bad, but nothing to get excited about.  I’ll agree that their Dunkel is better.
On tap. Pours yellow with a decent white head.  Not much aroma present. Maybe a hint of sweet malt aroma, but that’s about it. Nice balance of hops and malt. A bit thin, but very easy to drink.
Nice alternative to BMC. Light yellow with a sustaining head. Touch of lemon/citrus at the beginning with a crisp finish.

Pale golden with a white head. Sweet malt aroma is promising, but the flavour is a bit thin and watery until the dry, lasting finish. 19.10.09 On draught at Hotel Lindos Blu, Rhodes, Greece. It was a choice between this and Amstel. Sweet and not bitter enough thought I on this occasion. 5,3,4,3,8:2.3
Solid middle of the road german beer.  One that I can easily find in Italy.  Nice to fall back on.

Can. Clear, pale golden with a dense, medium, white head. Grassy and light fruity aroma. Mild aroma dominated by mild(!) hops. Watery body and a hoppy finish. The nice, lasting head is the reason for giving it a 3 on appearance. (060404)
Not much aroma, and a very typical Pils apperence. Flavor is very good. A fairly robust palate. One of my new favorite Pils!
Classic Continental lager, good hoppy beer for the price. Nice grassy nose, light malt flavour and a crisp clean finish.
Average weak pils. Straw gold, slightly lively pour.Hints of sweetness and wet hay. Easy to drink, but nothing special.
Pours a yellow/gold color with a large white head. Aroma of sweet malts, subtle hops, and grassy notes. Flavor is carbonated, smooth, a real weak flavor, swet, and malty. O.K. brew, nothing great.
This is a ery light beer with a big light head of foam. I do have to say it was very refreshing.
good pilsner sparkles very nicely in a glass very crisp taste not much else to say about it.
Fine pilsner.  Some suds and a some bubbles. Bitter hoppiness, grassiness and salty.  Clean and refreshing.  Not much to complain about, not much to rave about.

if you are drinking this beer, circumstances have made that happen.  now, native german beers are pretty good.  but this is basically a becks/heineken beer that’s undermarketed with the purposes of making it seem more presitigious.  it’s dry, kinda flat-tasting, and unimpressive overall.  i’d rather have a real beer

Best Before August 19th, 2006 bottle consumed on 2/24/2006.  Bottle was kept in a cooler
Clear, bright hay with slowly rising, large bubbles.  Fair amount of white head that is retained, somewhat at a small cover, simply due to the fact that there is so much carbonation in this.  There certainly is no lacing.  Smells powdery (baby powder, powdered sugar, whatever).  Hops are certainly there at first, but rather soggy, reminding of wet, dying (yellow) grass.  Very weak strength aroma-wise.  Hmmmm, biting carbonation upon first sip, highly carbonic, dry, bland straw and a mouthfull of dry, dead grass.  Some powdery, borderline vanilla-tasting malt sugars.  Almost plasticy on end, with just tons of dry straw, unbalanced lemongrass and noxious, disruptive carbonation.  Watery and almost sourish towards the end.  Straw soaked in seltzer water, with cheap hop extract bitterness, no flavoring hops.  Watery texture, awfully powdery finish.  A poorly made pale lager, in the worst sense of the term, with an exceptional amount of bitterness (for a pale lager).  Definite apple skins in the aroma upon warming somewhat.  Compound flaws,  I’ll stop now.
"Poured a light golden color with medium head. Aroma was of malts and some herbs mabye. Typical pilsner flavor very green. Not a huge fan of this one will pass next time."
The color of a traditional lager. Well balanced with Hints of apple for the middle the palate. Virtually nonexistent head. Metallic aftertaste.

Sweet yellow colored beer snot. No head. Sugary bred, slightly bittern doughiness. Nothing special going on here. Slight sourness in the malts/ A tad bit of hop bitterness shines through. Flavors are yellow...literally what can be said of them. Cold and watery, thirst quenching. Souredge. nothing else.

From bottle



Poured  yellow, with white head. Aroma was sour. Flavor of corn, and slight malt. Light mouthfeel, very watered down. Not impressed compared with their Dunkel

Pours from bottle with a huge fluffy head, typical of a North German Pils. Clean aroma, but not much in the way of hops, which surprises me. Distinctive malt and hops flavor. Easy drinking beer. I liked it a lot.
Not as good as other German Pils. Seems watered down and bland. Goes fairly well with spicy wings though.
a very light almost clear pale yellow color. Pours a desent head which Mostly diminished very qucikly. every easy to drink with not much of a after taste. overall good but not great.

12 oz. bottle:

Pours a very clear pale yellow with good but not overwhelming head. Head is fairly dense and subsides to a finger in a minute or less with a little lacing. Smell is mostly of hops, though not much aroma at all. Tastes mostly of hops, then malt. Pretty smooth with just a hint of bitterness in the aftertaste. Tastes more carbonated than it looked or poured. Does not taste as "fresh" as a Plsner Urquell and the bitter aftertaste is a bit harsher, but it is still a very drinkable beer that can be enjoyed one after another.
Yellow straw colour with dissipating head and quite a bit of carbonation.  Grassy aroma and a flavour of honey.  A nice average pil that’s fairly balanced.

Mine poured a slightly hazy pale gold.  Light white head that dissipated quickly.  Smells...bad.  Tastes, suprisingly better than I thought from my smell impressions.  Light tasting, not too shabby.  just kind of a boring drink.
Overall I was not too thrilled with this pilsner.  Beer seemed old and stale.  Some skunk to it as well.  Will not be trying this beer again.

Had on tap in Germany (12/7/05).  Initial hops smell pleasantly light and fresh, although somewhat light and lacking in presence.  This beer suffers from the mass brew syndrome that includes an inconsistent body with a stale taste.  Malt is a bit corn flavored with minimal bitterness.  Seems inspired by american pale lagers.
Clear golden color, small white head.  Bread-like aroma.  Flavor is nothing special, just tastes like plain beer.  Boring.  I like Harp better.

A decent mass brew.  Has a bit more bite to it than the average lager/pilsner, a tad more hop, and nothing offensive came off in the flavour, which seems to happen to me a lot with mass brews.  Goes pretty good with fajitas, very refreshing.
Not a bad beer, pale golden colour with a fair head that lasts for ages. Similar flavour to becks i guess, similar beer int it. Not bad.
Not a bad beer.  The beer pours out a a golden color with generous head.  it smells of malt with a noticable amount of hops.  Good hop character for a mass produced pils.  finish is clean.

Draught at the Flying Saucer in Raleigh, NC. Clear light golden color with thin white head. Skunky, but not unpleasant hop nose and flavor typical of European pilsners. Dry with a hint of honey flavor. Pleasant grainy finish that reminds me of corn on the cob.
Great golden color with a decent head.  The nose is aromatic with a nice balance.  Good beer.
Golden colour with a medium mostly lasting white head. aroma of malt and hobs. Nive smooth body. Good beer.
50 cl can. Pale golden colour with nice fluffy head. Aroma of hops and hints of malt. Also nice hoppy flavour combined with a soft sweet maltness. Refreshing and nice for a pilsner.

A good beer, was my favorite until I got started drinking microbrews.  Nicely hopped, good taste, little aftertaste, nice color.  If I have to buy beer and there are no good microbrews around, this owuld be my first choice.
Golden, thin white head, pretty standard beer, a lot like a heineken, with the hoppy bite to it mixed with crap beer.
Pours a bright gold yellow color.  Aromas of hops and malts.  Flavor is good hop and malt balance.  Big hop finish and dry aftertaste.
Not delicious. Hazy golden amber pour. Dusky old grain aroma. Flavor of dusty and moldy grain. But, not really impressive for the style. Finishes skunky.

Had about 4 of these at a Christmas party.  Unfortunetly I didn’t have a glass to pour into, so this rating is straight out the bottle.  Aroma was malty and grainy.  Flavor was lightly bitter, some citrus.  A little more flavorful and some more hops than other German pilseners I’ve had.  Was an alright session beer. Would pick this over the standard American macro brews anyday.
does have good carbonation.  colour is pale and light. aroma is a bit malty and wheaty.  taste is nothing fantastic, does have good body. overall nothing to rave about.

Argentinian licensed version: 
 Pours a very clear golden color, lively carbonated as most lagers, white head with some retention. Aroma is nothing special: grainy and malty. Flavor is medium bitter with some citric notes, just a little stronger than normal lagers. Decent mouthfeel for the Pilsener style. Not as refreshing as others but with a bit more flavor. Not specially enjoyable.
A classic brew from germany with a nice smell and color. However, the finish is quite long and bitter.
Pretty golden beer with a large white head sweet taste and a bitter aftertaste with a kick. it make you feel like your in a rain storm and you cant find your frisbee

1. On Tap at Wilkie’s Tavern, Warrington 04/02/2003
Clear golden coloured with a pale aroma. Bitter crisp finish.
2. On Tap at the Trades Club, Hebden Bridge 10/12/2005
Clear golden crisp and hoppy pils with some bitterness and dryness in a smooth finish.
3. On Tap at Kro Piccadilly, Manchester 04/04/2010
Malty aroma. Carbonation. Small white head. Clear golden coloured and hoppy with a hint of dryness in a crisp full malt finish.

Medium yellow with a huge white head that caps as a thin film leaving average lace. Burning damp cardboard & vegetal DMS in aroma with grassy hops. OK flavor with herbal bitterness in a light-bodied lager. I could live without this.


Jewel/Osco, Oak Lawn, IL 60453

Re-rate: Bottle.  Pours a light golden-yellow with a creamy thick white head and good carbonation.  In the running for my favorite Pils.  A semi-sweet herbal taste with a dash of bitterness.  Nice, dark overtones, a good pour, a beautiful sight. [3.4]Update in early 2008: Grassy nose with a goodly dollop of citrus, clear yellow-golden pour with heavy carbonation and a rich, soapy, rocky (brilliantly) white head.  Taste managed to encompass both a rich maltiness with grassy, bready, citric overtones as well as a distinct hoppiness that unfortunately veers toward the macro level.  Medium body with a touch of corn in the maltiness, but I’m not accusing anyone of adjuncts.  Light bitterness in with the sweetness, and only an occasional dose of bitterness, in the abstract sense.  Definitely chuggable, and a huge step up over BMC, but there’s still enough here for this to be enjoyed solo; it’s not a PIls I lust for, but it still more than gets the job done, here after four years! [3.0]
a beatiful looking pils, clear and smooth.  decent flavor and mouth feel, this brew is easy to drink.  well balanced.
Not good. Comparable to American Lagers, which are next to tasteless. No body, no taste, nothing.

On tap at Chalet Alpina, Forest Hills, Queens, NYC.  Clear golden yellow pils having a small white head with fair lacing. Fresh sweet malt and hop aromas. Soft carbonation.  Light bodied that starts with clean tasting sweet malt and hop flavors. Finishes dry with lingering hop bitterness. A clean refreshing pils beer. Goes great with smoked pork loin and pickled red cabbage.

From the Can: Pours medium gold with thin white head. All-round pPretty average German Pilsner. 
Grassy smelling, slight skunk undertones. 
Flavour is sweeter (malty)  and a bit more full compared to other mainstream pils. But nothing worth elaborating on.
Oh my god! This fresh pilsner is just so great. In case that you like refreshing beers that gives you a kick, Warsteiner will be a good subject.
Perfectly golden pour, with a long-holding white head.  Very slightly sweet aroma, a bit yeasty, but no too much.  Perfect finish, and perfect balance of bitterness.  One of my favorites.

330ml Bottle, 4.8%. Very little carbonation evident, gorgeous golden color with a quickly dissapating white head. Smells like my lawn after i cut the grass! Tastes sort of bitter on the tongue with a quick finish. Very smooth palate.

all of the brands that call there beer: king or queen, are realy not better than cheap brands.
Even worser are fore example BUD AND WARSTEINER
I’ve had worse lagers, I’ve had better lagers, this is pretty average. Alright for watching the football (soccer) in the pub.
Found the hops lacking in this one.  All I could really make out from the aroma and flavor was yeast.  Nice pale gold color and creamy head.  Smooth finish.  Cheers!

5 Liter keg: Poured from the keg a crystal clear gold and was topped by a huge amount of foam.  The head never went died out during any point of drinking so it added to a smooth and creamy palate making this pils a highly quaffable lager. Aroma has light grained malt and has a faint grass smell as well.  Flavor was somewhat bland and boring of barley malt with notes of sour grass. The keg kind of transformed a nitro feel and a rich creamy texture to the flavor, so i was able to enoy the flavor because of the combination created.

Lightish yellow gold with absolutely no head. Malty nose, old fashioned, lacks lift. Firm palate with good length.  Feels like good balance b/w hops and malt, but does has a decent level of bitterness on the finish.

Very pale gold. The white head fades fast. Odd nose...grassy?? Flavour is slightly malty and thats about it really. Used to like this lots years ago when Peter Dominic (a now extinct off licence chain) used to sell it, obviously my tastes have changed.

Canned.
Clear yellow coloured with a white head.
Aroma of malts, corn and hops.
Flavour of malts, corn and hops.

US Bottle Pour - Fizzy yellow body with a medium-sized, white frothy head. Aroma - Heavy citrus, some alcohol, some yeasty notes. Flavor - Starts off lightly sweet and heads towards a dry, bitter finish. Some citrus and grainy notes with definate alcohol in there. Light-Medium body.

I really like this beer.  Nice look, good pour, crisp taste, clean finish, its easy to find.  Light for a German beer, but hell Im American I can appreciate a good light beer.  The bottle has a very classy look to it too.
500 ml can. Nothing to get excited about here. Light yellow colour. Quickly dissipating head. Very little lacing. Aroma of bread. Tastes rather watered down.

Warsteiner is a very popular beer for Americans in Geremany.  Perhaps it is their Bud.  It looks a bit like a Bud product.  Its aroma, however, is BAD.  Sour and mashie smelling it is to the point of being offensive.  Its flavor is better but run of the mill.  Pretty smooth tasting with a hint of bitterness and malt.

Pours out a light off gold color, minimal head.  Nose is grainy, bits of hop, a some hints of malt.  Flavor is crisp, works on a hot day. Moslty lacking in flavor, but a nice sweetness rounds nicely with the light malt.
A pale goldenbeer with a firm head. The aroma  is a bit hoppy. A taste of hops and. a bit malty. An average pilsener. (can 33cl)
Almost no taste.  Smells like skunk.  Really light yellow color.  Might be better in a really really hot weater.

A very standard pils - all the basics you’d expect are there, a nice crisp bitterness, refreshing, drinkable, hoppy. But, nothing particularly exciting. Not worth going out of your way for but certainly better than many lagers.

Poured smoothly leaving a small head that disappeared quickly.  No lace to speak of (in this glass I’m drinking as I rate).

Aroma was sharp and clean initially, but disappeared fast.

Clean taste, bitterness evident.  Washes over all parts of the tongue with good results.  Balance seems to tip slightly in favor of hops.  Slight hops-bitter aftertaste, pleasant and not overwhelming.  Seems middle of the road in regards to body, not full and filling, but yet, not watery and insubstantial either. 

Overall impression is favorable.  I’d stock my fridge with this over Bud/MGD any day, and in fact, I do.  This is my fallback beer while I go off experimenting.

An easy to drink light beer.  Pours golden light with little to not head... no lacing either.  Palet.. yea right...  Very 1 deminitional... starts and finishes the same.... Very simularto Amstel Light....  drinkable... just not much going on.
Pours a nice golden color with a little head that leaves real quick.  The taste was just bad.  I really didn’t like it start to finish.  Looking forward to not having it in my frig.
You can drink a lot of them, because they’re so light.  Not much flavor, but does have the big difference that separates it from American boredom.

Looks like a dark urine. Like that piss you take right after you get punched in the kidneys. Pale white head. Aroma is nothing. A rubbery skunk aroma at best. A bit maltier than a BMC, but still no taste. The only thing classic about this is nothing. There is absolutely nothing classic here....at all.
Not an outstanding Pils, but has some lingering bitterness. Can tell that it is the most popular beer in Germany, Even if you don’t really like beer, you can drink a Warsteiner.

Biggish white coarse head, clear, pale yellow body. Aroma is
relatively faint (on an airplane, at least), mostly pilsner hops.
Very clean and smooth mouthfeel with little taste; aftertaste is a
lovely rounded bitterness, with strong hop notes. Very bitter for a
pilsener. For a pilsener this is not bad at all, but perhaps a bit too
much metal in the aftertaste. (0.33l bottle.)
An unappetizing color, thin head. Stale smell. Not hoppy, mediocre malts. At least it finishes quickly.
Pour is a piss yellow with a white head.  Aroma is a very sickly smelling graininess.  Flavor is a syrup laced with malt.  Kinda thick on the swallow.  Not very good.  The Bud of Germany.
Bottle, poured into a Oktoberfest mug.  It was a solid yellow color with a small head.  Fresh grass smell with a crisp finish, nothing special but it was nice drinking it along with a German band!
Bottle. Again, not much to say about this beer. The aroma was not so good, and the taste, blarg... Artificial.
A soft, pleasant pilesner, served on a Lufthansa plane. The hops are present, but not intrusive. Flowery boquet and smell.
Wartseiner Premium Verum has a no hop aroma and some malt.  The color is a light golden with a quickly diminishing white head.  There is some bitterness and malt flavor.

Pale golden body with a foamy white head and just about no lacing.  Sligtly malty aroma but some corn and veggies in there as well.  Veggie tastes, corn and maybe some peas.  A slight bump of sweet malts before a bitter finish.  Lingering bitterness.

Draft.  I really wanted the warsteiner half-liter glass mug.  Super pale clear yellow pour.  Light hop aroma, and actually found some malt in there too.  Maybe a bit grassy smelling too.  Not much more going on flavor-wise.  Crisp and clean finishing.

Bottle. This is very very overrated. Some bland hops in the aroma, but also some skunk and the stuff they add to natural gas so it has odor. The flavor is initially quite apply, but descends into cleaning chemicals and ramps. It leaves an annoying, lingering garbage aftertaste, too. Yuck.

bottle. Pours a really pale translucent gold with an actual head, so it could be worse. The aroma is of light hops, faint skunk, and a strange gassy odor that I can’t really identify but is definitely unpleasant. The flavor is not better, it’s really light with some hops in the mix of plastic and finish of wild onions.

Very pale blond, small layer of white head. Dill and mint hops. Sweet, almost toothpaste-like smells. Flavor is lightly hoppy, sweet, a little bit of toastiness, a little medicinal in the finish. Palate is light, but not completely watery. A bit more substance than the average mass-market version, but none of the magic of a truly great pils.
33cl bottle Unwins. Palegold. Quite a nice hop nose, bit of cereal in the mouth then lemony acids and hop finish. Ok for a lager
Clear but not very lively looking. Mild malt aroma. A little sour. A get some DMS. Surprisingly undercarbonated. OK malt flavor with cardboard and cheesy hops.

Draft at SDBC.  Nothing exciting here.  Tasted better than water, but wasn’t much to talk about.  Thin head and thin lacing.  Aromas were practially non-existant, flavors were there, but a little skunky.
Much paler than I expected. Still it was quite refreshing.  Not as much carbonation as I would like.  Probably would eb better paired with some food.
Can. Usual lager colour and taste. Not a bad beer but there’s nothing really new here. Ok though.

Bottle.  Pours clear with good carbonation but little head.  Very light gold color.  Pleasant mouth feel - slightly bitter but the overall experience is excellent. Great on a hot day but not sure it would be a good, everyday beer.  Would look for something with more character.  Still, a pleasant experience, better than most in it’s class. Recommended.
A nice sweet and malt taste.  the aftertaste is not too bitter.  It has a nice golden color.  The body is thicker than I expected, and it covers the palate well.
This is the most tasteful pislner I have had.  Smooth and sweet.  Try it on tap and not bottle.  I think most people will change their minds.
Bottled. A nice surprise with good mouth feel compared to other North German pilsners. Malty flavor with some sweetness balanced by some assertive bitterness.

12 oz bottle pours pale golden with a white head that dissipates rather quickly. Aroma is of hay and new sneakers.  Flavor is grainy.  Some barley and corn taste followed by a semi bitter hop finish.  On the palate this is crisp and clean.  I’m surprised that this beer claims to be Germany’s number 1 anything.  Drinkable but that is it.

Lager light apperance, with cascading carbonation.  The brew has a strong ’beery’ aroma that is dry and malty.  Lively mouthfeel and more mundane malt in the body.  Probably not bad on a hot day, kinda like a kicked up Budweiser.  Could be a gateway beer for some.
Well it didn’t taste like a German Pils to me.  Not enough hops.  A decent beer but marketed and produced for the masses.  Which makes it better than an American macro, but that is it.
About as good as you can get for a pilsner.  has some nice bitterness.  I think the Dunkel is better.

Supposedly one of the top selling beers in Germany, which doesn’t say much about the beer itself except it seems just another part of a clever marketing campaign. Beer writer James D. Robertson wrote twenty years ago of ’a very fine Pilsener’ with ’complex malt and hop aroma, and flavour’, so I was expecting a little more than was served up. Maybe big business has reeled its ugly head! Clear pale gold with very fine, light carbonation failing to keep its initially fluffy white head on for longer than the first sip. Overly generous unfermented and gritty malt, and haystack chaff aroma (a little like my breakfast cereal). The aroma wasn’t unclean, but more reminiscent of barnyard musty. Similar to the aroma in the mouth which gave the feeling of a non-alcoholic ’Near beer’ with its gluggy, gritty and lightly toasted malt flavour and bready yeast feel. It had a little balance in the back with some grassy and slightly sour hops. Finish is malty and sour with a long lingering effect like spent grains. It was generous in flavour, which I suppose was it failing point as it came across as clumsy and didn’t get any better towards the end of the glass. Disappointing!!! (33cL bottle, BBE 08/05)
Just kind of blah.  The best I can muster to say about this beer is that I poured with a nice head.  I was also very dry, crisp and refreshing.  It just doesn’t taste very good.
Not too impressed. Had this one just after having an Icehouse and still wasn’t impressed.  Figure that may be a decent sign of mediocrity.
Here it goes,. At first pour, the head seemed good, but in a few seconds ( the time to grab the cheese in the kitchen) it disappeared. Good malt taste and arome. Color is a good brigth gold.

Aroma:good malt aroma,light cooked vegetable...
Appearance:yellow fizzy beer...
Flavor:Good malt flavor,light hops...
