On tap at Angel Inn,notl. Piss/apple yellow, medium white head that disapated in a few minutes. Carbonated, watery. Typical pils/lager with apple, lemon and wheat tones. Had 2 as it grew on me but shouldve just had a Guiness. Won’t drink it again.

I poured this from a bottle and the head seems decent and the beer has some nice bubbling going on but the taste seems pretty simple-it has your usual German Pilsener elements with some copperiness, wheatiness and a bit of a bite in the aftertaste thrown in there. That dry bite is all I really enjoy here. The rest of it is uneventful. I think what makes me not to want another one is that lemony stale smell/flavor that I detect.

TAP at Matthews; Ocean Beach.  A disappointment for an overpriced, supposedly "premium" selection.  Apple juice yellow with a small white head and an indestinct flavor that reminded me of the Reingold I recently tried.  Frankly, the Rheingold was more enjoyable and drinkable.  Given a choice now, I’d take the two Rheingolds you could get for the price of one of these. BUY AGAIN: No

Can shared with HogTownHarry. Pours a clear light yellow with a small white head. Looks like apple juice mixed with water. Aroma of sugar, sweet malt and yeast. Way too sweet. The flavour is super: super watery and super sweet! Tastes like sugar water. Ugh! Avoid.

Can (500ml) shared with blankboy.   Poured a hazy, very light yellow, very bubbly to start, huge foamy, almost soapy white head, surprisingly almost no lacing.  Smell was strongly of icing sugar (guh!), lemon oil, chalk, floral air freshener, grain (wheat/flax), some stale hops, metals.  Flavour was harsh malt - that confectioner’s sugar again - , sour lemonade, mixed grains and minerals.  Mouthfeel astringent, metallic and ultimately liefless.  Nasty.
Hoppy aroma with hints off flowers. Clear yellow colour with good head. Bitter sweet hoppy flavour. Fizzy palate.

Overall this is a very average beer.  Nothing to write home about; somewhat bland taste, and dominated by carbonation.  I would consider this a step up from your Budweiser’s, Miller’s, Michelob’s, etc.

If you want a lager thats boring yet superior, this is the one. I’d classify this as the elite Budweiser. It’s still offers little. Try it, but it’s not worth the money with beers like Yuengling around... that is... if that’s what you like.
Bottle.  Really an overrated beer; there’s plenty of better stuff in Germany, even the bigger breweries.  Hoppy nose but mostly sweet malt flavors, and too much carbonation.

I never got this beer. Always thought of it as one of Germany’s worst, but it is treated like it’s this venerable classic. It’s drinkable, but over carbonated which makes having more than a few a chore for me.
Nice golden color. Nice and light Pilsener. Goes down smooth with ease and leave a dry but enjoyable aftertaste. Above average , not bad at all.
Bought a mini keg of this for the superbowl in 05. This went down smooth with a sweet flavor and slight dry after taste, very enjoyable.
Berlin - Pours gold with a decent head.  Fresh wheat/hops nose with a similar slightly bitter taste.  Not bad at all for a round beer.

Nice cristal lemon yellow color with small snow white head. Fine and refreshing pils aroma with some faint citrussy touches and a fresh herbal touch of hops. Taste is good in balance and has a nice refreshing carbonation. It has again a very nice pils-malt taste with elegant refreshing hops.
This beer just seemed too light to me.  It had a light color, light flavor, a little bit of a beer aroma.  Nothing special.  This beer will never stand out to me as a good pilsner.
this is a real good easy drinking lighter beer.  Goes down smooth with a crisp clean taste.  A very good pilsner.

Got this one today in a birthday package from Germany. Much fresher than here in America, but that is expected. Light hoppiness, and very easy drinking, Nice gold color, Good fresh in Germany as a bbq beer, very refreshing.  Always liked Warsteiner.

Bottle. Very pale golden straw colour, with an average, transient head. Light hoppy aroma and flavour - typical pilsener really. A bit disappointing - a bit of a chore really. The most interesting thing about this beer is by reading the bottle I think I discovered that the Spanish translation for Germany is Alemania.
Pale gold with generous egg-shell white head. Very little aroma. Flavor is crisp, mild hops. Not much to suggest it over other European lagers (e.g. Heineken)
For a macro brew this is better than most of its peers.  Nice short lasting head.  Good taste for a pils.  Put this in a line up against most mass produced pils (Budvar exempt) and this should win.

I dont know what got me going on trying all these pilseners.  I dont much care for them. but here goes...  This one is not bad.  Pilsener aroma, pilsener flavor. flavor is also a little funky and salty but not in a negative way.  good balance.

Pours a clear yellow with a low head.  Taste is classic pilsner, with light malt and hops.  It’s not the best beer going, but beats the heck out of American macros.  A light offering that makes a good session beer.

not bad. Not bad at all. Golden straw, light hops, on the nose. Smoth light palate with a simple white head, no lacing, medium carbonation. Mild herbal notes dancing with light bitter hops, with some sweet golden grassy malt. Just lovley, for a pilsner that is. I dont realy drink pilsner, but hey, I was at a beer festival so I gave it a try, great simple hot sun lager, much better than the macro-lager of this part of the world. Cheers
A bit light on the hops for a german pilsner.  This one was described to me as bieng like a budweiser with taste. That seems appropriate.

Sparkling gold, white creamy head.  Nose held notes of sweet corn, grassy hops and light fruity tones.  Similar in taste with herbal grassy notes throughout.  Light to medium bodied, prickly carbonation, crisp, dry, fruity finish.  For free it was fine, but would never go out of my way for another one either...
Pale straw like appearance with plenty of body.Low carbonisation and a nice fresh aroma maked this one stand out.
(Bottle)  Pours a clear golden body with a moderate white head.  Aroma of grass and caramel.  Slightly sweet malt flavor.

(Bottle 50 cl) Bright, pale golden with a rather subdued head. Soft and slightly sweetish. But first and foremost this is mild - much milder than the typical North-German pilsener. Only a discreet hoppy finish. Very pleasant. 141099 and 100205

a very clear beer with a bit dusty taste in the beginning.
Easy drinkable.
A pretty good pilsner in my opinion.
Had this in Paris near the Eiffel Tower.  OMG it was just like PBR!  Loved it!  I only wish it was PBR, so it loses points for not being THE PBR.

I really should just give up on German pilsners. Noble-type hop aroma and flavor are quite obvious. Despite the malty back flavor, this beer is just too one-dimensional, way too hoppy, almost skunky.  It’s pretty, to be sure -- pretty average. Better than Budweiser, but not worth the price.
In can at the CBC studio in Ottawa. Golden lager with a crisp hoppy aroma, German in style. Good bready malt with sharp german hops, crisp and refreshing in mouth. Medium bodied. Thanks to our CBC!

On tap into Shaker glass, Beer Sellar, Nashville TN.  Pale yellow with a white head, mostly diminishing.  Yeast, orange peel in the nose.  Flavor was a nice intensity (yeasty, lemony with a bit of Munich malt), but the body was light and watery.
Bright pale yellow color, big foamy head, with good lace, floral hay, herbal, pale malt follows throughon a light-bodied palate with sweet pale malt and crisp floral hop in a light bitter finish.
Big head; but  has a bland taste                                                                      .

On tap at the Pizza Iolanda near the Eiffel Tower.  Ordered the "serieux" size.  Cear yellow color with a thick head.  Smells like PBR.  Clean taste.  Nothing special until the big malt burst in the aftertaste.

Average German Pils.  Not quite upto St. Pauli or Becks though they claim to import more to us than either. But with that way of thinking Miller and Bud are our best because of being our biggest exports?! Anyway this seemed a little light and lacking substance even for a pils.  Nothing bad per se, just nothing that gets your attention.
(can) Better than expected.  Nice hops, clean finish; though a little weak. Nothing special, but a good everyday beer.
nice pilsner, aroma hmm so so , taste is allright nice maltsweetness hopbitter, good balance and carbonation. finish is almost lingering, for a pilsner a good thing.

Golden straw coloured with a massive white head that stands proudly for several minutes snubbing its nose to American macrobrew imposters. Little aroma and a simple balanced flavour.  Similar to Becks and St.Pauli’s, if you like Pilsners you will appreciate this beer, I still prefer the Dunkel.  Not exotic or memorable enough to drink as a celebratory beer, but if you’re going to drink alot of German beer on tap, this would be a good choice.
Ho-hum German pils. Pale gold, short head. Light, hoppy nose with some hay-like notes and peaches. Thin bodied, no length. Unremarkable.
yellow color, no aroma, elusive flavor.  can this even be considered a beer?
Way too light and timid.  Or maybe this isn’t the best choice to be following an Imperial IPA?   But a decent hop bitterness turns things around for me in the end.
pale, golden, clear, white foam, light body, fizzy, thin feel.  pretty good i think.  decent.

Poured very light gold - totally clear, some bubbles, decent head.  No appreciable aroma, but nothing offensive either.  Solid taste, nice hoppy finish.  Drinkable and refreshing.  I agree with the slogan on the bottle, "life is too short to drink cheap beer," but am not sure it applies to this one.  Decent.

Aroma and color are like an American macro. Slightly corny, and very light gold. Flavor is grainy(corn)? with low hoppiness and maltiness. Like it has been diluted with water. A German version of Coors. Not terrible. But not what I would consider an example of true German style.
Grassy and lemony aroma; somewhat on the sweet side, initially, finishes a tad dry and simple; crispy, clean, and drinkable

Pours clear straw-yellow in color with decent white head.  Slightly malty aroma with a little hops.  Good balance in the flavor as well.  Nice, crisp, and refreshing.  There are much better Pilseners out there, but I don’t think this is as bad of an example of many of the other raters.

Very mediocre I thought. Pale Ale fans might like it though. I was surprised by the fruity hoppiness of this beer. Poured very watery looking. Nice sized white head. Palate was decent with fairly bitter finish. If this is the "Classic German Pilsener" German beers are in trouble. Quite disappointing.
22 Oct 2004 - Simple slight fruit sweet aroma.  Clear yellow colour, suds lacing lowish head.  Simple ordinary but pleasant euro trash flavour.  Easy drinking palate that lingers a little.

12oz bottle. Served at 44.5° in my Duvel tulip. Light golden color with a small white head. Aroma is slightly lemony, with some hops notes. There is a small malt presence with a mild fruit/citrus taste. There is a touch of bitterness (not much) and the finish is clean. I don’t much care for Pilsener’s, but this is pretty good for one.

Light golden color, small white head, sweet  aroma. Light to medium malt flavor quickly dissipates, sharp initial taste of hops, seemed strong in carbonation, not a full bodied brew. This is a good tasting beer when I am in the mood for a lighter taste than my usual stronger flavored beer.

The bottle poured a pale golden crystal clear liquid. There was a medium rocky head that dissipated quickly leaving little to no lacing. The aroma was uncomplicated with notes of malt and a slight floral character coming through. The flavor has a slight cat-pee bitterness at first. It has a smooth mouthfeel. The middle is bitter and dry and the finish mercifully doesn’t last long and is slightly bitter.
another average german beer not that impressive. something that is good to buy if you want to have a decent import with a cool name but nothing more than that

enjoyed at local restaurant,

served in warsteiner glass (I was impressed) 

nice head and nose, complimented appetizer of toasted ravioli and crab dip well, clean crisp taste, good example of this type of beer, but nothing exceptional

Would drink again

The german equivalent to "Bud" ! Very watery, unpleasant "chemical" smell and nearly no traces of good - and expensive (!) - aromatic hops.
What’s the difference between a "Warsteiner" and sex on the beach ? There’s no difference; both is f...... near to water.......
Yellow with white head. Very tame with out much going on. Very average if not below average.

i did not detect any skunk aroma on this beer.  pours a brilliantly clear pale gold.  stable fluffy white head.  sweet, worty, honey aroma.  flavor has a nice floral hop note from the use of light stable hop extract.  hop extract is a great alternative for imported beer, however, the aroma may suffer slightly.  clean finish and light, highly palatable body.  could drink this by the liter.  perfect carbonation.  awesome.

Why isn’t this available in Croatia ? I certainly don’t know. It’s a good pils.  Brought by a friend from Germany. Pours a yellow-going-gold, with a nice and firm looking head. The aroma is malty and a bit lemonic. The taste is quite similar, fruity and malty for the most part. Also, its well hopped. Could use a bit more body, but it’s ok. Seems to be good when fresh, and this sample was. Still, nothing groundbreaking.

Looks like your boring, standard light-gold lager. Exciting, forward aromas of hop and grain, plus some pleasant skunkiness/cat’s pee. Nice, dry mouthfeel. Lots of grain in the flavour department, with a growing bitter-hop presence towards the middle and finish. Looks are deceiving: Warsteiner is significantly better than your stardard light-gold lager.
Very pale straw colour.  Maizy grainy grippy flavours like eating from a grain silo.  Could chew on this all week.  Not bad but to grippy for me.

1/2 liter can. Pours a pale straw with a 1 finger fizzy head not great retention moderate lacing. Little aroma...some detectable grainy sweetness over slight herbal tones. Wet mouth feel, some bready malt, some herbal hops, finishes fast and clean...seems like an average German Pilsner to me...slightly better than domestic mega suds and almost as indistinct.
Better then pilsners I’ve tried, Could drink six at one sitting  and then room for something more, not a speacial treat, but a good simple beer.

(12 oz bottle: Trader Joe’s in Pacific Beach, CA) Ugh.  Can I stop there?  Must I drink another sip?  Does "Ugh" tell you all you need to know?  This is another subpar German import, the flavor dominated by grain and a light, but unpleasant hops that shows some moderate bitterness in the finish.  Slight hops aroma in the nose, but the aroma of the malt is bordering on unpleasant.  At least it’s not skunky, though that’s little solice.  Bright yellow color and fully clear, which allows the multitude of rapidly rising carbonation bubbles to put on quite a show.  It looks like carbonated piss, but there’s just something mesmerizing about a yellow fizzy beer with lots of bubbles.  The white head is kind of one big sticky clump that holds together and gradually shrinks to a thin, but complete layer over the beer.  In fact, the head sticks together so well that it doesn’t leave even a trace of lacing on the glass.  I vow to never even consider buying this beer again.
Bottled. Pale yellow, small white head. Aroma is maizy and ricy, with hints of hops. Taste is mainly maizy and hoppy. Dries your mouth. Big wellknown brew but poor beer in my opinion.
Bottle. Golden clear color with small white head. Little aroma of hops. Flavor was small tone of hops with short finish. Drinkable as bar alternative.

Pours pale golden color with some white foamy head.  Aroma is sweet and malty with some hoppy notes.  Flavor is nice and smooth, bitter, and grassy.  I agree with other raters that it makes a good pair with food.  Overall, I enjoyed it.
(on bottle) Clear and pale golden brew. Avery strong hoppy nose and  also the taste is perky and full of hops. The finish is perfect, not gassy at all, but pearly and fresh.
Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is malty with some bitterness. Flavor is mostly bitter and hoppy.
Not a bad beer. Very easy to drink. Has a very hoppy wheaty taste to it. Almost taste like a liquid pretzel. Has a slightly watery taste but a enjoyable brew.

Nothing special but very drinkable. Slightly better than most pilseners, fairly wellbodied. Golden coloured, white head that leaves a lace after a short while but something remains at least. Medium hoppy bitterness. Not good. Not bad.
A little bitter and floral.  Light clear yellow color.  Decent pils and good for having a light meal.  This is a beer to eat with, unlike some big beers that are meals in themselves.
Nothing real impressive, yet not bad.  Hoppy in a good way. Was great at my nieces 1 year old birthday party.
Servicable, light.  Not terrible, but not impressive. Slightly sour, slight aftertaste.  Color is nice, thin head.  Better to drink cold, as it gets skunkier when it gets warmer.

Straw pour, large white head, lots of carbonation.  Grainy and light hop aroma.  Maybe some light skunk from the Saaz hops.   LIght feel, clean and crisp.  Not much flavor, some sweet malts, light hops bitterness.  Dull.  LIke my life.

Bottle, at Lufthansa.
Yellow with big head, nice lacings. Light aroma of malt and hops. Bitter taste of hops with long duration. Good pilsener.

Clear pale yellow with a thick white head. Aroma is grainy and malty with some skunkyness. Taste shows the same qualities as the aroma plus a some notes of lemon, grassiness and pilsner saaz-type hops. Pretty sweet, moderately bitter hop finish. Medium body with fizzy carbonation. Good head retention. Good balance, crisp. Not bad.
Medium Head/.  You can really taste the hops on this one.  The malty flavors clings on your mouth for a while.

all though the aroma was kind of an offensive skunky- malt note. The beer’s flavor was not all that bad.  Really smooth and good malt character.  Which consistened of corn, bread, and a slight citrus note.  kind of a dull apperance.
This beer has the worst aroma i’ve ever smelled.  It smells like ripped open skunk cabbage and it tastes like it too.   Worst mistake buying it

I’ve had this one both on tap and bottled, both in Germany and in the U.S.  It tasted pretty much the same each time.  It doesn’t have much aroma; there is a nice crisp bitterness to it though.  It is pretty smooth, but a bit thin.  There is less complexity to the malt than I like out of a Pilsener.  In spite of not being the best, it is widely available and is noticeably better than Becks, although noticeably worse than Bitburger or a number of other slightly harder-to-obtain German brews.

Bottle poured golden yellow with a decent head, no carbonation.
Grassy aroma like a malt liquer.
Flavor was like colt 45 just not as bad.
Watery body.

From Germany via Argentina! Great looking beer - amazing clarity with pretty decent head retention. Doesn’t smell as good as it tastes, but there’s some nice decocted malt and a very mild dried oregano hop character but it’s spoilt a bit by a fair bit of pineapple and a tiny bit of yeastiness. Very nice, tight malt character, with a LONG hop flavour (I always struggle to describe the flavour of German hops, but it tastes very German - bordering on minty but not quite) and a tiny bit of prawn shell saltiness. Simple but really good. Considering the number of shortcuts this brewery takes, the fact that this beer is so good is really an indictment on every other big brewer (and a few small ones too).

This was appropriately described to me as the German equivalent to Budweiser.  Rocky white head that dissappeared like my dog when she heard the word "bath":...Had an icky  rotten veggie aroma....thankfully it tasted much better than it smelled.  I don’t think I’d buy it.
Looking forward to trying the rest of the family.Cool soothing flavor . Light hoops and I think a hint of wheat .Good to great aftertaste fine burb and a good aroma.
Tap. Golden coler little head, ugly... Smell and taste really bad... the beer must be to old or something, it’s discusting!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Not the favorite pils kinda guy, but when comparred with other mass produced German pils it is very good.  A good balance of hop dryness and maltyness that goes down pretty easy.  Good beer in general.

This beer has chemical and skunky undertones and is weak on flavor. And the flavor that it has is sour.  Probably the worst German beer I have ever had. Its the Coors Light of Germany. Leave this one on the shelf or use it as a paper weight.

In a bottle from a "Lagers of Europe" Christmas Present.

Pale golden yellow colour. Quite a "fresh" taste, slight bitterness. Not bad as Lagers go.

Light gold with nothing even vaguely resembling a head.  Nose hoppy, grassy, and somewhat skunked.  Flavor is very citric, marginally sweet, and a bit hoppy, but the unpleasant skunkiness pops up again.

Bottle.  I had this one about 10 or 12 times on my Lufthansa flight in March 2004 going to Frankfurt on my way to Rome.  I enjoyed it because they were all free (we got bumped in business class) and it was actually a pretty decent beer.  A light colored brew with a vanishing head.  A little hoppy and biting on the nose with bubbly carbonation and a light body.  Not bad stuff, not great.... but not bad.  A decent Pilsener.

Light yellow color, little vanishing white head. Lively carbonation. Mildly fenoly and hoppy aroma, nothing special. Fenols in flavor too, ends with medium hops and some alcohol tones. Medium carbonation. Standard mildly dry pilsner.

Palest pale yellow color, fine white head. Aromatic head, i.e. giving off the typical lager-type whiff. Fresh, citrusy, lemon, clean, simple, blah, blah, blah...I’m sorry, no matter how many times I try to come up with something new, fresh, original, unique, etc...there’s nothing I can do!! It’s a boring beer!!!
Classic Pilsner,pPours yellow, short head life, slight bitter and mild hops flavor.   I like it quite a bit.
Better than most, but far from the best.  I agree that life is too short to drink cheap beer, but I’m not too sure this is what it’s supposed to mean.  It’s like a heine with some extra balls.

Looks and smells like a German pilsner should...medium yellow with plenty of white head, aroma is slightly bitter.  Taste is a little weak, not much on the front end and the standard hoppy bitterness on the back end.  Nothing too surprising about this, but nothing too spectacular either.  Light to medium body, with the bite I mentioned before as the finish.  I’m glad I was able to buy only one bottle of it.
Fizzy yellow beer, medium head.  Slightly bitter, not much character.  Good but not great.

Clear yellow/golden with a medium sized white head that quickly dissipated.
Aroma of hay and hops. Very highly
carbonated. Fairly well balanced pilsener with an odd(but not unpleasant)
hay/straw finish.
bottle.  poured a crystal clear yellow .  taste was a bit sharp with too much carbonation for me.

Light yellow with a moderate, white, bubbly head.  Aroma light grassy, caramel.  Flavor sugary sweet with a good hop blast finish.  Light, though a touch sticky.  One of the better lousy German beers thus far.  Also far better than Stella, by the way.
A pretty standard pilsener.  Pours golden-yellow with a thin white head.  Very light bitterness and floral hops.  A hint of grainy-malt flavor.  Not bad, but nothing exceptional either.
Classic Pils. sayas it all, poured yellow, head was gone fast. Slight bitter, slight hop.

big red cup / yellow, fizzy, eventually there’s no head... eventually looks like yellow Sprite. a bit sticky in the mouth, slight band-aid, tastes german... and uneventful. sweet, grassy, smeh. i didn’t know this is a pils; it just sorta tasted like some german crap.
Golden color. Good fizzy if drunk to the thorn. Adherent foam of good persistence. Cleaned up, fresh and bitter aroma balanced.
This was a good Pilsner.  Not good like Pilsner Urquell but descent.  This went well with the Franziskaner Hefeweizen on tap.  This is much better on tap then out of the bottle.
Billing this as a classic German pilsener just about sums it up.  Moderately hoppy, slightly bitter and acidic.  I’d recommend it as a beer to bring to gatherings.
Pale yellow colour,light flavor,clean finish.My friend got it for me from Germany but i think germans have lots of other super beers if u put in another way.

full bodied, lots of flavor, light aroma, clean palate, one of my favorite beers.
havent had a warsteinier in awhile it started off a bit hoopy with robust flavor, then gave a sweet, creamy smooth finish that is so refreshing.  Oh how I missed you!

Nothing to write home about, but not bad.  Keep in mind that I’ve had a Stella Artois tonight, and this is significantly better.  Some hopcit taste and aroma, and a fairlt smooth finish.  I won’t ever have this again, but I’d drink it if it was the only beer available on a desert island.
Pours a straw-like color with a short-lived white head and good carbonation.  Has a sweet, grassy aroma.  Not very flavorful, balanced but faint malt & hops.  Clean, dry finish.

Well... I will give this one some credit. My brother traditionaly drinks skunky pale lagers, but I got him to try one of these and he enjoys it.  At least its a step above heinekin or rolling rock.  For me... it does have that slightly skunky aroma and flavor to it.  Not particularly delightful.  

 The flavor is sweet and clean. This bottle wasn’t skunky.  Just a little bit of corn sweetness.

light in color a dull yellowish tint.. full bright white head w/ ltos of carbonation bubbles. it looked good.  The scent was lightly of citrus w/ something almost a bit skunky behind it just don’t know quite what it was.  The palate had a nice bite of carbonation and started dry but would become creamy as it warmed up a bit in your mouth.. a bit of a bitter after swallow flavor but not strongly.  Tasted of light hops and citrus was fairly dry and not overly flavorful in general.. overall it wasn’t bad but I wouldn’t get it again.

This was the first non domestic swill beer I ever had. At the time I really liked it. It had a faint but decent aroma, a nice  head with a fairly pale gold colour.  The malt and hops are faint, but well balanced.  It’s average.
Golden with stark white head.excellent tast the best german beer i everhad cant get much german beers down here in florida
Pale gold with white head. Nose of wheat and citrus. Medium weight with a dry light hop finish. Flavors of citrus and light malt.  Hops are light, not a bad session.
Good!, a little refreshing, with attitude, strong, and good german beer. I like it.
This beer was a nice beginning to my fall break.  Wheaty, with some malty notes, maybe even a hint of sweetness?  This was a good beer--one to be drank again.

This was a very ordinary beer.  Color was straw like with a modest head.  The style is a pils but very mild.  It was not unpleasant to drink but not a special beer.  This beer was consumed in a small town in Southwest Virginia.  I had it on tap and in a bottle.  The draught was thin and not very good.  The bottled version was better.
Again nothing really special here.  Still enjoyable with a decent flavor to it.  Aroma smells a little bitter but there isn’t any bitterness there.
light yellow with a tiny bit of hops. a study in mediocrity. nothing special at all, but nothing bad
Light Yellow Coloring.  Light White Head.  Skunky.  Watery.  Not Much Here and Really...The Dunkel is Your Only Friend....

Poured a light yellow, very clear, very american light beeresque.  LIght wiight head, very skunky, with a quite hoppy tinge.  The flavor can best be characterized as a very flavorful light beer, which is not saying much.
Sweaty lager smell with not much of a pils taste...ok standard stuff, looks posher than it is,but at £1 a bottle cant complain

16.9 oz bottle, pilsner glass.

Freshness date  Best before 04 feb 05

ours a clear pale yellow with a frothy, white, short lived head.

No lacing.
Looks like Bud, smells like Molson, (kind of skunky that is).

Flavor is lacking. Lightly bitter, but the skunkiness kind of comes through more.

Finish is metalic, sour and kind of grainy.

I remember buying a mini-keg of this stuff years ago and it wasn’t bad, but this bottle was not good.
German Pilsener reminds be of American Macro Pale Lager too much.  Clear Blonde, yellow large bubbled head.  A little skunky, watery, dry.

Surprised to see I haven’t had this before.  Sweet, citrusy, grassy aromas with a slight skunkiness.  Transparent light light blonde color with a small quickly dissipating head.  Could stand to be darker.  Start is somewhat astringent and sour.  Finishes a roasted maltiness.  Kind of burnt in the finish.  Ehhh...so so.

Bottle - Sour malt aroma.  Light yellow color with small collapsing head.  Taste is much better - full flavored malt with nice mouthfeel and slight bitter finish.  I was going to make a smart ass comment about Warsteiner being the German word for Bud but it’s much better than that.   It’s really a pretty good beer - only the aroma is a bit off.
Golden color with an ok head.  Has a bitter than malty flavor to it, maybe even some citrus.  A regular pilsner.  I like it and sometimes find myself in the mood for it.

I didn’t mind Warsteiner Dunkel, so I decided to try the original brand.  Overall, not as impressed as the dunkel.  Appearance-wise, it resembled pale lagers too closely.  The taste was only slightly more distinguishable from the rest of the paler beers.  I can say now that I’ve tried it, but if I want cheaper german beer, I’ll stick to Warsteiner Dunkel.
Pours a pale golden color. Aroma is sweet and grainy. Flavor is a little malty, some hops are present as well. Finish is a little grainy and spicey. Good pilsner.

12oz bottle: Pours a pale yellow with a small white head. Tastes like a standard pilsner without anything terribly remarkable about it. Not terrible, but not a beer that I’m going to search for either.
Bottle.  Drank from bottle at friends house.  Hmm, this beer is like Hieneken but add double the skunkiness.
A bit cloudy on the yellow side with a full head.  Has a standard pilsner aroma and is a fairly full and sweet taste.  Malt presence lends a nearly creamy feel to the finish along with some sourness.

Draught.  A very clear coloured lager with a lager snatch smell and a reasonably drinkable malty taste.  Score 1.7
Subsequent rating scored 2.8. Average becomes 2.2
Warsteiner was the first beer that I ever had. Fairly good taste. Hoppy. Not terribly complex, but there are mild tastes of fruit. All in all a middle of the road beer.

Fading medium sized white soapy head that leaves a creamy ring around the glass. Hazy yellow body. Not bad at all on the aroma side. Lightly spiced (old spice) orange hops, and sweet like some kind of lemon meringue dessert. Flavor is kind of blah. Papery hops with a little bit of sweetness to them. Slight mint hints also. Not horrible though.
Extremely clear with barely any aroma. Bubbles up quickly then disapates quickly. Palate is dry. Needs character & flavor. One & done for me.

Bottle. Clear blonde color with a nice white head. Aroma of malt with hops notes, maybe citrus too. The flavor begins bitter then becomes mostly malty and fruity (citrus) with a light metallic feeling. Slightly bitter finish.  Light body, lively carbonation, slightly watery texture. All in all it’s a clean, decent pilsner but still lacks some character and body to be considered good.

Extremely pale gold, totally clear; very fine white head, slowly collapsing. Chalk, milk-ripe grain, raw milk, summer wheatfields. Pale, metallic taste, getting quite bitterish for an instant, then leaking the pale malt through. Ends metallic-hoppy again. The balance malt-hops is impressive, the taste is awful. If these were noble hops - how have they been treated? Thin, watery texture, some burning. One really would have expected better from Germany’s N°1 selling Pilsener.

Here’s the dilly: If you get this stuff bottled fresh, within the magical land of Germania, it’s totally aces. However, the canned crapola that we tend to get ’cross the pond is nothing close, somehow. So my rating is very conflicted. Please forgive me, Germanians!

Golden color with a sizable head that disappears fairly rapidly.  Aroma was slightly hoppy and skunky.  The taste was nothing super.  Again, a mild skunk, but not the worst by far.  I guess it has some flavor which puts it above Bud, but that’s about all it has going for it.

Tried this at a German restaurant even though I’m not a pilsner fan.  Was told that it was one of the more popular German beers which immediately put me off as I thought Bud.  All I can say is just OK.  Went well with the food.
I liked this a tad more than the dunkel.  It has a decent lightness to the appearance that was a nice tandem with a sweeter feel to the beer.  A little lemony as well.
Yellow and fizzy...malty skunky aroma...skunky taste with not much of a finish...I liked this beer more the first time I had it when it was called Heineken...
Golden color, Light weak malty sweet aroma and taste, light body, light watery finish. a German bud.
innofencive, poor colour, crappy head retention, bad smell. has a queer taste of a candy i tasted when i was about 10 years old. over all crap
light gold hue, small head, an average everyday beer, ok to me, slight aroma, smooth w/dry finish.

Poured a light yellow in color ... I’d say pale gold, only it wasn’t quite deep enough. Thin, yeasty head. Aroma of sour malt and yeast. Flavor is run-of-the-mill Pils, nothing to write home about. Wasn’t very impressed by this one at all. Warsteiner’s dunkel is far superior.

A very interesting and unique Pils. It’s color is very gold, golder than any Pils I’ve every seen. Perfect size head and a very unique taste. It is hardly bitter at all, which is interesting because most Pils are typically have a bitter taste. This makes Warsteiner very unique. It’s aftertaste is smooth and it not bitter at all. A overall very smooth, unique Pils.

12 oz. snap cap brown, longneck bottle. Best before date of 11 Aug 04. So, not the freshest beer I ever bought or drank. Poured out a golden yellow color, with a minimal white head. It quickly slid back to just a thin matting barely covering the top of the beer. Aromas are of faint malts, some residual sweetness, and yeast. Even though it’s a filtered beer, it still reeks of yeast. Slight DMS aromas are also evident. Mouthfeel is on the thin side. Tastes are mostly of DMS, watery malts, and no hops. I can’t taste any hops in this beer at all. Too sweet and too mainstream for me.
Golen color, light head. This is more of an everyday beer, if that. Pretty average tasting, kinda dry.

Light gold color with minimal head when poured from a bottle.  Mild aroma.  Taste is, well..."average".  No particular flavor stands out, which probably means the beer is well-balanced..  Nice hot weather beer.

Thin, light golden beer with a fair white head. Clean lager aroma with detectable hop fragrance. This is about the only thing that distinguishes it from American premium lagers. I’m pretty sure if you like Bud, then you will have no problem drinking this. I have no problem with it, as long as it is on sale.

Crystal clear light golden body w/ a lasting pure white head.  Aroma is floral hop and clean grainy malt.  Flavor’s well balanced throughout w/ a dry finish & clean hop flavored aftertaste.  M/f is lighter bodied, highly carbonated and lightly biting from carbonation.  Probably the BMC beer of Germany, but I’d take this over BMC anyday.  Light, refreshing, and actually tastes like beer.
This didnt taste right to me, German beer shouldnt be like this, I was very dissapointed
Draught. Very light straw body with a 1.5 finger white head. Bitter on the front and the bitterness builds. Tastes like Budweiser. Warsteiner=’s German for "BMC". Blah.
clearish golden yellow. fluffy quickly fading head. this smells like a bud.  this tastes like a bud, but with a worse finish. i’m not kidding, who would want to copy bud? overall very bitter
A decent tasting pilsener but nothing to rave about. There are hops in the flavor that leave a little bitterness in the finish. Other than that this is quite bland (but refreshing).

Bottle: Poured a golden beer with a small head with almost no retention. Aroma is very weak with small touch of malt and sweet coming out of my glass. Taste is also very weak, almost watery with no hops detectable. Very bland and boring pilsner. I guess this could be an OK session beer on a beach down south…

As with many comments on this brew, I follow suit that a pilsner is not my preferred style, but it turns out this was a pleasant surprise. It has a nice hop aroma, is well balanced with enough hops in a dry finish. A very good session candidate.
Soft and sweet taste. I enjoy the subtle hoppy flavour and fresh finish. This is an under-rated beer.

Very light in color.  Small head flattens out quickley.  Smells a bit sweet.  Honey maybe and, yes, doughy.  Taste is a bit thin, light, theres the honey again. Not much hops.  Palate is like club soda. Not very interesting in general.
Very pale, doughy aroma.  Sweet malts, low hops for a pilsener.   The German Budweiser.   Of course, since its Germany, its not actually bad.
A dry crisp beer with some dry grassy notes, a bitter middle. Similar to Bitberger
Excelent comercial beer. Pale, crisp. Persistent white head. A tillte hoppy. Easy to drink, much better than Heineken.
Pale yellow beer with a white head. Somewhat sour brewing mashy aroma with a little hops. Quite hoppy flavor with a good bitterness. Quite flavorfull for a lager.

A very standard beer. Light and easy to drink. Light on taste but also light on aftertaste. The dunkle is much better in my opinion since this one seems a little weak. Stil better than anything produced my US macros.

Much better than Beck’s or Heineken, I think. Smoother at any rate. Pours blond with a tall foamy white head. Aroma is crisp and a bit grassy and mixed with some European hops. Gladly not skunked! Not too bad! Taste is carbonated and grassy. Some malt but generally pretty crisp and refreshing. A decent summer type beer or for whenever it’s hot. Finish is a bit sharp and the palate is carbonated. Not horrible but more an everyday refresher than a complex beer fan’s dream.
A great everyday beer.  Good hoppy flavor.  Everyone i have try it seems to like it.  Costs is close to popular american beers.  So why drink cheap beer as their slogan suggests?

Bottled. Looks like your choice on Lufthansa is Warsteiner or Becks. Warsteiner turned out to be just a notch above most beers of its kind. Its  character actually lets the mild hop profile come through. Still hard to get past the fact that it looks and pours just like a Miller.
This time this one was on draft at Anthony’s.  Great pour, surprisingly malty without being sweet.  Great hops.  Classic German Pils if poured correctly.
Always figured this for being more commercial than other German fare. After tasting I would have to say I had every reason to harbor those feelings.
This was better than the Classic German Pilsener St Pauli Girl because it didn’t smell like rotten crotch.
A great german pilsener, i enjoyed drinking this tasty german brew. Has a different aftertaste which is standable.

hey!  great session beer!  had this on tap... too bad they charge import prices for it.   blahhhhhhhhh.  exactly what i’d expect as a ’german standard’.  more enjoyable than any american standard, but still a bit watery and lacking in flavor.  sweet, malty.  good for getting drunk.
This is a good Pilsener, smooth, easy drinking and enjoyable.  It’s slightly bitter, hoppy, and easy to drink many.
Wierd grape bubblegum aroma.  Flavor has a hazelnut-tootsie roll maltiness to it.  Watery mouthfeel.  Not good.
This was not my cup of tea. Bitter, with an odd aftertaste, like it was sitting in an old can out in the sun.
In the bottle. Tiny bubbles. Yellow as dog pee. Nice up front bittering hops to this fizzy beer. I get a flower-like sweetness at the end. Too light for me.
Bottle 4,8%. Plenty, fine head. Pale golden colour. Smells a little grainy, but tastes better. Good maltiness, a little sweet. OK mouthfeel.
Thin golden colour, white head quickly falling back to nothing.  Thin malty aroma, Saaz aroma.  Good mouthfeel, malty taste and a decent floral/earthy hop flavour.  Crisp finish.

Canned- Pours a straw coloured body with a thick and foamy white head. Aroma is mild. Slightly mossy and hoppy. Taste is earthy and bland. Smooth on the palate, but strangely enough it feels like a porter. A strange but decent beer.

Light golden-yellow colour with a medium sized white head. Aroma is malty and slightly metallic (possibly due to the fact that it came from a can). Body is crisp and fresh. Flavour is sweet and malty with a dry and decently hopped finish. A simple and well-balanced warm weather beer.
A simple pilsener. A yellow/golden fizzy appearance with a white head. Has a decent hoppy taste. Very simple, but good beer. Def could drink a bunch of these.
Malty and yeasty with a warm bread nose.  Light sparkling yellow with a white head.  Lightly bitter beginning with a mild finish.  Fizzy palate.
About as middle of the road as you can get. Clear, pale yellow, decent head. Corn, malty aroma, some cereal flavor, with mild hop bite. Fresh, but a bit bland.

(Bottled, 4.7% ABV) Paleish lager color, small head and some lace. Soapy, flowery, hoppy aroma. Quite crisp and hoppy, citric flavor with some malt and a bitter, stingy, carbonated finish. Feels almost like corn was smuggled in, but must be the hops as it's German after all. Light-bodied, quite carbonated palate. Quite harshly hopped, light pilsener.

Brilliant Clear straw in color. Nice nose. I have had this beer a few times and not really cared for it. I am rating it now beacuse I have just had a great one. Full of hop flavor and aroma. It is missing the grassyness of North American attemps at this German lager style (german pils?) Anyhow my advise is givit a few trys you may come across some samples being more fresh than others and taste the difference!
Cheers
A good beer that can be found easily. Lots of wheat taste in this beer. Kind of simple, but good for the price.

14-04-04: Es una cerveza normal sin nada especial.
Es fuerte sin escesos, de color rubio oscuro, sin mucha espuma, el sabor es de duracion media.
13-11-13: Cada cerveza hay que ponerla en su lugar y en el 2004 solo considera buena una cerveza de abadia doble :) 
Es una muy buena cerveza pilsner pero con caracter y de sabor muy agradeble y facil de tomar. subo la nota de 1.9 a 3.1

Bottle.  Poured with a weak head and unappealing color.  Not a lot of aroma or flavor.  At least it was carbonated.  I'm told the label indicates this is the king of beers in German; I would have to agree...it beats Budweiser but just barely.
One of the better beers that I can find in a normal grocery store. Easy to drink with a refreshing amount of carbonation. I enjoyed this more than the ratings on this site made me think it would be.

If I were to choose a macro, this could be it. Clear and light with a white lasting head. Hoppy and malty aroma. Flavor is hoppy, and has a nice malty undertone. As far as light lagers go, this is a decent lawnmower beer, and has some hops to back it up.

Not a great beer to my tastes, but it exceeded the standards set by its appearance.  It poured a relatively unattractive yellow, with a somewhat soapy head and what looked like excessive amounts of carbonation.  Aroma was hoppy and sweet, but pretty weak.  Flavor was surprisingly full, however.  Good hoppy edge and a pleasing mellow sweetness.  Really easy to drink, and pleasantly carbonated.  Not fantastic, but I certainly plan to drink it again, especially when I'm in the mood for a not-too-skunky pilsener that's still light enough to drink easily.
This pils pours with nice carbonation. large bubbles in the head. Nice hop/malt sweet aroma. The flavor is equally malt sweet/hoppness with a little skunk, even and predictable. Just average.

My brother-in-law introduced this beer to me years ago...Im surprised I have not reviewed it.

on pour,pale yellow almost clear,big white head that fads fast.Sightly malty nose.

on taste:sweet and malty start,slightly grassy/earthy middles,the finish has some hops,but still mostly malt.

light body,nice carbonation,a pretty steady beer.

A nice medium bodied pilsner.A nice yellowish hue with a small head that eventually dissappeared.Had strong tastes of malts with some hoppiness.A good clean finish.Nothing to wow me here, but i have had this before and will again.

malty aromas and some hop aroma. straw color and crystal clear with a thin white head. malty cookie like flavors with an herbal hop bitterness. light and refreshing. much more preferable for a session than an american pils.

Not overly imperssed with this beer. Clear golden color with hardly any head at all. Mild malt aroma. Slight bitter hops at the end of the flavor. Light and easy to drink. But I was hoping more since my roomate would not shut up about this beer.
Yeah this beer is okay, very light straw, mild malt and hop flavour, slightly sweet.  Easy drinking but a bit too light for me.
Good but not great pilsener.  Yellow with a touch of the hop and a good mild aftertaste.  For a mass produced beer, it's quite good.

Carbonated straw body with fair head. Relatively intense hoppy nose. Very refreshing bittersweet flavor and long final. This is quite nice for an industrial one. I'd drink several more of these but I have to go...
Average Pilsener beer.  Yellow color, Head dissapears after 1 minuite.  Very hoppy taste with hints of yeast.  Overall good pilener beer.
Light yellow, clear beer. On tap, has a big white lasting head. Flavor is nothing special with a little more unbalanced bitterness than other pilseners.
A sweet smelling goldon pilsner. It has a nice bit of hop bite to it, as well, but it's not very complex or interesting. Still, it's refreshing and solid.
very pale color, beautiful almost champagne mousse and vry thick foam, easy going taste ans nice aftertaste of bitters

My first thought is: "nice, sweet nose".  My next thought is: "smooth".  The next thought is: "It’s just a hyped up Miller".  The next thought is: "No, definitely German  - definitely a bit complex."  Next thought is: "Easier to drink than Urquell."  Last though is: "Well, it isn’t expensive and it is better than a lot of beers in its price range, so maybe I’ll buy it again if it is still on sale at Publix."

I had one of these in a bottle a year or so back, but never got around to rating it, but generally thought that it was pretty good.  Had one on tap over the weekend, and I thought that I must have been drinking a different beer.  Looked great, nice colour and head, but the aroma was of quite harsh hops, and a real dissappointment.  Flavour was okay, but not really in balance.  Nice enough i suppose.

Sheesh, the town gets something new and I'm all excited to possibly be able to be the first to review something, and everyone else here has already tried it. Hmph!

Pours an amazingly light and clear yellow with a decent white head that left a little lacing.

Smells hoppy for a pilsner, but other than that it's typical.

Taste is crisp and refreshing. Nice touch of hops makes itself known amongst the malt.

Mouthfeel is better than average because of the slight bitter aftertaste of the hops. Drinkability is good because it's crisp and refreshing. I could easily have several of these.
smell of hops with a trace of citrus; pale yellow, thin head; starts with a crisp bitterness, but finishes with an unpleasant metallic taste that lingers

Pours a light wheat-golden color with an aromatic, quickly dissapating, creamy head.  Has a smooth, grainy taste with a hint of pepper and perhaps even chocolate.  A nice pilsener.  Aroma is slightly bitter and citrusy.  Clean, pure, lasting finish.  Definitely a good (though not a great beer!).  Heads and shoulders above a Stella Artois.
I was a little disappointed.  Very light colour but not a huge amount of flavour.  Very malty taste that doesn't really satisfy.
This is just another example of a crappy american version of a german pilsner.  There is no body, no flavor, just bitter watered down essences of malt backed up by some grassy, acidic flavors.
Very pale and clear. Huge quick disipating head. Aroma is sweet and earthy. Flavours are mildly bitter, hopped, grassy, and boring.
As with many German pilseners, the appearance well exceeds its aroma.  Bitterness in this one is a bit strong.  Is this ever sold in Germany, if so, what towns?
A yellow beer with a fine head. The aroma is sweet malty - and so is the flavor. A good but average pilsener.
Pale blond colour, white frothy head, not lacing. Sweet hoppy soaplike aroma.  Quite neutral initial flavour, moderately bitter in the end.  Soft mouthfeel - drinks very easy.

Bottle
Head is average and lacey. Pale golden colour. Not much aroma. Quite drinkable - some hops in the finish, neutral but not bad.

Re-rate:

Aroma is hoppy. Light version of Urquell.

Paid: $1.02 for a 500 ml bottle; freshness date on back 13. MAI. 04

Very crisp and clear light golden. Looks pretty thin, but it's so clear I bumped it up .5; Very little head.

Not much of a smell... maybe a bit grassy, and smells like a hint of honey, but I could be imagining that.

Not much of a taste to be had, which might make this a good beer for someone just starting to move away from the mainstream.

Thin in the mouth, but this would make a good session beer, because it's light and unfilling. Definitely worth the buck and two pennies... but not much more than that.
Its a normal blode beer, nice to take with some peanuts, a frankfurt or "tapas". The only think to comment... a fine bitter final taste... recomendable
Draught: pale yellow water. . . grainy and wheaty with some semblance of malt in the background and some dry hops in the finish.  Mediocre at best, but could be better fresh.
I go to a bar that keeps this on hand for me.  I am the only one who orders it, but I like it.  Little to no aftertaste, good aroma, and is enjoyable to drink with a bar meal.  One of my favorites.
Ahh The Queen of beers.  Very good brew, a notch above becks and heine.  If you just feel like tossing a few decent beers back this is the one.
Straw coloured German pilsner with a grassy aroma.  Very little head but decent carbonation and moderate bitterness, refreshing.  (500ml can)
Very nice appearance, taste is good.  I was a bit put off at how bitter and dry it was, however.  If someone handed one to me, I'd be content.

Mild grain aroma and flowery hops. Clear golden colour with plenty of bubbles and thick white head that sticks to the sides of the glass as it recedes. Mild bitterness and gentle cereal flavour with a slight sweetness and subtle pepperiness in the finish.Body is very light and refreshing. This a very good if somewhat simple beer. Bottle.
Very pale straw colour with a large white frothy head. Smells like straw as well dough. Taste is decent enough without having too much flavour, slight bitterness and a short finish.

nothing too special about this beer.  ultra-clear straw color, with a faint malty, grapelike aroma.  light in the mouthfeel and a little sweetness in the finish.  it would be a really good beer if it weren't so thin.

A boring beer with an almost cloying, sticky sweetness lurking. Too much head on it regardless of temperature. Like, half the glass. It doesn't make me want to have another. I have to wonder how much this beer may have suffered on the boat from Germany, since some of the negatives here may be attributable to staleness.
A rather simple German pilsener. Very clean tasting, no flaws. Light malt flavors with a grassy/citric hop bitterness. Crisp and refreshing.
Nothing to write home about. Light color.  Average taste....................

A readily available, although somewhat average, German Pilsner.  I prefer a little more body, but this is a refreshing light beer that undoubtably will have a following somewhere.  Not bad, but there are better beers from Germany.
Another in a gift six pack assortment.  Pale amber color with nice white head.  Flowery aroma and a bitter taste.  Not such a good beer but wasn't awful.
Pale yellow pour with a head that left fast.  Nondescript aroma.  Weak taste... some malt notes but not much else going on here.  Not impressed at all.
This Pilsner does not have much to praise.  It's a very thin, pale looking beer.  Livened up with more flavor/hops this could be quite good, but it's a mediocre beer as it stands.
Pilsener style that doesent have heaps to write about. Smooth but thin, slides down nice and pure but then dissapears, not much in the way of genuine flavour either. Average.
Pale yellow. Small fast fading white head. Grassy hop aroma. Flavor has a light sweet start with the same strange grassy bitterness that I didn't care for in the DFH 60 Min and pale ales.
This is one of my favorite pilsners.  It may be slightly over carbonated but the finish is clean and doesn't linger too long.
Bottle: pours overly fizzy.Too Champagne- like. Tastes like light beer, watery and overly thin. Wimpy and over carbonated with no maltiness or delecate floral hop presence. This beer screams MACRO.
A international mainstream pour with few things to make it stand out. This is a brew that someone can say they like Ger. brews without ever having one.
Not as good as i was expecting, very small head, pale yellow in color.  I did enjoy the flavor, less skunky than a typical pilsner.

NOt very impressive.  Pale yellow, thin head.  A little skunky, not too good, not too bad.  Very ordinary and uninteresting.  This was suggested to me by my boss, so I'll tell him it was good, but that's not quite how i feel.  No aftertaste.

Pours pale yellow with fizzy white head that leaves quickly. Aroma is nondescript.  Flavor is same but with some sweet malt.  But basically tastes like big brewery beer without skunk. Not bad, just misleading according to what the label packaging asserts:  "Life is too short to drink cheap beer."  Replace "cheap" with "mundane" and I would agree.

Was surprised to see it at a nieghbor's holiday party, was happy for the choice. Pours golden, not much of a head. A bit of malt aroma, wheaty? A crisp taste, nothing much to notice, little aftertaste. Not something I'd go out of my way to buy, but grateful it was available next to the Buds & Millers. Drank a few, enjoyable in the setting, but not a beer to savor...

To me Warsteiner is about solidity.  A good product which is amongst the top few big name German pilseners.  On draught it is slightly sweeter, whilst in cans, the carbonation is more apparent and it takes on a dryer quality.  You could easily drink stacks of this on a night out, and that would be no bad thing.
Although it doesn't stand out like so many other beers, Warsteiner products continue to be one of my favorite session beers.

This is a pretty good beer. It poured with a very nice eggshell white head on a straw colored body with slowly rising bubbles. The head was foamy but left little lace in its wake. Has a nice crisp hop flavor but a bit of an unpleasant earthy aftertaste. Overall I think this is pretty average beer but miles ahead of the more widely consumed Pilsener style beers. If you like Corona or Pacifico then Warsteiner Premium Verum will be a delightful treat. If you like Pilsener Urquell then you will be somewhat disappointed. Still it is a good beer, especially at the $5.29 I paid for a six pack. Goes great with pretzels!
overpowering smell really skunky. light head disipates quickly. it's an ok beer not great
Light colored lager. Has a lot of carbonation. Nothing to make this stadn out from any other lagers.

Very pale yellow lager. Almost colorless. Fizzy white head.
Light toffee and straw notes.
Well-balanced, but quite thin. Decently bittered. Light buttery flavor with hints of dry grass.
Light-bodied with a dry mouthfeel and fizzy carbonation. Short, crisp, clean, dry finish.
One of the better bottled Pilseners, nice taste, color and aroma. Always a good choice.
Pale golden with an ok white head. Aroma is grassy, some hops.Rather mild with a bitter finish. Nothing special...
Very light, watery body and flavor. Not much taste at all. The package claims "Life's too short to drink cheap beer". Heck, if you're going to drink this, you may as well save your money!
Straw body with quickly dissipating white head.  Aroma is fairly sweet, grassy.  Taste is mild sweet, moderately grassy bitter.  Light crisp body.  Nicely balanced.
nice looking pils, golden with a fluffy white head that lasted the whole time.  lightly grassy and bready with a dry bitter finish.

Nice yellow gold with a fair foamy head that vanishes to leave some lacing. Subtle barnyard aroma and flavours that have some grainy hops bitternes. Metal tinged aftertaste (this one from a 330ml bottle).

This is actually fairly good but there's better to be had.

Re-rate. Straw coloured, with a decent head. Aroma of malts and hay, carrying over to the flavour, which has a grassy hop finish. Not the best world available German Pils, but a fairly decent one nonetheless.
Light yellow body, no head.  Grassy aroma.  Dry hoppy flavor, more subtle than other pils and it works nicely.
Clean and crisp in flavor. No head retention. Nice yellow color. Typical for this style. Pleasant to drink.

Amazingly, I was up for sampling a few beers the night after the Fort Wayne tasting.  Had this on tap at the Steinkeller in Oxford, OH.  Nothing remarkable or interesting.  Clear straw-colored body, with a thin white head.  Grassy, bitter hops aroma.  Flavor was much the same, with grassy, bitter hops and a very light malt backbone.  Thin-bodied and typical of foreign macroswill.

Warsteiner, a beer that I have consumed dozens of times,  always a rather pleasant experience. 
 A golden Pils with a massive pillow of fluffy white head. The aroma is rather malty and sweet, honey, caramel, the flavor it almost the  same experience but an with a noticeable addition of  hops, Quit drinkable
Really not a bad pilsner. Smell is minimal, and certainly not skunked. There is kind of a nice candy sugar taste in the palatte. This went well with my Italian food.

Pale yellow colour, small head fainting quickly. I could taste the alcahol wich is very rare for a beer that low in alcahol. Flavour is light, dry and hoppy.
Palate is not good, very simple.

Light golden color. Noticeable about this beer is that it is very smooth and not very bitter for a german premium pilsener. Tastes more like Lager than like a Pilsener from the northern part of Germany. But still pretty nice. Re-rate: After having several of these in the last time, I also noticed the smoothness, which makes this a Pilsener that is enjoyable even after the 3rd and 4th one.

Ah the Bud Light of Germany. Bottle. Light straw color, smells yeasty, no real strong scent at all. The taste is light and easily forgettable. Sweet in the roof of the mouth. No Good. Kind of like St Pauli NA. After warming in the glass did collect a redeeming bitterness that was quite welcome.
This beer had a very pungent, unpleasant aroma for such a pale yellow brew.  I found it very difficult to drink... there are way better pilseners out there for much better prices.
a little weak aroma, nice taste, hoppy and slightly bitter, a very decent german pils, but noting to shout hurray about....

drank one of those little kegs of this with a friend.  ive had this beer many times over the past 2 years, just havent gotten around to rating it.  i think this is way better than a 2.94 beer...weak aroma, good flavor, good drinking beer.
Light gold color with thin white head.  Nice mild malt with hoppy aroma. Mild aftertaste. Decent German Pils.

The malt profile in this one was great, it tasted like a fresh baked pancake but with a touch of spice (skunk) just to make it real unique. Robust and flavorsome, creamy mouthfeel and underdeveloped aromas.
Golden pour with small head. Malt and small hop nose. Flavors of grain and slight hop finish.  Pretty good pilsener.
Pretty good German lager... a beer like this should be the minimum standard for macro lagers.
Decent pils. Golden colored, diminishing white head. Hops in the aroma with a hint of malt. Grainy malt flavor with a dry, hoppy finish. Pretty cheap, too.
Had this in a great seafood restaurant.  Went well with shell fish such as oysters, shrimp & scallops.

Light golden, diminishing head and lace. Saazy aroma, subdued malts, grains.  Nice body for pils, pale malts with a bit of artificial sweetness it seems, nice saaz that sharpen in finish, strangley metallic as it warms, better out of fridge. Decent.
Pale straw color. Very clean with sweetish fruity malts and light dry hoppiness. Quick pils with no aftertaste.

Clear, light straw color and lazy carbonation. Musky hop aroma and sugary malts. Flavor of pears and wheat. This is an enjoyable beer in a pinch. A former favorite of mine before my beer education commenced but still not bad.

Partykeg
Light blond color. Ways too watery, light aroma, light taste, light palate. Too poor.

This brew poured a medium sized head of medium sized white mostly dissappearing bubbles that left very little lacing and a transparent light yellow orange colored softly carbonated body behind.  Medium malt hop aroma, a smooth palated slighly bubbly mouthfeel and a malt hop flavor that goes down rather easily.
Decent German beer that most Germans probably hate.  Pours a very wonderful light color but has a strong malty flavor.  Very nice balance, well carbonated.  Very easy to throw these back.  Enjoy!!

German lager style with moderate hopping compared to Czecs but hops are apparent in nose and taste.  Pours with rapidly disappearing head, aroma is a pleasant mix of moderately strong malt and light noble hop.  Body is light, a nice lager with some taste to have ice cold on a hot summer’s day.

Pretty good pils... I can think of several better... nothing to get excited about, but then again, this style as a whole isn't gonna blow you away... just a little something to enjoy with a burger or a pizza or just to cool off on a hot day.

Beer pours (in Hoegaarden glass) a light applejuice (piss, read 'urine')-golden color with virgin-white head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is of straw, grass, vegetal.  Flavor is of straw, grass with small hops and a slightly dry ending.  Just another sucky yellow beer - there's plenty of them.  Sampled at 70 degrees Fahrenheit.

Pours pale like a typical pils and has a grassy/citrus aroma when in good condition. The taste is drier than most and pleasant on the back palate. The finish is a bit thin and therefore suffers in comparison to the Bohemian style.
Light golden color almost no head. Aproma was somewhat malty, mildly hoppy and maybe some cirus notes. Taste is slightly bitter with a blend of light malt. Finish is bitter and dry.

This beer pours a very light yellow - extremely clear.  The aroma is slightly hoppy, but not too interesting.  The taste is bitter, but not too strong.  Fairly plain beer, but enjoyable.  Reminds me of a really weak flavored pilsner.

Perfect golden color. Skunk emanes as soon as the bottle is opened, but disappears rather fast. It's obviously not to make room to complex aromas, pretty much only a light cereal nose combined with malt. The taste is so anticipated it's not even funny. no surprises at all: malt, cereals, hops. Actually, more bitterness would have boosted this otherwise just too light and easy beer.

Color is yellow hay-like with a strong white head about a finger high and stuck around leaving patchy lace. Smell is faint malt and hop, some what skunky but didn't seem to echo in the taste, at least not all together. Taste was crisp and clean, much like a light pilsner. Although it didn't have much malty sweetness, there is a hint of herb-like hop dry bitterness. Has a medium light body feel with a faint malt and drying hop finish, left a little empty and had a small metallic tone. An OK beer but easily overlooked for a reason.
A decent pi;sner to get any Bud drinker on the path to drinking a little better beers.  I wouldn't call this a high class beer though.
March 2001 - Decent. Not as flavorful as I remember it being on tap. Crisp and easy to drink but nothing special.

Billowy white froth; clear straw hue.  Sharp fennel and grass hop bouquet over a simple honey and grain malt base.  A cutting bitterness throughout is accentuated by the overall dryness.  Suitably thin and briskly carbonated with a firm texture.



Pleasantly bittered, accented by the malt structure that may lend some unfortunate astringency.



50 cl bottle, best before 14 May 2009.



Sparkling yellow body with a diminishing white head.  Light malt (light bread), moderate hops (grass), light yeast (dough).  Moderately sweet, moderately bitter.  Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter.  Very big for a pils.  Creamy mouthfeel.  This is one of the better pils I’ve had (stella, urquell).  The sweet start and dry finish are interesting.
This beer just seemed to appear everywhere.  Nice clear everyday beer. I would rank this as 1 of my staple beers.
Clear pale yellow/gold w/ bright white head. Sweet malt (grain, biscuit) & light hop (grass) aroma. Light, creamy feel. Clean, sweet malt flavour. Moderately bitter finish.
Slight malt nose.  Light colored (2 SRM?). Slight malt flavor with a very lager clean finish.  Not a bad beer to have with friends when you all want to get tanked.
May be a 250 year old German Pilsener recipe but not a classic.  Just a fairly average Pilsener.  Clean, crisp and shallow.
Not much of an aroma. What was there wasn't appealing. Pours a very light yellow, head weak. Not much in the body, plastic tasting finish. Avoid...

Every country has to make a straw colored light, 'innofensive' beer.  This is one of Germany's.  But in the general category this one is good for a couple reasons... The finish is complex, and the hops linger in a dry happiness, and the aroma is amazing.  The beer has a very flowery smell.
Yummy hay-juice hoppiness, deliccious, also quite malty. A bit thinner than necessary. Of course clear light golden with a huge fluffy protypical head. Not so bad!

Aroma is very nice and reminds me of good nights in Austria drinking large glasses of Warsteiner. As I look at this glass, it cries out, "Drink me! Oh, Drink ME!" So you know I have to. Mmmm the flavour is very pleasant and enjoyable and brings back terrific memories. The flavour is very wheaty. I should mention that this is a 5 liter keg we are drinking from, so this really helps. I don't understand why other raters don't give this a higher rating. This is GREAT fresh and from a keg! Listen to me. This is great stuff. Try it! The more you drink it the more you get a taste for it and you get a chance to sort out its complex flavours. 30.5% really does not give this beer justice. It is wonderful from a keg, trust me on this, and in a large Pilsener glass it looks so attractive. I give this quite a high rating.
i love this beer.this  should be the standard by which other beers are rated
Pale yellow, lots of carbonation.  Typical fare of a mass produced German lager.
Gold color. Mild aroma. Follows through with a medium-body palate. Very drinkable. One of my favorites.

This is I think, good beer for the syle.  I think it is intersting that all of the very highly rated beers are those with high ABV and many layers of flavors.  This is a good pils.  Not in the calibur of Victory Prima, however, it is good for the style.  Has light hop aroma, pours up medium head that does not dissipate completely.  Kinda fizzy.  Has a nice light hop flavor.  Good for hot summer days.

This pilsner poured a medium head that dissolved quickly. The carbonation could be seen rising to the top. It had a fruity aroma. The body was yellow. It had a bitter taste and an aftertaste that lingered.
Clear, light gold color. Mild aroma. Thin head. Nothing remarkable in the flavor although easy to drink. Much better if you can find it on draft.
Pale. White frothy head. Somewhat bitter. Fairly pleasant overall but nothing special.
Golden with a stark white head.  Floral, sweet nose.  Excellent body.  Sweet, citrusy barley beauty with that good German citric ending.
An unimpressive example of what has become a favorite style.  A cloudy golden wheat beer with nothing distinctive in taste or aroma.  Not unpleasant in any way, but we can do so much better.

not bad at all. i bought some tonight because i had some German beer in a German resturant once (vitzen, or weitzen, or something) it wasn't as good and rich as that lage, but, MUCH preferable to Heinikin (sp)
A decent beer that's not too hard to find in Ohio.......................
Not a good example of a German beer, not much going on with this one, other than bitterness.
Draft.  Surprisingly does not taste as light as it appears.  Slightly bitter aftertaste.  A staple in my kegerator.

Pale yellow, with a fizzy, diminishing white head. Perfumed hop bitter aroma. Same perfumed taste, followed by a bitter and metallic finish. Fizzy and almost sharp on the tip of the tongue, then finishes softer, but thin.

This beer is weak-kneed and reminds me of flat ginger ale.
I'd prefer it over many other lagers that actually have taste. Perhaps the only advantage with this beer is that it requires no effort to drink.

On the label is says, "Warsteiner - because life is too short to drink cheap beer." I'll keep this in mind next time I consider buying Warsteiner.
Warsteiner = German for Budweiser.  This beer was seriously watered down, and mostly tasteless.  Not reccommended.

Dark straw color with a whispy big bubbled head.  Ring of lace on every quaff.  Noble hops and light malt aroma. Very dry in the start and quenching and long in the finish. If anything a bit to dry.  Lacks the malt depth of some of the better pils. Refreshing, yet unfulfilling.
Bottled. Pale golden with fine creamy head. Grassy hop aroma. Pleasantly dry and weel hopped. Slightly mellow body. The finish  drya nd lingering bitter. I've had much worse beers aboard airplanes...
Appearance is very pale, moderate lasting head. Not much in terms of aroma, but not displeasing. A hoppy taste with a very dry aftertaste.
Weak head, but good lace.  Nice color and refreshing crisp taste.  Slight aftertaste, but not a bad one.  This is a good inexpensive one to go for!
A good lager especially for a widely available lager, a huge jump from BudMillerCoors but nothing to go crazy over, a treat for someone who really loves lagers, which is not me
Bottle.  A light golden color with a white head.  A skunky and dusty aroma.  A Crisp flavor of cardboard.  Like so many bad lagers I've suffered through with only a knod to something a little better.
very light looking. But suprisingly not light tasting.  Very easy drinking.

Well I have to Re-rate This Beer after having several more since my initial rating. My first bottle, on which I did my initial rating must have been really fresh, or whatever I was having with it was so good it threw the true taste and aroma off. Either that, or the bottles I've been having, and still have left are damaged some how. I just can't believe the difference in my first bottle and the rest. 
This beer indeed looks really weak. Seemed to me like it should taste watery, but It did't. It had a really good mouth feel and carbonation. The head pourd pretty decent.  But the last several bottles I've had were pretty bad. Aroma was repulsive, which of course adds to a barely drinkable taste. After having better beer, I have to say that this is one beer I won't be buying again.

Thin, bubbly head.  Clear--light 
golden appearance.  Crisp flavor.  
Smooth.  Slight tinge of grass in 
the aftertaste with a little touch of 
bittering hops.  Good model of 
style.

A dissapointment.   Could this be the German answer to the American BudCoorsMiller?

Rapidly diminishing head to nothing.  Light, crisp, hint of malt on the front end with noticable hops in the finish.
Clear yellow, very bubbly with a bigl white head. Malt aroma. Sweet and dry flavor. Somewhat bitter finsih.
Not bad at all. It was what I expected in a German beer. I agree with "By the 40" drink this out of a bottle for good results. Hey why wash another glass?
Golden colour, bubbly head, not persistent. The aroma is quite malty, just like the taste. Nice hoppy bitterness in the aftertaste. Refreshing, drinkable and pleasant, anyway...
Has a nice light golden color, with a medium size, short lasting head. Faint aroma. Has a good bitterness taste to it, off lemon perhaps. An good all-rounder German Pils.
Well balanced taste, nice aroma. Good german beer. Some pleasant bitterness on finish.
Drinkable.  I like the tall, skinny bottles. This is a garden variety pils -- on the dry side with a thinnish palate, but it's an excellent cookout/summer brew.
Short lived head. VERY pale in color almost looks watered down. Was very carbonated and hoppy with bitter aftertaste. Tast just like Miller Lite to me.

Clear in color, with a lot of bubbles coming up and a medium-sized white head (define pilsner). This one has just enough flavor and a balanced malt/hops combination: refreshing but not too watery. Satisfying finish. I usually like this kind of beers, and this one is OK for me.

A sweet aroma and an odd, distinctive taste.  Finishes rather dry.  Not sure if this quite representative of the style, but I do like it.  Quite drinkable alone; a nice change of pace from more complex beers.

The aroma is sweet and hoppy.  The appearance is a light gold, with a thick creamy head.  The flavor is hoppy, sweet, with a light bitter aftertaste.  The beer is smooth and easy to drink.  Overall nice.
Odd taste.  The pour reveals a golde colour with a frothy head.  Aroma is malty and something I can't describe.  Taste is unique, why I don't really know.  Finish is subtle yet forgettable.
I am definitely not a fan of this one. Weak in flavor and not an attractive color, in my opinion.  I'll pass on this...
Fresh tasting. not bitter and light. I can tell it is German by its quality but it is not quire as exciting as the Hacker Pshorre line.. Much better then most domestics.though.
Pale golden color witha lacey head. Perfectly clear with small bubbles. A touch skunky with some malts and a little wheaty taste.
This beer could have been a whole lot better, no bitterness very very mellow.  I have had much better german pilsner.  Thin to almost no head and a very pale yellow coloration.

This one pours a clear, golden yellow color with a small white head. The aroma is mildly sweet and slightly hoppy. The body is light, flavor is sweetly malty, with a crisp and dry finish. This is a good thirst quencher, and much better than a lot of macro domestics. This is drinkable, but is somewhat bland in flavor.
A good quality import from Germany.  Definitely a good alternative to other Euro-imports, i.e. Heine.
Better than domestic.  Nice head, nice finish.  Would probably buy it again, but not because it is stellar.

Not too bad. I like the mini kegs it comes in. I think they are 15 bucks. It's a pretty good deal. This beer is kind of bland and watery. Nothing special. I used to see Warsteiner bumper stickers around that said "Life is too short to drink cheap beer." There are some cheap beers I'd rather have than Warsteiner.
light golden lager.  crisp flavor, minimal hop bite.  Basically a boring beer.  The Budweiser of Germany.
Light yellow pour with almost no head.  Smells of sweet malts, with a taste not too different than many Molson-type lagers.  Drinks thin, bland, and slightly sour.

Bottled: Very light yellow coloured. Has a quickly diminishing head. A little sweetish and malty in the aroma. Flavour is bland and without much power. No bitterness at all in the aftertaste. I miss some hops in this.
Not bad, nothing exciting.  Probably will not make this a regular purchase, but certainly a better choice than many others in the price range.
Decent pilsner. Has a little bite to it. Bitter with a lingering aftertaste. Good "everyday" pilsner, but I'm going to stick with New Glarus' Edel Pils for now.
Can I say it?  OK then.  This shit rocks.  I love Warsteiner.  It's a nicely balanced brew that leans to heavy side of the scale, but not too much.

Rerate  Not sure what I was thinking the first time I had this. Dark golden appearance, slightly worty aroma with a bit of saazy skunk, corny like yeasty flavor dominates, decent mouthfeel, turns a tad metallic though near the finish. Original 4.0 Kept passing this by in the grocery store - finally trying it - need to get all of the top 50 most accessible beers! 10 more to go! Good clean pils - beats Urquell hands down. Clean crisp pour, with a good bit of lacing - better than average aroma for a pils.  All in all a good example of the style - glad I bought a whole six. Stays strong to the finish.
Good pils. Clean malt taste with a nice bitterness..........................
used to be one of my favorites, but lately has been thin. don''t buy it in the can
Enjoyable on a hot day, but nothing special about it. A decent pilsener.....

Used to drink this at the German club near my old Stanmore house with Marty and listen in on the old German guys discussing ways to cheat the poker machines. Went down ok, but I started to want a lemon cordial sometime during me third pint...
Solid pils, widely avilable. There is nothing extraoridnaty about the flavor but it is drinkable.  Nothing to write home about but certainly a fair representative for Pilsners.
This is definitly a europe beer. This beer is not offensive in any way and is just a good any time drink. Make sure to drink it out of a bottle, that cool 5 litter mini keg does it no justice.
A decent pilsener.  I personally liked it, because it is fairly aproachable.  Not too hoppy, not too strong.  A good easy beer.
A bit too close to crap American beers for my taste.........................
Not bad. Kind of reminds me of alka seltzer. ...............................
One of the best from Germany. Eine perle der nature... Indeed, not far from truth.

Common beer but it has a bit cheacteristic taste, but i don't like it. I can imagine some people would like it, but not me. Much to few hop, not sweet enough and strange kind of malt
But it refrehes!
Not bad, but not very exciting either. Nice malty overtones balance well with moderate hoppiness. Nice malts in aroma.

Light gold color. Medium head. Aroma is malty and slightly herbal (?). A medium bodied pilsner, with the typical pilsner flavor, Its slightly malty and slightly hoppy. Smooth taste. Very drinkable. Nice, but nothing special. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and slightly dry. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.
Excellent Pils. I can drink these all day long. Clean finsh.................
Canned(330ml). Best german beer I drink, gold color, refreshing, ...........
