Pale straw colour, nice white head very fluffy. Bitter/sweet taste, dry palate, Queer aroma like a sour fart. Points on tatste, not appearance or smell.
Really good beer, I could be on crack, but it kind of reminds me of Dos Equis a bit
A perfect beer to drink when you just want a beer. Refreshing, a little sweet, and at a pretty good price.

looks freakin'' weak.  Like watered down urine.  It is a pislener I guess, but just looks weak.  Thin white heas stuck to the top of the glass.  Seems ricey, crisp and light.  Some toasted barley taste in there.  Pretty refreshing though.  Decent mouthfeel and surprising body, but not impressive at all.

Nothing tops of a walk to the local beer store like a cold .5L can of Warsteiner. Nice session beer with a lesser aftertaste then either Becks or Heineken. Common party beer in Germany, sure beats anything you will find at a party here. Totally worth the extra effort to find it and the high price.

Really enjoyed this, and it seems to be widely available and cheap.  Reccomended.
RE-RATE: Now that I've had better this tastes watery.
Has a light goldern color and a light taste.  Overall nothing too remarkable, but not bad.  I like the fact that they sponsor a lot of racing teams...
A good pilsener, if not very remarkable.  Clear gold, with a dense white head.  Spicy and hoppy finish, with a mild maltiness throughout.  Long aftertaste, very pleasant.
Ok German beer.  Was called a lager on the menu which I ordered it from.  Very light and yellow.  Limited head.  Had a slight aftertaste of a skunk.  Maybe a bad bottle.
this was a very nice brew,I enjoyed it immensily. It reminded me of the beer in the munich beer gardens in a way.
Light blond beer with a medium creamy head. The aroma is yeast, bread and hop. Slightly sweet start with hop finish and a slightly bitter aftertaste. A well controlled beer.

Lighter in flavor than most of the big name european pilsners but also has less of the horrible skunky aroma. Nice pale golden color. Weak head. Pleasant bit of sweetness. Slight hop bite in the finish complimented by just the right amount of carbonation.
Not liking german beers very much...this was subpar even by my standards. The smell was a little bit repulsive, but the taste made up for it slightly.
Average, run of the mill beer. Sub-par by German standards..................
one of my favourite "normal" beers.. clean, crisp and smooth...perfect hot weather beer... drink it all day and nite.
Clear gold with clean malt nose, and clean taste but doesn''t stand out.....
Initially smelled like ass, but that faded. Not very impressive, quite boring. I think this is the beer for people to buy who want "German" beer but don''t really want to explore other styles.

Very pale, thinnish looking, little fast-dying head.  Aroma kinda skunky, despite brown bottle.  Flavor is fresher, but pretty bland on the whole, with bitterness only entering at the end.  Below average pils for sure; I once had a terribly old bottle of this, years ago when my then-girlfriend and I were still on a mainstream German lager kick, and I think it helped me move on to a higher level (my next purchase I believe was Mackeson XXX).  Fresher, this beer is not much better than what I remember, but thanks Warsteiner for helping me to find beers better than you!

Whoever tells me that this is a typical pilsener is pretty clueless. It"s more a lager beer. Pale yellow color, good head. Honey nose. Little malty body with nice spices. Aftertast nicley honeysweet with a grassy hint. If you don"t like a true german pilsener this is your choice, at least in Germany.
I seem to remember this beer being better.  Or maybe my tastes have just changed.  I found the flavor light this go around and generally unremarkable.
Crisp, clean german beer. An all right beer, nothing special though.........

Blonde with a fluff head and having an almost wheaty aroma with delicate pockets of malt. Clean crisp pilsner taste and well balanced. One of the better german pilsners I have tried--but still not a fan.
I was disappointed by this one.  Light flavor, pretty boring but not offensive.
Average brew from Germany, certainly not the best but worht a try. Very easy to drink light and crisp and a dry finish.
Definitely not one of my favourite German pilsners.  Dry and skunky flavour.
My bottle had little or no head.  Also, there was a funky aftertaste.  Otherwise, this is an average brew.
nice hop influences, small bitter finish, overall enjoyable brew ...........
Tastes like a slightly stonger version of Coors. Has a bit of an aftertaste but iniatially goes down smooth.
Translucent gold color. Fat head pretty rocky. Smells kinda like wonder bread. Crisp. Very dry finish. Eh.

Re-Rate 10/20/02: A clear light gold color on the pour, the head is mountainous, frothy, long lasting, and the lace gauzy. Nose is malt, clean and crisp. Front is malt, the top reedy, the finish is amazingly hopped for a pilsener, modest carbonation, and a very dry long lasting aftertaste. "Lagers/Pils, will never be my beer(s) of choice, but this one is drinkable and a nice session beer. Ranks #914 on my current 1000 beer master list.

Aroma light but sweet with floral hop accents.  Color a pale gold with medium head.  Flavor also features a sweet malt foundation and a well-rounded but mild hop top-end.  Body is medium-light--appropriate to the style, and is very smooth.  In sum, this is a very restrained offering, and one might want a little more assertive flavor, but the elements and balance here are good---a very decent German export beer.
Head dissapeared and didnt come back.  Polished golden hue with a lightly malty slightly uric nose.  Delicate malt (white bread) and slight hops.  Good for summer drinking.

This was above average and better than I expected.  It's so available and all over the place, I was expecting a bland macro version of a pils.  I liked the amount of hop (noticeable, but not overwhelming), the clean crisp taste and the thinner palate worked for me.

Oct, 2002 Delicate beers are not my favourites, although I always have a supply of lagers, pilsners and wheat beers in the fridge for when I want something cold. I didn't expect much of this one - best selling brands tend to be bland - but I was pleasantly surprised. There was a firm malt body and aroma, edging toward that of a watered down Scotch Whiskey. The hops were subtle but quite aromatic in a dusty, summer shower manner. Even though this is a best-seller, it's a best-seller in a country where Pilsner is highly regarded. If it's alright with a nation of Pilsner lovers it can't be that bad. [2.7]

March, 2018 660ml brown bottle, filtered. This is unremarkable, but pleasantly drinkable. An OK drinking beer. Nothing offensive - indeed, some pleasant notes. [2.7]
I must not be a fan of the style.  The beer was incredibly crisp but annoyingly dry and grainy.  I didnt finish the bottle.  but then again i am a southern california hop-head!
Yellow color.  Hints of grass and light hops in the nose.  Spritzy, crisp body.  Finishes lightly hopped.

I didn't find this beer to be the best tasting at first, or now that I think of it at the latter.  I can say that the buzz was fantastic.  It almost feels like they used Kava. I didn't taste any, but it was surely relaxing.  Only a hammock in the Carribean can compare.

There's something terribly industrial, utilitarian, rational about this beer.  It's the beer of the German scientist with the close-cropped hair, little eyeglasses and unsmiling countenance.  I find it grainy and dry and unhappy.  However, I can't help remarking that sometimes it's exactly what I want.

This is a beautiful german pilsener, adhering to every possible style guideline. It is a resounding crystal clear light golden colour with a white foamy head.  Crisp, super clean flavour profile with hop bitterness and malt finding perfect balance.  Super fresh and wonderfully simple this is a great beer.

Aroma reminded me of pulling a frozen pizza out of its wrapper--the smell of frozen cardboard and frozen mozzarella cheese.  Low bitterness, slightly dusty flavor, and slightly watery, with less body than I would have thought it deserved.
fairly good, but doesnt seem that complex...................................
neutral neutral neutral...Perhaps this is the most average beer I've ever tasted.
Not nearly as bad as somepeople rated it. I am not a huge lager fan overall. But I do enjoy a well done pilsner on a hot day. In my personal top ten for pilsners.
Pale golden. Hoppy aroma. A bit watery but still hoppy flavour. Don't let it warm up too much.

It has that "clean, crisp taste" that american beer ads always claim their beers have.  Not too bad for a pretty commercial beer made for more popular tastes and mass consumption.  I still enjoy simple beers like this from time to time.

Drank a pint of the draft version of this beer at a swanky resort in Arizona for $7+. First impression was that it wasn't worth the price. But value proposition aside, it was a smooth, pretty easy drinking beer, albiet not memorable. The aroma is unobtrusive wheatiness. It has a thin head with good lace and is pale gold in color. If you like dry, crisp German Pilsners, this is a good option; I simply like my beer more full-bodied.
Very forgetable.  Nothing too special about this beer.  Kind of a sweet taste that I just can't place.
A nice pilsener even though I don't care for pilseners. Clean and crisp. Good.

Good German pilsener.  I was surprised that this beer is so smooth yet doesn't taste like a light beer.  There isn't a trace of skunkiness at all (unlike some of the German green-bottle brews).  This is a good everyday drinking beer, and is running only $5.99 at my local store.  It's a bit light and watery.  Good, but not great.
Very nice Pilsener with a nice toasted wheat bread flavor to it.  Very smooth, crisp and clean tasting with a nice pleasant aftertaste.  No complaints here.
I wouldn't drink it unless it was made locally. Come to think of it, Crown Lager IS made locally and it tastes exactly the same! And I refuse to drink that crap. Draw your own conclusions.
Not bad... great pilsner though; im not much of a fan, but I'll always drink this if it's around. Not great, but not bad at all

Very light yellow in color.  It has a very nice hoppy aroma.
 And fortunately it tastes better than it looks and offers a nice crisp somewhat dry finish that is very refreshing especially in the summertime.
The best pilsner I've had yet, but that isn't saying much.  Light, sort of refreshing, with some definite sweetness.  Nothing really stands out.  Just sort of a clean beer.
Best described as bland. No glaring weaknesses here, but definitely nothing special. Fairly clean taste, but not much presence. Still better than American macrobrews by a wide margin.

Good hoppy aroma, but a very slightl unpleasant metalic tinge.  The head is big and tight, pure white, but the beer's colour is too pale yellow to be appealing.  It's suitably bitter for a pilsener, but the body is a little thin, and malt balance is conspicuously absent.  The finish, however, is smooth and dry and the hoppy aftertaste leaves a fresh mouthfeel.  Best for its smoothness and freshness, but not a beer to savour.

had on my own 5 liter keg that me and my bro finished off in one night.  Very nice head from the tap, and nice gold color.  unique warsteiner aroma that had some czech and german hops in it but there was something i couldnt pinpoint- wasnt good but wasnt bad at all.  Taste is light and sweet with subtle bittering and flavor hops.  Goes down smooth and eaasy with no harsh flavors.  Although I have had in a bottle and got some slight harshness- metallic tastes.   Decent german pils but nothing outstanding.  Gimme a prima anyday.
A very solid german beer.  A lot of hops yet not over powering.  One of the few pilsener type beers that i enjoyed.
Good "ordinary"man beer! Excellent imost respects. One to suggest to friends! Full, smooth taste & body!

Pale yellow. There's a little bit of a whiff of honey, but not
much else. There's a decent full taste for a beer that's so pale.
I'm just not getting much from this. Am I missing something? Nice 
balance, just kind of ordinary.

I did not enjoy this beer at all. I thought it was VERY skunky tasting. This was surprising to me because the beer was ice cold and comes in a dark glass bottle. Reminded me very much of Heineken Lager only skunkier. Not flavorful and not worth the money at all in my opinion.
This beer gives hope to the pilsners.  Crisp, refreshing, golden color, nice bubbles, smooth, good finish.  Very drinkable and worth the extra few bucks.

Definitely a good beer with a little bitterness to it.  This beer has a dinstinct flavor but there is nothing about it that really seperates it from the crowd - just a good consistent drinkable beer with a strong but pleasant aftertaste.
I had this beer on draft.   An easy to drink German import.  Nothing too over the top, but worth a try
This is the "Budweiser" of Germany.  It's quite popular.  It tastes OK and is drinkable but nothing to get excited about.
A little skunky, a little bitter, about what I expected from a classic german pilsener.
Skunky, pee yellow, thin with a watery bitter finish. The Commercial says it is the Queen of the beers! I would say Queen of Skunk!

Hay-like nose and piss yello color with no head. Light malt taste and clean, bitter finish that is faint. Thin and watery. I'm insulted by this beer, which you can get everywhere in Deutschland, home of the Reinheitsgebot. Pretty bad stuff.
very pale, no head. The warmer its served the better the taste gets. ok beer, difficult to believe this is truely the "Best selling German Beer in the World".
smooth, but bland.  Reminds me of an overpriced Miller product.  ...........
Don't like it, too bitter for me. Pale color, not much of an aroma..........
Light and refreshing, and a beer one can drink all night.  I'm not big into the foamy head, so it doesn't matter to me that this beer doesn't have one.

Really pale color and by the time the beer got to me there wasn't much in the way of a head. Not sure if the beer is naturally small headed, quick dissipating or if they just took too long getting it to me. Very pale and thin color. Flavor isn't so pale or thin. Strong, peppery hops dominate the flavor with a bitter finish. Something about it reminded me of body odor or a kid I knew in middle school who had funky breath. Didn't really taste too skunky though.
A lighter weight beer than I usually drink, not very substantial, but it's growing on me with every sip. I don't like the bitter finish, however, so this one will probably be my last.
A decent beer, however, it's aftertaste lingers too long. Other than that, a clean crisp beer that everyone should try... at least once.

Slightly hazy, low head despite good condition. Initial malt aromas reapper in the mouth along with what seems to be an adjunct flavour despite its reinheitsgebot roots, but then there is nothing to stop a German brewer using adjuncts for beers exported outside Germany.

16 oz. can that pours clear golden color with a decent white foamy head that sticks to my glass, light grassy and flowery aromas, bready malt and herbal hop flavors, light bodied with a crisp mouthfeel, finishes clean and semi sweet, pretty average but not that bad coming from a can.

This is what you would expect from a German Pilsner. Crisp, smooth and bitter with a nice hoppy aroma and flavor. Easy to drink with balanced flavors.Nothing outstanding, but just what you would want to find in a real beer.
Well-made, classic German pilsener with a nice herbal bitterness............
i LOVE this beer... so smooth.. yet has a great tingle to the taste.. could drink all nite... also.. i would like to go to where this beer is 8$ a 12pk.. b/c its 7.57$/6pk here in tennessee
Flavorful smooth beer with a nice finish.   Dan brought this to the Islands ’05’.  Too hoppy for a summer drink like the rest we had.

Great hops aroma. Sweet, light, and crisp. Nice white head on a light yellow (actually, a little too pale) body. Light carb and body. Crisp and refreshing, nice balance of sweet and hops. One of my favorite classic Ger. pils.
A little bland, with just a hint of bitterness in the aftertaste.  Decent...
This costs $8.99 for a 12 pack where I live, so it's cheaper than Bud.  It must be considered pretty crappy beer in Germany.

Had a few bottles of this tonight.  I’ve been wanting to try this one for a while.  This brew
pours a sparkling pale straw.  The massive white head is tight and rocky.  The head is fully
lasting and has very good lacing.  The nose though very fresh and clean is very faint and
hard to detect especially after it breathes a bit.  Soft aromas of grain, flowers, and a touch
of earth are present.  The flavor is very rich tasting and warming for a pilsener.  The sweet
start is followed by a ever so slight spiciness in the middle.  The balanced finish is long. 
The smooth palate is light to medium in body, with a creamy soft texture that finishes
crisp.  Perfect for a summer evening.
I can see why people like this so much - it's an extremely drinkable pils that is easy to find in NYC.  There's a slightly odd aftertaste and it's a bit fizzy.

Since having graduated into beer afficionadohood, I can say with appreciation, "Thank goodness for the Bavarian Purity Law".  This had the initial signs of being like an American macroswill -- minimal aroma (at first), yellow color.  But I tasted it and actually discovered that it had real malts and hops in this thing, so it salvaged the beer to a considerable extent.  (The malts even seemed to come out in the aroma more as I proceeded.)  Not particularly extraordinary, but it made the experience with this one something interesting, rather than the usual boredom of an American macroswill.  The maltiness and the hop character even gave a faint reminder of what I find so good in a great German doppelbock.  In short: a pretty standard beer, but with real beer ingredients, and nicely balanced.  Dry finish, like a Pilsener.  I think I could come back to it again.

Not my first choice for a Pilsner by any means, especially from Deutschland.  Just doesn't have any outstanding characteristics, even compared to other mass-market Pilsners.  Quite pale yellow color.  Some hop flavors towards the end saves this beer from utter suckdom, but just barely.
bad bitter pilsner-some buddies of mine bought one of the mini kegs of this and it sucked i thought
Very pale and pissy looking but decent head.  Quite skunky taste and smell, slightly refreshing.  Some malty sweetness, but that doesn't make up for the nasty aftertaste.

piss yellow with a bright white head, fresh-like but urinated budweizer aroma, flavor reminiscent of budweizer with a sweet finish, 'OH its German, it can't be as bad as BUD', however my friends, its not far from it...
Undemanding but pleasant German pilsener. Pretty much all-malt, sweet, lemony, soft refreshing palate.

An extraordinary macrobrew. Taste combines smoothness with bitterness in a very pleasant fashion. This beer doesn't have the annoying sweetness of the so many so called premium brands of American beer. A little watery...
Warsteiner always reminds me of a college party that I attended in Berlin a couple years back.  From what I understood, this is the German Budweiser (beer for the masses).  A nice bitter pilsener.
The color is clear yellow pilsner.  Not much head.  I found it to be very rough on the palate, and difficult to drink.  Had one and then moved on.

Very pale yellow color with no depth.  Little aroma and little head.  The beer is a little thin and maybe the bottle I had was a little skunky, but it was not smooth and frankly not that good.  Maybe it paled because we were drinking Hofbrauhaus on tap all night.  It must be the best selling beer in Germany in the same way that Bud is the best seller in America.

The aroma was better than finding a penny in the road...unfortunately it was the best part. Amazing malty sweetness from the aroma, but the flavor wasn't too complex albeit very smoothe. Not very bitter, and the finish wasn't fullfilling. Very non abraisive, neutral beer.

More pale-yellow-urine  clear colour with a short lasting large bubbled head. Faint yeasty, mown grass hoppy aromas. Medium soft body, with malty faint pop-corn sweet, faint bitter flavours. Soft foamy, weak almost flat finish. Just way tooooo "wussy" for my taste.
(Rated 26/5/02; Liedolo; Italia)

not much to report here: in color it's half way between tap water and anemic pale yellow. a disc of snowy foam differentiates it from an herbal tea in appearance. disturbing to learn that this is germany's best selling beer - it begs the question: what exactly is it selling?  proof that not even the reinheitsgebot can save a beer when vapidity appears to be the brewer's goal.  a paper-like aroma, suggesting a fresh box of envelopes, some hop perhaps, but again, used so parsimoniously it hardly matters. about as satisfying in terms of aroma as catching a whiff of the neighbor's bar b-q, that is, great for him but of little consequence to our own appetite. should be served with a sprig of hallertauer to swish around in the glass. still, aspersions aside, it's merely bland rather than overtly offensive. appropriate for watching t.v., smoking cigars or eating cookies, anything but studious attention to the beer.
Strong sweet smell. Pale yellow, bit of head. Grassy. Light. From Germany?..

The commercial description says it all - it is, indeed a "classic German Plisner".
A bit light (most Pils are to my taste), but beautifully balanced malt/hop character, pleasantly bitter.  This is supposedly the largest selling beer in Germany.
RE-RATE BEGINS HERE:  Had always had this in bottles until a week ago, when I had a chance to try it draft - and had to lower my rating as a composite.  The draft is very, very watered-down tasting.
Still a good Pilsner in bottles, but I can't recommend the draft, based on my experience.
Just tried it at LL but didn't get much idea of what its like. Think i'll pick up some this week.
Reminded me a lot of a shiner bock...crisp and skunky....serve me cold on a hot day please!
Light colour, sour & bitter, horrid. Lucky it was on special or I'd be really pissed off.
Light beer with not alot of flavour.  But the beauty of it is that it is extremely drinkable.
Beats the hell out of Becks/Heineken/St. Pauli in the mid-priced Europils class.
Quite tasty. I will rerate with more samplings.  Still a little too expensive in my area. Good macro pilsener but not for 9.00 a six pack.
Slight grassy aroma. Neutral, sweetish taste, almost no finish. Bland and disappointing German pilsener.
For a macro pilsener this is pretty good,smooth body, clean finish. I'd buy it again.
Not too bad for the price,I was impressed more than I thought I would be...not a bad pils, not the Best, but certainly not THE worst either! I wouldnt mind picking up a sixer of this once in awhile!

Overall a pretty good pilsner.  I was very impressed for the price, especially since I bought it in a 5-liter mini-keg.  I vastly prefer its flavor there to the bottles, though both are precarbonated.
Certainly not great, but a decent beer that is mass-produced................
Aroma is a little weak as is the color and head.  Very rich full bodied Pilsner with a gentle and pleasent aftertaste.  Better than most American Pilsners.

I was at a party Saturday night on a balcony overlooking Newport Harbor with lots of of French-accented foreigners.  I scanned the various bottles of wine at the booze table hoping to find something nice to go with the rib eye steaks sizzling on the grill.  I noticed at the back of the table there was this lonely unopened mini keg (3 gal ?) of Warsteinier.  Out of this mini keg, it initially looked like a Caffrey (all white foam).  After a little while, the foam receded into a head so thick and creamy you can put it on a hot fudge sundae and stick a cherry on it.  The color is a whitish yellow.  The aroma had a bready maltiness with a tiny bit of saaz.  Flavor is very clean (not a trace of skunkiness): bread malty with a slight hoppiness and no overt bitterness.  Mouthfeel is very smooth and creamy and fairly substantial for such a light colored beer.  This beer is quite tasty and I really enjoyed it since I practically had the whole keg to myself.
What lager is meant to be like. As smooth as silk and no bad aftertaste. Very rare in the U.K unless you're in the armed forces and have friends in Germany. I am and do so I'm lucky!
Cheapest of the imported German beers.  It's good enough with food, but I like many other pils better.  Perhaps it suffers by the time it gets to Minnesota.  I like Sprecher and Schell's much better.
For it's price I was very suprised. It was tasty. Not too strong but not too weak. A good pilsener.
Not as good as Bitburger, but the taste of this pilsner will grow on you in a hurry.
another beer from the sauerland, where i was born. comparable to veltins....
Decent hop, fairly smooth, Average representation of a pilsner..............
Fantastic German pils, one of the best, if drink is surposed to be for pleasure then this is  what you drink!
Slightly weak in flavor.  Also a bit too pale in color.  Nice hop to it.  Smooth in body.  Decent.
Very easy drinking with nice easy flavours and a crisp finish. They need to change there motto though, "Queen of Beers"
A fairly weak pilsener. Refreshing on a hot day though......................
Weak on aroma, deep golden in color, hoppy start, with a bit of nuttiness in the middle.  Pleasant, smooth finish.
A very weak German pilsener. A step above water. ...........................
pretty good pilsner.  I want to try it again................................
Bitter and crisp, a good combonation........................................
Pretty empty - almost hoppy but just sort of bitter instead and some evidence of a strong, clean malt but more just sort of sweet.  Just a sort of not quite almost kind of brew.
Crisp and sweetish, pretty light-bodied. Not bad, but nothing to write home about. Rather average for a pilsener
Little better than middle of the road.......................................
I think this is a very good for a pilsener. It's crisp, clean and smooth. What's not to like?
This is the worst German Pilsener I've ever tasted. Unpleasantly bitter flavour and aftertaste.

White lasting head and very light pale yellow color. Light bodied. Aroma is grainy with herbal notes. Flavour is malty, bready but not sweet, ending in a bitter finish. For a not-great lover of pilsener as I am this is a good one.
I prefer dark beers, however I like to try to expand my beer horizons.  This one is rather crisp and sharp.  A very good summertime german beer.

Bottle (BB Apr 23, 08). Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear light yellow. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (herbs), hints of soap and DMS. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Not the most consistent, I’ve found, but this was a nice sample (and seemingly fresh based on the exp. date).
Nothing special here. Big name pilsner with a big name taste--that is, a less than desired amount of it, especially the hops. Lacking in flavor, but not offensive either.
Rocksolid german pilsner. Nice mild flavor very fresh. I like it although you shouldn't let it sit for a while cause it loose its carbonation very quick and then it tastes like p.. !
I have to say I was a little let down the 2 times I tried this beer after hearing so many good things about it. It tastes a lot like the standard fare that is clean but not really that flavorful.
Looks great, mildly carbonated with a good head and lacing, not much on the nose. Light to medium bodied and crisp with a nice hoppy dryness in the finish.

Pale in color. Alcoholic, but acceptable nose. A tad bit sour in the front. Carbonated mid with mild yeast undertones and clover honey overtones. Fresh grain finish with honey undertones. Must try again.
A decent and reasonably priced German pilsener. Hops are noticable but are far from pronounced. nice middle of the road beer. Better than Beck's in my opinion but still in the same general ballpark.
pretty good brew...a little lighter for a german beer.......................

Can 500ml  

 Appearance: bright, crisp golen with crystal hue , mid white bright head. Classic German pils look. 4- 

 Aroma  sweet fresh nose , floral with golden malt , bit grainy , quiet refreshing and light.7+ 

Taste/Palate  clean mid bodied pils with slightly oily sides , fairly crisp with noted carbonation. Pleasant mid bitternes with slight mineral feel and alcohol hint. Noting superb here just solid German mainstrean well brewed.
Good Pils clean.  A little to sweet for me but otherwise good aroma.........

rerate (deleted old comments because they were worthless). color is very light golden and crystal clear with a big frothy white head. aroma reminds me of butter, turkey, and floral hops if you can imagine that combination. aroma starts off with the turkey, but the deeper you inhale the more floral and sweet it becomes...weird. taste is mostly of Saaz and is quite dry throughout the flavor with just a minute bit of sweetness to balance the flavor..this really isnt a bad beer.
A good German pilsener.  Not my favorite beer but it is one that I drink often.
Little bit skunky aroma. Pale yellow color, hopbitter, few malts, light sweet, no aftertaste, light body.
Crisp and refreshing. This a good lawnmower beer for non-white trash........
Its not fantastic, but it was worth trying.  I wasn't extremely impressed, but if given the opportunity I would try it again, and would recommend that others try it at least once.

Fair beer, it is quite unfortunate that many people in america think that this is a really good beer.  Definitely better than generic american lager, due to the fact that in fact it does contain hops, and if I try hard a real flavor, not that it is a great flavor, okay but still nothing worth working to hard to find.
We were maybe unlucky, but...this was very bad. The after-taste was horrible.
i'm not big into pilseners, but this was very enjoyable brew, a nice hop flavor
Comprable to the Dunkel.  A truly great beer................................
Somewhat decent pils. Good hop character. Actually quite drinkable. ........
A good pils considering the mass quantities sold.  I bit more boring than many pils, but I often drink it for price and availability reasons.
Fantastic! Great beer with an increasingly large following by people who know good beer when they taste it (not one for pig swill drinkers)

One reviewer wrote: "too bitter".
Huh? What planet are you from? This beer couldn't spell bitter if you gave it the b, t's and r.

OK, I tried to like this beer. I really did. The packaging is great, the beer looks good in a glass and the hype is out there... but alas, it was very bland and lifeless. At first I thought I must have had an old bottle so I bought one somewhere else. No improvement so I got a fresh one on tap at a festival. Sadly, still nothing to talk about. It has a strange earthy, gypsum/mineral flavor to it. I suspect this is the Budweiser of Germany. A lot of hype but very little substance. I'll take a Stroh's over this beer any day and put the money I save in my pocket for more Stroh's. I sincerely believe Warsteiner would lose any blind taste test against most cheap, adjunct ridden American beers such as Schaefer, Schlitz or Old Style. Warsteiner claims "life is too short to drink cheap beer," yet most of the cheaper beers actually have more depth, body, flavor and character than this overblown kraut beer. How can this be? I checked the ratings in Michael Jackson's book and a few others and found that their reviews weren't any better than mine.
This was a good beer for being the biggest seller in Germany. even after buying it at a discount beer store and getting bottles with dust on them really cheep.

Solid and enjoyable, but it would be a stretch to call this one a classic. This is the biggest selling, and thus blandest, beer in Deutschland. Funny, since Germany has so many breweries, the #1 beer there has 8 percent market share, as compared with Bud's 25-30.

First beer i have tasted on tap very smooth and refreshing going down. smooth on the palate. very heady when poared. one of my all time best. i love it good job Germany on making a smooth classic pilsener  like they say LIFE IS TO SHORT TO DRINK CHEAP BEER  (That is for sure)
OK, now, can anybody tell me what sets this apart from macroswill?..........

this style of beer isn't one of my favorites, but as those types go it wasn't sooo awful. i agree with those who noticed a metallic tinge in the flavor. 

for the price i got them at, though, i would buy these anyday over any other american brew of comparable quality. 

(tall 4 pack cans for $2.50)
Great Pilsener.  I just don't like Pilseners................................
an introduction to german lager but you better hope there are some more chapters
Very succesful in Germany but average in Taste. Light color and  bitter. ...
sweet sweet sweet and boring as buggery. this aint a classic german pilsener. the crown lager of germany.
ok for the kind of beer i can drink all day.................................
Bottle:  Pours a clear light yellow with a thin white head, malty biscuity aroma with flowery hops, watery texture with nice carbonation.  Starts and ends lightly bitter with a grainy ending.

I absolutely loved this beer. It tasted great while being one of the most solid and bold brews i have ever had. I'm also glad to see that it is becoming more popular, at least in the chicagoland area. Good fucking christ, did i actually write that. This stuff is skunky, boring, a pilsner none the less.
this is one of the better german beers .....................................
Becoming quite popular around here but it beats me why.  The bottles I tried were shot through with an unpleasant metallic tang and oddly textured.

Rerete 7/03:  Nothing much else to say here, except that this time I noticed that it tastes like watered down Heineken.
They say this is the number one selling German beer.  I believe it.
It's watery and almost devoid of flavor, just like Bud.
It's not disgusting, though.  There is a faint pilsener aftertaste which actually makes this a drinkable beer.
I was disappopinted by this one to say the least. Its flowery aroma was utterly disgusting and the flavor was borderline revolting. Too much yeast and flowery/perfume in both aroma and flavor.

Not the beer you want to end your night with.  Extremely yeasty and flowery aroma were an immediate turn-off.  Once poured, the piss-yellow appearance, along with the aroma, had me cursing myself for making this the last beer of the night.  The flavor is on par with the aroma, very bready and yeasty.
A good beer for light meals. I've always thought it had a slightly metallic aftertaste. Usually I buy it in the mini-keg form for a small gathering.
A great beer with a refreshing taste........................................
The best selling beer in Germany, Warsteiner is a passable German-style Pilsner.  Dry for the style, but still floral and smooth.  Bitterness cranks my rating up a notch or two.

Papery malt and sulphury bitterhop aroma.
Pale yellow, light pearling, low creamish head.
Quite sulphury hops.
Lightbodied.
Anonymous.
I used to think it was a pretty ok yet standard german pilsner, now it just bad  - either my taste or the beer has changed.
Classy german pils. Nice sharp carbonation and hop flavor with just enough sweetness to balance it out. "Life is too short to drink cheap beer". Amen.
I was expecting a much better beer.  Very mediocre.  Good by American standards, but not up to snuff compared to other German brews.
Kind of dissapointing being as it's so popular in Germany. Certainly drinkable - but rather bland.  Didn't have the bite that I was expecting flavorwise.
Warsteiner is a refreshing classic.  My favorite beer to be drank right out of the bottle.  No glass necessary for this one.
